General Comments: Differentiated gabbro within the Black Flag Group. To be published = Geological Survey of Western Australia East Yilgarn Update 2013-14, digital product.
Lithology Description: Gabbro.

General Comments: Intrudes the Black Flag Group; found west of the Abattoir East Gabbro; metamorphosed. To be published = Geological Survey of Western Australia East Yilgarn Update 2013-14, digital product.
Lithology Description: Gabbro.

General Comments: In Onslow 1, Abdul's Dam 1, Ruby 1. published in: CROSTELLA, A., IASKY, R. P., BLUNDELL, K. A., YASIN, A. R., and GHORI, K. A. R., 2000, Petroleum geology of the Peedamullah Shelf and Onslow Terrace, Northern Carnarvon Basin, Western Australia: Western Australia Geological Survey, Report 73, p. 17.
Lithology Description: Clear, translucent and milky white, fine- to medium-grained sandstone; rarely coarse-grained, well-sorted, minor microcrystalline limestone.

Reserved by: Clout J.M.F., Cleghorn J.H., Eaton P.C.
Lithology Description: Weakly differentiated gabbroic sill.
Yellowish coarse-grained bryozoan calcarenite and calcirudite, distinctly cyclic, and contains numerous hardgrounds; locally dolomitised.

General Comments: Variation of Abydos Adamellite (Defined). Abydos Adamellite said to be intruded by Woodstock Adamellite.
Lithology Description: Porphyritic feldspar-quartz-biotite-titanite monzogranite; moderately to strongly foliated; metamorphosed

General Comments: New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk).  Intrudes Callina Supersuite and North Shaw Suite. Age: 3425+/-4Ma.
Lithology Description: Foliated to weakly gneissic,medium-grained to weakly porphyritic blue-grey tonalite through monzogranite; commonly marked by lit-par-lit sheets of white leucogranite.
Quartz sandstone, grains subangular fine to well-rounded medium.

General Comments: Map Sheet: SH51-1,  Wildara 3041. Ultramafic volcanic rock, undivided; metamorphosed. To be published = GSWA geological map and explanatory notes, 2013/2014.
Lithology Description: Relatively massive, medium-grained, equigranular, olivine-spinifex-textured, cumulate ultramafic rock; extensive carbonate and serpentinite alteration.

General Comments: Turkey Creek, Bow 1:100 000 sheet areas, east Kimberley. Previously Boll Sandstone. c. 800 Ma. Age updated by I.Sweet.
Lithology Description: Fine- to coarse-grained quartz sandstone, pebbly sandstone, conglomerate, siltstone.

General Comments: East Kimberley region, McIntosh 1:100 000 sheet area.
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained, porphyritic biotite granodiorite and monzogranite.

General Comments: Essentially a lithified to partly lithified tidal flat sedimentary accumulation. Average exposed thickness: >3m.
Lithology Description: Interlayered grey to buff calcareous and siliciclastic laminates, sandstone and sponge spicules in the sandstones.

General Comments: Locally, moderate to good petroleum source potential.
Lithology Description: Multicoloured siltstone and shale at base; dolomitic and 'salty'. Grades up to shaly dolostones. Ooid limestones and dolostones in upper cycles.

General Comments: Probably same rock as Albany Adamellite. Dimension stone name. Quarried from the Mount Melville area. WA. It appears that GSWA now (2009) prefers this version of the name over Albany Adamellite. Intruded into the Nornalup Zone during Stage I of the Albany-Fraser Orogen
Lithology Description: Grey, megacrystic granitoid.

General Comments: Ruby Plains 1:100 000 sheet area.  Age from Gordon Downs 250K (2nd ed) limited to between the King Leopold Orogeny (~560Ma) and underlying Duerdin Group (~600Ma).
Lithology Description: Fine- to medium-grained quartz sandstone; minor pebbly sandstone and conglomerate; minor carbonates.

General Comments: See also Alcurra dolerite.
Lithology Description: Dolerite in dykes, sills, or plugs, with olivine gabbro, olivine norite, mesocratic orthopyroxene(-olivine) ferronorite to ferrodiorite.

General Comments: Previously included in Fraser River beds. See also Lexicon. SE51-11,12. Formerly considered part of Edgar Range Group.
Lithology Description: Fine to medium grained sandstone, interbedded mudstone; bioturbated; minor conglomerate lenses; fossiliferous.

General Comments: LEONORA 1:250 000, WEEBO 1:100 000.
See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Glauconite-rich clayey siltstone to greensand, rarely exposed.

General Comments: See also misspelling Allandale Sandstone, WA, which indicates Kungurian age (RefID 64630, 2008)
Lithology Description: Poorly sorted feldspathic sandstone, subordinate conglomerate, siltstone, carbonaceous shale and sporadic coal.

General Comments: Age: <1865-1850Ma. In the Western Zone of the Lamboo Complex.
Lithology Description: Biotite-hornblende granodiorite gneiss, and biotite-andalusite-garnet-cordierite monzogranitic gneiss; inclusions of metasedimentary and mafic meta-igneous rock.
Inclusion-rich biotite-hornblende granodiorite gneiss and garnet-cordierite-andalusite-sillimanite-biotite monzogranitic gneiss; metamorphosed equivalents of Neville Granodiorite
Medium to high grade metasediments and granitoids, sillimanite-garnet-cordierite-K-feldspar-plagioclase schist, granofels and migmatite: metamorphosed equivalent of Marboo Formation

General Comments: Bloods Range 1:250 000 map sheet area. Age: 1153+/-3Ma (Pb-Pb). Type Section: 24 56' 53.04'' S, 129 05' 10.25''E (WGS84). Underlies Dean Quartzite in the Mannanana Range. Within the Pitjantjatjara Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Finely porphyritic hypabyssal dacite; less abundant equigranular leucogranite.

General Comments: Geological province: Exmouth Sub-basin.
Lithology Description: Marine shales.

General Comments: Of McWhae et al (1959). See also Lexicon. Previously shown as part of Fairfield Group, but this was probably misinterpretation of a figure. Oil bearing in the Lloyd field; sealed by intraformational shales. Shown on 2009 Canning Basin Bizonation and Stratigraphy chart as Tournasian-Visean, also in 2017 ref..
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, shale, minor limestone, dolomite, anhydrite.

General Comments: Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).  Age :c.3016Ma.
Lithology Description: Gabbro, leucogabbro, serpentinised peridotite and dunite, pyroxenite, and minor anorthosite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Age: 838 +/-80Ma (Rb-Sr, Webb and Page 1977)(controversial?) . Formerly shown as Calymmian but reason not clear. Group is Neoproterozoic. Age is Adelaidean. See also the misspelt Angalarri Sandstone. Victoria Basin.
Lithology Description: Siltstone,  interbeds of fine sandstone, shale; minor dolostone and limestone.

Reserved by: Haines, P., Allen, H. (GSWA) after Blake & Towner (1974)
General Comments: Proposed publication: Geological Survey of Western Australia Record. Amadeus Basin, Centralian Superbasin.
Lithology Description: Interbedded pebble and cobble conglomerate, sandstone, pebbly sandstone and siltstone. Pebble and cobble clasts are typically well rounded; friable clayey sandstone matrix. Minor mudstone.

General Comments: Ages, relations, lithology updated from GA Timescales Project Feb 2009. Further updated 2015.
Lithology Description: Turbidite sandstone and siltstone.

General Comments: East Kimberley Region. In the Central Zone of the Lamboo Complex. GSWA interprets this unit asa  member of the Koongie Park Formation.
Lithology Description: Altered medium to fine grained granophyre with local disseminated malachite.

General Comments: Unit in Osprey Formation?

Lithology Description: Poorly sorted, cross bedded and partly bioturbated, paralic fine sandstone and siltstone with interbedded coarse sandstone and conglomerate

General Comments: NB: Ravensthorpe Terrane nomenclature was abandoned (Refid 65487, 2009). Hosts most of the gold and base metal mineralisation in the Ravensthorpe and Cocanarup areas.
Lithology Description: Dominant volcaniclastics, and minor lavas: metamorphosed calc-alkaline basalts (10-20%), andesite (50-70%), and dacite

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain. Age range extended back to 2815 Ma to include the Mount Kenneth Suite rocks.
Lithology Description: Syn-volcanic tonalitic rocks and trondhjemite, granodiorite, granite, monzogranite, gabbro, peridotite, dolerite, pyroxenite, magnetite, anorthosite; all metamorphosed. Felsic schists, gneisses.

General Comments: North Shaw 1: 100 000 sheet area, east Pilbara. Previously included within Apex Basalt - now established through new age data that it is part of Mount Ada Basalt (per statement from M. Van Kranendonk, Mar06). See also the misnamed Antarctic Chert Member.
Lithology Description: Lapilli tuff, felsic porcellanite, carbonate, arenite, conglomerate, chert, jaspilite, impact spherule layer; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Renamed from Cajuput Member reservation. Map sheet SF50-11 Mount Bruce, 2352 Rocklea 1:100k. Nearest Town: Paraburdoo. The Anthiby Member is proposed for a 90m-thick, unconformity-bound, siltstone-dominated unit at the top of the Kazput Formation in the Turee Creek Group. The unit has been informally referred to as the 'upper Kazput Formation'. Anthiby Well which is about 35km west of the type area. A full formal description will soon be published in ENS, and it is intended to publish a full definition in a GSWA Record or external publication.
Lithology Description: Siltstone-dominated.

General Comments: Present name by Traves (1955). U-Pb SHRIMP age 513 +/- 12 Ma. Ar-Ar ages 505 +/- 2 and 508 +/- 2 Ma (Glass and Phillips, 2006). K-Ar age ~510 Ma. Of the Kalkarindji continental flood basalt province. Included in the Kalkarindji Suite in Oct 2009. Locally associated with minor copper mineralisation.
Lithology Description: Massive and amygdaloidal tholeiitic basalt and basalt breccia; commonly capped by ferricrete. Agglomerate with brecciated flow tops. Minor sandstone and chert interbeds.

Stratigraphic Name: Antrim Plateau Volcanics and Lally Conglomerate
General Comments: In refID 72034. (GSWA (2016). 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology of Western Australia.  Also Subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Flood basalts with lesser siliciclastic sedimentary rocks.

General Comments: Within the Warrawoona Group (Pilbara Supergroup). Intruded by the Coppin Gap and Mullugunya Granodiorites (Mount Edgar Complex). Wrongly said to include the Antarctic Chert Member [misspelling of Antarctic Creek Member, of older Mount Ada Basalt]. In the North Pole Dome, Pilbara Craton.
Lithology Description: Basalt, komatiitic basalt, and serpentinised peridotite; local dolerite sills; minor felsic volcaniclastic rocks and chert; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Offshore equivalent of the onshore Point Spring Sandstone - named for a petroleum company and therefore does not adhere to stratigraphical rules/conventions. Geological province: onshore Bonapart Basin/Petrel-Sub-basin.
Lithology Description: Fine- to coarse-grained sandstone with a few siltstone interbeds, grading up into siltstone.

Reserved by: Preiss W.V., Walter M.R., Coats R.P. and Wells A.T.
General Comments: Unit redefined 29-SEP-2015 by Normington, V.J. and Donnellan, N, and data available here. Redefinition also to be published in: Normington and Donnellan, in prep. Characterisation of the Neoproterozoic stratigraphy of the northeast Amadeus Basin, Northern Territory. Northern Territory Geological Survey Report.  The depositional age(658 Ma) is inferred from Re-Os dating in Wallara 1.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, shale, dolostone, sandstone and grainstone.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic volcanics, including lavas and tuffs. Association may include volcaniclastic rocks.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic volcanics, including lavas and tuffs. Association may include volcaniclastic rocks.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic volcanics, including lavas and tuffs. Association may include volcaniclastic rocks.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic intrusive rocks.  Range in composition from alkali feldspar granite to tonalite; includes associated rocks such as migmatite and minor gabbro and diorite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic intrusive rocks.  Range in composition from alkali feldspar granite to tonalite; includes associated rocks such as migmatite and minor gabbro and diorite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: High-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with granulite facies assemblages; includes granitic gneisses

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: High-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with granulite facies assemblages; includes granitic gneisses

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Dolerite, gabbro and other mafic igneous rocks; commonly as dykes and sills; may include some metamorphosed mafic intrusions and subordinate ultramafic rocks.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly basaltic rocks; may include minor ultramafic volcanics

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly basaltic rocks; may include minor ultramafic volcanics

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly basaltic rocks; may include minor ultramafic volcanics

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Of Wadeye Gp - offshore equiv.of onshore Point Spring Sst. Variously overlies Sunbird+Tanmurra Fms.+ Kingfisher Shale. Named for a petroleum company and therefore does not adhere to stratigraphic rules/conventions.
Lithology Description: Lower 62m-thick interval of interbedded siltstone and fine- to very coarse-grained sandstone; up to 5% recrystallised limestone grains, occcasional fossils and common calcite cement; below fine- to coarse- and rarely very coarse-grained sandstone.

General Comments: Rason 1:250k map sheet area. A layered gabbro and anorthosite intrusive complex in the northeast corner of the Yilgarn Craton. The Argus Igneous Complex concordantly intrudes the western part of the Yamarna-Mount Gill greenstone belt, and has been dated at 2738 +/- 26 Ma (GSWA SHRIMP age). The unit is named after a bore (Argus Bore at 51J 560650 6893675) that occurs near the main outcrop of the unit.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed anorthosite; contains interleaved amphibolite.
Volcaniclastic olivine lamproite with olivine-phlogopite dykes.

General Comments: Arid Basin.
Lithology Description: Psammitic and semipelitic gneiss, locally garnet-rich; interlayered with mafic amphibolite to granulite and granitic gneiss.

General Comments: Informally named kimberlite pipe. In the Kimberley Block. Originally entered as NT unit, but more likely to be in WA [CEB Mar-2012].
Suitable for clay mining.
Lithology Description: Black and white shales with minor sandstone and orthoquartzite.

General Comments: Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).
Lithology Description: Layered mafic-ultramafic intrusion; gabbro, leucogabbro, leucogabbronorite, gabbronorite, anorthosite, minor troctolite; some olivine and/or chromitite-bearing; in rhythmic cycles; peridotite and troctolite

General Comments: Published as Arranoo Sandstone Member in 1988, but both names in use since. Gorter, Nicoll et al. (in prep Mar2009) formally propose to return to original unit name reserved and used in unpublished well completion reports - Arranoo Member. See also misspelt Aranoo Sandstone Member (2013) for age refinement.
Lithology Description: A finely-laminated sequence of interbedded fine-grained sandstone, siltstone and shale.

General Comments: See also Ascot beds, Ascot Beds. The informal Jandakot Beds were incorporated into the Ascot Formation by Kendrick et al. (1991).
Lithology Description: Marine deposits comprising shelly calcarenites, silty clay and glauconitic clay. Contains abundant molluscan fauna.

General Comments: Vasse River Coalfields, Perth Basin. See also Ashbrook Coal Measures.
Lithology Description: Numerous upward-fining cycles dominated by sandstone.

General Comments: Defined 1964. (Evans et al 2003; Sircombe 2003). Contains SHRIMP Pb-Pb dated volcanic rocks of 1806 +/- 9 (Nelson, 2003) and 1829 +/- 5 (Sircombe, 2003). Overlain by Capricorn Group dated at 1804 +/- 7. Overlies the June Hill Volcanics in Duck Creek Syncline, but  Ashburton Formation appears to be diachronous and is believed to be older than the volcanics in other areas. Ashburton Basin.
Lithology Description: Mudstone, siltstone and thin- to very thick-bedded lithic-quartz sandstone; minor pebble- to cobble-conglomerate, felsic to mafic volcanic rocks, BIF and dolostone. Lower greenschist facies.
Metabasaltic pillow lava and pillow breccia
Altered basalt flows and claystone.

General Comments: Of Echuca Shoals Formation [GA Browse Basin Biozonation and Stratigraphy Chart 2016]
Lithology Description: Medium-grained sandstone.

General Comments: Extrusive metabasalt found on the lowermost parts of the Black Flag Group, in the St Ives Goldfields mining camp. To be published in Electonic and digital 100K East Yilgarn 2013 update, Geological Survey of Western Australia, Department of Mines and Petroleum.

Unit shows different age ranges in different areas. Greatest range in nothern Exmouth and Barrow Sub-basins; limited range in Dampier Sub-basin and Kangaroo Trough. Ages, relations, lithology updated from GA Timescales Project Feb 2009.
Lithology Description: Deep marine claystones and shales.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain. Age: 2780Ma.
Lithology Description: Tremolite schist derived from intrusive rock; gabbro with well-developed modal layering; magnetitite units interlayered with gabbro; layered gabbro, serpentinite derived from peridotitic igneous layers. Metamorphosed.

Gabbro with well developed modal layering of pyroxene and plagioclase; locally grading into leucogabbro and magnetite-bearing gabbro; metamorphosed. Serpentinite derived from peridotitic igneous layers; locally grades into metapyroxenite.

Magnetitite units interlayered with magnetite- and ilmenite-bearing leucogabbro; modally layered on a metre scale; metamorphosed. Gabbro grading into magnetite- and ilmenite-bearing olivine gabbro, leucogabbro and gabbronorite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Age from

Lithology Description: Garnet-bearing hornblende-plagioclase gneiss, garnet anorthosite, layered anorthosite, leucogabbro and gabbro (metamorphosed to amphibolite), and mottled anorthosite

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain.
Lithology Description: Monzogranite, layered gabbro sills, and dolerite; commonly foliated; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File G/50-1. See also Austin Member.
Originally reserved 25-DEC-74?
Lithology Description: Four sediment types including brown/orange and grey calcareous mud, brown or grey shelly calcareous mud, brown to cream calcareous sands and lithoclast (carbonate rock fragment) gravel.

General Comments: Most references give age as Neoproterozoic, but a few say Mesoproterozoic (as per unconformably underlying Tijunna Group). Victoria Basin.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, dolostone, conglomerate, dolarenite, shale.

General Comments: Reference: GA REF OREFID = *26357, REFID = 14142 AGSO Record 1997/38.  NOT RefID 26357, which is about onshore drilling near Batchelor , NT.
Reference: GA REF OREFID = *26357, REFID = 14142 AGSO Record 1997/38.  NOT RefID 26357, which is about onshore drilling near Batchelor , NT.
Reference: GA REF OREFID = *26357, REFID = 14142 AGSO Record 1997/38.  NOT RefID 26357, which is about onshore drilling near Batchelor , NT.

Reference: GA REF OREFID = *26357, REFID = 14142 AGSO Record 1997/38.  NOT RefID 26357, which is about onshore drilling near Batchelor , NT.

Lithology Description: Shale, siltstone, partly calcareous; minor limestone and dolomite.

General Comments: Within the Bangemall Supergroup. Collier Basin. Three un-named sub-units are mapped separately: thin- to thick-bedded sandstone and siltstone; thin- to thick-bedded sandstone and minor siltstone; thin- to thick-bedded dololutite, dolarenite, dolorudite, dolomitic siltstone, siltstone and sandstone. 150m thick.
Lithology Description: Planar-laminated green, maroon and cream-coloured siltstone and mudstone, interbedded with subordinate fine- to very coarse-grained lithic sandstone, dolostone and minor thin chert beds; intruded by dolerite sills.
Dolomite and chert breccia

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Comprises folded sandstone, shale and conglomerate.

General Comments: Defined on card, 5-OCT-73 as Baines Beds. Described in GSWA Memoir 3 (1990) , NW Birrindudu Basin,  p351, 352, 355. May be lateral equivalent of Birrindudu Group. Mesoproterozoic.
Lithology Description: Shallow marine medium to thinly bedded, rippled and cross bedded sublithic sandstone and quartz sandstone with a sparse clayey matrix; minor lithic sandstone, greywacke, conglomerate and siltstone, with mudstone at the top
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Type area in SG50-14[?or SG50-01?  - in the Kennedy Range]. Of the Minyala Sub-Group (Byro Group).
Lithology Description: Siltstone and black shale; minor interbedded fine-grained sandstone.
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Possibly not intended as a formal name? Appears to be unpublished elsewhere.
Geological province: Murchison Domain.  Age: c. 2630-2620Ma.
Lithology Description: Undeformed monzogranite, syenogranite, and alkali granite; post-tectonic.
Chiefly claystone, grey, silty to arenaceous, common traces of glauconite as high as 10% and traces of mica and pyrite.  Towards the east the upper part is interbedded sandstone and siltstone.
Pale grey to green-grey manganiferous shale, fine-grained micaceous, calcareous, and glauconitic sandstone, interbedded red-brown shale, micaceous siltstone

General Comments: Map Sheet SF50-15 Turee Creek, 2551 Snowy Mount 1:100k.  Nearest Town: Paraburdoo. The Balgara Dolerite refers to a suite of c. 2.2Ga dolerite sills that were intruded into the Turee Creek and Shingle Creek Groups, and are petrogenetically related to the Cheela Springs basalt. Balgara Well is located about 4km NNE of one of the localities where these sills were first dated in the Turee Creek Syncline.  A full formal description will soon be published in ENS, and it is intended to publish a full definition in a GSWA Record or external publication.
Lithology Description: Dolerite sills.
Coarse-grained monzogranite with K-feldspar megacrysts; internally massive, intense contact-parallel foliation with down-dip mineral lineation.; High Ca granite.

General Comments: Reserved as Balingup, but NLR in 1981.

Lithology Description: Feldspar+/-quartz-phyric dacite content.

General Comments: Province not stratigraphic name.

Bardoc 1:100k map sheet 3137. Dolerite and gabbro; includes cumulate and granophyric differentiates. Part of the Widgiemooltha Large Igneous Province. Intrudes Archean greenstone and granitic units of the Yilgarn Craton. See also GSWA ENS:Wingate, MTD (partial report), Ballona Dolerite Member (P_-_wb-o): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 09 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite and gabbro; includes cumulate and granophyric differentiates.

General Comments: Type section: Ballythanna 1, 65-298m, Byro Sub-basin. Lat 26deg03'42", Long 115deg40' 11" E.
Lithology Description: Fine- to medium-grained sandstone, minor carbonaceous siltstone, locally bioturbated.

General Comments: Monzogranite with a pinkish colouration. Fine-medium grained equigranular quartz-feldspar-biotite-muscovite granite with a spaced cleavage and mineral lineation trending approximatley 154 plunging 50. Fifteen analyses yield a weighted mean 207Pb*/206Pb* date of 2643 ± 8 Ma (MSWD = 2.13), interpreted as the age of magmatic crystallization of the monzogranite. To be published in Geological Survey of Western Australia publications, particularly digital and paper LIGHTFOOT 1:100,000 geological map.
Lithology Description: Monzogranite with a pinkish colouration. Fine-medium grained equigranular quartz-feldspar-biotite-muscovite granite with a spaced cleavage and mineral lineation trending approximately 154 plunging 50.

General Comments: Published on the GSWA WATTS 1:100 000 geological map sheet in 2007. Chemical parent (Frederick Suite) is I-type.
Lithology Description: Muscovite and biotite monzogranite; locally porphyritic; minor biotite granodiorite; highly magnetic.

General Comments: WA Age: on (2007) 1:250K map sheet NULLAGINE, stated to be c.2766Ma. Overlain / underlain by Koongaling Volcanic Member (see 1999  WARRAGINE sheet and 2007 NULLAGINE sheet).  Formerly called Bamboo Creek Porphyry but recent studies have led to revision of lithology. In Fortescue Basin (2007 Mount Edgar 100K, version 2, refid 65727).
Lithology Description: Rhyolite, rhyodacite and dacite in flows and subvolcanic intrusions; alkali feldspar and quartz phenocrysts; volcanic breccia, welded ignimbrite, witth accretionary lapilli; resedimented pyroclastic deposits.

General Comments: Part of the Shaw Granitic Complex. previously of Cutinduna Supersuite, but from 2016 part of Sisters Supersuite. See GSWA online Explanatory Notes System.
Lithology Description: Coarsely K-feldspar porphyritic monzogranite with a strong synmagmatic foliation defined by aligned K-feldspar phenocrysts.
Metamorphosed komatiitic basalt and pyroxenite; minor high-Mg basalt; tremolite and talc-rich schist.

General Comments: In Refid 22754 is the comment "Stratigraphic position unknown; possibly overlain by Glenhill Formation."
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone, conglomerate, ferruginous sandstone, siltstone and shale

General Comments: In the Capricorn Orogen [?? Capricorn Orogeny shown as 1830-1780 Ma on Robinson Range 1:250k 2002 map & Bangemall Supergroup is shown as in Edmund and Collier Basins]. Affected by the 1030-950 Ma Edmundian Orogeny.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, dololutite, dolarenite, stromatolitic dolostone, sandstone.

General Comments: Used once, !981.
Replaced in 2007 by Baramine Member, but GSWA has decided [2014] to return to the original full name.
Lithology Description: Consists mainly of a mixture of bedded vitric, lithic and crystal tuffs minor accretionary lapilli tuff interlayered with bedded fine to coarse volcaniclastic rocks. Includes felsic, as well as basaltic, lavas and pyroclastic rocks.

General Comments: See also Barbwire Formation and Lexicon. Includes the "James Sandstone".
Lithology Description: Prominently cross bedded and poorly sorted fine to coarse grained sandstone, intraformational conglomerate, shale, calcareous siltstone with poorly preserved plant remains. Marine/deltaic deposits

General Comments: Nabberu 1:250 000 / Rhodes 1:100 000 sheet area. Sandstone. Defined and published in article 50188.
Lithology Description: Poorly sorted sandstone, siltstone and granule conglomerate, local valley-fill deposit.
Mixed sandstone and dolomitic sequence.

General Comments: Is the main channel iron deposit unit in the Marillana Formation.
Lithology Description: Channel iron deposit (CID) ore. Conglomerate, minor claystone, breccia and sandstone; fossil wood fragments.

General Comments: See also misspelt Baker Monzogranite.
Lithology Description: Medium to fine grained biotite monzogranite with minor small mafic xenoliths.
Medium-grained, granophyric monzogranite; undeformed; local xenoliths of partly melted, coarse-grained granite.

General Comments: PUBLICATION: Semeniuk, V., 2008, Journal of the Royal Society of Western Australia Volume 91 Part 1 (Supplement): 53-148. Radiocarbon dating of shells and calcarenite within the Formation places it in the Holocene.  A whole-of-calcarenite sample for radiocarbon analysis returned an age of 2740 +/-120 yrs BP. Shells of Saccostrea cucullata from under a limestone lens returned an age of 900 +/- 100 yrs BP.
Lithology Description: Red sand varying to orange quartz and light coloured to orange quartz-and-carbonate sand.

General Comments: Originally of Teichert, C., 1944. See published Lexicon (1963) for description. May be obsolete. Not used since 1980.
Replaces the invalid Barracouta Formation (WA)  -  the older Barracouta Formation of Gippsland Basin (Victoria), has priority.
Geological province: Murchison Domain.  Age: ~2780 Ma. Hosts vanadium mineralisation (mine is proposed).
Lithology Description: Layered gabbro and anorthosite, with magnetite and pyroxenite layers; metamorphosed.

General Comments: See also Barrambie Igneous Complex.
Lithology Description: Gabbro, pyroxenite, anorthosite, magnetite rock

General Comments: Replaces Burramundi Conglomerate, a historical name, possibly misspelt? Age is Early to ?Middle Famennian.
Lithology Description: Cobble to boulder conglomerate with minor intercalated coarse-grained sandstone and reefal carbonates; quartzite clasts dominant.
Interbedded calcarenite alternating with debris-flow megabreccias; local enormous allochthonous blocks of reef limestone.

General Comments: Abrolhos Sub-basin.
Probably accidently capitalised.
See also Barrow Formation. Recent references put this unit only in the Barrow and Exmouth Sub-basins of the Northern Carnarvon Basin. This group is a good quality gas reservoir.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone and claystone.

General Comments: Glengarry Basin. Previously included in Maraloou Formation.
Lithology Description: Locally laminated chert with cherty siltstone, ironstone; tuffaceous rocks, chertifed sedimentary rocks and thin lava flows; microbial laminates, barite and anhydrite nodules.
Fine- to coarse-grained ophitic to sub-ophitic dolerite and quartz granophyre overlying clinopyroxene cumulate.
Migmatitic orthogneiss.

General Comments: In Swan Coastal Plain area. Of Seddon (1972), Playford et al (1976).
Lithology Description: Basal conglomerate overlain by dune quartz sand with heavy mineral concentrations.

General Comments: Offshore. Vulcan Sub-basin &  Browse Basin.

Map sheet 2544 Meekatharra, SG50-11. Aphyric basalt with acicular pyroxene rich groundmass. Chemically and texturally distinct volcanic unit within the Meekatharra Formation.To be published = Volcanic member will be described in detail in a journal publication discussing its chemistry, and petrography. It will also be incorporated into GSWA geological series maps for the Gabanintha and Meekatharra 1:100,000 mapsheets.
Lithology Description: Aphyric basalt with acicular pyroxene rich groundmass.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File SD/52-14. Age updated by I.Sweet.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone and mudstone.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain. Age: ?2780Ma. Part of the Austin Downs Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Metamonzogranite; commonly foliated; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Age limits inferred from ages of component Darwin Formation (base) and Wangarlu Formation (top). This name superseded Bathurst Island Formation, but the Formation may have been reinstated in ~2005 by NTGS?
Lithology Description: Sublabile sandstone, siltstone, mudstone, conglomerate, conglomeratic sandstone, argillaceous siltstone; locally calcareous or unconsolidated; strongly weathered in outcrop with the development of a trizonal laterite profile.

General Comments: Kalgoorlie map sheet area. Fine-grained grey coloured microgranite sills and dykes that have intruded mafic rocks of the Coolgardie Subgroup; quartz-feldspar phenocrysts; locally  metamorphosed. To be published: East Yilgarn 2013-14 update. Digital package Geological Survey of Western Australia.

Lithology Description: Equigranular to feldspar porphyritic biotite monzogranite; weakly to moderately foliated.
Dioritic gneiss (circa 3280 Ma) and leucocratic gneiss (circa 2720 - igneous mafic intrusive) containing zircon xenocrysts with ages of circa 4000 Ma, 3982 Ma, and 3945 Ma

General Comments: Minimum age from tuff in overlying Wooly Dolomite. Conformable relationship with overlying Cheela Springs Basalt and Wooly Dolomite suggests minimum age is likely close to depositional age. Maximum age from dolerite sills intruding the underlying Turee Creek Group. Youngest detrital zircon in this unit (BRQ) is 2420 +/-18 Ma (GSWA 2005), but younger potential source rocks (dolerite dykes) contain no zircon. The parent unit, Shingle Creek Group, is proposed as the formal name to replace the informal lower Wyloo Group. As such it includes the Beasley River Quartzite, Cheela Springs Basalt, and Wooly Dolomite. Wyloo Group is now reserved for what was informally referred to as the upper Wyloo Group.
Lithology Description: Fine to coarse grained sandstone; locally silicified.

General Comments: Originally referred to as the Beaton's Creek Conglomerate by Noldart and Wyatt (1962). Contains significant placer gold mineralisation.
Lithology Description: Comprises very coarse-grained lenticular conglomerate with rounded to subangular pebbles and cobbles of granitic and wacke lithic fragments.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Glengarry Basin. Maximum age of 1996 Ma is from detrital zircons.
Lithology Description: Chloritic siltstone; sandstone; and breccia; numerous mafic volcanic fragments.
Fine- to medium-grained quartz and skeletal sand, mostly structureless and bioturbated; lenses of silty calcareous clay, rich in shell fragments.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Thin calcareous mudstone.

General Comments: Age: c.1835Ma.
Lithology Description: Siliceous argillaceous and slightly feldspathic quartz sandstone with sparse quartz, chert and claystone pebbles and ubiquitous large scale cross beds; basal red-purple-brown medium grained quartzite and flaggy micaceous fine sandstone.

General Comments: See also reservation for older Bedout Volcanics for use in offshore Canning Basin,  by R. Hocking (1988).
Reserved for use in offshore Canning Basin. See also younger Bedout Formation. [age and relationship information provided by J.Totterdell, MAR-2015]. See also younger Bedout Formation.
Age: 2346 +/- 38 Ma (Simonson and Hassler, 1997);  2603 +/- 7 Ma on zircon (Krapez, 1997). Max & min ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Argillite, dolomite, limestone, banded iron-formation, chert, volcaniclastics. Neoarchaean impact spherules. Contains a spherule marker bed.
Sandstone, siltstone, sedimentary breccia, conglomerate.

General Comments: See also definition data for Beedagong Formation.
Lithology Description: Calcareous claystone and/or mudstone which usually grades upward into calcilutite; green to dark grey; massive.

General Comments: For a granite in the Lissadell 1:250 000 sheet area (east Kimberley region). Age updated by I.Sweet.
Lithology Description: Medium- and coarse-grained porphyritic biotite monzogranite.

General Comments: Arrowsmith-Beagle Islands sheet area. (Hall and Kneale, 1992). Was intended to be replaced by Beekeeper Member of the Wagina Formation in 1995, but Beekeeper Formation remains in current use.
Lithology Description: Mixed carbonate-siliciclastic marine unit.

General Comments: See also Beekeeper Formation.

Cuts the southern part of the Southern Cross Domain and Southwest Terrane of the South Yilgarn Craton. NW trending; moderately magnetic, relatively short in length. Mafic. Age unknown, but probably younger than c.1210 Ma, because they crosscut younger structures in the Kepa Kurl Booya Province near Bremer Bay. See GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD and Spaggiari, CV (partial report), Beenong Dolerite (P_-_be-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 01 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite.

General Comments: Cuts the southern part of the Southern Cross Domain and Southwest Terrane of the South Yilgarn Craton. NW trending; moderately magnetic, relatively short in length. Mafic. Age unknown, but probably younger than c.1210 Ma, because they crosscut younger structures in the Kepa Kurl Booya Province near Bremer Bay.
Lithology Description: Mafic. Moderately magnetic.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Boulder conglomerate with mainly quartzite and volcanic clasts with lesser schist, granitoid, limestone, and vein quartz; the matrix varies from fine to very coarse, with fossil debris.

General Comments: Age is pre-Cainozoic.
Lithology Description: Radiolarian claystone, minor siltstone and fine sandstone
Granophyric leucogranite.

General Comments: Rocks previously assigned to Hardey Formation. Age: <2830 and >2772 Ma [Coongan Explan. Notes, 2010]. Age range from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Pelite, feldspathic sandstone, pebbly sandstone, conglomerate, shale, siltstone, metabasaltic lava and pillow lava, and metatuff.
Fossiliferous marine limestones+beach calcarenite; includes white to cream, shelly/bioturb.calcarenite, laminated x-laminated shelly calcarenite/coquina, laminated to x-laminated beach calcarenite.

General Comments: Informally named horizon within the Virgin Hills Formation. A transgressive marker bed with abundant trilobites. In the McWhae Ridge area.
Unit occurs in both Northern Territory and Western Australia.
Lithology Description: Carbonate; minor shale and sandstone.

General Comments: Previously considered part of the Grants Patch Group. Now (2016) reassigned into the Vetters Subgroup, Kalgoorlie Group. Bent Tree Basalt lies within Davyhurst, Bardoc and part way into the Kalgoorlie 1:100K map sheets areas.
Lithology Description: Tholeiitic basalt; massive pillowed lavas, including mafic sills; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Said by GSWA to be in Bentley Basin (2011, 2016). Age from constituent units. Max age from Kunmarnara Group. Minimum age from ?subvolcanic dacite sill intruding the Smoke Hill Volcanics (Tollu Group).
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, chert; felsic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks; minor mafic volcanic rocks; minor calcareous sediments; weakly to moderately deformed.

General Comments: Subsurface unit interpreted by Karen Connors for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area. Undivided low grade metasedimentary rocks of Bentley Supergroup; non-magnetic (to weakly magnetic) unit; gravity response is variable due to underlying units; unit is intensely folded and faulted within Musgrave Province in south, but to the north beneath western edge of Amadeus Basin it appears to form a broad, non-magnetic "sheet" of variable thickness sandwiched between overlying magnetic volcanics and underlying magnetic basement (See Frogtech Geoscience, 2017).
Lithology Description: Low grade metasedimentary rocks of Bentley Supergroup.

General Comments: Formerly "Wooramel suite" and "Bertibubba suite".
Lithology Description: Equigranular and porphyritic, biotite metamonzogranite; lesser dykes of leucocratic, biotite tonalite, and granodiorite.

General Comments: Included in Maiwok Subgroup of Roper Group in Urapunga-Roper River 2nd ed. explan. notes. Occurs in the Beetaloo Sub-basin. Note a Re-Os date from the lower part of the overlying Velkerri Formation is 1417+/-29 Ma (Munson, 2016). The 1386 Ma age is from a single grain (Yang et al, 2018).
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone: fine to medium and locally coarse grained, trough cross-stratification, ripple marks.

General Comments: Reserved as Beta Island Formation.
Lithology Description: Gypsum-bearing lunette dunes.

General Comments: Definition by Towner R.R., and Crowe R.W.A. (1976).  Subsurface only. Although 2008 paper suggested this name was abandoned/superseded, Mory (2010) says "appears to be equivalent to Hoya and Reeves Formations." In Fitzroy Trough area. Oil recovered from fluvial sand of this unit.
Lithology Description: Consists mainly of moderately sorted, medium to coarse-grained sandstone with minor mudstone and conglomerate, rare glauconite and a high proportion of lithic fragments; diamictite.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

Lithology Description: Poorly sorted, pebbly quartz sandstone.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

Lithology Description: Shelly calcarenite to calcirudite; shallow marine and beach-ridge deposits; minor calcretization.
Grey fine grained quartz feldspar porphyry and porphyritic micromonzogranite, in places foliated; a phase contains pink feldspar phenocrysts in places.

General Comments: For use on PINK HILLS map sheet; nearest town is Gascoyne Junction. To be published: EUDAMULLAH, MOUNT PHILLIPS, MOUNT AUGUSTUS, YINNETHARRA and PINK HILLS 1:100K map sheets. Named for Biddenew Creek in the area.
Lithology Description: Feldspathic metasandstone, with coarse-grained granule and pebbly feldspathic metasandstone, phyllite, quartz-muscovite schist, and cobble and boulder metaconglomerate.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain.
Lithology Description: Metagranite to metagranodiorite with rafts of metagabbro; monzogranite to syenogranite, undeformed; fine-grained monzogranite dykes in greenstones; schistose granodiorite; moderately foliated metagranodiorite.

General Comments: Previously considered part of the Linger and Die Group. Now (2016) reassigned into the Vetters Subgroup, Kalgoorlie Group. Big Dick Basalt lies within the Bardoc 1:100K  map sheet area.
Lithology Description: Komatiitic basalt. Variolitic basalt; pillowed to massive; metamorphosed

General Comments: Current usage revised formally in GSWA Bulletin 145 (text published 2009), although this name already exists on the maps for this publication (Plate 2, published 1998). Formerly designated as the informal Big Spring Member of Pillara Fm. (Read 1973).
Lithology Description: Cyclic units (to 20 m thick) of coarse-grained arkosic sandstone, well-bedded to massive; locally calcareous, with conglomerate at the base; siltstone, shale and carbonates towards the top
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Map Sheet = Menzies Nearest Town = Menzies.The unit occurs in the western part of the Eastern Goldfields Superterrane of the Yilgarn Craton. Wheretobepublished = GSWA explanatory notes and interpreted bedrock geology map in 2017.
Lithology Description: Mainly consists of biotite monzogranite with numerous pegmatite dykes.

General Comments: Age Late Jurassic (middle Oxfordian). Probably only in Barrow Sub-basin of Nthn Carnarvon basin. See references. Maybe interleaved with and underlying Dingo Claystone
Lithology Description: Sandstones.

General Comments: Place name is Billilly Well.  However correct usage for this formation name remains as Bililly as defined originally by Perry and Dickens (1960) BMR Report 46 (per email from R. Hocking/GSWA Mar.06). Max, thickness: 1200ft.
Lithology Description: Lower medium- to coarse-grained quartz sandstone and upper fine-grained silty sandstone and interbedded micaceous siltstone.

Basal high-Mg basalt, then massive tholeiitic basalt with abundant gabbro and dolerite sills; pyroclastic tholeiites in top 1 km, interlayered (in upper 500 m) with felsic volcanics and scarce ferruginous chert, intensely deformed and intruded.

General Comments: Possible source of Archean detrital zircons in Ferdies Member of the Dead Bullock Formation, Tanami region. See also Billabong complex.
Lithology Description: Strongly foliated, upper amphibolite facies biotite gneiss, coarse-grained augen gneiss.

General Comments: See also Billeranga Sub-group, and the misspelt Billeringa Subgroup.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, claystone, basalt and tuff, arkose, conglomerate

General Comments: Defn on Tech File G/50-1. Contains potential hydrocarbon sealing units.
Lithology Description: Grey thinly bedded feldspathic and quartz sandstone and siltstone with interbedded commonly carbonaceous shale; local friable calcisiltite and hard fossiliferous calcarenite.

General Comments: For the sandy unit presently included in the Tumblagooda Sandstone around Bindoo Hill just south of the Greenough River in the Irwin Terrace of the northern Perth Basin. It¿s an upgrade of the old Alan Condon name Bindoo Hill beds (from BMR Bull 77 part 1). I think it¿s a younger unit, probably Devonian, maybe Silurian, but definitely not part of the Tumblagooda (R.Hocking 17-Nov-2015).

Lithology Description: Medium-grained porphyritic basalt with plagioclase phenocrysts; agglomerate.  Highly weathered and laterised.

General Comments: Part of the Widgiemooltha Large Igneous Province; intrudes Archean greenstone and granitic units of the Yilgarn Craton. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD and Romano, SS (partial report), Binneringie Dolerite Member (P_-_wx-o): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 09 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Olivine gabbro and dolerite. Includes cumulate textures and granophyric differentiates.

General Comments: SG50-1. SHRIMP dates are on alunite altered tuff layers, and provide maximum depositional ages.
Lithology Description: Quartz wacke interbedded with grey to black siltstone and shale, commonly bioturbated; offshore marine to inner shelf.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Formerly referred to as "Butte Sandstone" (Clarke and Teichert (1948).
Lithology Description: Basal transgressive sandstone deposited in coastal to nearshore environment, overlain by marine shales, radiolarite, siltstone, calcilutite and calcarenite.

General Comments: Lennard River 250k. Previously informally known as Leopold Downs Dyke Suite. Metadolerite dykes; mainly northwest-trending dykes; commonly metamorphosed to amphibolite facies. Intrudes the Marboo Fm and granitic units of the Paperbark Supersuite; it does not include [intrude?] units of the Kimberley Basin, therefore an age of 1879 to 1810 is inferred. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD and Phillips, C (partial report), Biridu Dolerite (P_-_bi-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 06 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Metadolerite dykes; mainly northwest-trending dykes; commonly metamorphosed to amphibolite facies.

General Comments: Fregon Domain, Musgrave Province. Connection to Birksgate Granitic Complex assumed. Volcanosedimentary protoliths of ages: ~1550 and 1300 Ma.  Many rocks in the Birksgate Complex are also in the Pitjantjatjara Supersuite. In W.A. this unit has also been referred to as Birksgate Metamorphics - to be renamed in updated version of the BELL ROCK map sheet.
Lithology Description: Granulite to amphibolite facies quartzofeldspathic gneiss and paragneiss, locally migmatitic; granitic augen gneiss, locally mylonitic; felsic to ultramafic orthogneiss; leucogranite layers; garnet-sillimanite gneiss; staurolite gneiss; iron formation
Quartzite with local garnet, sillimanite, or staurolite

General Comments: Based on lithological and structural similarities the Supplejack Downs Sandstone (formerly of Ware Group) is now included in this group (RefID: 63261). Latest age control (summarised, 2008, by http://www.nt.gov.au/d/Minerals_Energy/Geoscience/index.cfm?header=Victoria%20and%20Birrindudu%20Basins) suggest Birrindudu Basin ranges from 1700-1640 Ma.  Equivalent of Tolmer Group. Hosts U and REE's in the Killi Killi Hills.
Lithology Description: Sublithic arenite, quartz arenite,siltstone, shale, conglomerate,stromatolitic chert, limestone,glauconitic sandstone. Marine to fluvial sediments.

General Comments: Age: 1880 +/- 3 Ma, c. 1880Ma.  A rhyolite sill within this unit (Page and Hancock 1988) is now mapped as part of Maude Headley Member. Within the Lamboo Complex. Age: c.1880Ma.
Lithology Description: Low to medium grade metamorphosed basaltic volcanics, volcaniclastics, dolerites, pelites and carbonates; carbonate and chert lenses, and local sandstone interbeds.

General Comments: Confirmed reservation by A. Hickman (GSWA) 28-MAY-2007. For map sheet 2955; nearest town Marble Bar. Intrusion of Cleland Supersuite in Mount Edgar Granitic Complex. To be pub: GSWA Record 2006/15; defined in Mt Edgar Explan Notes (June 2007).
Lithology Description: Biotite monzogranite to granodiorite and syenogranite; fine- to coarse-grained; locally seriate and porphyritic; rare pegmatite dykes; weakly metamorphosed.

General Comments: Advised of use in widely circulated, but unpublished report (R.Hocking)

Upgrade of Bitter Springs Formation to Group rank. CONSTITUENT UNITS (from base to top): Gillen Formation, Loves Creek Formation, Johnnys Creek Formation. Age from correlation of basalt in Johnnys Creek Formation with Amata Dolerite (824+/-4 Ma). New work gives a  maximum depositional age of 896 +/- 24 Ma for detrital zircon U-Pb SHRIMP sampled from informal member 3 of the Gillen Formation (Kositcin et al 2014), which is considerably older than the inferred deposition of 820 Ma for the Bitter Springs Group. Amadeus Basin, Centralian Superbasin.
Lithology Description: Dolomite, stromatolitic dolomite, siltstone, and sandstone; evaporitic in subsurface. Limestone, siltstone, mudstone.

General Comments: Plumridge  SH51-08 and Neale  SH51-04 sheet areas. Metagranodiorite and metadiorite; may include remnants of Archean rocks and Tropicana Gneiss. Tectonic Unit hierarchy: Tropicana Zone, Kepa Kurl Booya Province, Albany-Fraser Orogen. Publications: Doyle, M.G., Fletcher, I.R., Foster, J., Large, R.R., Mathur, R., McNaughton, N.J., Meffre, S., Muhling, J.R., Phillips, D. and Rasmussen, B., 2015.Geochronological constraints on the Tropicana Gold Deposit and Albany-Fraser Orogen, Western Australia. Economic Geology, 110(2): 355-386. Occhipinti, SA, Doyle, MG, Spaggiari, CV, Korsch, RJ, Cant, G, Martin, K, Kirkland, CL, Savage, J, Less, T, Bergin, L and Fox, L 2014, Preliminary interpretation of the deep seismic reflection line 12GA¿T1: northeastern Albany¿Fraser Orogen, in Albany-Fraser Orogen seismic and magnetotelluric (MT) workshop 2014: extended abstracts compiled by CV Spaggiari and IM Tyler: Geological Survey of Western Australia, Record 2014/6, p. 44-59.
Lithology Description: Metagranodiorite, quartz metadiorite, metadiorite.

General Comments: McIntosh 1:100 000 map sheet, East Kimberley.
Lithology Description: Foliated and metamorphosed leucocratic biotite-muscovite(-epidote) tonalite to granodiorite; inclusions of epidote amphibolite

General Comments: Used by Fairbridge (1953) to replace Black Flag Series, but no constituent units then, so Black Flag Beds was preferred. Corresponds to Black Flag Supersequence. In the Kalgoorlie Terrane in Eastern Goldfields Superterrane of the Yilgarn Craton. See also Black Flag beds, Black Flag Beds, Black Flag Formation for more information and history.
Lithology Description: Comprises upper felsic volcaniclastic and sedimentary rocks; and, lower dacites and andesites. Felsic units are intercalated with horizons of siltstone, mudstone and sandstone.  Also includes mafic dykes.

General Comments: New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk). Has a crystallisation age of 3018+/-19Ma; later, leucocratic veining during a 2970+/-5 magmatic event.  Intrudes Ruth Well Formation (Roeburne Group) and Andover Intrusion.
Lithology Description: Weakly foliated monzogranite.

General Comments: Published as Black Range Suite in 94/27988. Not used since 1998. Replaced by Black Range Dolerite Suite from 1999 to ~2013, but In 2018 GSWA has taken the decision to return to using this name. Intrudes Muccan and Mount Edgar granitoid complexes. A prominent swarm of black to very dark brown weathering dolerite dykes with north to north-east strike-related to basaltic lavas Mount Roe Basalt (of Fortescue Group). See also GSWA ENS: Hickman, AH (partial report), Black Range Dolerite (A-_bg-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 03 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite dyke; local gabbro; weakly metamorphosed.

General Comments: Note: both Black Rock Subgroup (NSW) and Black Rock Sandstone (Vic) have priority and are unrelated. Black Rock Granite NSW, is invalid and unrelated.  King Leopold Orogen.  Age: c.1865-1850Ma.
Lithology Description: Biotite-hornblende granodiorite and tonalite.

General Comments: Fine grained basalt and basaltic breccia. Kalkarindji Province.
Lithology Description: Interbedded basalt and agglomerate, minor intercalated sandstone and siltstone.
Troctolite, norite, gabbro.

General Comments: Informal name for the upper part of the Kuriyippi Formation, which this author says needs redefining; he includes it in the Treachery Formation.
Originally of Reeves (1951). Also supersedes Wonjil Shale. See also Lexicon. Also previously named Belina Shale.
Lithology Description: Shallow marine to freshwater, fossiliferous and commonly bioturbated well-bedded siltstone with common small-scale cross beds, shale, and very fine sandstone, mudstone.

General Comments: Name not originally reserved. This unit also occurs near Mt Bertreaux (along Wankari Detachment Zone). Underlies Amadeus Basin sediments.
Lithology Description: Red shales, polymictic conglomerate, sandstone, siltstone; tuffaceous horizons and local lensoidal quartz sandstone beds; felsic and mafic schist derived from volcanic rock, schistose quartz conglomerate.

General Comments: In the Edmund Basin. Minimum age constrained by regionally discordant dolerite sill (1072+/-8 Ma), but otherwise constrained by age of Edmund Group.
Lithology Description: Locally sulphidic siltstone and mudstone with minor thinly to thickly bedded sandstone, chert, claystone
Sandstone, red-brown, fine to medium-grained, kaolinitic, with pebble beds. Trace fossils, cross bedded

General Comments: Of Woolyeenyer Group.

A correlation of this unit in wells across the Barbwire Terrace includes mudstone, sandstone and carbonate lithologies, the name Boab Sandstone is no longer suitable. wheretobepublished = A Revised Subsurface Devonian Stratigraphy for the Central and Southern Canning Basin. GSWA Report to be published early 2014.
In the NE part of the Albany-Fraser Orogen, Neale 1:250 000 sheet area SH5104, Scherk Range 1:100k, 3840. Previously called the Bobbies Point Alkali Granite
Lithology Description: Pink, medium- to coarse-grained, seriate to equigranular, variably strained and mylonitized metasyenogranite; weak to moderate, NE-trending foliation. Includes minor mingled mafic rocks and minor BIF rafts.
Boulder, cobble and pebble conglomerate,  coarse-grained conglomeratic sandstone, clasts mainly of Precambrian quartzite.

General Comments: Defined as Boee Beds 1973. Described in GSWA Memoir 3 (1990) , NW Birrindudu Basin,  p351, 353, 357. May be lateral equivalent of Redcliff Pound Group. Neoproterozoic.  Age from K.Grey (GSWA, Memoir #3, 1990).
Lithology Description: Medium to fine grained lithic sandstone with minor conglomerate
Pebble to boulder conglomerate pebbly sandstone, quartz arenite and minor siltstone.

General Comments: Offshore shale and siltstone equivalent of Langfield and Ningbing Groups, also Cockatoo Group equivalent. See also Bonaparte Formation, Upper and Bonaparte Formation, Lower. Divided into upper and lower parts on the basis of palynological assemblages.
Lithology Description: Shale, siltstone, dolomitic sandstone and quartzitic limestone.

General Comments: Acts as a seal for the Nita Formation hydrocarbon reservoir.
Lithology Description: Dominantly red-brown mudstone, often calcareous or dolomitic, with interbeds of argillaceous dolomite and rare thin beds, veins and scattered crystals of halite and anhydrite.

General Comments: Also older Sm-Nd dates (3280, 3260 Ma) for Bonney Downs Granite [but said to intrude Golden Eagle Orthogneiss which is ~3199-3178 Ma].
Lithology Description: Monzogranite and leucomonzongranite, sparsely porphyritic and muscovite-bearing, locally abundant xenoliths of granitic gneiss and greenstone.

General Comments: Kalgoorlie 1:250 000 sheet area.
Lithology Description: Tonalite; mafic granite.
Claystone

General Comments: Map Sheet=Balladonia SI51-3, 3632. Nearest Town=Esperance. Brief description: Undeformed to weakly deformed granite; typically porphyritic. Published in 2015 in Geological Survey of Western Australia Report 150.
Lithology Description: Granites, ferroan, alkali-calcic to alkalic; characteristically strongly enriched in REE. A-type.

General Comments: Intruded Warrawoona Group.
Lithology Description: Dacite porphyry. Euhedral to subhedral plagioclase and quartz phenocrysts up to 5 mm long set in a dark aphanitic groundmass. Plagioclase (An30) laths commonly form glomeroporphyritic groups.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain.  Age: c.2780Ma.
Lithology Description: Layered gabbro, with dunite, pyroxenite, anorthosite, and hornblende gabbro; includes younger leucogabbro; metamorphosed
Forms basement of the Boogardie Synform consisting of talc-carbonate altered ultramafic flows cut by fine to medium-grained felsic intrusives.

General Comments: (Playford et al., 1976).
Lithology Description: Sandstone.

General Comments: Intruded by Carbana Monzogranite (Emu Supersuite). Structurally underlies and locally intrudes basal part of Panorama Formation (Warrawoona Group). In the East Pilbara Terrane.
Lithology Description: Strongly foliated to gneissic biotite tonalite containing greenstone xenoliths; the gneissic compositional layering is complexly folded.

General Comments: Sherlock 1:100 000 sheet.  Name abandoned by GSWA (Mar.06) - formerly parent of Louden and Mount Negri Volcanics (both now Members of the new Bookingarra Formation), Cistern Formation, Kialrah Rhyolite and Rushall Slate (all 3 now part of Croydon Group).  The Bookingarra Group has been reinstated in 2016. Reinterpreted structural, stratigraphic, and geochronological data indicate that the succession of the Whim Creek greenstone belt was not deposited immediately adjacent to the succession of the Mallina Basin and that several of the correlations made by Van Kranendonk et al. (2006) are incorrect (Hickman, 2016).
Lithology Description: Volcaniclastic sedimentary rocks, siliciclastic rocks and basalts which unconformably overlie Whim Creek Basin.

General Comments: Carnarvon Basin. Needed as a result of new age data. To be published in AJES.

See also Boolaloo Granite. Gascoyne Province. Shown as part of -Pg on Wyloo 1:250k map sheet.  Previously in Boolaloo Supersuite but GSWA have discontinued this supersuite in favour of Moorarie Supersuite (S.Sheppard, pers. comm., Oct 2008)
Lithology Description: Biotite granodiorite (locally adamellite).

General Comments: Ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Fine-grained, finely laminated, dark grey-brown to black flaggy iron-formation, minor chert, jaspilite, shale; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Name requested: Boonadgin Dyke Suite. Dolerite dykes. Map Sheet: Pinjarra SI 50 -02.  Nearest Town: Pingelly. NW trending dolerite dykes in SW Yilgarn, discernible in aeromagnetic maps. Three dykes dated at 1888 Ma with SHRIMP and TIMS U-Pb. Named after Boonadgin Nature Reserve near the location of the key sample from which the new age was first identified. To be published: Manuscript to be submitted to Precambrian Research by the end of March 2017.
Ruby Plains 1:100 000 sheet area. Defined as Adelaidean age.
Lithology Description: Basal interbedded laminated buff dolomite and flaggy dolomitic siltstone; common upper intraclastic, peloidal, oolitic and stromatolitic grainstone. Discontinuous lenticular  beds of graded and massive conglomerate above laminated dolomite.

General Comments: Age: 610 Ma. Formerly of Savory Group. In the Savory Sub-basin. Intruded by "Boondawarri Dolerite".
Lithology Description: Diamictite, conglomerate, sandstone, siltstone, shale and carbonates, including distinctive oolitic and pisolitic limestone and stromatolitic dolomite.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Dominated by tholeiitic basalts, with massive flows, associated with pillow lava and hyaloclastite breccia.

General Comments: See also Boongerooda Greensand. Age: 61.5-60Ma.

Lithology Description: Reef limestone; massive accumulation of collapsed coral fronds of Acropora.
Medium-grained, equigranular biotite monzogranite; scattered mafic enclaves and strong foliation.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. This unit too young to be part of Canning Basin as defined in Provinces database, but GSWA has a broader definition. Different unit to Early Cretaceous Borda Formation of Bight Basin, SA.
Offshore unit.

Also Defn on Tech File D/52-14. Has been used for Waggon Creek Fm+Point Spring Sst. Onshore unit of Wadeye Gp. Regarded as part of Point Spring Sst by Mory and Beere(1988) but actually overlies it; onshore equiv. of Kuriyippi Fm. Formerly of Point Spr Sst. See also Point Spring Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone, conglomerate, siltstone.
Dolerite; typically recrystallised at amphibolite facies. Includes Norie Group wall rocks / xenoliths.

General Comments: Unclear why this was considered 'Not a stratigraphic name' in 2001, but name continues to be used, and rocks described. Kurnalpi Terrane. See also Bore Well complex and Bore Well rhyolite. Age is for a rhyolitic volcaniclastic rock within the Complex.
Lithology Description: Andesites and volcaniclastic rocks with minor dacites, rhyolites and intrusions.

General Comments: Eastern Goldfields Province. Age derived from coarsed grained porphyritic granite sample. See also 'Mount Boreas' names.
Lithology Description: Includes undeformed, coarse-grained, porphyritic granite.

General Comments: This unit is not included on GSWA maps since about 2000.  eg, mapped as un-named coastal dune and beach deposits on 2006 Port Hedland 250K and 2000 Roeburne 250K map. This unit is too young to be part of Canning Basin as defined in Provinces database, but GSWA uses a broader definition.
Lithology Description: Calcarenite; minor calcirudite and calcilutite.

General Comments: Forrest SH52-10. In a drillhole through Eucla Basin. Mafic to intermediate metagranite. To be published=GSWA Record, September 2015.
Lithology Description: Diorite to metamonzodiorite.

General Comments: To be used for porphyritic microgranite on map sheet SH 51-5; nearest town is Menzies.
Lithology Description: Feldspar- and quartz-phyric microgranite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Probably surficial unit of Boulder Dyke.

The Bounty Igneous Complex is an extensively developed mafic-ultramafic intrusive unit that concordantly lies between the Songvang Formation and the Never Can Tell Basalt in the Lawlers Anticline. It is characterized by two fractionation cycles that grade from peridotite and pyroxenite at the base through gabbro to dolerite on the top. wheretobepublished = GSWA digital package 2013/2014. Geographical name = Bounty Group mine.
See variations of Bow Hill lamprophyre.
Lithology Description: Olivine-phlogopite lamprophyre and garnet-phlogopite lamprophyre.

General Comments: On Bow 100K map (GSWA, 1999) superseded by Paperbark and Sally Down Supersuites? Proposed this be redefined as Bow batholith, reflecting the diversity of granitoid rocks - will incl: Sally Downs, Violet Valley Tonalites, some of Mabel Downs. But published as Bow River Granite on Auvergne 100K and 1:250k maps (NTGS, 2000, 2006, 2015), and in GSWA Kimberley update 2013., perhaps with modified distribution?
Lithology Description: Typically a pink to green-grey, coarsely crystalline and porphyritic biotite granite; phenocrysts of K-feldspar locally displaying rapakivi textures.

General Comments: Dolerite dykes, trending northwest to north-northwest.The dykes extend from east of Kalbarri in the north to Albany in the south. Assigned to Marnda Moorn Suite; age 1218-1202 Ma; emplaced during the formation of the Pinjarra Orogen (Darling Orogeny). See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD (partial report), Boyagin Dolerite (P_-MMbo-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 09 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite dykes.

General Comments: Precambrian. West Pilbara.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed pillow basalt, massive basalt, dolerite sills and minor felsic tuff and chert - with spinifex-textured komatiitic basalt near base.

General Comments: May be accidental capitalisation of informal name.
Lithology Description: Monzogranite.

General Comments: Formerly included in the Sunbeam Group. Age appears to be poorly constrained between Mesoproterozoic and Neoproterozoic.
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone and subordinate siltstone, predominantly cross-bedded, in places pebbly; mudstone; minor glauconitic sandstone, pebble conglomerate; fluvial to coastal deposits.
Massive, serpentinized dunite to peridotite, intensely foliated talc-tremolite-magnetite-carbonate schists. two peridotite>pyroxenite>gabbro fractionation cycles in Lawlers Anticline.

General Comments: First described by Talbot (1926); defined by Daniels and MacLeod (1965). Age range constrained by Wyloo Group (below) and Bangemall Group (above) that sandwich it. In 2012 (GSWA Record 2011/25) age range shown as 1800-1465 Ma. Bresnahan Basin.
Lithology Description: Both matrix-supported and clast-supported boulder conglomerate, conglomeratic sandstone, pebbly sandstone dominates, interbedded fine sandstone and mudstone.
Marl

General Comments: upper Vulcan Formation? Probably intended to mean the Berriasian sands in the Brewster 1A well, in the Caswell sub-Basin.
Lithology Description: A thick sequence of clean, relatively high net/gross sands with mudstones; deposited by poorly confined, sand-rich, mid-slope grain flows or high-density turbidity currents on a deep-water ramp.

General Comments: NULLAGINE and YARRIE 1:250 000 sheet areas. Pilbara Province. First used by the Proterozoic Granites Project.
Lithology Description: Trachyandesitic, trachytic, and lamprophyre dykes, porphyritic; hornblende monzogranite, granodiorite, micromonzonite, microsyenite, and micromonzodiorite, in small stocks.

General Comments: Reserved as Bridport (Semeniuk 1987).
Lithology Description: Grey, primarily carbonate sandy mud and mud infilling deep, relatively still-water environments of the central basin of Cockburn Sound.

General Comments: Ages, relations updated from GA Timescales Project Feb 2009.
Lithology Description: Medium-grained sandstones with shell fragments and common rip-up clasts; fine-grained sandstones with tidal varves and shell lags; dark grey heterolithic mudstones with common Teichichnus trace fossils; calcified sandstone.

General Comments: New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk).  Also, for use on PINDERI HILLS map sheet; nearest town Karratha.
Lithology Description: Monzogranite, and lesser granodiorite, foliated and locally gneissic; medium-grained, but characterised by ubiquitous megcrysts of microcline; minor hornblende.

General Comments: Kalgoorlie map sheets, SH51-09, 3136, Coolgardie area. Extrusive meta-ultramfic to high-Mg unit with localised spinifex textures. Overlain by the Lindsays Basalt (lateral equivalent to the Lunnon Basalt) and overlies the Burbanks Formation.To be published: Electronic and digital update of the East Yilgarn package, in 2013. Geological Survey of Western Australia, Department of Mines and Petroleum
Lithology Description: Extrusive meta-ultramfic to high-Mg unit with localised spinifex textures

General Comments: Map Sheet: Halls Creek 4461, Gordon Downs SE52-10. Laminated, fine-grained quartzite grading locally into graphitic metasandstone and schist. Conformably overlain by calcareous metasandstone, metasiltstone, carbonate schist and marble. Metasedimentary rocks are intercalated with bimodal metavolcanic rocks. Metamorphosed to upper greenschist facies. This new formation will be defined in a GSWA report on the geology of the Eastern Zone of the Lamboo Province, Halls Creek Orogen, northern WA. This report will be published within the next few months (beginning of the 2016/17 financial year).
Lithology Description: Laminated, fine-grained quartzite grading locally into graphitic metasandstone and schist. Conformably overlain by calcareous metasandstone, metasiltstone, carbonate schist and marble. Intercalated with bimodal metavolcanics
Friable black shale with thin yellow phosphate bands; containing palynomorphs, foraminifera and vertebrate remains.

General Comments: Historical name has been used from prominent Township on the Bardoc map sheet - Broad Arrow. Lies within the Bardoc and Kalgoorlie 1:100K sheet areas. Forms part of the Kalgoorlie Group in the Eastern Goldfields Superterrane of the Yilgarn Craton. It includes the Highway Formation and Scotia Basalt. To be published = GSWA digital release 2016.
Lithology Description: Basalt and komatiite; local relict pyroxene spinifex texture; minor interflow sedimentary rock; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Hosts Cu-Pb-Zn mineralisation.
Lithology Description: Interbedded fine to coarse sandstone, siltstone, silty shale, pyritic and pyrrhotitic shale, dolomite, stromatolitic dolomite, local basalt
Carbonate rock and minor shale, commonly sulphidic

General Comments: See also Brockman Creek Kimberlite.
Lithology Description: kimberlite dyke

General Comments: Contains the majority of main iron ore zones. Ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706. See also the many informal or misspelled variations on Brockman %.
Lithology Description: Banded iron-formation, chert, mudstone and siltstone. Includes crocidolite.
Quartz sandstone, conglomerate.

General Comments: See also the informal Bronzite Ridge complex.
See also Lexicon. Formerly considered part of Dampier Group.
Lithology Description: Fine- to very coarse-grained sandstone; minor mudstone and conglomerate; deltaic

General Comments: In refID 72034. (GSWA (2016). 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology of Western Australia. Informal grouping of Early Cretaceous siliciclastic Canning Basin units. Also Subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Fine- to coarse-grained sandstone; minor mudstone and conglomerate.

General Comments: Reserved as Gannet Formation - advised by R.Hocking 10-12-92.
Lithology Description: Limestone.

General Comments: Previously Browne Evaporites, Browne Beds, Browne beds. Age considered to be c.840 - c.818 Ma in 2000, when the base of the Cryogenian was 850 Ma [basis of numerical age assertions unclear].
Lithology Description: Gypsum, dolomite, halite, anhydrite. Red-brown mudstone, argillaceous dolostone, sandstone, minor conglomerate.

General Comments: Balfour Downs explanatory notes. See also Brownrigg Formation.
Lithology Description: Fine- to coarse-grained quartz sandstone  with cubic and spherical voids after pyrite and limonite; scattered small pebbles of vein quartz;minor interbedded carbonate siltstone.

General Comments: East Kimberley, Gordon Downs 1:250 000 sheet area. Different ages appear to represent different events.
Lithology Description: Arkose metamorphosed to quartzofeldspathic granofels with sparse to abundant pebbles and cobbles; minor banded ironstone, siltstone, and foliated conglomeratic calc-silicate rocks.

General Comments: Described but informal. See also Bruno Member.
Lithology Description: BIF.

General Comments: SG50-8, Peak Hill. Reservation modified Oct 95. Glengarry Basin. Deposited in the Bryah rift. Max depositional age given by detrital zircons in Ravelstone Formation dated at 2014+/-22 Ma (Nelson,1997). Minimum age given by Pb-Pb isochron age of 1920+/-35 Ma from the Narracoota Formation (RefID 21099, 2000). Incorporates part of the Glengarry Group of Gee (1979, 1987).
Lithology Description: Includes a sequence of greywacke and conglomerate; mafic-ultramafic volcanic rocks; turbiditic sedimentary rocks; chemical and fine-grained clastic units.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Glengarry Basin.
Lithology Description: Chert breccia, laminated (wavy microbial) chert and chertified stromatolitic dolomite; well bedded to chaotic breccias.

General Comments: Overlies Amadeus Basin units.
Lithology Description: Silty sandstone, conglomerate, conglomeratic sandstone.
Thick-bedded, blocky to flaggy quartz sandstone interbedded with ferruginous sandstone and siltstone.

General Comments: After Buddadoo Hill (type area), Mellenbye 1:100k map sheet. Type area: 28deg 42'S 116deg 29'E.  Intrusive into possible Norie Group rocks and overlain by Polelle Group rocks.
Lithology Description: Layered gabbroic rocks with distinctive magnetitite horizons and minor diorite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Formerly assigned to the Sulphur Springs Group, but now placed in the Soanesville Group (Hickman 2011 GSWA Annual Review 2009-10)
Lithology Description: Basalt, generally pillowed, minor komatiitic basalt, metamorphosed; tuffaceous volcaniclastic sandstone, dacitic composition, weakly metamorphosed; felsic volcaniclastic sandstone, shale, local grey, white and black chert, weakly metamorphosed.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Fossiliferous, shallow marine reef complex marginal slope facies, white to pink medium to thickly bedded calcarenite grading to calcirudite;crudely bedded; some allochthonous blocks lst, sst, siltst.

General Comments: This name may be obsolete?
Lithology Description: Tholeiitic and high MgO basalt.

General Comments: Not related to Buldania Formation. Replaces 2849 Buldania Granitoid Complex?
Lithology Description: Composite intrusion; predominantly seriate biotite-hornblende granodiorite; biotite-rich monzogranite; metagranitic rock; amphibole-rich metamonzogranitic rock.

General Comments: For succession from Heavitree Quartzite to Steptoe Formation. Named after Buldya Soak in Throssell 1:250 000 sheet area. Age: ca 830 to ca 700Ma.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, shale, dolomite, limestone, evaporites (halite, gypsum, anhydrite) in subsurface and diapirs. Mixed carbonate-clastic-evaporite succession.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.Contains significant hydrocarbon source rocks.
Lithology Description: Shale, siltstone, minor quartz wacke, variably calcareous.
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

Lithology Description: High-Ca granite. Fine- to coarse-grained biotite monzogranite; K-feldspar phenocrysts, locally megacrystic; foliated.
Foliated, partly recrystallized monzogranite; quartz-biotite-oligoclase-microcline matrix and scattered microcline phenocrysts.
Limestone
Nonfoliated, medium- to coarse-grained, leucocratic biotite(¿muscovite) monzogranite; previously mapped as a muscovite-bearing granitic rock; weakly metamorphosed.

General Comments: Age: 1610-1570Ma. Birindudu Basin.
Lithology Description: Dolostone, dolarenite, siltstone, sandstone, chert, shale.
Quartz sandstone, conglomerate.

General Comments: Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).  In the West Pilbara Superterrane.
Lithology Description: Gabbro, leucogabbro, serpentinised peridotite and dunite, pyroxenite and minor anorthosite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).
Lithology Description: Layered mafic intrusions

General Comments: Described in GSWA Memoir 3 (1990) p504, 516-517.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, conglomerate, minor dolomite; fossiliferous
Komatiitic and high MgO dolerite rocks structurally interleaved with calc-alkaline feldspathic sandstones.
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

Lithology Description: Medium-grained, hornblende bearing, perthitic K-feldspar phenocrysts; unfoliated. High Ca granite.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Porphyritic tholeiitic basalt
Shoreline, marine and coastal aeolian deposits; includes coastal lake deposits. Calcareous aeolianite, coralgal reefs, coquina and shelly limestone, variably calcreted.

General Comments: Map sheet 2544 Meekatharra, SG50-11. Spinifex textured high-Mg basalt, locally with orthocumulate basal subunits. These are a texturally and geochemically distinct sub-unit within the uppermost part of the Meekatharra Formation. To be published = Volcanic member is described in detail in a journal publication in review (journal of Petrology). It will also be incorporated into GSWA 1:100,000 geological series mapsheet 2544 (Meekatharra) to be published in 2017.
Lithology Description: Spinifex textured high-Mg basalt, locally with orthocumulate basal subunits.

General Comments: Clearly not related to Cenozoic Bungarra Member.
Lithology Description: Layered mafic and ultramafic intrusive rocks; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Clearly not related to  Archean Bungarra Igneous Complex.
