Defn on Tech File SE/52-6. Probably conformable on Mount Parker Sandstone. Limited to Osmond Range area.  No longer includes Halls Creek area dolomite (now the Neoproterozoic Eliot Range Dolomite). See also recent use of Bungle Bungle Formation.
Lithology Description: Dolarenite, dololutite, and dolorudite, and chert breccia; commonly stromatolitic; minor dolomitic sandstone, siltstone and mudstone, and stromatolitic chert.

General Comments: Ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Pillowed and massive basaltic flows; basaltic breccia; and basaltic volcanic sandstone; minor chert; amygdaloidal basalt flows occur in upper parts of formation; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Badja,  Rothsay, Youanmi 100k sheets.  To be used in the southern Murchison Domain. Named after Bunnawarra  Hsd, lat 28deg37', long 116deg34'. Age: 2970-2930 Ma. Type area: Outcrops around Kynea Rockholes. Metamorphosed 'basement' unit, no known older units in region.
Lithology Description: Kynea Tonalite: Migmatitic tonalite to granodiorite gneiss with metagranitic leucosomes

General Comments: Will be of Coolgardie Subgroup, when that name published [Charlotte Hall, GSWA 29-MAY-2013]
Lithology Description: Coarsely plagioclase-phyric basalt.

General Comments: Originally named Federal City Tonalite but changed after nomenclatural debate - for use in the complete revision of the Murchison domain lithostratigraphy; to be published in GSWA Annual Review 2007-2008. Age ?2750 Ma. Geological province: Murchison Domain. Part of the Annean Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Tonalite; weakly metamorphosed

General Comments: 1190-1170 Ma intrusion age. Intruded into the Nornalup Zone late in Stage II of the Albany-Fraser Orogeny. A voluminous porphyritic granite. NOT related to Paleoproterozoic Burnside Granite, NT.
Lithology Description: Porphyritic granite
Coarse-grained biotite monzogranite; K-feldspar megacrysts; generally homogeneous, deformed at margins; possible a composite intrusion.

General Comments: Fine to coarse grained well sorted aeolianite, yellow coloured, poorly cemented, and with distinctive cross-bedding. Mineralogy: carbonate, quartz, feldspar. Deposited in Marine Isotope Stage 1 (~8 ka).[Matej Lipar, Pers. Comm. Mar 2014]
Lithology Description: Unit of aeolian sand and soil sheets. Partly indurated along laminae causing some lithification; abundant rhizoconcretions.

General Comments: Map Sheet: SH51-1,  Wildara 3041. Pyroxene spinifex-textured basalt; locally variolitic and/or pillowed; metamorphosed . To be published = GSWA geological map and explanatory notes, 2013/2014. Not related to Burrell Creek Formation, Burrell Creek Volcanics or misspelt Burrell Formation, all NT.
Lithology Description: Pyroxene spinifex-textured basalt; locally variolitic and/or pillowed; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Formerly Burt Range Series. Now includes Spirit Hill Limestone. Hosts Pb-Zn-Ag deposits.
Lithology Description: Calcareous sandstone, quartzose limestone and dolostone, minor carbonaceous shale. A diverse fossil assemblage.
HFSE-granitoid intruded into mafic-volcanic and sedimentary rocks.

General Comments: Intrudes the Burtville Sandstone.
Formally known as Burvill beds. Max. thickness: <80m.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, typically fine- to very fine-grained; minor siltstone, shale, calcareous sandstone and quartzose limestone. A diverse assemblage of macrofossils, trace and microfossils.

General Comments: Jackson 1:100 000 sheet area (2737). Intruded by Chatarie Well Granite.  Intrudes Marda Complex.
Lithology Description: Fine- to medium-grained granophyric monzogranite; High-HFSE granite.

General Comments: East Kimberley Region. Within the Halls Creek Group. Age: c.1855Ma. Not related to Butchers Basalt, Yilgarn Craton.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed and chlorite altered trachytic and trachyandesitic volcanics and volcaniclastics, commonly with a carbonate rich matrix, and local ferruginous chert and metachert.

General Comments: Map Sheet: SH51-1,  Munjeroo 2941.  Basalt; fine-grained with local pyroxene-spinifex texture, includes medium-grained layers and lenses; minor interflow sediments; metamorphosed. To be published = GSWA geological map and explanatory notes, 2013/2014. Not related to Butchers Gully Member.
Lithology Description: Basalt; fine-grained with local pyroxene-spinifex texture, includes medium-grained layers and lenses; minor interflow sediments; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Rudall 1:100 000 sheet area.
Lithology Description: Banded paragneiss with layers of quartz-feldspar-biotite gneiss, quartz-biotite schist, micaceous quartzite, quartz-muscovite schist and amphibole-chlorite schist. Local metamorphosed banded iron formation

General Comments: Equivalent to Ningbing Group, or part of it? Contains similar miospore assemblage (Playford, 1982) and ostracod fauna (Jones, 1985, 1987) to lower Fairfield Group, Canning Basin.
Lithology Description: Sandy & silty limestone with minor silty dolomite & sandstone with thin beds of sandy limestone. Richly fossiliferous.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.Good to fair predominantly gas-generating source rock intervals are present.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, quartz wacke, shale, sandstone, claystone; locally fossiliferous shelf sequence.
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Informal subdivision of Byro Group. Unclear how this corresponds to the formal lithostratigraphy.
Lithology Description: Fine-grained, bioturbated sandstone overlying interbedded sandstone, siltstone, and mudstone.

General Comments: Informal subdivision of Byro Group. Unclear how this corresponds to the formal lithostratigraphy.
Lithology Description: Black shale and siltstone overlain by fine-grained sandstone; hummocky and swaley cross-stratified.

General Comments: Informal subdivision of Byro Group. Unclear how this corresponds to the formal lithostratigraphy.
Lithology Description: Intercalated siltstone, shale, and sandstone.

General Comments: Age: c. 1804Ma. Geological Province: Blair Basin
Lithology Description: Thin to very thick-bedded medium to very coarse-grained sandstone, dolostone, dololutite, dolorudite and felsic volcanic rock.

General Comments: Radiocarbon dating of shells within the Formation places it in the Holocene, viz., 1090 +/- 160 yrs BP and 2100 +/- 180 yrs BP. PUBLICATION: Semeniuk, V., 2008, Journal of the Royal Society of Western Australia Volume 91 Part 1 (Supplement): 53-148.
Lithology Description: Light-coloured, laminated, bedded, to low-angle cross-bedded, medium to fine to coarse sand and shelly sand and some shell gravel. Locally, the Formation is cemented to form beachrock which occurs as a sloping rock pavement.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, shelly limestone.

General Comments: Houtman Sub-basin. See also Cadda Formation.
SE51-12, Noonkanbah. Canning Basin.
Lithology Description: Vuggy unfossiliferous dolomite, interbedded siltstone, evaporites and breccia. Includes relict stromatolites and corals.

General Comments: To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Cagacaroon Hills, Mellenbye 1:100k sheet area. 28deg38'S 116deg25'E. Type area: Cagacaroon Hills. Intrusive into probably lower Polelle Group supracrustal rocks.
Lithology Description: Metasyenogranite to metagranodiorite.

General Comments: Underlies a 50 km2 area between Balla Balla and Peawah Hill, north of the Sholl Shear Zone. Occupies about 500 km2 S of the SSZ and was dated at 2990 +/-5 Ma (GSWA 142950, Nelson, 2000). The rock is a foliated, K-feldspar porphyritic biotite (-hornblende) monzogranite with local xenoliths of granitic gneiss [Hickman (2016) GSWA Report 160, p54].
Lithology Description: Foliated, K-feldspar porphyritic biotite (¿hornblende) monzogranite with local xenoliths of granitic gneiss.

General Comments: Gascoyne region.
Lithology Description: Equigranular and porphyritic, medium-grained biotite monzogranite.

General Comments: Balfour Downs area. See also Hickman (1983) GSWA Bull127 p131-132. Trends north-northeast and has a maximum width of 1000 m, 2 km south of Daylight Rock Hole. Intrudes Mosquito Creek Formation, Kurrana Batholith. Unconformably overlain by Fortescue Group. See also GSWA ENS: WINGATE, MTD (partial report), Cajuput Dolerite Member (A-_bj-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 03 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite dyke, gabbroic.

General Comments: Map sheet area: 2252 Hardey 1:100k. A glacigenic diamictite unit approximately 500m above the top of the Meteorite Bore Member within the Kungarra Formation, Turee Creek Group, just below the Beasley River Quartzite unconformity in a section that includes the type section of the Meteorite Bore Member (MBM) on the northern limb of the Hardey Syncline. To be published: Initially in GSWA's Explanatory Notes Database (ENS), but ultimately in a GSWA Record or peer reviewed publication (AJES?)
Lithology Description: Glacigenic diamictite.

General Comments: Defined 1959, redefined 1961, 1981. Also supersedes Callawa Boulder beds. See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Fluviatile cross-bedded very fine to coarse-grained sandstone, granule conglomerate and minor siltstone; plant and trace fossils

General Comments: To be used on the North Shaw mapsheet; nearest town is Marble Bar. Rocks extensively migmatised and deformed; cut by swarms of leucogranite veins. East Pilbara Terrane. Occurs as minor banded granitic gneiss within the Cleland Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Monzogranite, granodiorite, quartz diorite, granite, leucogranite, quartz-feldspar porphyry, rhyolite dykes, diorite, leucogranodiorite, felsic orthogneiss, migmatite, amphibolite, pegmatite

General Comments: See also Lexicon. First described by Maitland (1901). Some 2003 GSWA publications show this unit as part of the Lyons Group, but the GSWA 2008 1:500k Geology does not.
Lithology Description: Calcareous siltstone and hard calcarenite, limestone, conglomerate; very fossiliferous; glacigene and marine.
Equigranular, medium- to coarse-grained biotite bearing monzogranite. High Ca granite

General Comments: Previously called the Calyie Sandstone, this unit has been reduced in area, see refID 23156 Williams (1995). Supersedes Mount Vernon Sandstone. Collier Basin.
Lithology Description: Recrystallised fine to coarse sandstone, in places glauconitic, with lesser interbedded siltstone, granule to pebble conglomerate, shale, mudstone, dolostone, pebbly sandstone, minor chert and dolostone

General Comments: Fully described in GSWA Record 1992/7, 93/27545.
Lithology Description: Monotonous sequence of silty shales deposited in low-energy, marine setting with restricted circulation.

Reserved by: Redfern R., Apak N., Backhouse J.
General Comments: Barbwire Terrace area, Canning Basin.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, claystone, fine-grained sandstone, thin basal limestone.

General Comments: Informally named horizon within the Virgin Hills Formation in the McWhae Ridge area.

Lithology Description: Sheared and weathered felsic volcanic rocks; intensely deformed and altered, banded quartz-oligoclase-hornblende-chlorite rocks with fragmental textures; andesitic in composition, probably pyroclastic in origin.

General Comments: In refID 72034. (GSWA (2016). 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology of Western Australia.  Also Subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, limestone.

General Comments: Amadeus Basin (phase 2).
Lithology Description: Siltstone and mudstone, sandstone, conglomerate, minor dolomite, shallow marine to fluvial.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset.
Lithology Description: Dolerite, gabbro and other mafic igneous rocks; commonly as dykes and sills; may include some metamorphosed mafic intrusions and subordinate ultramafic rocks.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset, and 'Pre-Cz geology, NSW & Vic'.
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Unclear if this is intended as a formal name or not. Probably equivalent to the Lawlers Tonalite.
Lithology Description: Strongly foliated and/or lineated grey, plagioclase-phyric tonalite to granodiorite.

General Comments: Gascoyne region. Age: c. 1985 Ma from age of veins intruding Quartpot Pelite.
Lithology Description: Garnet-sillimanite-bearing pelitic and psammitic schists; quartzite;metamorphosed banded iron-formation, amphibolite.

General Comments: Named after Camel Rock? Map Sheets: 3452 Connaughton, 3551Cronin. Nearest Town = Parnngurr.  K-feldspar, quartz, plagioclase  /- biotite leucogranite and monzogranite. Undeformed to strongly foliated and mylonitic. Intrudes Paleo- to Mesoproterozoic rocks of the Tabletop Terrane in the Rudall Province. Dated in two localities at c. 1310 Ma (Nelson, 1996) and 1296  /- 4 Ma (Maidment, in prep.).Tobepublished = Will be used in an informal sense (i.e. Camel suite) in a GSWA report documenting the results of dating carried out at GA. Report is in final editing stage, and might be released within a couple of months (August, 2016?).
Lithology Description: K-feldspar, quartz, plagioclase  /- biotite leucogranite and monzogranite. Undeformed to strongly foliated and mylonitic.
Sandstone

General Comments: For use on map sheet 2855; nearest town Marble Bar. Dated: 3310+/-3Ma. Intrudes Homeward Bound Granite.
Lithology Description: Biotite granodiorite, medium- to coarse-grained, foliated; metamorphosed.
Dolerite

General Comments: Northwestern Ashburton Formation overlying June Hill Volcanics. Formerly considered coeval with Pingandy supersequence but now believed to be younger.
Locality Canegrass Swamp in Bardoc 1:100k map sheet area.  To be published = GSWA Digital product 2016.
Lithology Description: Granite; typically poorly exposed and deeply weathered.
Shale
Sandstone

General Comments: PUBLICATION: Semeniuk, V., 2008, Journal of the Royal Society of Western Australia Volume 91 Part 1 (Supplement): 53-148. Originally reserved as 'Cape Boileau'.
Lithology Description: Cemented beachrock composed of laminated, bedded, to low-angle cross-bedded, medium to fine to coarse calcarenite and shelly calcarenite.

General Comments: PUBLICATION: Semeniuk, V., 2008, Journal of the Royal Society of Western Australia Volume 91 Part 1 (Supplement): 53-148.
Lithology Description: In general, a bedded and laminated to cross-laminated interlayered red sand varying to orange quartz and quartz-and-carbonate sand (depending on carbonate sand content), and locally gravelly sand, and small limestone lenses composed of calcarenite.

General Comments: Of Mory (1988) - replaced Cape Hay Member (Hyland Bay Formation). Now of the Hyland Bay Subgroup (Kinmore Group).
Lithology Description: Thick basal shale overlain by thinly bedded sandstone, siltstone and shale, locally grading into more massive sandstone; unconformably overlain by a thin interval of marine shale, then at least two regressive sandstone-dominated cycles.

General Comments: Mentioned

Lithology Description: Sandstone; minor siltstone and shale.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.  Age: 32 - ~6Ma (1995 reference). Ages updated to 44-7.2 Ma  from GA Timescales Project data Feb2009, but more recent references give age as Oligocene - Miocene.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, limestone.

General Comments: Age: 1804 +/- 7 Ma from Koonong Member tuff.
Lithology Description: Conglomerate, ferruginous and quartzitic sandstone, ferruginous siltstone and mudstone, dolostone and felsic volcanic rock; metamorphosed.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Within the Mount Bruce Supergroup, Oakover River area. May be lateral equivalent to Wittenoom Dolomite (now Wittenoom Formation) or may be older.
Lithology Description: Massive to well-bedded, recrystallised dolomite and stromatolitic dolomite; minor chert. Contains a spherule-bearing megabreccia: asteroid impact ejecta.

General Comments: Redefined unit now includes granitic rocks forming most of northern two-thirds of Corunna Downs Granitoid Complex.
Lithology Description: Monzogranite, leucogranite,syenogranite, granodiorite, metagranite, granitic orthoschist; local mafic xenoliths; minor pegmatitic granitoid as dykes and small intrusions in amphibolite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: See also Cardabia Group, the former units of which are now members of Cardabia Calcarenite.  Age: 61.5-49.5Ma. See also Cardabia Formation.
Lithology Description: Calcarenite, commonly glauconitic and fossiliferous, calcilutite, greensand; shallow marine.
Sandstone

General Comments: Named after Cardibar Bore. Name for metamorphic sedimentary rocks on Edmund 1:100K Map.
Lithology Description: Metamorphic sedimentary rocks.

General Comments: Previously the shale component of the Pincunah Hill Formation, now upgraded to formation status as basal unit of Soanesville Gp (Van Kranendonk/GSWA Mar06). Named for Cardinal Cu-Zn prospect on nearby NORTH SHAW. Of Pilbara Supergroup. Age: prob.c.3200Ma.
Lithology Description: Ferruginous shale, banded iron formation; interbedded sandstone, felsic volcanic rocks.
Fractionated hornblende bearing, leucocratic body with fluorite and cassiterite.

General Comments: Supersedes Cardup Shale etc. Age: 750 Ma?
Lithology Description: Weakly metamorphosed shale, conglomerate, quartzite, sandstone

General Comments: To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Carlaminda Hsd, Yalgoo 1:100k sheet area. 28deg17'S, 116deg43'E. Type area adjacent to Carlaminda Hsd. Probably time-equivalent to the Lordy Basalt Member of the Meekatharra Formation in the northern Murchison Domain, but subtle differences in lava types and abundances warrants a separate formation.
Lithology Description: Thin flows of platy olivine spinifex-textured komatiite interlayered with thicker pyroxene spinifex-textured basalt; minor interlayered sedimentary and volcaniclastic rocks; metamorphosed to serpentinite.

General Comments: Do not confuse with Carlton nomenclature of NSW.
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone, conglomerate, minor limestone.

General Comments: In the Perth Basin.
Lithology Description: Includes sandstone.
Sandstone, siltstone, shale, conglomerate, diamictite, dolomite.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Superseded Binda Beds. Definition by Towner R.R. and Crowe R.W.A. See also misspelt Caroline Formation.
Lithology Description: Conglomeratic sandstone, sandstone, siltstone, laminated calcareous siltstone, claystone, mudstone with calcareous concretions and faceted and striated dropstones. Wood fragments, trace fossils and bioturbations, and palynomorphs.

General Comments: Melita area.
Lithology Description: Muscovite-biotite syenogranite with pegmatitic segregations; low-Ca granite.

General Comments: Carr Boyd Ranges, East Kimberley? Different from Carr Boyd Rocks Complex/Carr Boyd Complex.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, ferruginous sandstone, siltstone and mudstone.

General Comments: Gindalbie, Kurnalpi region. Probably Archean.
Lithology Description: Largely composed of pyroxenite; includes layered ultra mafic to mafic sequences, cross-cut by bronzitites.
Micaceous claystone, siltstone, shale and sandstone. Marine fossils. Local dropstones.
Shallow marine fossiliferous fine to medium grained well sorted and laminated to thinly bedded quartz sandstone, siltstone, intraformational claystone conglomerate and pebble to boulder conglomerate.

General Comments: Holocene sand unit in Shark Bay area. To be published: GSWA Report or Bulletin, in next couple of years. May be published earlier in AJES or similar paper, but full definition will be in GSWA publication.
2590-2543 Ma. Previously part of the Brockman Supersequence

Lithology Description: Red bed mudstone and dolostone facies dominate and thick halite deposits developed in sub-basins; largely devoid of diagnostic fossils.

General Comments: Probably intended to replace Carrington Granitic Suite. See also Carrington Granite Suite. Informally subdivided in to 7 unnamed granite bodies in Lake Mackay area. Shown as equivalent age to Rapide Granite, older than 1770-1760Ma Yambah Event, younger than Reynolds Range Group, Nicker beds. Aileron Province, Arunta orogen, North Australian Craton.
Lithology Description: Biotite tonalite to biotite-muscovite granite; most commonly equigranular and medium-grained, although porphyritic varieties also occur. Local andalusite-bearing granite; some merging into migmatite: may be S-type.

General Comments: In Durack Ranges. Kimberley Basin, North Australian Craton.
Lithology Description: Green to black quartz basalt, in places amygdaloidal and with basaltic volcaniclastic rocks, interbedded massive feldspathic or argillaceous quartz sandstone, laminated siltstone and mudstone.

General Comments: Published in GSWA Kimberley geological information series 2018 update, as unnamed member of Carson Volcanics. Also Subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Feldspathic sandstone, quartz sandstone, and siltstone; localized stromatolitic chert.
Comprises claystones, marls and calcisiltites.

General Comments: See also Carynginia Formation Limestone and Carynginia Limestone and Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Black to grey micaceous siltstone and shale, interbedded sandstone, minor conglomerate; marine.

General Comments: See also Carynginia Formation.
In Lamboo Province because included in Paperbark Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Foliated coarsely porphyritic biotite muscovite monzogranite with coarse K-feldspar phenocrysts and recrystallised biotite and quartz defining a strong tectonic foliation

General Comments: Age: ~56Ma. See also Cashin Calcarenite Member - the lithological component does not form part of the formal current name (email per R. Hocking, May 2008).
Rudall 1:250 000 sheet area.
Lithology Description: Iron-rich graphitic, pelitic schist, BIF and chert.

General Comments: Bentley Basin (GSWA 2011). Min age inferred from age of Bentley Supergroup. Max age from  Wururu Rhyolite.
Lithology Description: Rhyolites, basalts; sandstone, siltstone and mudstone.

General Comments: Part of the Whitewater Volcanics reassigned to Castlereagh Hill Porphyry. Porphyritic rock unit of Castlereagh Hill redefined as Greenvale Porphyry. In the Western Zone of the Lamboo Complex.
Lithology Description: Quartz-feldspar porphyry, hornblende-biotite granodiorite.

General Comments: Formerly a member of Cockleshell Gully Formation (name now abandoned) as the Cattamarra Member.
Lithology Description: Fine- to coarse-grained sandstones with dark carbonaceous siltstone and claystone interbeds, and coal seams up to 11m thick.

General Comments: Houtman Sub-basin. See also Cattamarra Coal Measures.
Lithology Description: Interbedded sandstone, siltstones and coals.

General Comments: Muccan 1:100 000 sheet 2956. Previously included in informal Gossan Hill Group. Reassigned to the new Croydon Group (from the De Grey Group in Pilbara Supergroup, now upgraded to De Grey Supergroup) (GSWA 03/06).
Lithology Description: Interbedded dacite tuff, welded tuff, tuffaceous siltstone and shale, and thin-bedded sandstone, siltstone, wacke, and carbonate rocks.

General Comments: Map Sheet area: SF 50-10 Wyloo 1:250k. A glacigenic diamictite conformably overlying the Boolgeeda Iron Formation, and conformably overlain by 10-15m of BIF.  To be published = Initially in GSWA's Explanatory Notes Database (ENS), but ultimately in a GSWA Record or peer reviewed publication (AJES?).
Lithology Description: Glacigenic diamictite.
Coarse-grained, equigranular, biotite bearing monzogranite; High Ca granite.

General Comments: Part of the Widgiemooltha Large Igneous Province; intrudes Archean greenstone and granitic units of the Yilgarn Craton. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD (partial report), Celebration Dolerite Member (P_-_wt-o): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 09 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Mainly dolerite and gabbro; includes cumulate and granophyric differentiates.

General Comments: Unclear if this is intended as 'structurally controlled clusters of granitic intrusions that may be of significantly differing age (as per Pilbara granitic complexes), or a stratigrpahic unit.
Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Surficial or regolith units; poorly consolidated alluvial, colluvial, aeolian, lacustrine and coastal deposits; residual deposits (eg, laterite).

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Surficial or regolith units; poorly consolidated alluvial, colluvial, aeolian, lacustrine and coastal deposits; residual deposits (eg, laterite).

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Surficial or regolith units; poorly consolidated alluvial, colluvial, aeolian, lacustrine and coastal deposits; residual deposits (eg, laterite).

General Comments: Was formal name intended? Associated with ultramafic horizons, Mount Keith, Cliffs and Monument Ultramafic units. In one of  the most highly nickel sulfide-endowed komatiite belts in world.
Lithology Description: Massive and pillowed high-Mg and high-Fe basalt.
Carbonaceous shale
Dolerite dyke.

Moderately stratified interlayered conglomerate, pebbly conglomerate and coarse sandstone, and massive to pebbly siltstone. Bed thickness varies between 0.1 to 2.5 m.Conglomerate near the base contains some megaclasts.
Brown calcareous shale, siltstone.

General Comments: Reservoir for Challis field.
Lithology Description: Massive limestone, interbedded shale, sandstone.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Ferruginous sandstone, fossiliferous limestone, grey to black shale
Coarse and even grained or commonly foliated to weakly porphyritic biotite granite, monzogranite and granodiorite with small mafic xenoliths; locally sheared

General Comments: See also Lexicon. SH50-5.
Lithology Description: Poorly sorted sandstone to conglomerate; ?fluviatile.

General Comments: Gascoyne Province. Included in -Pg on Edmund 1:250k map sheet.
Gascoyne Province

Lithology Description: Predominantly sandstone with a few thin shale beds.

General Comments: Published in: GA record: An Integrated Study of the CO2 Storage Potential in the Offshore Vlaming Sub-Basin (Borissova et al., 2014) [actually GA Record 2015/09]. Mostly coincides with lithostratigraphic unit Charlotte Sandstone of Parmelia Group,  hence has been assigned a similar name.
Lithology Description: Predominantly a very fine to very coarse quartzose sandstone with minor interbedded mudstone and coal.

General Comments: Previously of the Kelly Subgroup (Warrawoona Group). Now of the Kelly Group (Pilbara Supergroup).  Geological Province: Pilbara Craton.
Lithology Description: Basalt and basaltic komatiite; minor dolerite sills, chert and felsic volcanic rocks; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Jackson 1:100 000 sheet area (2737).
Lithology Description: Granite

General Comments: Or Gneiss. A major component of the Yule Granitoid Complex. Age: c. 3065Ma.
Lithology Description: Equigranular to porphyritic biotite monzogranite and granodiorite, weakly to strongly foliated, local banding; metamorphosed

General Comments: Maximum deposition age: SHRIMP U-Pb 2209 (+/-) 15 Ma from detrital zircons, subsequently reinterpreted as a provenance age.  Minimum (and likely depositional) age constrained by age of tuff bed in the conformably overlying Wooly Dolomite.The parent unit, Shingle Creek Group, is proposed as the formal name to replace the informal lower Wyloo Group. As such it includes the Beasley River Quartzite, Cheela Springs Basalt, and Wooly Dolomite. Wyloo Group is now reserved for what was informally referred to as the upper Wyloo Group.
Lithology Description: Vesicular and amygdaloidal metabasalt, metatuff, and metasandstone.
Consists of sandstone (locally richly fossiliferous), laminated siltstone, and rare limestone beds.

General Comments: In 2012 (GSWA Record 2011/25) age range shown as 1800-1465 Ma.
Lithology Description: Pebble- to boulder-conglomerate, pebbly sandstone, sandstone, siltstone and mudstone.
Metamorphosed biotite granodiorite and tonailte; medium- to coarse-grained; strongly foliated to gneissic.
Pelitic and psammitic rocks interbedded with metachert and metamorphosed BIF, and minor metapsephite and metamorphosed felsic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks.

General Comments: Probably equivalent to the Warrada Dolomite Member of Daniels (1970).  In the Edmund Basin. Intruded by a dolerite sill in Maroonah and Mangaroon 1:100k sheet areas.
Lithology Description: Dolomite, dololutite, dolomite breccia, dolarenite, dolorudite, mudstone, siltstone, and minor sandstone.

General Comments: Previously considered to be within the Earaheedy Group. Supersedes the combined 'Wandiwarra Formation' and 'Princess Ranges Quartzite'.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, mature fine to medium grained sandstone, and shale; commonly laminated and silicified, and cleaved and sheared in the Stanley Fold Belt.

General Comments: Wallaringa & Wodgina 1:100 000 sheets. Occurs as locally abundant inclusions within the Petermarer Monzogranite (RefID 68283).
Lithology Description: Hornblende-biotite granodiorite; grades to K-feldspar porphyritic monzogranite; massive to moderately foliated; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Intrudes Apex and Euro Basalts and the Mullungunya Granodiorite. Part of the Mount Edgar Granitoid Complex.
Lithology Description: Massive, non-foliated, medium-grained, grey-white biotite trondhjemite, characterised by high plagioclase and quartz contents.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Consists of clacerted, well cemented oolitic limestone.

General Comments: Also incorrectly referred to as Chinaman Creek Chert  - prefer Chinaman Pool Chert (Van Kranendonk Mar06). Within the Coongan Subgroup, Warrawoona Group, Pilbara Supergroup.
Lithology Description: Layered sedimentary chert.

General Comments: Ages, lithology updated from GA Timescales Project Feb 2009. Of Kennedy Group in 1998.
Lithology Description: Sandstone

General Comments: Formerly considered part of Yeneena Group, Yeneena Basin.
Lithology Description: Generally upward-fining sequence of polymictic pebble to cobble conglomerate and quartz pebble conglomerate, pebbly sandstone with detrital muscovite; medium to coarse grained sandstone in places with siliceous nodules, minor siltstone and shale

General Comments: Age: 12,000-7,500yrs B.P. (Carbon-14 dating).
Lithology Description: Slate grey, homogeneous to mottled clay; large in situ mangrove stumps, rootlets and plant detritus are abundant; burrow structures locally.

General Comments: Validity as mappable unit questioned in Mory (2010). Unlikely to be identifiable in subsurface.
Lithology Description: Consists of large-scale, cross-bedded, poorly sorted granule conglomerate and fine to coarse-grained sandstone.  Thin to medium-bedded, and in places some graded bedding.  Asymmetrical ripple-marks occur on bedding planes.

General Comments: Cryogenian as age for the parent unit Oscar Range Group in the 2006 edition of GSWA's 1:500k Bedrock Geology of WA.
Lithology Description: Interbedded boulder to cobble conglomerate, locally cross-bedded grey to white quartz and feldspathic sandstone, local tuffaceous phyllitic siltstone and minor carbonate, intruded by minor thin dolerite sills

General Comments: Age is Early Palaeozoic. Appears in GSWA Memoir 3 (1990) which has NOT yet been indexed. PP08/06. Described in GSWA Memoir 3 (1990) , NW Birrindudu Basin,  p351, 359, 360. Possibly Devonian.
Lithology Description: Shallow to emergent mainly fine to medium grained clayey and micaceous quartose and lithic sandstone with some low-angle cross beds and minor grit and pebble-rich beds

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain.
Lithology Description: Monzogranite; metamorphosed, foliated.

General Comments: PUBLICATION: Semeniuk, V., 2008, Journal of the Royal Society of Western Australia Volume 91 Part 1 (Supplement): 53-148.Originally reserved as 'Church Hill'. This unit in Canning Region, but may be some question whether it should be included in Canning Basin Province.
Lithology Description: In general, a red quartz sand, mainly structureless, but locally with lamination and cross-lamination.
Coarse, even grained, granulite-facies leucocratic monzogranite with sheets of granite

General Comments: Originally of Miller and Gair (1975). Formerly considered part of Whim Creek Group (its upper parts were included in the Constantine Formation); then became part of the Bookingarra Group in the Mallina Basin. Reclassified later into Croydon Group (email - GSWA Mar/06) - GSWA Record 2006/15. Hosts notable massive sulfide mineralisation. Redefined as a unit within the Bookingarra Group again in 2017.
Lithology Description: Volcaniclastic conglomerate, breccia and sandstone; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Subsurface unit. See also Clanmeyer Formation.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, shale, minor limestone.

General Comments: Canning Basin region, but probably Holocene unit, so may not be part of Canning Basin Geological Province.

Replacing the informal WMC term Clapp Ridge Shale, exists in petroleum wells of the Barbwire Terrace, Canning Basin.wheretobepublished = A Revised Subsurface Devonian Stratigraphy for the Central and Southern Canning Basin. GSWA Report to be published early 2014.
Lithology Description: Dominated by reddish-brown, argillaceous and dolomitic siltstone, with interbeds of silty dolomite and silty claystone.
Sandstone

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Red glauconitic feldspathic quartz sandstone.
Seriate biotite monzogranite; low-Ca granite.

General Comments: After Claudius Creek. Map Sheet: SH51-1,  Munjeroo 2941. Dominantly conglomerate  with subordinate sandstone. Locally schistose. Mafic/ultramafic clasts common in conglomerate. The unit is metamorphosed. To be published = GSWA geological map and explanatory notes, 2013/2014.
Lithology Description: Dominantly conglomerate  with subordinate sandstone. Locally schistose. Mafic/ultramafic clasts common in conglomerate. The unit is metamorphosed.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Previously of Gorge Creek Group, then independent; now reassigned to Gorge Creek Group (De Grey Supergroup) (GSWA Record 2006/15). Includes former Nimingarra Iron Formation rocks. Intruded by Stone Yard Granophyre. See also incorrectly named Cleaverville Group (attributed to Kiyokawa and Taira (1998) in Precambrian Research v.88, p102-142 - who elected to change the status of the unit and include additional formations not previously assigned to it, without consultation with GSWA and without detailed redefinition (per email from Arthur Hickman to Roger Hocking, Nov. 2007). Gorge Creek Basin, De Grey Superbasin.
Lithology Description: Chert and banded iron formation, minor felsic volcaniclastic rock, shale and siltstone; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Informal name. Appears to be named after author Christopher Cleghorne Medlins. This is inappropriate unless no place names were available in the area.
Lithology Description: Mudstone, conglomerate, basalt, breccias and quartz-feldspar sandstones.

General Comments: For use on SPLIT ROCK mapsheet; nearest town Marble Bar.  Named for Cleland Rock; not to be confused with Cleland Formation and Cleland Sandstone of Northern Territory. Strelley is the  type granite. Possible source rocks for Ferdies Member of the Dead Bullock Formation, in the Tanami region.
Lithology Description: Leucogranite, granodiorite, monzogranite, tonalite, granite, pegmatite, mixed granites, minor gneiss.

General Comments: Lake Lefroy map sheet area. To be published: East Yilgarn 2013-14 update. Digital package Geological Survey of Western Australia.

Reserved by: Redfern R., Apak N., Backhouse J.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, minor siltstone.

General Comments: New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk).  Intrudes Pinnacle Hill Gneiss; intruded by Munni Munni Intrusion.
Lithology Description: Weakly foliated to gneissic biotite tonalite; metamorphosed.
Spinifex-textured komatiite with comagmatic dacite intrusions.

General Comments: Perth Basin
Lithology Description: White to cream shelly/bioturbated calcarenite, bioturbated forameniferal limestone, laminated x-laminated marine calcarenite, laminated to x-laminated beach calcarenite.

General Comments: North Shaw 1:100 000 sheet area 2755.
Lithology Description: Spinifex-textured, massive and pillowed ultramafic lavas and pillowed high-Mg basalt.
Fine to coarse well sorted cross-bedded feldspathic sandstone with siltstone and conglomerate interbeds
Gabbro

General Comments: After Lake Cobb, WA. Map Sheet = Cobb 250K Nearest Town = Patjarr Community. Lithology: Sandstone, siltstone, conglomerate and minor carbonate. Distribution: Cobb Embayment of Canning Basin, WA. Age: top is middle Ordovician based on fish fossils. Rocks previously included in Paterson Formation.Contacts: unconformably overlies Mesoproterozoic crystalline basement; unconformably overlain by early Permian Paterson Formation. To be published: 2016-2017 in Geological Survey of Western Australia Record or 250K geological map notes (depending on which is completed first).
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, conglomerate and minor carbonate.

General Comments: This name replaces invalid Hamelin Formation, but  excludes that unit's evaporite part, the Yaringa Formation. Type section in Hamelin Pool-1, 951-1225m. Reference section in Yaringa-1. Shallow marine environment. Conodont fauna not diverse, but give likely early Gorstian to earliest Pridoli age. Divided into lower and upper parts. Max. thickness: 335.5m in Pendock-1A (1856-2191.5m).
Lithology Description: Interbedded dolomite and gypsum with minor shale.

General Comments: Reserved as Cocanarup (Witt, W.  1994). Informal name (not known if published as a defined/formal name). Hosted by Annabelle Volcanics.

Formation Map Sheet = Menzies Nearest Town = Menzies. The Cock Robin Formation is a potentially older (than the Kalgoorlie Group) mafic/ultramafic succession in the western part of the Eastern Goldfields Superterrane of the Yilgarn Craton. It is intruded by the 2803 ± 3 Ma Twin Hills Monzogranite (date in Dunphy et al., 2003). wheretobepublished = GSWA explanatory notes and interpreted bedrock geology map in 2017.
Lithology Description: Tremolite schist, basalt and amphibolite with subordinate sedimentary rocks.

General Comments: Formerly Cockatoo "Formation" "Cockatoo Series", "Cockatoo Sandstone".
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone, conglomerate and limestone; minor dolomite and siltstone.
Quartz sandstone, micaceous fine-grained sandstone, shale

General Comments: Age: <3068 +/-22 Ma and < 3066 +/- 4Ma (SHRIMP). In East Pilbara Terrane.
Lithology Description: Leucocratic biotite (-hornblende) tonalite and granodiorite and subordinate monzogranite; locally abundant pegmatite and greenstone and granitoid gneiss xenoliths; weakly metamorphosed

General Comments: In Onslow 1, Abdul's Dam 1, Ruby 1. The Cody Limestone was defined (originally as Cody Formation) in GORTER, J.D., and DAVIES, J.M., 1999, Upper Permian carbonate reservoirs of the North West Shelf and northern Perth Basin, Australia: APPEA Journal, v. 39, no. 1, p. 343¿362 (definition in Appendix 1 on 362). Renamed Cody Limestone in: CROSTELLA, A., IASKY, R. P., BLUNDELL, K. A., YASIN, A. R., and GHORI, K. A. R., 2000, Petroleum geology of the Peedamullah Shelf and Onslow Terrace, Northern Carnarvon Basin, Western Australia: Western Australia Geological Survey, Report 73, p. 17.
Lithology Description: Limestone, dense to microcrystalline and locally calcarenite.

General Comments: (Playford et al., 1976).
Lithology Description: Yellow-brown coarse-grained sandstone, commonly conglomeratic, with claystone, siltstone and shale intercalations.

General Comments: In the Crowhurst Basin.
Lithology Description: Purple and green fissile laminated siltstone with minor white and purple silty dolomite interbeds, lenses and nodules; white sandy dolomite and dolomitic sandstone, purple siltstone and dolomitic siltstone, and green pyritic cherty siltstone

General Comments: See also Collie Coal Measures.
Lithology Description: Conglomerate, sandstone, siltstone, claystone, coal

General Comments: Supersedes Mucalana (Muhling and Brakel, 1985) and Collier (Cooper et al, 1998a) Subgroups. Minimum age constrained by 1070 Ma dolerite intrusions.  Maximum age constrained only by detrital zircons. Collier Basin.
Lithology Description: Dominantly siltstone, fine- to very coarse-grained sandstone, pebbly sandstone, dolostone and minor chert and conglomerate. Intruded by thick dolerite and gabbro sills.

General Comments: Age stated to be: ~830 Ma in 1998.
Lithology Description: Massive medium grained white and purple quartz sandstone and sandy purple chert-pebble breccia.
Enriched in banded iron-formation.

General Comments: Name first used in 1969 and dated to Early to Middle Miocene. Age is Balcombian (an Australian Stage).  Partly overlain by and interfingers with Nullarbor Limestone. Age: 18.5-14.5Ma. Yarle Sandstone, Plumridge Formation may be lateral equivalents.
Lithology Description: Thin calcareous sandstone, minor siltstone, claystone, calcarenite and granule conglomerate.
Fine- to medium-grained, porphyritic monzogranite. High Ca granite.

General Comments: Onshore Perth Basin unit. Notified by A.Davidson 28-NOV-94.
Lithology Description: Predominantly medium-grained, moderately sorted, subangular to subrounded, pale grey to pale greenish-grey, slightly clayey sand.

General Comments: Incorporated into the new Bookingarra Formation (GSWA Mar06).  In the Mallina Basin. Previously considered a member of the Mount Negri Volcanics or the Rushall Slate. Restored to being Member of Rushall Slate in 2017 redefinition of that unit.
Lithology Description: Fine-grained sub-volcanic intrusive rock; vesicular metabasalt with rare pyroxene spinifex-texture;

General Comments: See also misspelt Condensor Dolerite.
Lithology Description: Lava

General Comments: Note: Use of Condren Formation on Mt Ramsay 1:250 000 was a mistake - RH 5-Sep-2008.
Lithology Description: Fluvial to paralic or deltaic fossiliferous cross bedded and ripple marked fine to medium quartzose sandstone, with minor siltstone, coal seams and conglomerate. Abundant plant macrofossils.

General Comments: GSWA Geochron record 1381 (2017) states this unit is part of Western Zone of Lamboo Province.
Lithology Description: Foliated coarsely porphyritic biotite muscovite monzogranite with small amphibolite xenoliths and small veins of tourmaline-bearing aplite and pegmatite

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Defn on Tech File G/50-5.

Yilmia 1:100k sheet area?  Biotite granitic gneiss with a magmatic crystallization age of 2668 ± 15 Ma. Located 40 Km south of Coolgardie, Eastern Goldfield Superterrane. . To be published = East Yilgarn 2013-14 update, Geological Survey of Western Austrtalia digital product. This unit now includes rocks previously reserved as the Quairnie Rock Gneiss.
Lithology Description: Biotite granitic gneiss

General Comments: Mentioned.
For Walpole area.

Reserved by: Fitton M.J., Horwitz R.C., Sylvester G.
General Comments: Age: >2.9Ga. Within the De Grey Supergroup. Of Whim Creek, Mallina, Lalla Rookh Basins.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed fine to coarse grained wacke, shale, iron formation, poorly sorted arkose, sub-arkosic and lithic sandstone, conglomerate, pebbly sandstone, siltstone, tuff, turbidite, basalt; intruded by mafic to ultramafic sills.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Ages from rhyolite. Martin & Thorne (2004) suggest Formerly of the Edmund Subgroup (Bangemall Group) - then reassigned to Tringadee Formation?  And now part of Yilgatherra Formation? But Coobarra Formation still in use in 2011.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, conglomerate; minor siltstone, shale, small plugs of rhyolite.

Basal 350m of fine- to medium-grained amphibolite; then 300m of pelitic/psammitic and siliceous aphanitic to feldspar-phyric schists with pods of foliated granitoid; at the top, amphibolite (500m thick) with abundant lenses of basaltic breccias.

General Comments: Youngest population of detrital zircons dated at c.1713 Ma.
Lithology Description: Thin to very thick-bedded lithic quartz sandstone, minor siltstone and mudstone
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

Stratigraphic Name: Coodardoo Formation, Ullawarra Formation, Devil Creek Formation, Discovery Formation
General Comments: Informal grouping of Edmund Group units.  Equivalent to Depositional Package 4 for Edmund Basin in the GSWA 500K Solid Geology GIS (2008)
Lithology Description: Siltstone and mudstone; sandstone, dolostone, dolomitic mudstone, chert, and minor conglomerate

General Comments: Quartzite and banded iron formation. A thin unit of quartzite and banded iron formation, to be added to the base of the Polelle Group of the Murchison Supergroup, Murchison Domain, Youanmi Terrane, Yilgarn Craton. To be published: Cue 1:100 000 map sheet explanatory notes
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed iron-formation, weakly layered, strongly foliated; medium-grained foliated quartzite; quartzite with interlayered metaperidotite schist; quartzite and metamorphosed iron-formation, well foliated.

General Comments: Age: 2851+/-2Ma. Geological Province: Pilbara Craton. Formerly of Shaw Granitoid Complex (1998, 2001 - 04). Said to intrude Split Rock Supersuite (2006, refid 63441).
Lithology Description: Biotite monzogranite, leucogranite, K-feldspar-phyric monzogranite, pegmatitic monzogranite, greisen veins
Monzogranite, fine- to medium-grained, biotite-bearing, seriate to feldspar-phyric; intruded by quartz-barite veins.

General Comments: Pinderi Hills 1:100 000 sheet area. Age: Late Archaean approx 2760 Ma. Part of Fortescue Group.
Lithology Description: Fine-grained ultramafic lava; abundant quartz xenocrysts.

General Comments: De Grey (2757) area, Pilbara region. Port Hedland 1:250 000 sheet area.
910 Ma is age of the youngest detrital zircon (Bagas and Nelson 2007), 830 Ma is the age of intermediate to mafic rocks that intrude the lower part of the (Yeneena) Basin (Maidment, unpublished).
Lithology Description: Thickly bedded massive to well- bedded sandstone, minor siltstone, shale and pelitic schist, carbonate, and basal polymictic conglomerate

General Comments: Archean mafic and ultramafic rocks with minor sedimentary units of the Kalgoorlie Terrane,Eastern Goldfields Superter, from ~2726-2690Ma. To be published = Geological Survey of Western Australia East Yilgarn update 2013-14, digital product.
Lithology Description: Basalts to komatiites.
Quartz wacke and siltstone, variably calcareous, locally fossiliferous.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Defined by Passmore (1970).
Lithology Description: Decimetres- to metres-thick beds of yellow-red-brown loose quartz sand: quartz grains with very thin ferruginous coating.

General Comments: (Cockbain and Playford, 1973). Age is Pre-Cainozoic. Geological Province: Perth Basin.
Lithology Description: Undivided; chalk, greensand, glauconitic sandstone, siltstone, marl; characteristically glauconitic.

General Comments: Intrudes base of Warrawoona Group. Part of the Callina Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Hornblende tonalite to granodiorite; metamorphosed and foliated

General Comments: Latest age control (summarised, Crispe et al 2007) suggest Birrindudu Basin ranges from 1735-1640 Ma.
Lithology Description: Sublithic arenite and minor quartz arenite, mainly medium-grained, thin-bedded to flaggy, showing cross-bedding and ripple marks; siltstone and shale. Shale pellets common in the sublithic arenite.

General Comments: Age: c.2691Ma.
Lithology Description: Foliated monzogranite; minor syenogranite and granodiorite.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Defn on Tech File G/50-14. Max. thickness: 4985ft. in type section.
Lithology Description: Grey to brown and reddish-white, thin bedded and fine-grained sandstone, with cross-stratification in places.
Sandstone, siltstone, dolostone, stromatolitic dolostone and silicified dolostone.

General Comments: De Grey (2757) area, Pilbara region. Port Hedland 1:250 000 sheet area.

Now included in the Salvation Group (which has replaced parts of Sunbeam Group) - previously included in the Sunbeam Group. Formerly of Kahrban Subgroup tog. with Marlooyanoo Fm. However the two formations were indistinguishable from each other, hence Marlooyanoo Fm has been abandoned.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, lithic fine sandstone, micaceous siltstone, shale. Ripple marks common. Minor medium to coarse sandstone; varicoloured chert. Minor carbonate and conglomerate.

General Comments: To be used on map sheet 3054 - nearest town is Nullagine. In the Pilbara Craton. Within the De Grey Supergroup.
Lithology Description: Chlorite-actinolite schist, quartz-muscovite schist, amphibolite, andalusite-muscovite schist, phyllite, lithic sandstone containing subangular basaltic clasts, siltstone, chert, gabbro, komatiitic basalt.

General Comments: See also Coondina Adamellite (Reserved, 1975)
Lithology Description: Medium-grained, weakly porphyritic biotite monzogranite.

General Comments: Parts of this unit at Bee Hill reassigned  to Stag Arrow Formation in refID 71042, Jones (2017).
Lithology Description: Conglomerate, sandstone, wacke, dolostone, shale
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Previously part of Calyie Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Coarse-grained sandstone, pebble to boulder conglomerate.

General Comments: Probably unrelated to the Coongan Volcanics? Within the Pilbara Supergroup. Comprises Mount Ada Basalt and Duffer Formation, both formerly of Talga Talga Subgroup.
Lithology Description: Felsic volcanic rocks, felsic schist, basalt, dacite, andesite, sandstone, conglomerate, amphibolite, komatiite, peridotite, chert, psammitic and pelitic schist, mafic schist, wacke, shale, iron formation, ultramafic schist.

General Comments: Precambrian. Muccan 1:100 000 sheet 2956. Pilbara. Spelling corrected DEC98.  Equivalent to the Honeyeater Basalt.  Formerly of the Gorge Creek Group. In Mar2006 downgraded and reassigned as Coonieena Basalt Member of the new Bookingarra Formation, but in 2014 new geochron suggests unit is at least 25 M years too old to be related to Bookingarra Formation, so reinstated as ungrouped formation [Hickman Apr 2014]
Lithology Description: Pillowed and massive tholeiitic basalt, basaltic andesite, high-Mg basalt, mafic pisolitic tuff.

General Comments: Within the Pilbara Supergroup. Historically, has been informally refered to as the "Coonterunah succession" by Buick et al (1995). Middle unit of Group has been radiometrically dated.
Lithology Description: Basalt, high-Mg basalt, banded iron formation, mafic schist, chert, andesite, andesite to basalt, rhyolite, silicified and sericitised basalt, dolerite, amphibolite, silicified evaporite, sandstone, tuffaceous sandstone; metamorphosed

General Comments: Reserved as Coor-de-wandy (Occhipinti, S.A. 1999).
Lithology Description: Siliciclastic sedimentary rocks; metamorphosed

General Comments: Definition card 24-APR-1974. In press according to DL1980.
Lithology Description: medium to coarse, even-grained biotite adamellite.  rare phenocrysts.  It is poorly to moderately foliated by alignment of feldspar, biotite, quartz and some biotite wisps and schlieren.

General Comments: Belonging to the Walganna Suite of the Bald Rock Supersuite. It is named after Cootharra Bore at AMG Zone 50J, 657693E, 6963391N, on the Nowthanna 1:100 K sheet area.
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained monzogranite; undeformed.

General Comments: Fine- to medium-grained dolerite sill; locally forms dykes within Hardey Formation. Briefly described in GSWA online ENS: Hickman, AH (partial report), Cooya Pooya Dolerite Member (A-FOkc-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 01 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Fine- to medium-grained dolerite sill.

General Comments: Reserved as Copperfield by Rattenbury (1992) for Ballard Sheet.  In the Yilgarn Craton. Margins of this unit hosts historic gold workings.
Lithology Description: Biotite monzogranite with prominent mineral lineation.
Biotite metamonzogranite with prominent mineral lineation; Hi-Ca granite
Biotite metamonzogranite with prominent mineral lineation; low-Ca granite

General Comments: Data from OZCHRON1. Comment for Copperhead carbonatite: 'The ages of the zircon suites are complex, with 1821 Ma being the interpreted magmatic age from 28 analyses. A lower Th/U group is older (1840-1880 Ma) and late Archaean xenocryst cores are 2419-2736 Ma.'. Interp magmatic age 1821+/-4 Ma U/Pb SHRIMP.
Lithology Description: Albitite, albite-carbonate fenite, carbonate veins, and carbonatite breccia.

General Comments: Intrudes Mount Ada and Apex Basalts. In the Mount Edgar Granitoid Complex area.
Lithology Description: Biotite granodiorite and tonalite; medium-grained, massive to seriate, weakly foliated; local mafic xenoliths, metamorphosed.

General Comments: Part of the Biranup Zone (Kepa Kurl Booya Province, Albany-Fraser Orogen [2009]. Min age is of high-grade metamorphic event.  Interpreted as an exotic terrane dominated by granitic rocks with protoliths 1690-1660 Ma and reworked gneissic equivalents; a 10-20km wide belt of intensely deformed heterogeneous gneisses.
Lithology Description: Granitic gneiss; heterogeneous; mainly derived from Recherche Granite; deformed with orthogneiss (circa 1700-1600 Ma) and paragneiss; including quartzite (?circa 1550 Ma)

General Comments: To be included in the Soanesville Subgroup of the Gorge Creek Group, North Shaw 1:100k sheet area (2755). Age: 3270-3200Ma.Reassigned to Soanesville Group when subgroup was upgraded (GSWA 03/06). Soanesville Basin. Basalts and BIFs previously considered part of this unit have been reassigned to the Honeyeater Basalt.
Lithology Description: Consists of sandstone with a lensoidal basal polymictic conglomerate and is interbedded with banded and ferruginous chert, black carbonaceous shale, and siltstone; turbiditic.
Shale, marl, marly limestone and limestone. Fossiliferous. Intertidal to shoreface and shallow subtidal.

General Comments: Contains good hydrocarbon source rocks.
Lithology Description: Fine grained, locally silty sandstone.

General Comments: Turkey Creek, Bow 1:100 000 map sheets, East Kimberley.  Of Dougalls Suite.
Lithology Description: Foliated and metamorphosed biotite (-hornblende) tonalite and granodiorite; locally garnet-bearing

General Comments: Name returned to original form, Cornelia Sandstone, after being superseded by Cornelia Formation; now redefined as Cornelia Sandstone (albeit as more restricted unit) in HOCKING, R. M., JONES, J. A., PIRAJNO, F., and GREY, K., 2000, Revised lithostratigraphy for Proterozoic rocks in the Earheedy Basin and nearby areas: Western Australia Geological Survey, Record 2000/16.  This unit is a possible equivalent of the Edmund Group.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, mudstone, glauconitic sandstone, conglomerate.Pebbly, dirty sandstone.

General Comments: See GSWA ENS: Ivanic, TJ 2018, Corner Well Gabbro Member (A-ANwc-xol-apl): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 01 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Modally layered olivine gabbro grading into olivine gabbronorite interlayered with lherzolite, dunite, pyroxenite, and minor anorthosite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: East Kimberley region. Kimberley Province. Of the Syenite Camp Suite (Sally Downs Supersuite).
Lithology Description: Medium-grained, even textured biotite(-hornblende) tonalite.

General Comments: c. 1855 Ma. Is this deliberately formalising Corridor gabbro, or accidental capitalisation?
Is this being replaced by Corridor Gabbro?
Lithology Description: Layered mafic-ultramafic intrusion.

General Comments: NW-trending suite of mafic dykes; interpreted from aeromagnetic data. This unit is interpreted from distinctive northwesterly linear trends on geophysical imagery and is not observed in outcrop. It is considered likely that dolerite is a main constituent of the unit. It was originally defined as the Cosmo Newbery Dyke Suite (79571), now formalised as Cosmo Newbery Dolerite to avoid form term. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD and Spaggiari, CV (partial report), Cosmo Newbery Dolerite (P_IP-_nw-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 01 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.

Of Stirling Petroleum N.L. (1979). Well Completion Report for Bruce-1. In the Beagle Sub-basin. Presumably intended to be superseded by Cossigny Formation (in 2001), but usage of Cossigny Member has resumed (2014). Cossigny Member appears to be part of Keraudren Formation in Roebuck and Offshore Canning basins, 2015. Forms intraformational seal.
Lithology Description: Paralic and marine siltstone, claystone and limestone.

General Comments: For use on map sheet 2855; nearest town Marble Bar.  Dated: 3318+/-3Ma.  Intrudes Owens Gully Diorite.  Part of the Mt Edgar Granitic Complex (GSWA 500K Solid Geology GIS, 2008)
Lithology Description: Weakly foliated, fine- to medium-grained, muscovite granodiorite and minor monzogranite.

General Comments: North Shaw 1:100 000 sheet area 2755. Within the Warrawoona Group (Pilbara Supergroup). Marble Bar 250K (2010) gives age as 3515-3498 Ma (after Buick et al. 1995)
Lithology Description: Amphibolite; metamorphosed mafic volcanic and intrusive rocks, locally schistose. Basalt, andesitic to felsic volcanic rocks, and interbedded black and white-layered cherty iron formations.

General Comments: To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Courin Hill, Wurarga 1:100k sheet area. 28deg13'S 116deg25'E. Type area: Courin Hill. Intrusive into Polelle Group supracrustal rocks.
Lithology Description: Metagranodiorite to metadiorite; biotite-rich, with K-feldspar megacrystic augen up to 50 mm long; metamonzogranite and pegmatite gneiss and chloritic mafic rafts 1 to 5 m across.

General Comments: Youanmi 100k sheet.  To use in the southern Murchison Domain. Age: c. 2815 Ma. Type area: Courlbarloo Rockholes, near Youanmi Downs,10 km northwest of Yuinmery Hsd, lat 28deg33', long 118deg48'.
Lithology Description: Hornblende tonalite with 3-8mm hornblende phenocrysts; locally weakly deformed; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Recent articles show age as Oligocene or Miocene.
Lithology Description: Massive, cryptocrystalline buff, white or grey dolomite and dolomitic carbonate mudstone.

General Comments: Previously referred to as Bunker Bay Suite (Kay, 1956).
Lithology Description: Strongly deformed and metamorphosed composite of interleaved anorthosite, leucogabbro, gabbro, sheets of granite and pagmatite veins.
Leucocratic, medium-grained, biotite bearing monzogranite; contains large phenocrysts of K-feldspar.

General Comments: Cocanarup and Raventhorpe 100k. Briefly described in GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD and Spaggiari, CV (partial report), Cowerdup Metadolerite (P_-_cd-mod): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 01 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Mafic dolerite sill differentiated from ultramafic rock at base to granophyre at top; altered to epidote-sericite-chlorite-amphibole

General Comments: Defn on Tech File G/50-1.
See also Lexicon. Originally part of Newman Subgroup. SG50-1.
Lithology Description: Black shale, siltstone, and sandstone in coarsening-upward succession. Commonly bioturbated.

General Comments: PUBLICATION: Semeniuk, V., 2008, Journal of the Royal Society of Western Australia Volume 91 Part 1 (Supplement): 53-148. Originally reserved as 'Crab Creek Calcilutite'.
Lithology Description: White/cream shelly, laminated to burrow-structured calcilutite.
Medium-grained biotite granodiorite. High Ca granite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly basaltic rocks; may include minor ultramafic volcanics

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Of Pirajno and Occhipinti (in prep.).Their preferred term for a mylonitic unit named by Gee (1987) as Crispin Conglomerate.
Lithology Description: Quartzite clasts in a matrix of quartz-sericite schist; both mylonitized.

General Comments: Age appears to be poorly known. said to be Late Triassic or Jurassic in age in 1999 explan notes, but map of same area (and similar vintage) gives age as Cretaceous. Formerly included in old defn of Gunbarrel Basin, but wrong area, and Paterson Orogen (Neoarchean- Ediacaran), but much too young (CEB Dec2011).
Lithology Description: Fine to coarse grained sandstone, bioturbated and cross-bedded; minor pebble conglomerate; plant fossils

General Comments: Lissadell 1:250 000 sheet area, east Kimberley. Age updated by I.Sweet. Do not confuse with Crooked Creek units in Qld and NT.
Lithology Description: Medium-grained, plagioclase-phyric, biotite granodiorite and monzogranite.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain. Part of Austin Downs Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Metagranodiorite, commonly foliated.

General Comments: Mention in Witt & Swager (1989) Table 2
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained. equigranular granodiorite.

General Comments: In the Crowhurst Basin.  Age: c.?1500Ma.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, shale, dolomite, stromatolitic dolomite, and sandstone.

General Comments: Of Woolyeenyer Group.
Replaces Bookingarra Group as parent unit for Cistern, Louden, Mount Negri, Kialrah and Rushall units - nomenclature revised in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk). In the Mallina Basin.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, shale, iron formation, sandstone, pebbly sandstone, pebble to boulder conglomerate; lesser mafic and felsic volcanic rock; metamorphosed. Deposited as a series of submarine fans.

General Comments: Reserved as Cudalgarra by McCracken, S. (1994).
Lithology Description: Limestones, dolostones and evaporitic mudstones.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain. Part of the Annean Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained, metamorphosed leucocratic tonalite.

General Comments: Geogical province: Murchison Domain.
Lithology Description: Hornblende (-biotite) tonalite-trondhjemite-granodiorite and quartz-diorite rocks.

General Comments: Reserved as Cullens by Le Blanc Smith (1993).  An irregular argillaceous unit at base of the Stockton Group succession. Not known if published/defined as a formal name?
Lithology Description: Argillaceous unit containing some diamictite.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File E/52-13.
Lithology Description: Fine to coarse fluvial cross-bedded fossiliferous sandstone, granule and pebble conglomerate and red siltstone

General Comments: Age: Approx 900 Ma. Described by Andrew (1990) in Geology of the mineral Deposits of Australian and Papua New Guinea. AusIMM p711-713. Ages given: Rb/Sr whole rock 905+/-2 Ma (1986), U/Pb zircon  1012+/-12 Ma (1986), K/Ar pyroxenes 854+/- 57 Ma.
Lithology Description: Plug of calcite-dominant (sovite) and dolomite-dominant (beforsite) carbonatite phases; a weathered capping of silicified, limonitic collapse breccia; all enclosed by an envelope of carbonated, mica-rich pyroxenite, largely altered to amphibolite.
Limestone.

General Comments: Muccan 1:100 000 sheet 2956. Formerly of the Pilbara Supergroup; now redefined as part of the De Grey Supergroup.
Lithology Description: Shale, siltstone, sandstone, lithic wacke, pebble conglomerate.
Coarse even grained to porphyritic monzogranite with amphibole, biotite or orthopyroxene clots in feldspathic halos. Retrograde amphibolite facies metamorphism.

General Comments: Reserved as Cundimurra Granite.
Lithology Description: Metamonzogranite to metasyenogranite; commonly with pegmatite veins; locally undeformed with common magmatic foliation.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Of Minilya Subgroup. Defined 1967. Part of the Minilya Sub-Group (Byro Group).
Lithology Description: Quartz wacke, siltstone, carbonaceous siltstone and shale, locally fossiliferous.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Defn on Tech File G/50-5.
See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Sandstone

General Comments: Within the Bangemall Supergroup.
Lithology Description: Parallel-planar laminated siltstone interbedded with thin- to medium-bedded, fine- to coarse-grained sandstone and minor chert.

General Comments: To be used on WARRIE mapsheet; nearest town is Marble Bar.  Named for Cutinda Creek.
Lithology Description: Monzogranite.

General Comments: Edjudina 1:250 000 sheet area.
Lithology Description: Biotite monzogranite; High-HFSE granite.
Siltstone

General Comments: Defined in Trendall & Blockley (1968). Full details in card file. 2490 +/- 20 Ma on zircon, 2470 +/- 4 Ma using SHRIMP. Contains high-grade hematite ore; mined at Tom Price. Basal unit in Brockman Iron Formation. Max & min ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Predominantly well-banded banded iron formation made up almost entirely of chert and iron oxides. Includes ferruginous volcanic tuffs, 2-3m thick with 10-20cm of potassium feldspar/stilpnomelane spherules. Contains ~20cm microkrystite-rich (spherule)unit.

General Comments: Name probably abandoned?
Lithology Description: Succession of dacite and rhyolite tuffs, volcanogenic sandstone and conglomerate.

General Comments: Informal reference to gabbro from Dalgaranga greenstone belt, Murchison Domain, Youanmi Terrane.  Age: Magmatic crystallisation age of granophyre unit from upper part of gabbro intrusion; dated sample is from near the southern termination of a north-plunging synclinal fold closure in the Dalgaranga Greenstone Belt; coeval with ~2715 Ma Maddina Basalt or ~2725 Ma Gidley Granophyre. Age: 2719+/-6Ma, in the range of the Yalgowra Suite. Related to Dalgaranga Formation? Not related to Dalgaringa Supersuite, Gascoyne Complex.
Lithology Description: Lower part: mottled gabbro containing large poikilitic hornblende and clinopyroxene grains. Upper part: quartz gabbro and granophyre (dated rock). Lower half of body contains numerous felsic tuff xenoliths possibly derived from footwall units

General Comments: Glenburgh 1:250 000 sheet area, Gascoyne Region. Age: 2005-1970 Ma. Not related to Dalgaranga dolerite in Murchison Domain.
Lithology Description: Foliated to gneissic granites; metatonalite and metagranodiorite; minor amphibolite, local mafic granulite. All rock types are blotchy from clots of fine-grained biotite after garnet.

General Comments: North Shaw 1:100 000 sheet area 2755. Name for rocks of the 'Soanesville Sill Complex' structure occurring within the Soanesville Group (GSWA 03/06). Soanesville Basin.
Lithology Description: Gabbro, dolerite, dunite, peridotite, serpentine-chlorite schist, serpentinite, metaleucogabbro, metapyroxenite, ultramafic schist; metamorphosed.

General Comments: North Shaw 1: 100 00 (2755) SHRIMP dating 2936 +/-5Ma
Lithology Description: Granite

General Comments: Albany-Fraser Orogen. Main component of the Biranup Zone (formerly Biranup Complex), Kepa Kurl Booya Province [2009]. Interleaved with metagabbro and pyroxene granulite of the Fraser Complex. Granitic protoliths 1690-1660 Ma; intensely deformed and metamorphosed up to granulite facies. Metamorphism ~1180 Ma.
Lithology Description: Intensely deformed and metamorphosed up to granulite facies. Granodioritic, monzogranitic, syenogranitic gneisses, OPX-bearing granitic gneiss, and quartz-magnetite gneiss, mafic gneiss and amphibolite; strongly magnetic - distinctly linear trending.
Shelly calcarenite to calcirudite; shallow marine and beach-ridge deposits; extensive calcretization.

General Comments: (Cockbain and Playford, 1973). Of  Warnbro Group in GSWA 1:500 000 geol dataset 2006.
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained feldspathic sandstone, grading to fine conglomerate.

General Comments: Named for Dardie Rocks,  the central part of the intrusion called "Widgiemooltha Monzogranite" on GSWA maps (but never formally registered as such). Shown on WIDGIEMOOLTHA SH51-14 and COWAN 3234.
Lithology Description: Monzogranite; high-Ca granite.
Microcline-phyric clinopyroxene-hornblende-bearing quartz monzonite; some granodiorite, monzogranite, diorite, and quartz diorite.

General Comments: Supersedes Darwin Member? See also Lexicon.  Along with the Petrel Formation, equivalent to the former "Mullaman Beds". Different unit from Darwin Granite in Tasmania. Shown as Aptian to Albian in 2015
Lithology Description: Kaolinitic claystone, commonly radiolaria-rich, silty in places, montmorillonitic, glauconitic and calcareous when fresh; basal conglomerate; minor bioturbated siltstone, carbonate, sandy claystone and clayey sandstone.

General Comments: Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).
Lithology Description: Includes olivine gabbronorite.

General Comments: Age: 1667+/-4 Ma (SHRIMP U-Pb zircon). For use on map sheet SG50-02; nearest town Gascoyne Junction. To be published: GSWA, 2007, Western Capricorn Orogen, 2007 update: 1:100K Geological Information Series.
Lithology Description: Schistose coarse-grained, strongly porphyritic biotite metamonzogranite; rounded phenocrysts of K-feldspar up to 6cm in diameter.

General Comments: First described in the Balfour Downs 1:250 000 sheet area and mostly considered to be Mesoproterozoic until 2017. Also shown on Nullagine and Robertson sheets. May includes dolerites of several different ages. Intrudes Manganese Group and Fortescue Group. Now [2018] infered to be younger and assigned to Kalkarindji Suite. See also GSWA ENS: Hickman, AH and MARTIN, DMcB (partial report), Davis Dolerite (E-KJdv-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 13 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Fine- to medium-grained dolerite sills.
Foliated, inequigranular, medium-grained,leucocratic, pink-grey muscovite-garnet syenogranite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Main body of granite lies across both the Davyhurst and Riverina 1:100K map sheet areas. To be published = GSWA Digital product 2016.
Lithology Description: Granite; typically poorly exposed and deeply weathered
Granodiorite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Redefined to include Croydon Group (Mallina Basin), Nullagine Group (Mosquito Creek Basin), Whim Creek (Whim Creek Basin) and Gorge Creek Groups (Gorge Creek Basin) in the De Gre ySuperBasin, Pilbara Craton. Goldsworthy Group now obsolete.
Lithology Description: Shale, wacke, feldspathic sandstone, arkose, banded iron formation, conglomerate, basalt, high-Mg basalt, siltstone, chert.

General Comments: Dixon Range 1:250 000 sheet area (east Kimberley region).  Of the Dougalls Suite.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed hornblende-biotite(-epidote) tonalite; inclusions of metadolerite and amphibolite

General Comments: Mount Harris Basalt has been thrust over Dean Quartzite at Mt Harris. Correlated with Heavitree Quartzite in northern Amadeus Basin.
Lithology Description: Fine to coarse grained quartzite, quartz sandstone; minor vein quartz pebble conglomerate, sericite-quartz schist, quartz-kyanite-muscovite layers, feldspathic sandstone.

General Comments: Renamed to 'Microgranite' for Central Yilgarn 2008 GIS package, to follow GSWA convention of not using the term porphyry [advice received from GSWA Jun 2016]
a redbed sandstone of probable Cambro-Ordovician age in a drillhole.
See also the misspelt Deeadeea Member and Deeadeea Claystone Member.
Lithology Description: Poorly bedded, partly cross-bedded, medium to coarse grained, moderately sorted reddish-brown sandstone with well rounded grains.

General Comments: Probably to used as Deep River Formation.

Lithology Description: Differentiated sill: basal pyroxenite to dolerite; granophyric phase in the central to upper sections; metamorphosed.
Offshore, fine-grained calcareous sequence, with foraminiferal assemblages.

General Comments: Holocene sand in Shark Bay area. To be published: GSWA Report or Bulletin, in next couple of years. May be published earlier in AJES or similar paper, but full definition will be in GSWA publication.
Defined as Denison Beds 1973. Described in GSWA Memoir 3 (1990) , NW Birrindudu Basin,  p351, 353, 357. May be lateral equivalent of Redcliff Pound Group. Neoproterozoic.
Lithology Description: Quartz arenite.
Hornblende granodiorite and tonalite with scattered microcline phenocrysts; mafic granite.

General Comments: This name appears to have been introduced by Logan et al. in 1970 for a well indurated red-brown calcarenite and calcirudite Pleistocene limestone along the margins of the Depuch and Useless Inlets of Shark Bay, WA, Carnarvon Basin (see STRATNO 80241). The same name has been used more recently offshore for a Jurassic sequence of  thin coaly and algal-rich mudstones and pro-delta marine shales and fluvio-deltaic sandstones in the Roebuck and offshore Canning basins. The Pleistocene unit has recently (2013) been renamed the Depuch Limestone.
Lithology Description: Includes thin coaly and algal-rich mudstones and pro-delta marine shales.

General Comments: The authors (Playford et al. 2013) state that this is a renaming of the Depuch Formation, citing  the reason that limestone is the primary lithology, however little information is provided further justifying this change. However, the fact that Depuch Formation has also been used for a Jurassic unit of different lithology offshore, makes a name change for this Pleistocene unit helpful in distinguishing it.
Lithology Description: Strongly cemented red-brown calcarenite and calcirudite.

General Comments: Of the O'Callaghans Supersuite, Paterson Province. Contains clusterings of geochemical analyses with high U.
Lithology Description: Syenogranite to alkali-feldspar

General Comments: Glengarry Basin. Informally called Wilthorpe granite in a 1992 thesis.
Lithology Description: Massive to deformed biotite granite with lenses of biotite schist, quartzite, amphibolite and banded iron formation

General Comments: Within the Bangemall Supergroup. Edmund Basin.85 - 200m thick.
Lithology Description: Laminated to thick-bedded dolostone, dolorudite; interbedded shale, dolomitic breccia, chert and siltstone.
Kimberlite
Consists of high magnesium basalt with a pillowed to massive structure and variolitic texture, with minor intercalated pyritic graphitic mudstones.

Stratigraphic Name: Devonian conglomerates associated with reef complexes 80958
General Comments: In refID 72034. (GSWA (2016). 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology of Western Australia. Lennard Shelf, Canning Basin. Also Subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Boulder to cobble conglomerate and sandstone.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias
Dolomite

General Comments: After  being excised from Bangemall Group then being placed in the "Savory Group",  the rocks of this subgroup now form "mostly Sunbeam and Diasappointment Groups" - see RefID: 50188.
Use on Barlee 1:250 000 sheet.
Lithology Description: Foliated conglomerate, sandstone, siltstone and argillite. Composition of basal units depends on underlying rocks.

General Comments: East Kimberley Region. Kimberley Province.  Of the Sally Downs Supersuite. Part of the Bow River batholith in the Lamboo Complex.
Lithology Description: Medium to fine grained, locally porphyritic leucocratic biotite monzogranite and minor syenogranite; rich in mafic inclusions adjacent to gabbro.

General Comments: Dated 1912 +/- 3 Ma and 1910Ma.  Of the Sophie Downs Suite. Originally defined as part of the Halls Creek Group, now recognised as a separate unit. Parts also previously mapped as Biscay Formation.  Intruded by Woodward Dolerite.
Lithology Description: Amygdaloidal metabasalt and amphibolite, metagabbro and meta-anorthosite, cordierite-bearing pelite; metadolerite sills; minor metamorphosed rhyolite.

Stratigraphic Name: Ding Dong Downs Volcanics - felsic volcanics
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed rhyolite; minor interlayered metamorphosed basalt, metasedimentary rocks and metadolerite sills

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Ages, relations, lithology updated from GA Timescales Project Feb 2009.
Lithology Description: Marine claystones and sporadic siltstones.

General Comments: Name reserved for Edmund 1:100K Map. Is the same as Dingo Granite used by J.Pearson 1996, but as Dingo has been used for other units first and Dingo Granite in Qld, Dingo Granite in WA is informal only, and now replaced by Dingo Creek Granite.
Lithology Description: Mainly fine to medium-grained porphyritic biotite-muscovite monzogranite to syenogranite; K-feldspar phenocrysts abundant (40% plus).

General Comments: Informal name? Invalid. Dingo Claystone has priority. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008). Part of the Sisters Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Gabbro, leucogabbro, serpentinised peridotite and dunite, pyroxenite, and minor anorthosite; metamorphosed.
