General Comments: Archean granite in Sir Samuel 1:250 000 sheet area
Lissadell 1:250 000 sheet area, east Kimberley region. Age updated by I.Sweet.
Lithology Description: Fine- to medium-grained hypersthene biotite amphibole tonalite.

General Comments: Meant to supersede Dirk Hartog Formation. Established by Gorter, Nicoll and Foster (1994) WABS symposium p373-396. Upper boundary of Dirk Hartog Group is now at a type 1 sequence boundary with the overlying Faure Formation. Shows traces of gas and residual oil. Dolomite is a potential hydrocarbon reservoir.
Lithology Description: Interbedded light-grey to light-grey-brown dolomite and gypsum with minor shale.

General Comments: Replaced most of younger part of the Savory Group. (Sunbeam Group replaced the older part of the Savory Group.)
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, conglomerate.

General Comments: Within the Bangemall Supergroup. Formerly Discovery Chert of Edmund Subgroup (Bangemall Group). Edmund Basin.
Lithology Description: Planar-laminated, pyritic, silicified carbonaceous siltstone, with cubic and rhombohedral mineral casts after pyrite or evaporites; local beds of silicified sandstone, pebble conglomerate and sedimentary breccia occur.

General Comments: ROBINSON RANGE 1:250 000 sheet area and beyond. Intrudes the Yarlarweelor Gneiss Complex.  Mapped as Durlacher Supersuite in GSWA 500K Solid Geology GIS (2008)
Lithology Description: Fine to medium grained, equigranular to porphyritic, biotite monzogranite with tabular K-feldspar phenocrysts.

General Comments: Has reservoir potential. Apparently correlative with Fossil Cliff Sandstone, Callytharra Foramtion and Nura Nura Member.
Lithology Description: Hard calcareous sandstone grading to sandy limestones (sparite cement in coarse-grained sandstone); minor coal interbeds; a distinctive bed with high radioactivity and density, low resistivity and sonic velocity: possibly bentonite from volcanic ash.

General Comments: Informal name.

A north eastern extension of the Cleaverville greenstone belt, interpreted as oceanic sea-floor of an immature island arc, based on basaltic and rhyolitic bimodal volcanism. Incorrectly assigned to misnamed Cleaverville Group
Lithology Description: Felsic volcanics, black-white chert, felsic tuff, ferruginous chert and banded iron formation.

General Comments: Said to be originally defined as conformable beneath the Dean Quartzite in Forman (1966)[which Forman 1966?] by Close et al. (2003). Previously correlated with Bloods Range Formation.
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone, siltstone, shale, arkose, feldspathic sandstone and fine conglomerate with quartz-mica schist in places

General Comments: Formerly Ningbing Limestone & Jeremiah Member.
Lithology Description: Limestone

General Comments: PUBLICATION: Semeniuk, V., 2008, Journal of the Royal Society of Western Australia Volume 91 Part 1 (Supplement): 53-148.
Lithology Description: Muddy red quartz sand, muddy brown quartz sand (mud in the muddy sand is kaolinitic and/or calcilutaceous); sheet-like deposit occurring between red sand and calcilutite.

General Comments: Age: 7,450-5,840yrs B.P. (for wood from this unit).
Lithology Description: Sand, shelly sand, sand/mud laminite, bioturbated mud, laminated mud, and conglomerate - mostly as lensoid, ribbon and/or wedge-shaped bodies [see DEFINITION  for further detail]

General Comments: Reserved as Dodonea Carbonate Member (Haines 2008) - for use on CROSSLAND sheet.; nearest town Fitzroy Crossing.  Replaces  "lower carbonate member" of Worral Formation (Lehmann 1984). Type section at Barbwire 1 petroleum well (596-613m). For publication in: GSWA Report 2008.
Lithology Description: A distinctive unit dominated by massive to weakly laminated and nodular carbonate, usually pale grey to beige dolomite, locally limestone; grading upwards to dolomitic or calcareous mudstone at the top; local minor sand.

General Comments: Of Hyland Bay Sub-group (Kinmore Gp). Subdivided into 'defined' Upper and Lower Dombey Fm. Supersedes Dombey Member (Hyland Bay Formation).
Lithology Description: Bryozoan-rich limestone with shaly lower section passing up into massive limestone.

General Comments: After Donegal Mine. Map Sheet: SH51-1,  Munjeroo 2941. Komatiite and komatiite flow units; olivine spinifex texture and local well developed cumulate zones; includes talc-chlorite schist; metamorphosed. To be published = GSWA geological map and explanatory notes, 2013/2014.
Lithology Description: Komatiite and komatiite flow units; olivine spinifex texture and local well developed cumulate zones; includes talc-chlorite schist; metamorphosed

General Comments: (Playford et al., 1976).
Lithology Description: Massive, predominantly medium to coarse-grained, moderately to well sorted, quartzose sandstone; heavy mineral concentrations and shaly intercalations in the middle part; fine to coarse quartz sandstone in lower parts.

General Comments: Offshore northern Perth Basin - Beagle Ridge and Abrolhos Sub-basin. See also Dongara Sandstone.
See also Lexicon.  Used as dimension stone in the building industry. A commercial name as well as a stratigraphic name.
Lithology Description: Indurated fine- to medium-grained feldspathic and kaolinitic sandstone with shale partings and colour variations from white to beige and pink.

General Comments: Became part of Mooloogool Subgroup, Glengarry Group in new Glengarry Basin stratigraphy of Pirajno & Occhipinti, then part of Mooloogool Group, Yerrida Basin.
Lithology Description: Arkose, siltstone (in places kaolinitic), sandstone, conglomerate, and breccia in arkosic matrix.
Breccia

General Comments: North Shaw 1:100 000 sheet area 2755. Within the Warrawoona Group (Pilbara Supergroup). Age given as <3498 Ma in 2010-2012 GSWA maps.
Lithology Description: Basalt, massive or pillowed, locally schistose, metamorphosed; silicified amphibolite and amphibolite schist, medium grained and variably foliated; silicified metamafic volcanic rock; mafic schist derived from basalt.

General Comments: Occurs as a sheet of black nodular soil between Airport Creek Formation and Christine Point Clay - probably representing a pedogenic unit deveoped on a calcareous parent (Airport Creek Formation) during a Pelsitocene low sea level stand.
Lithology Description: Homogeneous, dark grey, muddy sand cemented by low magnesian calcite into graine-sized nodules; with medium and coarse sand grains. Unfossiliferous palaeosol.

General Comments: Emplaced as a series of sheets into Tickalara Metamorphics. See also Dougalls suite.
Lithology Description: Predominantly tonalite, trondhjemite leucogranite.

General Comments: Lissadell 1:250 000 sheet area. Dougalls Suite. Age updated by I.Sweet.
Lithology Description: Foliated and metamorphosed hypersthene-hornblende-biotite tonalite; pyroxene amphibolite and country rock inclusions.

General Comments: Gordon Downs 1:250 000, Ruby Plains 1:100 000 sheet area.
Lithology Description: Lithic sandstone; micaceous siltstone, shale; minor dolomitic beds.
K-feldspar-phyric, massive to weakly foliated, hornblende-biotite granodiorite; low Ca granite.

General Comments: North Shaw region.  Preliminary data suggested a 3525 Ma age, in Coonterunah Subgroup (per M. Van Kranendonk, Mar.06). Subsequent work indicates a maximum depositional age of 3481 Ma and correlation with McPhee Formation, so now part of  Talga Talga Subgroup,  Warrawoona Group (Pilbara Supergroup). (Hickman 2011 GSWA Annual Review 2009-10). Type area is in east Strelley greenstone belt.
Lithology Description: Blue, black and white layered chert, basalt, carbonate rocks; minor felsic volcaniclastic rocks; also hydrothermal barite, evaporites and stromatolites.
Tectonic chert in dykes and sills, local barite

General Comments: BUNGAR 100k sheet.  A new granite in the southern Murchison Domain. Age: 2945 Ma. Type area: 5km west of Dromedary Bore, lat 29deg02', long 118deg25'. Overlain by Norie Group sedimentary rocks adjacent to the Narndee Igneous Complex.
Lithology Description: Muscovite-bearing granite schist and gneiss; locally biotite rich. Granodiorite gneiss; locally biotite-rich with K-feldspar augen.

General Comments: Top age is inferred from overlying Ashburton Formation (isotopic dates include 1829+/- 5 Ma).  Base age is very poorly constrained - underlying Mount McGrath Formation is undated (only a maximum depositional age of 2455 Ma) and dykes cutting the older Cheela Springs Basalt are 2007+/-16 Ma. 1km thick.
Lithology Description: Thin to thick bedded, locally stromatolitic, metadolomite; metadolorudite, and minor chert and pelite.

General Comments: Canning Basin region, but probably Holocene unit, so may not be part of Canning Basin Province.
Wolfe Basin.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, conglomerate, siltstone, diamictite.

Massive matrix-supported polymictic pebble to boulder conglomerate; larger clasts striated; poorly sorted lithic sandstone and dolomitic sandstone, pebble to cobble sandstone; minor thin-bedded dolomite

General Comments: Age: 3520-3400Ma. (3465Ma).  Occurs between Talga Talga and Salgash Subgroups (Warrawoona Group).  First proposed that it should be part of Talga Talga Subgroup, but later reassigned to the Coongan Subgroup of the Warrawoona Group (Van Kranendonk Mar06). Has ages from 3477 (max depositional age) to 3463 (eruption of basal unit) Ma.
Lithology Description: Predominantly dacitic volcaniclastic rocks; grades up to rhyolite; feldspar-porphyritic subvolcanic intrusions are common and voluminous; also pillow basalt and layered red and white sedimentary chert; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Narryer Terrane.
Lithology Description: Monzogranitic and syenogranitic gneiss, in places with abundant amphibolite and metagabbro inclusions

General Comments: Probably a North American unit.
Defn on Tech File G/50-1.
Lithology Description: Siltstone
Porphyritic, fine- to medium-grained granodiorite; minor monzogranite; medium to coarse tabular phenocrysts of K-feldspar; locally magnetite and allanite bearing.

General Comments: Gascoyne region, Glenburgh 1:250 000 sheet area.
See also Dunnsville Granite.
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained granodiorite; penetrative foliation and subhorizontal mineral lineation; sheared contacts with greenstones; low Ca granite.
Marine silty claystone.

General Comments: Defined as equivalent to Mesoproterozoic age in 1985. A max. age of 520 Ma makes it Cambrian.
Lithology Description: Clean quartz sandstone, minor basal conglomerate lenses and claystone.

General Comments: Name for belt of Palaeoproterozoic granites in the northern Gascoyne Complex (Maroonah and Mangaroon 1:100 000 sheet areas) - includes Pimbyana, Dingo Creek and Yangibana Granites and several unnamed units. Now extended to Discretion Granite in Milgun 1:100 000 sheet area (2010).
Lithology Description: Metamonzogranite, granodiorite and granite; minor tonalite, syenogranite, gabbro.

General Comments: For use on mapsheet WEBB; nearest town Kiwirrkurra. Outcrop locations is south of Dwarf Well. To be pub: as part of Interpreted Bedrock Geology map of WEBB 1:250K sheet/part of MACDONALD 1:250K sheet. GSWA in early 2008. Aileron Province, Arunta Orogen, North Australian Craton.
Lithology Description: Coarse-grained biotite metamonzogranite in low scattered pavements and bouldery outcrops south of Dwarf Well.
Recrystallised leucocratic medium to fine grained biotite monzogranite with minor secondary muscovite
Fine to medium micaceous and feldspathic sandstone; minor siltstone and mudstone.
Sandstone, arkose, siltstone
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly basaltic rocks; may include minor ultramafic volcanics

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset. [Note: Name of unit does not match age range given - whole of Paleozoic, CEB Feb-2012]
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Albany-Fraser Province.
Probably same unit as Eastern Leucocratic granite?

Reserved by: Sheppard S., Tyler I.M., Griffin T.J.
General Comments: East Kimberley region.
Lithology Description: Fine to coarse grained leucocratic biotite syenogranite, monzogranite and monzonite.

General Comments: Max. thickness: >10m. Type section destroyed by roadworks.
Lithology Description: Of laminated to bedded yellow to orange quartz sand, medium and coarse sand-sized grains; interstitial fine sand, minor clay also occur; contains scattered charcoal, trace fossils (burrows and root casts) and vegetative debris; unfossiliferous

General Comments: See also Echuca Shoals (abbreviated version). Includes hydrocarbon source rocks.
Lithology Description: Predominantly an extensive claystone; organic-rich, oil-prone marine shale.

General Comments: Used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Edamurta Range (also type area), Mellenbye1:100k sheet area. 28deg 34'S 116deg28'E. Intrusive into possible Polelle Group rocks.
Lithology Description: Metagabbro, locally with relict igneous texture or garnet-bearing, deformed, greenschist to amphibolite facies. Anorthosite to leucogabbro with distinctive euhedral plagioclase megacrysts to 20mm long; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Zanthus 1:250k sheet SH51-15 , ?Zanthus 1:100k sheet 3635. Metagranite, quartz metadiorite and metagabbronorite. Please note that the unit occurs in remote country and there are no geographic features in the vicinity, other than Harris Lake.  To be published = 2010 WA state map 1:500k layer. Published GSWA Record 2011/23 p22 [to be indexed ASAP]. These rocks have been dated at c. 1660 Ma.
Lithology Description: Heterogeneously deformed pegmatites and granites. Ranges from megacrystic metamonzogranite and equigranular metasyenogranitic gneiss, to rapakivi-textured metagranodiorite and metagabbronoritic rocks. Inferred hybrid products. A-type.

General Comments: Age: c. 1620Ma-c.1465Ma. Together with the Collier Group it overlies the Gascoyne Complex. Edmund Basin.
Lithology Description: Mostly fine-grained siliciclastic and carbonate sedimentary rocks: siltstone, sandstone, conglomerate, dolostone, stromatolitic dolostone, carbonaceous siltstone, chert; thick dolerite and gabbro sills.
Tonalitic orthogneiss-gneiss.
Mudstone, shale, siltstone, sandstone; minor glauconitic and tuffaceous sandstone, rhyolite tuff; basal hematite-clast conglomerate, ferruginous shale; dolerite sills.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain. High-HFSE.
Lithology Description: Biotite granodiorite  with high HFSE geochemical characteristics;weakly metmorphosed.

General Comments: In the Louisa Basin.
Lithology Description: Tillite, conglomerate and quartz sandstone; upper part dolomite and limestone. Capped with a persistent pink-dolomitic unit.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: See also GSWA Memoir 3 1990 (advice from R.Hocking 10-12-92).
Lithology Description: Condensed marine mudstones.

General Comments: PUBLICATION: Semeniuk, V., 2008, Journal of the Royal Society of Western Australia Volume 91 Part 1 (Supplement): 53-148.  Radiocarbon dating of shells within the Formation places it in the Holocene, viz., 3680 +/- 210 yrs BP.
Lithology Description: Light-coloured, laminated, bedded to cross-laminated, polymictic shell gravel, shell grit, shelly sand, and some coarse and medium sand layers.

General Comments: Basal mudstone member of the Boab Sandstone. Occurs in subsurface central Canning Basin (Barbwire Terrace) wheretobepublished = GSWA report A revised subsurface stratigraphy for the Central and Southern Canning Basin.GSWA Report to be published early 2014. Map sheet=Dummer.
Lithology Description: Mudstone
Quartzose, very fine- to fine-grained, moderately well-sorted sandstones with interbedded siltstone and claystone.

General Comments: Of the Goose Hole Group. Includes: Eagle Hawk Sandstone, Overland Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Feldspathic sandstone; minor siltstone.
K-feldspar-porphyritic biotite monzogranite; weakly foliated.

General Comments: Listed as in Halls Creek Province, but references say Kimberley Basin. See also Elgee Formation - age from SHRIMP dating of xenotime.Kimberley Basin, North Australian Craton.
Lithology Description: Massive red-brown siltstone with fine-grained micaceous, ferruginous and feldspathic sandstone interbeds; basal sequence in places of stromatolitic, sandy or oolitic dolomite, shale, micaceous siltstone and fine grained sandstone.

General Comments: Fully described in GSWA Record 1992/7, 93/27545, where it was accidentally misspelt as Eliasson Formation.
See also Elimberrie Bioherms.

East Kimberley, Gordon Downs 1:250 000 sheet area. Overlying & underlying units may be conformable or disconformable. Previously mapped as part of Bungle Bungle Dolomite. Distinguished on basis of stromatolite fauna. Correlates with Heavitree Quartzite and Bitter Springs Formation (Amadeus Basin). See also Eliot Range Formation. Age ~850-800 Ma based on stromatolite fauna.
Lithology Description: Dolomitic mudstone, siltstone and sandstone; minor dolomitic breccia and black chert; stromatolitic.

General Comments: Talbot 1:250k sheet SG52-09. To be published: Werner, M, Howard, HM, Smithies, RH, Aitken, ARA and Medlin C 2012, Mount Eveline, WA Sheet 4345: Geological Survey of Western Australia, 1:100 000 Geological Series. See also:Smithies, RH, Werner, M, Howard, HM and Kirkland, CL 2019, Eliza Formation (P_-PGe-xfr-sp): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 16 August 2019. <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>
Lithology Description: Rhyolite lavas, subvolcanic sills, and pyroclastic rocks, locally interlayered with volcanic sandstones and siltstones and minor basalt.

General Comments: For use on PINDERI HILLS map sheet; near Dampier.  Named for Elizabeth Hill Mine.  Reserved name published as Elizabeth Hill Suite.  Age: c.3068Ma.
Lithology Description: Granodiorite, monzogranite, tonalite, leucogranite, pegmatite; interleaved  banded and gneissic in places.

General Comments: Type Locality: 21 30' 00''E, 117 58' 10''S.  Omitted from Pilbara lithostrtigraphy revision (GSWA Record 2006/15), but now tentatively placed in the Sisters Supersuite (M. Van Kranendonk, GSWA, 2008).
Lithology Description: Biotite - bearing monzogranite

General Comments: Informally named unit of the Miocene Ellendale Lamproite Province or Field (email R.Hocking 20/11/08).
Informally named unit of the Miocene Ellendale Lamproite Province or Field (email R.Hocking 20/11/08).
Informally named unit of the Miocene Ellendale Lamproite Province or Field (email R.Hocking 20/11/08).
Informally named unit of the Miocene Ellendale Lamproite Province or Field (email R.Hocking 20/11/08).
Informally named unit of the Miocene Ellendale Lamproite Province or Field (email R.Hocking 20/11/08).
Informally named unit of the Miocene Ellendale Lamproite Province or Field (email R.Hocking 20/11/08).
Informally named unit of the Miocene Ellendale Lamproite Province or Field (email R.Hocking 20/11/08).
Informally named unit of the Miocene Ellendale Lamproite Province or Field (email R.Hocking 20/11/08).

This name takes precedence over the informally named Elendale Lamproite (numbered) units of the Miocene Ellendale Lamproite Province or Field (email R.Hocking 20/11/08). Cryogenian as age for parent unit Oscar Range Group in the 2006 edition of GSWA's 1:500k Bedrock Geology of WA.
Lithology Description: Cross bedded and rippled grey-green to brown phyllitic sandstone, feldspathic sandstone and minor siltstone and cobble and boulder conglomerate, overlain by laminated siltstone with occasional hematite lenses

General Comments: Not to be confused with Ellis Formation in the Antarctic. Interfingers with Sir Frederick Conglomerate.
Lithology Description: white to pale brown, cross-bedded, medium-grained quartz sandstone and pebbly sandstone; may be kaolinitic; minor interbedded calcareous sandstone and siltstone.

General Comments: Recognised in Vesta-1 from 3342.0m to 3479m as a series of blocky sandstones ([each] <10m thick), within homogeneous claystone of the Lower Vulcan Formation. Information from: Ellis, G., Bond, A., (2006). AC/P-21 : VESTA-1 WELL COMPLETION REPORT (INTERPRETIVE DATA), Eni Australia Ltd,  p27 in particular. Also found in Vesta-2. Important for oil and gas discoveries.Found in Swan Graben and Eclipse high. See also Elm Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Well cemented quartz arenites, dominantly fine to medium, with common loose very fine to fine quartz grains, poorly sorted, sub-angular to sub-rounded, with trace calcareous cement and trace brownish grey argillaceous matrix

General Comments: To replace the obsolete Mount Elma Conglomerate. Interbedded locally with Pillara, Nullara and Sadler Limestones, and Virgin Hills Formation
Lithology Description: Quartzite-dominated cobble to boulder conglomerate; minor coarse-grained arkosic sandstone.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

Lithology Description: White, pale grey or pale brown, well-sorted, porous, dominantly quartzose sandstone, typically fine- to medium-grained but locally including coarse and granular beds; locally massive or with interbeds of mudstone and minor carbonate.

General Comments: For use on map sheet 3055; nearest town is Nullagine. To be published: YILGALONG 1:100K Geol. Series map (2005). Defined in Yilgalong Explan. Notes to be pub: June 2007. Intrusion of Emu Pool Supersuite forming most of Yilgalong Granitic Complex.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed, foliated to gneissic, biotite tonalite and granodiorite; minor monzogranite.

General Comments: Ruby Plains 1:100 000 sheet area. Defined as Adelaidean age. Thin bedded argillite; minor quartz sandstone.
Lithology Description: Thinly bedded to laminated, partly micaceous, red-brown shale and green siltstone with minor thinly bedded lithic and quartzose sandstone mainly near the top and bottom.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Shallow-marine siltstone, shale and limestone, with lesser sandstone.Fossiliferous.

General Comments: Informal name for a greenstone belt which apparently contains no Strelley Pool Formation, as do many of the other greenstone belts in the East Pilbara Terrane - 11 out of 20 have identified Strelley Pool Formation within them. See also the informally presented Emerald Mine greenstone complex.
See also lexicon.  See also the misspelt Emiriau Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Fine- to coarse-grained poorly sorted sandstone; conglomerate

General Comments: Described in GSWA Record 1992/7, 93/27545.

Reserved by: Fitton M.J., Horwitz R.C., Sylvester G.
General Comments: West Pilbara. Unrelated to the geographically seperate Empress Shale (member level) of the Yilgarn Formation.

Lithology Description: Poorly-sorted quartz-pebble and sandstone-boulder conglomerate; coarse-grained sandstone

General Comments: For use on SPLIT ROCK sheet; near Marble Bar. Includes some 19 granites. Previously published as Emu Supersuite (GSWA Annual Review 2003-04: Van Kranendonk et al, "Event stratigraphy..."). Not related to Emu Suite in Queensland. In East Pilbara Terrane.
Lithology Description: Monzogranite, hornblende-biotite monzogranite, syenogranite, tonalite, granodiorite, mafic tonalite, quartz diorite

General Comments: Part of the Bow River batholith. Age: c. 1835-1805Ma.
Lithology Description: Medium to fine grained gabbro, quartz gabbro and tonalite; locally extensively veined by granitic rocks.
Dolomite, dolarenite, shale, chert

General Comments: Briefly described in RefID: 22814. Formerly of Cockleshell Gully Formation (name now abandoned) as Eneabba Member.
Lithology Description: Feldspathic sandstone interbedded with local minor conglomerate and multicoloured claystone and siltstone; rare coal.

General Comments: Offshore Perth Basin. See also Eneabba Formation.
See also Lexicon. Max. thickness: <150m. Formerly called "Snowie Sandstone"
Lithology Description: Well sorted, medium-grained quartz sandstone, calcareous in part, siltstone, shale, quartzic limestone; fossiliferous.
Sandstone

General Comments: Of the Grants Patch Group or Intrudes the Garnts Patch Group?
Currently used as a constituent of the Entia Gneiss Complex. Geological Province: Arunta Block (Division 2). Formerly of the Harts Range Group
Lithology Description: Quartzofeldspathic gneiss; layered amphibolite: conspicuously interlayered

General Comments: New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk). Also, to be used on FORTESCUE map sheet; nearest town Karratha. Age: 2982+/-5Ma.
Lithology Description: Seriate biotite monzogranite containing mafic schleiren and veins of pegmatite. Composite, including pegmatite veins of Sisters Supersuite rock.

General Comments: See also Erayinia Granite Complex and Erayinia Granitoid Complex.
Lithology Description: Ranges in composition from monzogranite to quartz syenite and syenite, typically with hornblende or clinopyroxene, and locally with abundant mafic xenoliths; massive to moderately foliated; strong shearing in mafic enclaves.

General Comments: Replacing the informal WMC term eremophila red beds, exists in petroleum wells of the Barbwire Terrace, Canning Basin. wheretobepublished = A Revised Subsurface Devonian Stratigraphy for the Central and Southern Canning Basin. GSWA Report to be published early 2014. Map sheet = Dummer. Unit in ? Formation (TBA).

For recent update see: Haines, P.W., Allen, H.J. 2016. The Murraba Basin: another piece of the Centralian Superbasin jigsaw puzzle falls into place IN GSWA 2016 extended abstracts: promoting the prospectivity of Western Australia: Geological Survey of Western Australia, Record 2016/2, p. 31-35.
Lithology Description: Shallow marine, well sorted, mainly fine to medium grained, sublithic and minor quartz sandstone, siltstone, shale and glauconitic sandstone; cross bedded, ripples; minor conglomerate.

General Comments: Gascoyne region.
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained muscovite-biotite-garnet monzogranite, granite and pegmatite.

General Comments: Changed to Errabiddy Formation in 1997 - 2001 period, but name appears to have reverted to Sandstone by 2006. Age ~1055 Ma. Geological Province: Badgeradda Basin.
Lithology Description: Feldspathic sandstone; minor pebble conglomerate lenses.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Of Guppy (1952). See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Fluvial very fine to medium grained parallel-and cross-bedded micaceous sandstone with minor siltstone and mudstone; plant macrofossils and palynomorphs.

General Comments: East Kimberley Region. Kimberley Province. Age: c.1910Ma.
Lithology Description: Partly recrystallised garnet muscovite granite.

General Comments: Includes trilobites and ammonoids.
Lithology Description: A white to yellowish-grey scutelluid marker bed

General Comments: Age ~1140 Ma. Spatial extent not well-constrained. Presently (2009) confined to Nornalup Zone.
Lithology Description: Weakly to moderately deformed and recrystallised granite; even grained or porphyritic
Purple to grey fine to medium grained micaceous sandstone interbedded with green siltstone, with tabular cross-bedded blocky white orthoquartzite at the top

General Comments: Said to include the Wilson Bluff Limestone and Nullarbor Limestone in the Ooldea Explan Notes (published 2007, but written earlier), but this grouping has been rarely used by GSWA since it was first established by them in 1970, and has more recently proved to include a significant hiatus. The name is likely to have been obsolete since the late 1990s.
Lithology Description: Marine clastics and carbonates deposited offshore
Limestone, siliciclastic rocks (locally spongolitic, bituminous, calcareous, or bioclastic), sandstone.
Monzogranitic to tonalitic gneiss with inclusions of Meeberrie Gneiss and Dugel Gneiss.

Reserved by: Clout J.M.F., Cleghorn J.H., Eaton P.C.
Lithology Description: A sill - similar in composition to, and spatially associated with, the high Fe tholeiitic portion of Paringa Basalt. Gabbroic.

General Comments: Reassigned to new subgroup of Warrawoona Group - Kelly Subgroup because this thick basaltic formation marks the beginning of a new volcanic event. Previously this was included as the top unit of Salgash Subgroup in the lower section of the group. Thickness on NORTH SHAW sheet : 9.4km. Kelly Subgroup now (2006) upgraded to Kelly Group of Pilbara Supergroup (by GSWA).
Lithology Description: Basalt, chert, dolerite, komatiitic basalt, komatiite, amphibolite, basaltic fragmental rock, gabbro, ultramafic to mafic schist, carbonate rock, felsic tuff, shale, sandstone, quartzite, metapyroxenite, serpentinite

General Comments: Lies across Bardoc 1:100K map sheet area. Named from the Evaporation mining camp. Within GSWA mindex GIS public domain layers. To be published = GSWA digital release 2016.
Lithology Description: Metamonzogranite; foliated to gneissic, and equigranular to sparsely porphyritic.

General Comments: (Le Blanc Smith, 1993). Described as Collie Subbasin, Southern Perth Basin (2008)
Lithology Description: Includes coal.
Sandstone, cross-bedded quartzose calcarenite, minor pebble conglomerate.
Medium-grained, equigranular and massive syenite.

General Comments: 1976 redefinition of Fairfield Beds.
Lithology Description: Fossiliferous limestone, shale, siltstone, sandstone, dolomite; shallow marine deposits.

Stratigraphic Name: Famennian reef complexes, marginal slope and basin facies 80954
General Comments: In refID 72034. (GSWA (2016). 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology of Western Australia.   Lennard Shelf, Canning Basin. Also Subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Limestone, calcareous sandstone and mudstone; lesser siliciclastic sandstone and conglomerate.

General Comments: In refID 72034. (GSWA (2016). 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology of Western Australia.  Includes Windjana and Nullara Limestones.Also Subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Limestone, lesser sandstone and siltstone, bedded (backreef) to massive (reef).

General Comments: Defn on Tech File SE/52-6.   Correlated with Olympic Formation. Possibly equivalent to [other?] diamictite of the Duerdin Group. See also Fargoo Formation. Wolfe Basin.
Lithology Description: Diamictite, tillite, locally abundant dolostone clasts, dolostone, dolomite, conglomerate.

General Comments: Previously assigned to Corboy Fm. (now part of Soanesville Gp. overlying this group). Named for Farrel Well, COONGAN 1:100 000 sheet. For widespread quartzite at base of the 3.0Ga Gorge Creek Group. Age: <c.3200Ma and >c.2940Ma. Within De Grey Supergroup.
Lithology Description: Dominantly weakly metamorphosed quartz-rich sandstone, with common cross-bedding and local ripples; local outcrops of basal polymictic boulder to pebble conglomerate. Metamorphosed.

General Comments: See also Iasky and Mory (1999). GSWA Report 69 p10-11, and Gorter et al (1994) WABS p569-588. The rocks that form this unit were previously considered to be in the topmost Dirk Hartog Formation and the basal Kopke Sandstone of Hocking (1987). The base of the unit is a type 1 sequence boundary. Upper boundary not well controlled.
Lithology Description: Reddish silty sandstones, siltstones and claystones. Angular carbonate clasts (probably reworked from top of underlying Ajana Formation).

Reserved by: Clout J.M.F., Cleghorn J.H., Eaton P.C.
Lithology Description: Weakly differentiated gabbroic sill.
Calcareous claystone, marl. Some medium grained sandstone in Caswell sub-.basin

General Comments: To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Fields Find Mine, Ninghan 1:100k sheet area. 29deg02'S 117deg15'E. Type area: northern Ninghan map sheet. Intrusive into inferred Norie Group banded iron formation; overlain by Polelle Group basaltic rocks. Published on Thundelarra (Zibra, I., Ivanic, T.J., Chen, S.F., 2017, Thundelarra, WA Sheet 2340: Geological Survey of Western Australia, 1:100 000 Geological Series).
Lithology Description: Peridotite, locally hornblende bearing, and pyroxenite  at the base of the intrusion with gabbro, hornblende gabbro, leucogabbro, and dolerite towards the top; metamorphosed

General Comments: See also misspelling 50-mile Tank Gneiss.
Lithology Description: Quartzofeldspathic gneiss, minor monzogranite, mafic to ultramafic enclaves and deformed pegmatite veins common; high-Ca group.
Banded tonalite, granodiorite, and local trondhjemite, monzogranite and syenogranite, gneiss and migmatite.

General Comments: Includes Fingoon Quartzite, Larry, Butler Creek and Poynton Formations. Unit for time space plotting (EG, HG 2007). Songfa Liu to use this on 'Pre-Permian solid geology map of the Paterson area' CEBJun-2009. Age control poor. Originally shown as Archean to Mesproterozoic. In 2009 shown as Statherian.
Lithology Description: Metasedimentary succession composed of feldspar-rich paragneiss, muscovite-schist and quartzite

General Comments: Used in the Rudall 1:250 000 sheet area.
Lithology Description: Massive or layered micaceous quartzite with local quartz-muscovite schist and psammitic gneiss

General Comments: See also informal Finlay intrusion.
Supersedes Finlayson Sandstone Member (redefined 1993). Renamed the Finlayson Member (Occhipinti et al. 1997) because of its heterolithic nature.
Lithology Description: Off-white silica-cemented rippled mature thinly to thickly bedded quartz sandstone and quartz siltstone with local brown diagenetic spots; local chert breccia. Quartz arenite.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File SE/52-5.
Lithology Description: Epidotized amygdaloidal dolerite.

General Comments: Intended to supersede the Upper Mount Goodwin Formation of Gorter (1998). Of Mount Goodwin Subgroup (Gorter, Nicoll, et al. in prep. Mar2009).
Lithology Description: Grey and green claystones with minor siltstone and sandstone
Sediments
Syenite and quartz syenite.

General Comments: Fitzmaurice Basin. Fitzmaurice Mobile Zone. Wingate Mtns 1:100 000 sheet area. Thickness: >3500m. Age: ~1200Ma.  See also Fitzmaurice group.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, shale, minor grit and conglomerate.

General Comments: See also Fitzroy Lamproite. Small plugs, <100 m to 1.8 km across; several, known as the Ellendale Vents, are diamondiferous.
Lithology Description: Leucite lamproite, olivine lamproite, lapilli and chaotic tuffs.
Deep-water mass-flow deposits with diagnostic features including massive sandstone, dish structures, and vertical water escape pillars.

General Comments: Reserved as Flamingo Shale Member. Age from Arafura Basin data.
Lithology Description: Shale, siltstone, sandstone, sandy limestone, glauconitic sandstone, pyritic sandstone.
Glacigenic purple micaceous shale and siltstone with interbedded fine to coarse and pebbly sublithic sandstone and dolomitic sandstone.

General Comments: To be used on the Mount Billroth mapsheet; nearest town is Dampier.  Ages: 3166Ma and 3164+/-4Ma.
Lithology Description: Biotite-bearing tonalite; strongly foliated; locally interleaved with abundant massive to weakly foliated, K-feldspar porphyritic monzogranite.

General Comments: Gabbro sill 500m thick with a harrisitic leucogabbro chilled top contact. Named after Fleece Pool (also type area), Cue 1:100k sheet area 2443. 27deg20'S, 117deg50'E. Published = AJES article on mafic-ultramafic intrusions of Youanmi Terrane, publication in 2010/11.
Lithology Description: Gabbro with gabbronorite base and harrisitic leucogabbro top contact; metamorphosed.
Foliated and metamorphosed leucocratic biotite-muscovite(-garnet-magnetite) monzogranite; inclusions of amphibolite and country rock.

General Comments: Zanthus 1:250k sheet SH51-15 , ?Zanthus 1:100k sheet 3635.  Interbedded semipelitic and psammitic gneiss.  To be published = 2010 WA state map 1:500k layer. Published GSWA Record 2011/23 p17 [to be indexed ASAP]. Maximum depositional age. GSWA Record 2013/5 (RefID 68654) has it as c.1620 Ma.
Lithology Description: Amphibolite- to granulite-facies interlayered psammitic  to semipelitic gneisses,which appear to be the metamorphosed equivalents of interbedded sandstones and mudstones.

General Comments: For use on the DAMPIER sheet. Includes the Gidley Granophyre.  Age: c.2724Ma.

Grouped as Springvale, Wilagee, and Foal Creek intrusions, with a single lith description in 500k_geologyp08_lut.csv. Informal unit of Springvale Suite [advice from GSWA Dec 2013]. Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).
Lithology Description: Layered mafic-ultramafic intrusions; peridotite, troctolite, gabbro, olivine gabbro, olivine gabbronorite, gabbronorite, leucogabbro, and anorthosite; minor chromitite layers.

General Comments: Reserved as Forest Belle by Rattenbury (1992) for the Ballard Sheet .  Not known if published by originator.  In the Yilgarn Craton. Cut by auriferous gold veins.
Lithology Description: Coarse-grained gabbro with clinopyroxene oikocrysts; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Published as the misspelt Forrestier Bay Granodiorite (GSWA Record 2006/15). Previously known as Forestier Bay gneiss (Sun and Hickman 1998). Forms part of the Harding Granitic Complex.
Lithology Description: Biotite granodiorite and monzogranite, sparsely porphyrytic with phenocrysts of microline, and locally compositionally banded; massive except where tectonically foliated adjacent to Sholl Shear Zone.

General Comments: North West Shelf. Hydrocarbon seal.
Lithology Description: Marine claystone.

General Comments: In the Glidden Basin.
Lithology Description: White or purple massive to blocky thickly bedded well sorted fine quartz sandstone

General Comments: Possibly an abbreviation of Forsyths Conglomerate Member?  Need to confirm this. PP. 17/1/06.

On YARRIE this group lacks the Mount Roe Basalt; instead a basal Koongaling Volcanic Member (Hardey Formation) overlies, and is genetically related to the underlying Gregory Granite Complex. Intruded by Cooya Pooya Dolerite and Gidley Granophyre. Bellary Formation is now considered the oldest unit in this group [See refID 66217 Coongan Explan Notes (2010)]. In Fortescue Basin (2007 Mount Edgar 100K, version2, refid 65727).
Lithology Description: Mafic volcanics - basaltic and andesitic lavas, siliciclastic sedimentary rocks, chert, minor pyroclastic rocks and carbonates.
Metadolerite, dolerite, gabbro; medium to coarse grained, massive grey-green rock, usually foliated

General Comments: Map Sheet = Menzies Nearest Town = Goongarrie on BARDOC. The Fortune Granite has been mapped in the western part of the Eastern Goldfields Superterrane of the Yilgarn Craton. It intrudes mafic rocks of the Vetters Subgroup. Wheretobepublished = GSWA explanatory notes and interpreted bedrock geology map in 2017.
See also Forty-four Hill Member.
Lithology Description: Basal conglomerate, well-stratified quartzose sandstone, brownish red sandstone, dolomite, volcanics, chert.

General Comments: (Woolnough and Somerville, 1924). Also referred to as Fossil Hill Formation this unit "is best regarded as a member of the Holmwood Shale" as concluded by Playford et al (1976). Unit reinstated as Member in 2005, after being considered a formation for some years. See also Lexicon. 1993 ref says Fossil Clifff Member includes Artinskian microvertebrate fossils.
Lithology Description: Interbedded dark micaceous and gypsiferous siltstone, sandy siltstone, shale, and bioclastic calcarenite deposited in a series of coarsening-upward parasequences.

General Comments: Gas prone unit. Numerical age: ~287-~273Ma (Sakmarian - Kungurian, from 2001 chart. 2015 biozonation and stratigraphic chart shows the unit as Sakmarian- Roadian.
Lithology Description: Carbonaceous siltstone and mudstone with sandstone and minor limestone. Abundantly fossiliferous.

General Comments: Map Sheet: SH51-1,  Wildara 3041. Sandstone to siltstone; local conglomerate; metamorphosed. To be published = GSWA geological map and explanatory notes, 2013/2014.
Lithology Description: Sandstone to siltstone; local conglomerate; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File E/52-6.
Lithology Description: Interbedded sandstone, conglomerate and siltstone.

General Comments: Bentley Basin.
Lithology Description: Limestone, dolomite, siltstone, chert, sandstone, and basalt.

General Comments: Includes the former Fraser Complex of Myers (1985) as well as interlayered metagranitic and metasedimentary rocks previously assigned as undivided Biranup Complex.
Lithology Description: Garnet amphibolite (metagabbro), layered ultramafics, metamelanogabbro, metaleucogabbro, meta-anorthosite, pyroxene granulite, metagabbro, gabbronorite, granulite.

General Comments: See also Fraser River beds.
Related to Fraser Suite?, Gnowangerup-Fraser Dolerite?
Age: ~1800Ma. In the Tanami Inlier. Includes the "Pipeline granodiorite". Shown as equivalent in age to Granites Suite and Borefield Road Suite.
Lithology Description: Medium- to fine-grained, equigranular biotite- or hornblende-bearing monzogranite to syenogranite. I-type.

General Comments: Age: 1946 +/- 71 Ma, Pb-Pb age from stromatolitic carbonates; Russell et al. 1994 (RefID 65419). Previously of the Earaheedy Group. Consists of four major granular iron-formation intervals, separated by at least 3 major shale and siltstone bands, and minor carbonate. Different unit from Frere Formation (NT)?. SHRIMP U-Pb dating of magmatic zircons from thin tuffaceous layers in the Frere Formation provides depositional ages of  c. 1890 Ma,  Johnson (2013), RefID 69003.
Lithology Description: Consists of four intervals of granular iron beds separated by shales, siltstones and carbonates; includes BIF, siltstone, shale, massive green chert, and granular iron-formation.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Fluvial deltaic deposits of ferruginised, partly bioturbated, poorly sorted, coarse-grained sandstone, conglomerate, and minor siltstone.

General Comments: Edjudina 1:250 000 sheet area.
Lithology Description: Monzogranite.

General Comments: See also Frigate Formation.
Lithology Description: Shale, calcareous shale; minor glauconitic sandstone.

General Comments: Informal nomenclature used to describe the voluminous granodiorite-monzogranite-syenogranite suite that dominates the Nornalup Zone.
Lithology Description: Granodiorite, monzogranite, syenogranite.
A distinctive, one metre thick pebbly sandstone to pebble conglomerate bed, useful as a stratigraphic marker.

General Comments: Using a sequence stratigraphic framework, this unit is the low stand systems tract constituent of the South Perth Sequence.  It largely coincides with the Gage Sandstone.  To be published: Poster at WABS 2013  in GA record in 2014. Described in GA Record2015/09.
Lithology Description: Consists of poorly sorted fine-grained to granular feldspathic sandstone interbedded with dark grey/black micaceous mudstone and siltstone.

General Comments: Formerly also Gage Formation (Davidson, 1995).
Lithology Description: fine-grained to granular feldspathic sandstone interbedded with shale and siltstone, which may be several metres thick in some wells.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Meliat area. Reserved as Galah Monzonite.
Lithology Description: Muscovite-biotite monzogranite with pegmatitic segregations; low-Ca granite.

General Comments: For a report on the Bonaparte and Ord Basins.
Published on Canning Basin maps.GSWA Bull145 Plates 4 & 5. CEBJul2009
Lithology Description: Distinctive cyclic sequence, each averaging 11-12m thick, coarsening upwards, commonly from marine siltstone or sandstone at the base to subaerial boulder conglomerate at the top.
Pebbly feldspathic sandstone and conglomerate; minor siltstone.
High Ca granite. Biotite monzogranite with prominent K-feldspar megacrysts; aligned K-feldspar, biotite, and xenoltihs define foliation locally.

General Comments: Reserved as Gamma Island. Also published as Gamma Island Dolomite.
Lithology Description: Dolomite and dolomitic carbonate mudstone.

General Comments: Bentley Basin.
Lithology Description: Conglomerate and coarse cross-bedded sandstone; basalt and rhyolite clasts up to 20cm.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Shallow marine dolomite and silty dolomitic limestone with sandy interbeds.

General Comments: Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).
Lithology Description: Layered with serpentinized dunite cumulate at base + metapyroxenite at top; bulk of the body is serpentinized peridotite. Serpentinite and serpentine schist after peridotite and dunite

General Comments: May be local name, equivalent to Irregully Formation, Edmund Group.
Lithology Description: Hosts a polymetallic deposit in dolomitic siltstone and shale.

General Comments: Formerly Shaw Granitoid Complex (2002 - 2004).
Lithology Description: Biotite leucomonzogranite, muscovite-biotite leucogranite with local garnet; very strong tectonic foliation.

General Comments: Original reserved name of Garden Granites changed after further discussion - for use in the complete revision of the Murchison domain lithostratigraphy; to be published in GSWA Annual Review 2007-2008.  Age: c. 2625Ma. Part of the Bald Rock Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Undeformed monzogranite to syenogranite; post-tectonic.

General Comments: Age of 1560.00 (K/Ar) is taken from the Birrindudu Group on the 2006 Geology of NT 2.5 million scale map, and is significantly older than previous references.  A subsequent  SHRIMP U-Pb study (RefID: 64662) of detrital zircon in the Tanami region, gives an age: ~1.77 - 1.64 Ga, for same reasons as unconformably underlying Pargee Sandstone (p40-41).
Lithology Description: Cross bedded, thinly to thickly bedded white sublithic medium to coarse grained, poorly sorted quartz sandstone with siltstone, shale; minor glauconitic sandstone and flaggy dolomitic sandstone, and basal conglomerate.

General Comments: Previously of Immarna Group. Grouing used again in 2007, 2017.
Lithology Description: Mudstone, carbonate, stromatolitic, oncolitic and oolitic, gastropods, minor sandstone horizons.  Upward change from argillaceous to carbonate mudstone. Lacustrine

General Comments: For a report on the Bonaparte and Ord Basins.
Lithology Description: Peloidal grainstone and limestone breccia, algal boundstone.

General Comments: The high-grade metamorphic core of the Capricorn Orogen. Although used in a 'stratigraphic unit' sense when first established, not technically a stratigraphic unit; more a structural unit. More recently used in a 'province' sense: but see RefID 66950. RefID 24535 gives age of constituent monzogranite: 1619+/-15 Ma.
Lithology Description: Granite plutons, sheets and dykes; granitic gneiss; and metasedimentary rocks.

General Comments: Defined by Bastian & Willmott (1965a). See also Lexicon. See many variations of Gearle, including Upper Gearle Siltstone and Lower Gearle Siltstone.
Lithology Description: Clayey siltstone, dark grey-black claystone, radiolarian siltstone. Dark-grey to black pyritic mudstone.

General Comments: Canning Basin.
Within the Sisters Supersuite.  Intrudes De Grey Supergroup.
Collie SI50-6. See also Gibraltar Quartz Monzonite.
Lithology Description: Clinopyroxene- and hornblende-bearing quartz monzonite; some alkali granite and syenite

General Comments: Reserved as Gibson. Used for two separate units in WA. Cretaceous unit within Bathurst Island Group, in Vulcan Sub-basin is Invalid name - use Brown Gannet Limestone instead. Not the same unit as another Gibson Formation in the Yeelirrie area of WA which is properly defined and has priority. Also distinct from Gibson Creek Formation, NT.
Lithology Description: Deep water limestone; pelagic marl, hemipelagic marl, limestone.

General Comments: Formerly referred to as "Dampier Granophyre". Intrudes along the basal unconformity of the Fortescue Group; intrudes the Hearson Monzogranite outcrops along the Burrup Peninsula and Dampier Archipelago islands.
Lithology Description: Thick sheet of massive, dark-green, dark-blue, purple or black granophyre, commonly porphyritic; remelted granite; basal gabbro.

General Comments: Informal unit for the Surface Geology of WA 1:1 million scale dataset
Lithology Description: Gabbro

A carbonatite complex (rocks with >50% carbonates, fluoroapatite, nepheline and other feldspathoids), characterised by ferrocarbonatite sills, dykes and veins, that are surrounded by variably fenitised country rocks. Widespread iron oxide veins.

General Comments: Briefly described.

Consists of massive, partly deformed and recrystallised, layered mafic-ultramafic intrusions emplaced in the southern granulite-facies zone of Musgrave Block; over 20 massive and layered mafic-ultramafic intrusions. Part of Warakurna Large Igneous Province? See also Giles Suite.
Lithology Description: Layered mafic-ultramafic intrusions: gabbro, gabbronorite, norite, troctolite, pyroxenite, melagabbro, anorthosite

General Comments: Used in the 1:1 million scale geology of SA, National Geological Maps Project.
Lithology Description: Recrystallised gabbroic rocks, mafic granulite, granitic gneiss, minor metamorphosed mafic and felsic volcanics, minor felsic granulite, gabbro, dolerite; marginal phase of Giles Complex

General Comments: Metadata ID: ANZLIC Metadata ID ANZCW0703008281. Part of the Giles Complex.
Lithology Description: Pyroxenite, peridotite, websterite, ultramafic rock

General Comments: Bentley Basin. Ages from a paper about the Giles Complex - Sun et al 1996, AGSO Research Newsletter 24 p13-15. Does this name supersede Giles Complex?? Warakurna Large Igneous Province. Two facies are mapped separately. This unit name is to be restricted to the older mafic-ultramafic rocks of the Giles intrusions (Giles Suite 1), with crystallisation ages between c. 1078 and 1075 Ma.
Lithology Description: Layered mafic-ultramafic intrusions of gabbro, troctolite, gabbronorite, norite, pyroxenite and anorthosite; massive gabbro and granite.

General Comments: Invalid subdivision of Giles Suite. Needs a different name.
Lithology Description: Layered mafic-ultramafic intrusions.

General Comments: Invalid subdivision of Giles Suite. Needs a different name.
Lithology Description: Mafic intrusive rock; massive or weakly layered; locally mingled with leucogranite.

General Comments: Kurnalpi 1:250 000 sheet area.
Lithology Description: Syenite

General Comments: Variation of the reserved name Gillam Creek Leucogranite (Smithies H., Champion D., 2000).
Lithology Description: Weakly feldspar-porphyritic biotite(-muscovite) monzogranite; locally with magnetite phenocrysts; massive to weakly foliated; weakly metamorphosed.

General Comments: To be replaced by Gindalbie Group again,  in GSWA publications in 2014.

To replace Gindalbie Formation,  in GSWA publications in 2014. [advice from Nicole Patison (GSWA) 26-FEB-2014]. Map Sheet SH51-5, 3139, MELITA.  Nearest Town = Leonora. To include Melita, Teutonic Bore and Spring Well Formations.  Brief description = Rhyolitic, rhyodacitic to andesitic volcanic rocks and coeval basalt, dolerite and gabbro; metamorphosed.
Lithology Description: Rhyolitic, rhyodacitic to andesitic volcanic rocks and coeval basalt, dolerite and gabbro; metamorphosed.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. SH50-14. Defined Glauert (1910). Type section in MacIntyre Gully, 1.6km N of Gingin.
Lithology Description: Glauconitic chalk, minor greensand; richly fossiliferous

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Calcarenite, commonly ferruginised, glauconitic and/or quartzose; shallow marine bioclastic.

Stratigraphic Name: Givetian-Frasnian reef complexes, marginal slope and basinal facies 80956
General Comments: In refID 72034. (GSWA (2016). 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology of Western Australia. Lennard Shelf, Canning Basin. Also Subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Limestone, calcareous sandstone, and mudstone; common breccia and mass flow deposits; lesser siliciclastic sandstone and conglomerate

General Comments: In refID 72034. (GSWA (2016). 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology of Western Australia. Lennard Shelf, Canning Basin. Includes Pillara Limestone and Cadjebut Formation (reefal precursor). Also Subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Limestone with lesser siltstone and sandstone, commonly cyclic;
Contains irregular echinoids and molluscs.
Medium- to fine-grained quartz arenite; minor pebbly sandstone, conglomerate and siltstone.

General Comments: Previously basal unit within the Savory Group, now [from ~2003] included in the Salvation Group (Mesoproterozoic).  For the location of type section see ref Bullen Explan Notes (1995). Unit defined by Williams (1992). Salvation Basin.
Lithology Description: Medium to coarse grained sandstone, pebbly sandstone, siltstone, and pebble to cobble conglomerate. Poorly sorted and cross bedded.

General Comments: Of the Lake Johnston Greenstone Belt, Youanmi Terrane.
Lithology Description: Fine to medium grained amphibolite after mafic volcanic rock. Aphyric to fine grained basalt, locally amygdaloidal; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Kalgoorlie Terrane, Eastern Goldfields Superterrane. To be published = Geological Survey of Western Australia East Yilgarn update 2013-14, digital product. Originally reserved as 'Gleesons Komatiitic Basalt', but name shortened in Nov 2014 by Hall, and Wyche, GSWA.
Lithology Description: Komatiitic basalt to basalt; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain.
Lithology Description: Komatiitic basalt, clastic sedimentary rocks; minor chert and rhyolite; weakly metamorphosed.

General Comments: Of Kiangi Creek Formation, Edmund Subgroup, Bangemall Group, of Muhling and Brakel (1985). Is unit still in use? [CEB Feb 2012].

Suite of dolerite sills, dyes & plugs, each usually > 100 m thick. Three types recognised - basaltic, doleritic and gabbroic. Intrudes Salvation Group, parts of Earaheedy Group, Edmund and Collier Groups in the western part of the Bangemall Supergroup. Age of intrusion: 1066+/-14 Ma (Pb-Pb).  See also the misspelt Glen Ayle Dolerite.
Lithology Description: Fine to medium grained dolerite sills and dykes.
Red, green and black, commonly laminated siltstone, shale and fine sandstone (locally glauconitic); blocky quartz sandstone.

General Comments: Age: 1250 Ma. In the Glidden Basin.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, quartz wacke, shale, and siltstone.

General Comments: Of Bentley Supergroup, Bentley Basin (GSWA, 2011).
Lithology Description: Basalt, rhyolite, andesite, tuff, shale, siltstone, sandstone and minor dolomite.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain. See Range Bore intrusion. Age considered to be ~2745 Ma because cut by 2740+/- Ma felsic igneous rocks and intrude ~2960 Ma (and possibly 2752 Ma) felsic volcaniclastics. Previoiusly included in Yalgowra Suite, but placed in Annean Supersuite in 2010 (Cue 1:100k map RefID 67116, and AJES article RefID 66195)
Lithology Description: Contains a layered sequence of mafic-ultramafic igneous rocks, including widespread dolerite and gabbro, but also wehrlite and olivine-chromite-rich units; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Name published in 1964, but never defined.
Lithology Description: Pale grey, fine- to very coarse-grained, very poorly sorted (locally bimodal), subrounded to rounded quartz sand and abundant feldspar; predominantly fluvial.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. SG50-1. Max. thickness: 2700ft. See also misspelt Gneuda Formation.  Includes youngest known thelodonts in Australia and possibly the world (from 1993 ref). Diverse macrovertebrate fauna. Dolomite is potentially a hydrocarbon reservoir.
Lithology Description: Interbedded carbonate rocks and siltstone with minor evaporites; calcarenite, quartzwacke, calcilutite and calcareous siltstone, generally very fossiliferous.

General Comments: Mount Ramsey and/or Gordon Downs 1:250 000 sheet area. In the Hooper Complex and Lamboo Complex western zone. Age: 1865-1850Ma.
Lithology Description: Coarsely porphyritic biotite hornblende granodiorite and tonalite with mafic inclusions.

General Comments: Dolerite and gabbro dykes; trending east-northeast to northeast; mostly interpreted from aeromagnetic data. See also Gnowangerup dyke swarm, Fraser dyke swarm, Fraser dykes and Gnowangerup Dyke Swarm. One of four mafic dyke suites cutting the southern and southeastern Yilgarn Craton. Part of the c.1210 Ma Marnda Moorn Large Igneous Province. Ages range from 1218+/-10 and 1202+/-10 Ma. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD and Spaggiari, CV (partial report), Gnowangerup¿Fraser Dolerite (P_-MMgf-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 09 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Typically dolerite and gabbro, minor quartz diorite.

General Comments: Used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Gnows Nest Range, 28deg 36'S, 116deg51'E. Type area 5 km north of Golden Grove mine. Possibly subvolcanic to Scuddles Member. Probably includes rocks previously interpreted as meta-arkosic and called Shadow Well Formation.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed granodiorite to tonalite with K-feldspar phenocrysts up to 8 mm in 4-6 mm matrix. A separately-mapped sub-unit is similar, but also contains hornblende phenocrysts.
Equigranular biotite monzogranite; High Ca granite
Biotite granodiorite and monzogranite with minor hornblende; medium-grained, seriate to locally porphyritic, metamorphosed.

General Comments: Originally of McWhae et al. (1958); Casey and Wells (1964). Included as in informal unit in the Liveringa Group on the advice of GSWA (R.Hocking) Oct 2008.  Probable correlative of Hardman Formation (Towner & Gibson, 1983)
Lithology Description: Paralic, cross bedded and ripple marked, thinly bedded fine and medium grained sandstone with minor siltstone; abundant trace fossils and burrowings with rare plant macrofossils; basal coarse sandstone and conglomerate in places

General Comments: See also Lexicon. 2008 - fossil fish found in Gogo Formation by John Long and Gavin Young with fossil unborn baby embryo inside with umbilical cord. Source rock for Nullara and Yellow Drum Formation's oil.
Lithology Description: Fossiliferous shallow marine reef complex basin facies black to light grey shale and siltstone with thin lenses of limestone and layers with abundant limestone concretions.

General Comments: Probably obsolete.
Lithology Description: BIF (consisting of quartz, chert, hematite and magnetite in units <10m thick) and interlayered mafic volcanic rocks.

General Comments: Lies within the Bardoc 1:100K map sheet area. Named after mining camp within the granodiorite extent and referenced in Cassidy et al (2002; AMIRA P482/MERIWA M281). To be published = GSWA digital release 2016.
Lithology Description: Fine- to medium-grained granodiorite.

General Comments: Nullagine and Noreena Downs 1:100 000 sheet areas
Lithology Description: Layered orthogneiss derived from tonalite, granodiorite, monzogranite and pegmatite; layers and lenses of amphibolite and ultramafic schist; foliated granite, granitic gneiss, mingled metasedimentary and metavolcanic xenoliths and granite
Massive, medium and even-grained gabbro that is sporadically pyroxene-phyric.
Mudstone and thinly bedded fine-grained sandstone.

General Comments: To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Golden Grove Mine, 28deg45'S, 116deg58'E. Type area: Gossan Hill 28deg48'S 116deg58'E.Conformably overlying Gossan Valley Member and underlying Scuddles Member.
Lithology Description: Rhyodacite, rhyolite and laminated felsic volcaniclastic rocks; host to significant massive sulphide horizons; metamorphosed.

A differentiated (micro-) gabbroic sill, the main host to Kalgoorlie-Boulder gold mineralisation. Upper & lower chilled margins, a lower ultramafic layer, several gabbroic units, iron-rich microgabbro, central granophyric unit.
Rounded mafic rudite.

General Comments: Excellent hydrocarbon source potential. Fossiliferous. Well developed hydrocarbon source horizons with efficient Carribuddy seal.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, sandstone, shale; minor dolomite, limestone.

General Comments: Bentley Basin.
Lithology Description: Dark-grey, feldspar-phyric rhyolite with very fine-grained groundmass; massive, flow-banded or spherulitic.

General Comments: Fitzmaurice Basin.
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone, siltstone, shale.

General Comments: Named after Gooche Well on Mt Phillips Sheet. Series of small inliers faulted against Pooranoo Metamorphics, and inclusions in Durlacher Supersuite granites. The 1776 +/- 8 Ma date is said to be igneous crystallisation age of the precursor granite (Sheppard et al. 2005).
Lithology Description: Strongly foliated, porphyritic metagranodiorite and metamonzogranite, and augen gneiss.
Equigranular, fine- to medium-grained biotite monzogranite to granodiorite.

General Comments: Also supersedes Googhenama Conglomerate.
Lithology Description: Interbedded fine- to coarse-grained, light pink to purple coloured sandstone, commonly quartz-rich with ripple marks; granular to boulder conglomerate, lenticular, commonly matrix-supported, quartz-pebble rich or polymictic.

General Comments: Used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Goonetarra Well, Yalgoo1:250 geol. sheet area. 28deg30'S 116deg42'E. Type area: immediately north of Goonetarra Well. Intrusive into top-Norie Group and base-Polelle Group supracrustal rocks along a lineated contact.
Lithology Description: Metagranodiorite to tonalite with monzogranitic components; locally with well developed linear fabric

General Comments: Reserved as Goongarrie Adamellite.
Lithology Description: Locally K-feldspar-phyric, biotite monzogranite; deformed contacts, weak to moderate foliation. High Ca granite.

General Comments: Incorporates the previous Wannery, Chubilyer, Weedoddie and Yeelingee Members of Daniels (1970) and the lower part of the Jillawarra Formation (Chuck, 1984)? Unclear if this applies to Gooragoora Fm. or to Blue Billy Fm.
Lithology Description: Medium- to thick-bedded, fine to coarse-grained sandstone and siltstone; minor conglomerate, dolostone and dolomitic siltstone.

Stratigraphic Name: Gooragoora Formation, Blue Billy Formation, Cheyne Springs Formation
General Comments: Informal unit for the Surface Geology of WA 1:1 million scale dataset.  Equivalent to Depositional Package 2 of the Edmund Group in the WA 500K Solid Geology GIS (2008).
Lithology Description: Siltstone and mudstone; sandstone and dolostone; locally sulphidic

General Comments: 525 Ma [basis for numerical age unclear. Timescale unclear. Reference from 1999] . Includes: Negri Subgroup, Elder Subgroup. Ord Basin.
Lithology Description: Limestone, sandstone, siltstone, mudstone, minor chert.

General Comments: Map Sheet=Malcolm SI51-7. Nearest Town=Esperance. Brief description=Series of syenogranitic, monzogranitic,and granodioritic gneisses. Part of Recherche Supersuite. Published in 2015 in Geological Survey of Western Australia Report 150, p33 etc.
Lithology Description: Series of syenogranitic, monzogranitic,and granodioritic gneisses.

General Comments: Lissadell 1:250 000 sheet area (east Kimberley region). Age updated by I.Sweet.
Lithology Description: Coarse-grained porphyritic biotite(-hornblende) monzogranite and syenogranite; rapakivi-like texture.

General Comments: Redefined by Van Kranendonk et al (2004).  Age: 3.27Ga. Mallina Basin. Reassigned to De Grey Supergroup from Pilbara Supergroup and including the new unit, Farrel Quartzite (GSWA 03/06).
Lithology Description: Chert, ferruginous chert, banded iron formation, jaspilite; minor siltstone, shale, sandstone, pebbly sandstone, quartzite, polymictic conglomerate, felsic volcaniclastic rock, basalt, ultramafic schist, mafic schist

General Comments: Used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Gossan Hill (?mine), Badja 1:100k sheet area. Type area Gossan Hill 28deg 45'S 116deg 58'E. Unconformably overlain by probably Polelle Group units and intruded by Warriedar Suite mafic-ultramafic intrusive units.
Lithology Description: Felsic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks; rhyolitic to dacitic in composition; locally with economic massive sulphide mineralization; metamorphosed.

General Comments: To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015.  Type area Gossan Hill, Badja 1:100k sheet area. Intruded by Gnows Nest Granodiorite at the base and conformably overlain by Golden Grove Member.
Lithology Description: Quartz-porphyritic rhyolite and felsic volcaniclastic rocks; metamorphosed

General Comments: [An informal, probable company name from the Kanowna gold camp]

Gradationally related to Petermann Sandstone/Deception Siltstone/Cleland Sandstone/Shannon Formation succession below it. Minimum age: Payntonian (~491-488 Ma) based on palynology and trilobites (NTGS Record 2018-010, p iii, p17). Younger radiometric age (505+/-6 Ma) is a maximum depositional age for a sample from the central part of the basin (Henbury) taken from well below the contact with the overlying Pacoota Sandstone and 100s of metres above the contact with the Petermann Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Silty sandstone with minor siltstone; fossiliferous and stromatolitic dolostone with minor limestone.

General Comments: In refID 72034. (GSWA (2016). 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology of Western Australia. Granites-Tanami Orogen. Variation of this unit used in subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area (stratno 80977).
Lithology Description: Biotite monzogranite.

Stratigraphic Name: Granites-Tanami Orogen metamorphosed igneous felsic unit 80978
General Comments: In refID 72034. (GSWA (2016). 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology of Western Australia. Granites-Tanami Orogen. See also variation used in subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area stratno 80979.
Lithology Description: Foliated biotite-muscovite-quartz-plagioclase-K-feldspar orthogneiss with thin leucocratic quartz--feldspar interlayers.

General Comments: See also Granny Smith diorite. This age may be the age of zircon xenocrysts derived from the turbidites intruded by the granodiorite.

Redefined by Crowe and Towner (1976); redefined again by Apak and Backhouse (1998) reducing the Group to what was the upper Grant Group interval. Retains Hoya, Calytrix and Clianthus Formations of Redfern and Millward (1994). Lower Grant Group has been renamed Reeves Formation. See REFID: 64971. Age from rare macrofossils and palynoflora. Produces oil in the Boundary oil field.
Lithology Description: Shallow marine to fluvial, and possibly partly glacial, cross-bedded fine to very coarse quartz sandstone, laminated micaceous sandstone, siltstone, mudstone, and minor conglomerate, fossiliferous; wood fragments and bioturbated in places.

General Comments: Sample dating published in: Wingate, MTD, Kirkland, CL, Riganti, A and Wyche, S., 2011, 185990: metagabbro, Grass Flat Bore; Geochronology Record 868: Geological Survey of Western Australia, 4p.
Lithology Description: Mafic intrusion.

General Comments: [An informal, probable company name from the Kanowna gold camp]. See also Gravedam Grit.

Intrusive mafic sills, dolerite to gabbro; commonly differentiated; c.2680 Ma. Flat REE trend (chondrite normalised); includes Golden Mile Dolerite and Condenser Dolerite. To be published = Geological Survey of Western Australia East Yilgarn update 2013-14, digital product.
Lithology Description: Dolerite to gabbroic sills.

General Comments: Also previously referred to as Grebe Formation, Grebe Sands, Grebe Sandstone, Grebe Marl and Grebe Marl Member. Eocene. Grebe Sandstone Member reappears in Geology and mineral resources of the Northern Territory (2013) as basal Member of Hibernia Formation.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, minor marl and limestone.

General Comments: Differentiated gabbro; cumulate to subophitic textures; hornblende-plagioclase-actinolite; metamorphosed. Sill at the top of the Coolgardie Subgroup. To be published = Geological Survey of Western Australia East Yilgarn update 2013-14, digital product.
Lithology Description: Differentiated gabbro; cumulate to subophitic textures; hornblende-plagioclase-actinolite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Basaltic rock; vesicular, with rare pillows; metamorphosed; spinifex-like texture defined by metamorphic actinolite. Kalgoorlie Terrane, Eastern Goldfields Superterrane.
Lithology Description: Basaltic rock; vesicular, with rare pillows; metamorphosed; spinifex-like texture defined by metamorphic actinolite
Mottled red and white, medium- to coarse-grained argillaceous sandstone; siltstone, shale, claystone and conglomerate lenses.

General Comments: With Yaloginda Formation, replaces Gabanintha Formation. Geological province: Murchison Domain.
Lithology Description: Andesitic, rhyolitic, dacitic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks; widely intruded by layered mafic-ultramafic sills; weakly metamorphosed

General Comments: Bow, Mount Remarkable 1:100k, east Kimberley region. Paperbark Supersuite. Porphyric rock of Castlereagh Hill redefined as Greenvale Porphyry. 1865- 1850 Ma. In the Western Zone of the Lamboo Complex.
Lithology Description: Massive quartz-feldspar monzogranite porphyry; medium to coarse phenocrysts of quartz, K-feldspar, and plagioclase.

General Comments: In the Fortescue Basin.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed and foliated granite, syenogranite, granitic augen gneiss, granophyre and granophyre gneiss

General Comments: In the Fortescue Basin. Requested by Songfa Liu, for use on: 'Pre-Permian solid geology map of the Paterson area' Jun-2009.
Lithology Description: Granophyre; locally includes gneissic granophyre and granophyric gneiss

General Comments: Pilbara. Invalid name. Should not be formalized. Gregory Range Granite has priority.

1:100k map sheet = 1936. Nearest Town = Grey.  Fine to coarse grained well sorted aeolianite, yellow coloured, well cemented. Mineralogy: carbonate, quartz, feldspar. Deposited in Marine Isotope Stage 5 (~125 ka). To be published = This year (2014) in Australian Journal of Earth Sciences.
Lithology Description: Consists of an eolian calcarenite/calcrete-microbialite/paleosol cycle.

General Comments: East Kimberley Region. Kimberley Province. Part of the Bow River batholith.  Age: 1835-1805Ma. In the Lamboo Complex.
Lithology Description: Medium- to fine-grained, even textured or weakly porphyritic biotite granodiorite and tonalite, with lesser biotite monzogranite.

General Comments: In the Arunta region - Aileron Province generally weakly to non-magnetic.  Also referred to as Grimwade suite granites. Appears to incorporate diorite and gabbro (highly magnetic, moderate gravity response) of former Borefield Road Suite from 2014.
Lithology Description: Fine, medium and coarse-grained, granite, monzogranite; K-feldspar megacrysts, metasedimentary xenoliths.

General Comments: Stated to be of the Kwinana Group (Abeysinghe 2003) but this is probably incorrect (per email R.Hocking 12 Feb 2008). Underlies the Pinjarra Plain of alluvial fans fronting the Darling Scarp and Darling Plateau. See also probable misspelling - Guilford Formation.
Lithology Description: Alluvial sand and clay with shallow-marine and estuarine lenses and local basal conglomerate.

General Comments: See Defn in B200 (1979) also.
Lithology Description: Shallow marine colour laminated and cross bedded fossiliferous limestone interbedded with siltstone and shale, and minor sandstone and dolomite

General Comments: Distribution: Rudall & Gunanya 1:250 000 sheets. Of Yeneena Basin? Formerly assigned to Tarcunyah Group (Grey et al. 2005).
Lithology Description: Sandstone; minor conglomerate, siltstone and shale. Medium-to coarse-grained arkosic sandstone; interbeds of coarse-grained, pebbly feldspathic sandstone are common in the top 100m.

General Comments: Probably obsolete. Name last used 1981.
Lithology Description: meta-argillite

General Comments: Bentley Basin (GSWA, 2011).
Lithology Description: A succession of amygdaloidal basaltic lavas which contain numerous thin and laterally discontinuous layers, and small successions of volcaniclastic, cherty-epidotitic mudstones, siltstones, sandstones and conglomerates.
Slate

General Comments: Plumridge 1:250k sheet SH51-8. Gwynne 1:100k sheet 3939. Dominantly psammitic gneiss with minor semipelitic layers; includes minor metagranitic rocks, metamafic and meta-ultramafic rocks. Previously the Salt Creek granulites named for a locality originally identified in 1970's GSWA literature as Salt Creek. 250k topographic maps showed this creek was instead called the Gwynne Creek (not Salt Creek) and thus this unit, which outcrops predominantly along the creek was named the Gwynne Creek Gneiss.
Lithology Description: Dominantly psammitic gneiss with minor semipelitic layers; includes minor metagranitic rocks, metamafic and meta-ultramafic rocks.

General Comments: Madura Province.
Lithology Description: Metagabbro interlayered with trondhjemitic plagiogranite.

General Comments: Gascoyne region, Glenburgh 1:250 000 sheet area. Granitic gneiss.
Lithology Description: Interlayered leucocratic and mesocratic granitic gneiss, pale grey granitic gneiss and foliated metagranite, gneissic to foliated porphyritic metagranodiorite; high-Ca group

General Comments: Map Sheet: SG51-13, Sir Samuel 3042. Basalt; fine-grained with local pyroxene-spinifex texture; includes medium-grained layers and lenses; minor interflow sediments; metamorphosed. To be published = GSWA geological map and explanatory notes, 2013/2014. Same rocks may have previously been called Mount White Greenstone?
Lithology Description: Basalt; fine-grained with local pyroxene-spinifex texture; includes medium-grained layers and lenses; minor interflow sediments; metamorphosed

General Comments: See also Tickalara Metamorphics.  Redefined to exclude the Ding Dong Downs Volcanics due to an unconformity. Redefined by Griffin and Tyler (1992) - Geol. of the southern Halls Creek Orogen. Intruded by Woodward Dolerite. There are inconsistencies with the age of Olympio Formation.
Lithology Description: Greywacke, slate, mica schist, greenschist, tuff, conglomerate, minor felsic volcanics.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

Lithology Description: Migmatitic cordierite-sillimanite pelitic hornfels locally retrogressed to pelitic schist

General Comments: Duplication of name prefix (also used for Hamelin Granite) is acceptable (email R.Hocking 20/11/08) since a great distance separates them and lithologies are vastly different.
Lithology Description: Beach ridges, coquina of small Fragum erugatum shells.

General Comments: Of Myers (1994).  Previously referred to as the Dunsborough Suite (Kay, 1958). Duplication of name prefix (also used for Hamelin Coquina) is acceptable (email R.Hocking 20/11/08) since a great distance separates them and lithologies are vastly different.
Lithology Description: Granite gneisses.

General Comments: Upper part deposited between 2470-2440Ma. Age of lower part: c.2600-2500Ma. Includes volcanic units ranging in age: 2597-2449 Ma.
Lithology Description: Chert, banded iron-formation, jaspilite, dolomite, mudstone, siltstone. Includes shallow-water reef limestones.

General Comments: Turee Creek Basin.
Kalgoorlie Terrane, Eastern Goldfields Superterrane. To be published = Geological Survey of Western Australia East Yilgarn update 2013-14, digital product.
Lithology Description: Komatiite and subordinate basalt; metamorphosed.

General Comments: The basal Tertiary unit in the central Eucla Basin.  Also overlies Gawler Craton in marginal palaeovalleys. Major marine transgression. Contains heavy minerals. See also Hampton Formation. Previously included in the Burdunga Subgroup, Immarna Group.
Lithology Description: Poorly sorted limonite-stained sandstone, typically quartz rich; includes subordinate gravel, conglomerate and siltstone.

General Comments: Map Sheet = Weebo Nearest Town = Leonora. Brief description = Mainly contains basalt with minor komatiitic basalt and interleaved felsic volcanic and sedimentary rocks. It is named after Hangover Bore which lies NNW of Leonora. Tobepublished = GSWA digital release (Maps and explanatory notes).

Basalt and komatiitic basalt interleaved with ultramafic rock; minor mafic intrusive rock; minor interflow sedimentary rock; metamorphosed.Kalgoorlie Terrane, Eastern Goldfields Superterrane. To be published = Geological Survey of Western Australia East Yilgarn update, 2013-14. Digital product.
Lithology Description: Basalt and komatiitic basalt interleaved with ultramafic rock; minor mafic intrusive rock; minor interflow sedimentary rock; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Volcaniclastic sandstone dated at 2774 ± 5 Ma found near Hanns Jasper Hill on the Lightfoot 1:100,000 map sheet (3539). Same age as a volcaniclastic sandstone found in the Palkapiti Formation and to c. 2770 ma plutonic rocks of the Minigwal Suite. To be published = 2010 publication of the Lightfoot 1:100,000 geological map by the Geological Survey of Western Australia. Hardcopy map and digital package.
Lithology Description: Dacitic volcaniclastic sandstone; crystal- and lithic-rich; metamorphosed.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Of the O'Callaghans Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Coarse-grained biotite syenogranite

General Comments: Connaughton 1:100k (Rudall 1:250 000) sheet area. Reservation varied at L.Wyborn's request. Equivalent to -Pgl+-Pgm on Connaughton 1:100k geol. sheet.
Previously Hardey Sandstone. Within the Mount Bruce Supergroup. In Fortescue Basin (2007 Mt Edgar 100K, version 2, refid 65727), Oakover Basin..
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, shale, lithic wacke, mudstone, arkose, calcareous beds, conglomerate; porphyry, porphyry breccia; quartzite; dacitic to rhyolitic lavas; quartz-feldspar-mica schist; boulder breccia; basalt; felsic pyroclastics, ultramafic lava.
Fossiliferous shallow marine mottled white red-brown and dark grey micaceous sandstone, siltstone, mudstone, limestone, conglomerate; commonly ferruginised by weathering.
Sandstone.

General Comments: In the Glidden Basin.
