Lithology Description: White pink and purple blocky thinly to thickly bedded fine medium and coarse grained quartz sandstone, purple laminated shale with rare green laminae, and minor thin interbeds of purple siltstone

General Comments: See also Harris Sandstone Member, Lexicon, Harris Formation. Contains stem fragments and trunks of Lycopodiopsis.
Lithology Description: Fine- to coarse-grained quartz sandstone; minor siltstone and (near base) diamictite.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File SE/52-5. 1790 Ma. Age: 1800 - 1790Ma. Intrudes King Leopold Sandstone, Kimberley Group as sills. North Australian Craton, Kimberley Basin. Mafic intrusions contain PGE-Au-V mineralisation.
Lithology Description: Gabbro, dolerite, diorite, granophyre; pyroxene granophyre differentiate overlies the dolerite and gabbro in some of the thicker sills.

General Comments: Published in GSWA Kimberley geological information series 2018 update. Halls Creek Orogen; King Leopold Orogen. Durack Fold Belt; Yampi Fold Belt. Also Subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Pink to pale-grey, medium- to coarse-grained granophyre.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. SD52-10,14. Lithologically correlated with the Eagle Hawk Sandstone (Ord Basin).
Lithology Description: Red micaceous quartz sandstone.

General Comments: Was replaced by the Harts Range Group but is to be reinstated in the Illogwa Creek and Hale River 1:250 000 sheet areas. Whelan, J. (NTGS), 31-MAR-2011.
Lithology Description: A thick metasedimentary succession with subordinate Paleozoic igneous units including mafic to ultramafic intrusions, metabasalts, granites and pegmatites.

General Comments: Possibly referring to Hervey Beds (DPSEP03). Province NOT Yilgarn Craton.
Redefined 1985. See also Lexicon.  Age: c.1820Ma (Page, OZCHRON). In the Tennant Creek Inlier.
Lithology Description: Arenite, siltstone, shale; some felsic volcanic rocks and basaltic lava at and near base.

General Comments: Uppermost unit in the Carlingup Greenstone Belt
Lithology Description: Fine-grained clastic metasediments, minor dacitic metamorphosed volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks, and minor coarse-grained metaclastic rocks interbedded with pelitic rocks.

General Comments: Separated from Winning Group (in RefID 14228) on the basis of a minor break, changes in ocean currents, rate of sediment supply and transition to carbonate deposition.
Lithology Description: Friable pink bioturbated marl with Chondrites burrows; glauconitic sand and fish debris thicker near base; rare Planolites burrows and chalk infillings towards top.

General Comments: Defined 1961 - as Hazlett Beds. Sandstone, siltstone, claystone. Eastern Canning Basin. Described in GSWA Memoir 3 (1990) , SW Birrindudu Basin,  p351, 360, 361. Mesozoic.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone and white claystone

General Comments: Of the Negri Subgroup (Goose Hole Group). Ord Basin.
Lithology Description: Grey massive to laminated limestone; minor chert and stromatolites.

General Comments: New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk).  Intruded by 2725Ma Gidley Granophyre. Forms part of c.2990Ma Dampier Granitic Complex.
Lithology Description: Monzogranite and syenogranite containing microcline megacrysts up to 5cm long; rock commonly shows a magmatic alignment of microcline phenocrysts, but otherwise massive and non-foliated.

General Comments: Probably an accidental misspelling of Heavitree Quartzite when first used, but unit redefined in 2016 from Heavitree Quartzite to Heavitree Formation due to the recognition that the rocks of the unit are silicified sandstone rather than a quartzite. Detrital zircon analysis suggests a maximum depositional age of 1050 to 1000 Ma (Camacho et al 2002, Maidment 2005, Maidment et al 2007; Kositcin et al 2014). It is thought that the Heavitree Formation sits in the Cryogenian subdivision of the Neoproterozoic (e.g. Grey 2005). Amadeus Basin, Centralian Superbasin.
Lithology Description: Fine-, medium- or coarse-grained, planar and cross-bedded, variably feldspathic quartzose sandstone, pink, grey, pinkish-brown, purple or white weathering, and rare laminated mudstone or conglomerate intervals.

Stratigraphic Name: Heavitree Formation and Bitter Springs Group
General Comments: In refID 72034. (GSWA (2016). 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology of Western Australia.  Informal grouping of units to suit map scale. Also Subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone, sandstone and conglomerate, dolomite, stromatolitic dolomite and siltstone.
Shale

General Comments: Glengarry Basin. See also Heines Formation (published 1995). Ages inferred from Wilthorpe Formation and Padbury Group.
Lithology Description: Upward-fining succession of polymictic conglomerate with a carbonate matrix, lithic wacke, sandstone, quartz-hematite schist and quartz-sericite-hematite schist.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File SE/52-6.  Age considered to be ~800 Ma, Cryogenian, in 1999. More recently considered Ediacaran.
Lithology Description: Micaceous siltstone, fine- to medium-grained sandstone, mudstone

General Comments: For use in Perth Basin. Bulletin to be published early 1995. See informal Henley Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, dark greenish-brown and glauconitic; minor siltstone.

General Comments: Not to be confused with Henry River nomenclature in NSW - Henry River Granite.

Lithology Description: Granite

General Comments: Age updated by I.Sweet.
Lithology Description: Massive, silicified white quartz sandstone.

General Comments: Location: Neale  SH51-04sheet area. Metadiorite and quartz metamonzodiorite gneiss; locally intruded by Paleoproterozoic granite and mafic rocks. Age: 2795-1780 Ma Tectonic Unit hierarchy: Tropicana Zone, Kepa Kurl Booya Province, Albany-Fraser Orogen. Publications:  Kirkland, CL, Spaggiari, CV, Smithies, RH, Wingate, MTD, Sweetapple, MT, Watkins, R, Tessalina, S and Creaser, RC 2015, Temporal constraints on magmatism, granulite-facies metamorphism, and gold mineralization of the Hercules Gneiss, Tropicana Zone, Albany¿Fraser Orogen: Geological Survey of Western Australia, Record 2015/5, 33p.
Lithology Description: Felsic to intermediate granitic gneiss locally interlayered with mafic (gabbroic) gneiss; typically with well-defined layered gneissic fabric; sanukitoids. Overprinted by mylonitic fabric. Sulfide-bearing quartz veins and calcite veins.

General Comments: There is an intention to amend the spelling of this unit to Herschel Limestone,  to match the changed spelling of the topographic feature. This is to be published as a GSWA report [advice R. Hocking 5-Jun-2015].
Lithology Description: Fossiliferous limestone and unlithified shell beds
Granite

General Comments: In the Crowhurst Basin. Age: c.1500Ma?
Lithology Description: Pink to yellow massive, thinly bedded to laminated and possibly stromatolitic dolomite, minor interbeds of sandy oolitic dolomite breccia and fine dolomitic sandstone

General Comments: Grebe Sandstone Member reappears as basal Member of this unit, in Geology and mineral resources of the Northern Territory (2013).
Lithology Description: Limestone, sandstone; minor shale and marl.

Reserved by: Wyche, S., Riganti, A., Chen, S.F.
General Comments: To be used on the JACKSON 1:100 000 sheet (SH 50-12/2737) as included in the CY-GIS (Central Yilgarn-Geological Information Series) digital package to be released in 2005 by GSWA.
Lithology Description: The intrusion has a very limited exposure, but it is clearly distinguishable on aeromagnetic images.

General Comments: Map Sheet: SH51-1, Wildara 3041. Basalt; fine-grained with local pyroxene-spinifex texture; includes fine-grained metamafic rock. To be published = GSWA geological map and explanatory notes, 2013/2014.
Lithology Description: Basalt; fine-grained with local pyroxene-spinifex texture; includes fine-grained metamafic rock.
Sandstone

General Comments: Defined as Hidden Basin Beds 1976. Described in GSWA Memoir 3 (1990) , SW Birrindudu Basin,  p351, 353, 357. Neoproterozoic. North Australian Craton.NTGS follows Memoir 3.  More recently GSWA shows this unit as Mesoproterozoic & significantly older than Murraba Basin. For more information, see Haines, P.W., Allen, H.J. 2016. The Murraba Basin: another piece of the Centralian Superbasin jigsaw puzzle falls into place IN GSWA 2016 extended abstracts: promoting the prospectivity of Western Australia: Geological Survey of Western Australia, Record 2016/2, p. 31-35. See also: Haines, PW (partial report), Hidden Basin beds (P_-_hi-ss): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 02 May 2019, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone, sublithic sandstone, shale and siltstone

General Comments: Lawlers Prospect. Probably informal mine site nomenclature.

On Cowan 3234, Widgiemooltha SH51-14. The Higginsville Subgroup will be part of the Kalgoorlie Group and comprise the Woolyeenyer and Mount Kirk Formations.  To be published in GSWA series map release 2018 and explanatory notes, 2018-2020.
Lithology Description: Mafic to ultramafic rocks; minor interflow sedimentary rock; metamorphosed.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. SG50-6. (Clarke et al., 1951). See also Highcliff Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Coarse-grained quartzofeldspathic sandstone, minor siltstone, claystone and carbonaceous shale.

General Comments: Offshore Perth Basin.

Lies within the Bardoc and Kalgoorlie 1:100K map sheet areas.The Highway Formation (previously Highway Ultramafics), has been reassigned to Broad Arrow Subgroup, which sits within the Kalgoorlie Group in the Eastern Goldfields Superterrane of the Yilgarn Craton. To be published = GSWA digital release 2016.
Lithology Description: Komatiite; locally preserved olivine-spinifex texture; commonly serpentinized or silicified.

General Comments: Bentley Basin.
Lithology Description: Massive, spherulitic or porphyritic rhyolite; minor trachyte and dacite; vitric lavas.

General Comments: In the Crowhurst Basin. Crowhurst Group (Mesoproterozoic)
Lithology Description: Interbedded purple and white flaggy and blocky, partly glauconitic fine and coarse quartz sandstone, purple thinly flaggy ferruginous siltstone and purple laminated shale

General Comments: Advised of use in widely circulated but unpublished report (R.Hocking)

Lithology Description: Adamellite

General Comments: Of Giles Complex. See also informal Hinckley Range intrusion. Connected to Wingellina Hills intrusion.
Lithology Description: Gabbro, gabbronorite.

General Comments: Unit upgraded to Formation in Arnhem Bay-Gove and Urapunga areas 1997, 1998 - as a unit of Collara Subgroup (Roper Group) in Urapunga-Roper River region. May have been downgraded again to Member in 2010 (as shown on Walhallow 1:250 000 sheet?
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone: grey to pink, fine to very coarse grained, medium to very thick bedded, trough cross-stratified, ripple marks, mud rip-up clasts

General Comments: Of the Bentley Supergroup, Bentley Basin. Although a recent reference [?] suggests this is an Amadeus Basin unit, the parent units (Tollu Group, Bentley Supergroup) have variously been assigned to the Officer Basin and Musgrave Province [CEBSept2009]. It is most likely that the 1026 +/- 26 Ma dacite, originally believed to be Smoke Hill Volcanics, represents a subvolcanic sill that intruded into the Smoke Hill Volcanics (either belonging to the Hogarth Formation, or to an event that post-dates this formation).
Lithology Description: Andesitic to trachytic lavas; rare trachyandesite to dacite; laminated felsic volcanic siltstone and lesser sandstone; porphyritic aphanitic rhyolite; felsic volcanic-pebble breccia; metagabbro, massive with sub-ophitic texture.

General Comments: Offshore Perth Basin, Beagle Ridge area.
Of Clarke et al., 1951. See also Lexicon. 1993 ref says Fossil Clifff Member includes Artinskian microvertebrate fossils. Originally listed as in SA too. SA probably wrong.
Lithology Description: Green to grey shale and siltstone with thin limestone beds, sporadic glacial erratics and cannonball concretions; marine.

General Comments: To be used on MARBLE BAR map sheet; nearest town is Marble Bar. To be published:  Van Kranendonk, M. et al - approx. 21 August 2006 - Geology and mineralization of the east Pilbara - a field guide/GSWA Record 2006/16.
Lithology Description: Alkali-feldspar granite, local older diorite and granite; granitic dykes; intrusive rhyolite and dacite; granodiorite; interlayered granite and amphibolite; metamorphosed

General Comments: Reassigned from the Gorge Creek Group to Soanesville Group (GSWA 03/06).
Lithology Description: Amphibolite, silicified amphibolite, metabasalt, metakomatiitic basalt, silicified mafic schist, tremolite-chlorite-talc schist, interlayered ultramafic schist and quartzite, and metamorphosed basalt.

General Comments: Informal name.
Lithology Description: Ultramafic rocks

Reserved by: Fitton M.J., Horwitz R.C., Sylvester G.
General Comments: Age > 3000 my
Lithology Description: Chert

General Comments: Of the Lake Johnston Greenstone Belt. Age 2921 +/- 4 Ma and 2903 +/- 5 Ma, from strata below and above the komatiite layer. Also 2930 - 2875 Ma (Mole et al 2012; Wang et al 1996).
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed BIF, clastic metasediments, metamorphosed ultramafics (including komatiite), and minor felsic metavolcanic and metavolcaniclastic rocks.

General Comments: Yampi and Lennard River 1:250 000 sheet areas, West Kimberley region. Maximum Age: 2500 Ma. To be revised for use as a province - R.Hocking 18-AUG-2010.
Lithology Description: Metamorphic rocks and granites.
Migmatitic quartz-biotite orthogneiss.
Jaspilite

General Comments: Misspelt & informal. Formal name would be Horans Line Gabbro.

Probably equivalent to Indulkana Shale. Hosts the Mereenie oil and gas and Palm Valley gas fields. Has unconventional shale gas and oil potential. Originally Horn Valley Beds. Fossil assemblage is Bendigonian.
Lithology Description: Green laminated siltstone with fine sandstone interbeds, fossiliferous limestone; mud-rich sedimentary rock containing an abundance of fossils; rich petroleum source.

General Comments: Unclear if this is intended as a formal name or not.
Lithology Description: Medium-grained, weakly foliated and leucocratic granite with a very low abundance of mafic minerals.

General Comments: Previously assigned to Padbury Group. Defined in 1979 as part of Glengarry Group. Now part of Bryah Group, first in Glengarry Basin stratigraphy of Pirajno and Occhipinti, now in Bryah Basin (1998, 2000). See also Horseshoe Range Beds.
Lithology Description: Garnetiferous banded iron formation with intercalated greywacke and manganiferous shale; turbiditic
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Seems to be the same as the Horseshoe Basin, which overlies the Turee Creek Basin (and Group). See also Shingle Creek Group.

PUBLICATION: Semeniuk, V., 2008, Journal of the Royal Society of Western Australia Volume 91 Part 1 (Supplement): 53-148. There are no radiocarbon ages derived from this Formation, but ages of 5500 +/- 160 yrs BP, 5590 +/- 240 yrs BP and 6910 +/- 180 yrs BP from underlying calcarenites demonstrate its Holocene age.
Lithology Description: A fine to medium sand-sized bioclastic and quartzose and locally oolitic calcarenite.  The cementing agent is sparry calcite.  The limestone is laminated, cross-laminated, cross-bedded, to large-scale festoon-bedded.

General Comments: Defined 79/04653 P138. Yilgarn Block. Discrepancy in ages; both Archaean and Early Ordovician have been given!
Lithology Description: Well banded, silty metasediments, with minor pyroclastic units.

General Comments: Phil Playford is proposing to use the name Hoult Member of the Peron Sandstone for a unit of fossiliferous sandstone exposed on the south side of Faure Island. The fauna shows that it was deposited during the last interglacial period of the Pleistocene, about 120 000 to 130 000 years ago. The name is taken from Hoult Landing on Faure Island, which was named after the Hoult family, who had owned the Faure Island pastoral lease for many years. Playford and Berry (2002) in an unpublished report had used the name 'Faure Member' for this unit, but this is inappropriate as Hocking et al (1987) and later Iasky and Mory (1999) had already applied the name Faure Formation for a Lower Devonian unit in this area. To be published: GSWA report or bulletin in the next year to 18 months.
Dongara, WA. Forms the impermeable cap rock for the Dongara Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Fossiliferous black mudstone, sandy siltstone and shelly storm beds. Limestone, laminated mudstone.
Lamproite

Reserved by: Redfern R., Apak N., Backhouse J.
General Comments: Barbwire Terrace area.
Lithology Description: Basal thick diamictites, mudstones and dropstones and massive sandstone.
Dolerite

General Comments: Probably not intended as formal name.
Lithology Description: Generally massive, medium to coarse-grained, sporadically muscovitic, leucocratic granite with no foliation.
Sandstone, dolomite, limestone, siltstone, shale, mudstone, stromatolitic dolostone, evaporitic mudstones.

General Comments: Bonaparte Basin, Petrel Sub-basin. Age: Kungurian-Ufimian to latest Permian. Includes Torrens, Pearce, Cape Hay, Dombey and Tern Formations (after Gorter et al. 2009). This version of the name is preferred by Geoscience Australia. See also information under Hyland Bay Sub-group and Hyland Bay Formation.
Lithology Description: Mudstone, siltstone, sandstone and carbonate rocks.

General Comments: Kurnalpi Terrane.
Lithology Description: Basaltic andesite and associated hyaloclastites; andesitic conglomerates, breccias and sandstone; andesite-dacite, variably porphyritic and amygdaloidal; fine-grained sedimentary rocks, chert, minor banded iron formation.

General Comments: Incorporates Kurabuka Formation of the Mucalana Subgroup (Bangemall Group). Collier Basin.
Lithology Description: Greenish-grey to black, parallel-planar laminated, pyritic and carbonaceous siltstone, locally silicified. Thin interbeds of sandstone occur in upper parts; also includes chert (silicified lutite), minor limestone and calcareous siltstone.

General Comments: Includes unnamed subunit. Illaara greenstone belt, Southern Cross Domain, Youanmi Terrane. Probably formalises Illaara quartzites.
Lithology Description: Quartzite and quartz-rich metasedimentary rock; locally fuchsitic; includes subordinate quartz-muscovite schist and ferruginous intercalations; sandstone, with minor siltstone and pebbly sandstone; metamorphosed.
Iron formation

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain.  Age: ?2645Ma. Name misspelt when first reserved and published. See also misspelt Illigalara Monzogranite.
Lithology Description: K-feldspar megacrystic monzogranite, occasionally laminated; metamorphosed.

General Comments: East Kimberley, Gordon Downs 1:250 000 sheet area. Previously mapped as part of Mount Parker Sandstone & Wade Creek Sandstone but younger age now recognized.
Lithology Description: Lithic sandstone, minor siltstone and dolomite.

General Comments: Correlated with Neale Formation.
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone, stromatolitic or oolitic limestone, dolomite and chert
A-type. Yb-enriched, within-plate granite.

General Comments: Defined as Ima Ima Beds in 1977. Described in GSWA Memoir 3 (1990) , NW Birrindudu Basin,  p351, 352, 355. May be lateral equivalent of Birrindudu Group. Mesoproterozoic.
Lithology Description: Predominantly sandstone-medium to thin bedded, medium to coarse-grained sublithic arenite and quartz arenite, cross bedding and scattered pebbles common. Minor lenses and bands of conglomerate.  Local shearing and quartz veining
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Included in Yelma Formation by Sheppard et al.( 2016). Part  of Tooloo Group.
Lithology Description: Felsic volcanics and felsic porphyry.
Heterogenous coarse-grained, porphyritic to equigranular amphibolite-facies monzogranite.

General Comments: Collective name for intrusive rocks in Mallina Basin; includes a suite of high-Mg diorite (sanukitoid) intrusions (Smithies & Champion 2000), Northern Pilbara Craton. Age: >2.9Ga. Informally named "Pilbara high-Mg diorite suite". Intrudes De Grey Supergroup.
Lithology Description: High-Mg diorite (sanukitoid) intrusions. Massive to moderately foliated, mesocratic, hornblende-biotite granodiorite+tonalite and hornblende-biotite(-clinopyroxene) granodiorite are the most common rocks; range from equigranular to seriate to porphyritic.
Shale, maroon, minor green, calcareous; thin white flaggy siliceous sandstone interbeds; rare limestone lenses. Rippled, desiccated, bioturbated
Comprises clay and channel iron deposits with granule to pebble conglomerate at base.

General Comments: Of Daniels (1966), a revision of Top Camp Dolomite. Originally included all units below Kiangi Creek Formation. Revised by Chuck (1984) and Copp (1998); now includes only the lower dolostone interval (Wongida Dolomite Member) of original Irregully Formation.
Lithology Description: Stromatolitic dolostone, massive dolostone, parallel-laminated dolomitic siltstone, siltstone, silty sandstone, quartz sandstone, and conglomerate.

General Comments: Informal grouping of basal Edmund Group units.  Equivalent to Depositional Package 1 of the Edmund Group in GSWA 500K Solid Geology GIS (2008)
Lithology Description: Stromatolitic and non-stromatolitic dolostone, dolomitic siltstone, sandstone, siltstone, and conglomerate.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. SH50-1,5,9,10. (Clarke et al., 1951).
Lithology Description: Fine to coarse-grained quartz sandstone, conglomerate, siltstone, carbonaceous claystone with minor coal; continental.

General Comments: Offshore Perth Basin, Abrolhos Sub-basin, Beagle Ridge.
Possibly replacing Isabella Formation?  In the Gregory Range Inlier.
Lithology Description: Consists of brown-weathering, grey to blue, fine-grained or porphyritic rhyolite, characterised by small spherical amygdales of quartz, chlorite and carbonate.

General Comments: Of the Paterson Orogen. Yeneena Supergroup. Previously of Lamil Group (until ~2004).
Lithology Description: Thinly bedded carbonate rocks, calcareous siltstone, minor shale, local sulphidic dark grey or pale grey-cream carbonate rock and shaley calcarenite, sandstone, conglomerate
Granodiorite

General Comments: Mentioned in geochron file 104975.1.pdf (1997?) as of Mulgabbie Pluton. Does GSWA intend to formalise this unit name?
Lithology Description: Monzogranite.

General Comments: Map sheet: Errabiddy 2347, Robinson Ranges SG50-07.  The Jackys Pool Metadolerite (P_-jp-modg) is restricted to several northeast-trending metadolerite dykes, all <1 km in length on southeastern ERRABIDDY and northern GOULD in the Yarlarweelor Gneiss Complex. The metadolerite dykes are only 1-3 m wide. They parallel numerous Archean metadolerite dykes (A-mwa-YNA); however, the garnet-bearing metadolerite dykes are inferred to be Paleoproterozoic in age since they crosscut Archean-aged fabrics and are themselves intruded by granitic rocks of the 1820-1775 Ma Moorarie Supersuite. The metadolerite dykes are distinguished from Archean amphibolites (A-mwa-YNA) in that they commonly contain corona textures of garnet around pyroxene, and do not contain a well-developed gneissic banding or schistosity. Published as Jackys Pool Metadolerite Suite: 2015 West Capricorn Orogen Geological Information Series, but GSWA is returning to the original name in 2018. See also GSWA ENS: Sheppard, S, Occhipinti, SA and Johnson, SP 2016, Jackys Pool Metadolerite (P_-_jp-modg): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 01 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Garnet-bearing metadolerite dykes.Commonly contain corona textures of garnet around pyroxene, and do not contain a well-developed gneissic banding or schistosity.

General Comments: For use on the MOUNT WOHLER map sheet; near Whim Creek.  In Mallina Basin and east Pilbara. Part of Sisters Supersuite and intrudes De Grey Supergroup.
Lithology Description: Tonalite and granodiorite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: GSWA is progressively returning from form terms 'dyke' and 'intrusion' to lithological terms such as dolerite and gabbro, hence this name may be reused to replace the Jameson intrusion [CEB2018].
Lithology Description: Gabbro, troctolite

General Comments: Vulcan Graben, Timor Sea. Pattillo and Nicholls (1990). Different unit from the Jamison Sandstone (Roper Group) also in NT. lateral equivalent to Heywood Formation?
Lithology Description: Monotonous succession of silty claystones, with occasional thin limestone or dolomite stringers.

General Comments: See also Jandakot beds, Jandakot Beds.

Briefly described as part of 2010 Acreage Release in: Nicoll R.S, G. Bernadel, T. Hashimoto, A.T. Jones, A.P. Kelman, J.M. Kennard, S le Poidevin, D.J. Mantle, N. Rollet and P.R. Temple (2010) Northern Carnarvon Basin, Biozonation and Biostratigraphy, 2010, Chart 36. On CD: Basin Biozonation and Stratigraphy Charts, 2010. Geoscience Australia.
See also Lexicon. Formerly part of Edgar Range Group.
Lithology Description: Shallow marine laminated pink and purple siltstone with a sugary texture, massive and partly sandy mudstone, limestone. Includes extremely thin coal seams.

General Comments: Ruby Plains 1:100 000 sheet area. Defined as Adelaidean age. Within the Duerdin Group. Ferruginous sandstone in Auvergne area. Wolfe Basin.
Lithology Description: Dolomitic and ferruginous sandstones and quartz sandstone, siltstone and mudstone. Extremely thick massive sandstone with single beds up to 2.5m thick.

General Comments: Previously shown as Calymmian (Mesoproterozoic). Victoria Basin. Conservative maximum deposition age of 1322 +/- 22 Ma, with two isolated grains aged 1243 Ma and 1171 Ma (Carson, 2010).
Lithology Description: Medium grained, silica-cemented quartz sandstone/orthoquartzite, minor siltstone, basal conglomerate.

General Comments: Leonora district, Eastern Goldfield Superterrane. May be informal mining company nomenclature.
Defined as Jawilga Beds 1973. Described in GSWA Memoir 3 (1990) , NW Birrindudu Basin,  p351, 353, 357. May be lateral equivalent of Redcliff Pound Group. Neoproterozoic.
Lithology Description: Partly cross bedded medium to fine grained lithic sandstone and chert granule conglomerate

General Comments: New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk). Intrudes Cliff Pool Tonalite; intruded by Munni Munni Intrusion.
Lithology Description: Foliated, weakly compositionally banded, and locally sparsely porphyritic granodiorite and lesser monzogranite.

General Comments: Equivalent to: Backdoor Formation, middle. May be a current Member of Backdoor Formation? By 2012, presented as a Member of Backdoor Formation in Teano 1:100 000 sheet [GO'C 2012].
Lithology Description: Thin- to very thick-bedded sandstone and minor siltstone.

General Comments: See definition for Jeedamya Rhyodacite. Gindalbie Terrane.
Lithology Description: Calc-alkaline intermediate-silicic complex consisting of predominantly rhyolitic to rhyodacitic pyroclastic and volcaniclastic clasts.

General Comments: Ages: 2684 +/- 6 Ma zircon,  and 2690 +/- 16Ma. Top of Fortescue Group. Age range from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706. Stromatolitic in part.
Lithology Description: Shale, sandstone, siltstone, mudstone, dolomite, local microbanded chert, jaspilite, conglomerate; fine-grained massive rhyolite; mafic tuff with local accretionary lapilli and agglomerate; thin basalt/dolerite and andesitic basalt flows.

General Comments: For use on map sheet 2855; nearest town Marble Bar.  Intrudes Fig Tree Gneiss. Dated: 3307+/-3Ma and 3310+/-4Ma.
Lithology Description: Biotite granodiorite, medium- to coarse-grained, foliated; metamorphosed.
Sandstone.
Green silicified glauconitic mudstone, chert, sandstone, pebble conglomerate

General Comments: Savory Basin (now included in the Officer Basin).  For location of type area see Bullen Explan Notes (1995). GSWA shows this unit as Mesoproterozoic in 2005 & 2006 publications. Mesoproterozoic age matches Salvation Group too.
Lithology Description: Fine to medium grained sandstone, shale, siltstone, mudstone and conglomerate.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File SG/50-5.

Mafic to ultramafic intrusive rocks, undivided; locally abundant carbonate. Part of the Widgiemooltha Large Igneous Province; intrudes Archean greenstone and granitic units of the Yilgarn Craton.See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD and Romano, SS (partial report), Jimberlana Norite Member (P_-_wz-xo-a): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 09 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Norite, bronzitite, gabbro, pyroxenite, peridotite, dolerite.

General Comments: See also Jimperding Complex.
Lithology Description: Granitic rocks partly recrystallised in greenschist facies. Even-grained, seriate, or porphyritic granites, metasedimentary rocks, unltramafic rocks, banded quartzo-feldspathic orthogneiss.

General Comments: Originally Randal (1962), Malone (1962). Unfossiliferous. Previously considered to include Ordovician conodonts, trilobites, brachiopods, but these now recoginsed to be in separate Florina Formation.
Lithology Description: Dolomitic-siliciclastic siltstone with sandstone-siltstone interbeds; dolostone; minor cryptalgal dolostone, ooid dolograinstone, dolomitic quartz sandstone; evaporite (principally anhydrite) common in siltstones and some sandstones; flat pebble breccias

General Comments: Superseded Coomberdale Chert and Dudawa Beds.
Ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Comprises well-banded BIF made up of chert and iron oxides; 5 thin stilpnomelane layers concordant with the stratification of the BIF.

General Comments: For use on map sheet 2855; nearest town Marble Bar. Dated: 3303+/-2Ma. Intrudes Fig Tree Gneiss and is intruded by Moolyella Monzogranite.
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained, biotite monzogranite, locally foliated.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File SE/52-6.  Within the Duerdin Group. Includes lenses and seams of material known as the ornamental stone 'zebra rock'.
Lithology Description: Green and red banded shale; gypsiferous and dolomitic in part.

General Comments: Note: relationship with underlying Juderina Fm was considered conformable and gradational until 2004. Similarly the relationship with the overlying Thaduna Formation was considered transitional until 2004. maximum age from underlying Bubble Well Member of Juderina Formation.
Lithology Description: Laminated siltstone and shale, minor feldspathic/lithic sandstone and quartz sandstone, local thin dolomite or dololutite and chert beds.

General Comments: Timor Sea. See also misspelt Johnson Formation Dolomite.
Lithology Description: Limestone, minor sandstone.

General Comments: See also local name Scotty Creek Conglomerate.
Lithology Description: Conglomerate and sandstone with granitoid clasts and matrix dominating, metamorphosed. Arkosic arenite, fine- to medium-grained, rare pebbles - metamorphosed. Conglomerate and sandstone with mafic matrix dominating - metamorphosed.

General Comments: Within the Sisters Supersuite. Geological province: Pilbara Craton/Mallina Basin.  Intrudes De Grey Supergroup.

Lithology Description: Conglomerate
Biotite granodiorite, locally includes tonailte and monzogranite; medium- to coarse-grained; locally seriate and porphyritic; weakly to moderately foliated; mafic xenoliths; metamorphosed.
Equigranular monzogranite.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. 92/27499 considers Jowlaenga Formation part of Broome Sandstone. See also Broome Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Fine to medium grained poorly sorted and commonly ferruginous, fossiliferous, silty sandstone, mudstone, conglomerate

General Comments: Gascoyne Province. Included in -Pg on Edmund & incl. in -Pgmv on Winning Pool-Minilya 1:250k map sheets.
Formerly Jubilee Calcarenite?  See also Jubilee Calcarenite Member. Note Jubilee Calcarenite used in 2002, but as a member of Cardabia Formation.

Previously defined as Juderina Sandstone. Formerly of Windplain Subgroup (Yerrida Group). Yerrida Group made obsolete and now of Windplain Group. Dating from Bubble Well Member. Relationship with overlying Johnson Cairn Shale was recorded as disconformable in 2004. Previously considered conformable and gradational.
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone (in places cross bedded and rippled), minor siltstone, laminated siltstone, shale and chert, chert breccia and conglomerate. Conglomerate usually matrix-supported with vein quartz clasts, and intraformational sandstone clasts.

General Comments: Described in GSWA Record 1992/7, 93/27545
for GSWA publication.
Lithology Description: monzogranite
Sandstone

Reserved by: Preiss W.V., Walter M.R., Coats R.P., Wells A.T.
General Comments: Redefined by VJ Normington, N Donnellan, 30-SEP-2015. Redefinition approved 9-NOV-2015.
Lithology Description: A widespread, relatively thin unit of dolostone, limestone (oolitic in part) and siltstone with sandstone lenses; contains sparse stromatolites.
Dolerite

General Comments: East Kimberley Region. Kimberley Province. Ages: c.1910Ma and 1913+/-5Ma.  In the Lamboo Complex (eastern zone).
Lithology Description: Partly recrystallised fine grained leucocratic monzogranite.
Basalt

General Comments: Used in Proterozoic granites project. Gascoyne Province. Shown as -Pgp & -Pg on Yanrey-Ningaloo 1:250k map sheet.  Parent Boolaloo Supersuite discontinued by GSWA; now part of Moorarie Supersuite (S.Sheppard, pers. comm., 2008)
Lithology Description: Granitic rocks, adamellite

General Comments: Initial isotopic age (1843 +/- 2 Ma) reanalysed and reinterpreted to 1799 +/- 8 Ma (Evans et al, 2003). Overlain by Ashburton Formation in Duck Creek Syncline, but  Ashburton Formation appears to be diachronous and is believed to be older than the volcanics in other areas.
Lithology Description: Predominantly intermediate and mafic lava, pillow breccia, fine to coarse pyroclastics and minor dolomite, sandstone and mudstone.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain. NOT part of Austin Downs Supersuite, as wrongly shown in GSWA Annual Review 2007-08 (Van Kranendonk pers. comm. 14-APR-2011). Shown as part of Bald Rock Supersuite in 2010, but not in 2012.
Lithology Description: Foliated to strongly sheared K-feldspar-porphyritic monzogranites. Granites and metamorphic equivalents; high grade metamorphics, syenogranites and pegmatites.

General Comments: Edjudina 1:250 000 sheet area.
Lithology Description: Biotite monzogranite; High-HFSE granite.

General Comments: Forms a radial distribution of dykes into pillow basalt. Hosts the Jupiter gold deposit.
Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias
Sandstone, mudstone and conglomerate; partly eolian.

General Comments: McIntosh 1:100 000 map sheet, East Kimberley. In the Western Zone of the Lamboo Complex.
Lithology Description: Fine- to medium-grained, biotite-cordierite-sillimanite granodiorite and monzogranite with abundant migmatitic metasedimentary inclusions

General Comments: Talbot 1:250k sheet SG52-09. To be published: Werner, M, Howard, HM, Smithies, RH, Aitken, ARA and Medlin C 2012, Mount Eveline, WA Sheet 4345: Geological Survey of Western Australia, 1:100 000 Geological Series.
Lithology Description: Rhyolitic and trachytic lavas, subvolcanic sills, and pyroclastic rocks, locally interlayered with volcanic sandstones and siltstones and minor basalt.

General Comments: Wallaringa and Wodgina 1:100 000 sheets.
Lithology Description: Muscovite-biotite(-garnet) monzogranite; equigranular to weakly porphyritic; massive to layered.

General Comments: To be published: Werner, M, Howard, HM and Smithies, RH 2012, Mount Eveline, WA Sheet 4345: Geological Survey of Western Australia, 1:100 000 Geological Series.
Lithology Description: Quartz-feldspar-porphyritic rhyolite; subvolcanic intrusions; rounded and embayed quartz phenocrysts and subhedral and embayed alkali feldspar phenocrysts, both up to 7 mm, in a very fine grained felsitic groundmass.
Komatiitic and tholeiitic basalt.
Shale, siltstone, sandstone, dolomite.

General Comments: Rudall 1:100k sheet area, 3552 . For the 1700Ma orthogneiss etc
Lithology Description: Felsic intrusives.

Approved by: Munson, T., Glass, L., Beyer E.
General Comments: This will include, in part, units formerly included in the Kalkarindji Volcanic Group. Constituent units defined in both NT and WA, So no single typestate applies. GSWA has recently used Kalkarindji Supersuite for this unit. Kalkarindji Suite rocks are known to be extensive in the sub-surface.
Lithology Description: Tholeiitic basalt, dolerite and andesite: partly vesicular or amygdaloidal; minor trachyte, microdolerite, basaltic flow breccia, peperite, pyroclastic deposits, quartz sandstone, siltstone, sedimentary breccia, limestone, chert.
Well-bedded to massive reefal-slope and fore-reef limestone; locally dolomitized, steeply dipping, with allochthonous blocks and debris flows in some horizons.

General Comments: Bardoc 1:100k map sheet 3137. Dolerite and gabbro; includes cumulate and granophyric differentiates. Part of the Widgiemooltha Large Igneous Province; intrudes Archean greenstone and granitic units of the Yilgarn Craton. To be published in: East Yilgarn GIS 2018 package. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD (partial report), Kalpini Dolerite Member (P_-_wk-o): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 09 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite and gabbro; includes cumulate and granophyric differentiates.

General Comments: This unit is interpreted from distinctive northeasterly linear trends on geophysical imagery and is not observed in outcrop. It is considered likely that dolerite is a main constituent of the unit. It was originally published as the Kimberley Dyke Suite (79598), but name is invalid (clash with Kimberley Group), and it is therefore renamed to Kalumburu Dolerite to avoid form term. Dolerite; typically northeasterly trending dykes. To be published in: Kimberley GIS 2018 package etc. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD and Phillips, C (partial report), Kalumburu Dolerite (DC-_ka-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 01 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Probably dolerite.

A lower polymictic conglomerate with clasts including local granite, gneiss, basalt, BIF, and a matrix with little or no clay or silt. An upper fine- to coarse-grained lithic sandstone with clasts similar to those in conglomerate

General Comments: No geographic names are available in region. Kalyukuyarra is the Martu word for "water pools after rain". This is proposed as the type location for the suite (Zone 51, E 569204, N 7447540, GDA94) includes boulders with the Martu symbol indicating water gathers at the location after rainfall. Suite crops out and is present in one drillhole. Largely undeformed with some discrete high strain zones in some outcrops. To be published in Payne et al. (in prep).
Lithology Description: K feldspar, quartz, plagioclase, biotite granitoids. Largely undeformed with some discrete high strain zones in some outcrops.

General Comments: 2706+/-36 Ma (Foster et al., 1996). See also Hannans Lake Serpentinite.
Lithology Description: Komatiitic flows and/or massive olivine adcumulate; metamorphosed. And thin, discontinuous sedimentary rocks, including definitive shale marker beds at the top.

General Comments: See Kambalda Sequence.

Lithology Description: Fossiliferous limestone, shale and limestone breccia.

General Comments: Name probably replaced by Kanandra Metamorphics.Geological Province: Arunta Block (Division 1). Quartzofeldspathic gneiss, commonly migmatitic and garnetiferous, mafic granulite, calc-silicate rock.Incudes variable zircon cores with an age spectrum from 2500 to 1850. Minimum age from intrusion. Intruded by Mount Swan Granite. Rare but distinctive zircons with igneous zoning and shape define a unimodal cluster of concordant isotopic compositions with a weighted mean 207Pb/206Pb age of 1734+/-3 Ma, interpreted as a magmatic crystallisation age.
Lithology Description: Pelitic and semi-pelitic migmatite, mafic granulite, metapsammitic rock, garnet leucogranite and biotite granite with rare calc-silicate rock.

General Comments: North Shaw 1:100 000 sheet area 2755. Within the Pilbara Supergroup. The redefined banded-iron formation portion of Pincunah Hill Fm is now assigned to this unit as the Pincunah Member (Van Kranendonk/GSWA Mar06). Current version of constituent name is Pincunah Banded-iron Member (checked in ASUD, June2014).
Lithology Description: Olistostrome megabreccia; banded iron-formation; layered chert; shale; andesite; andesitic volcanic sandstone; dacite and rhyodacite; felsic volcanic rocks; felsic volcanic breccia and volcaniclastic sandstone; rhyolite lava and pumice breccia.
Alluvial silt and clay, indurated; calcareous in upper part, basal pisolite gravel.
Quartz-feldspar porphyry

General Comments: Contains Keene Basalt within drill core Lancer 1.
Lithology Description: Lower part mainly mudstone, claystone and sandstone; upper part stromatolitic dolostone, sandstone and mudstone; grey shale beds, possible ash beds, and basalt (Keene Basalt).

General Comments: To be used on the upcoming CHALLA and WINDIMURRA 1:100 000 maps due for publication in 2012. Spelling corrected back to original spelling of  'Murdana'.
Lithology Description: Rhyolite, dacite, felsic tuff; meta banded chert, meta banded iron-formation.

General Comments: Age: 2692+/-4 Ma (Claoue-Long et al., 1988).
Lithology Description: Extensive chert and siliceous slate which are distinct marker beds - locally associated with BIF in Kambalda domain.  In the Norseman greenstones they form an association with metagreywackes, BIF, and felsic pyroclastic rocks.
A-type. Within-plate, Yb-enriched granite.

General Comments: Became part of Bryah Group in new Glengarry Basin stratigraphy of Pirajno & Occhipinti (1997) and Pirajno (1996). Previously of Glengarry Group.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed and locally ferruginous shale and sandstone with metaconglomerate bands and lenses, and chert and siliciclastic metasediments.

General Comments: Occurs in the vicinity of the Camel-Tabletop fault zone.
Lithology Description: Medium to coarse arkosic sandstone, micaceous fine to medium grained quartz sandstone, minor quartz feldspar wacke, shale, siltstone and conglomerate

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain.  Age: ?2670Ma.
Lithology Description: Metamonzogranite.

General Comments: For use in Cretaceous of Perth Basin. See informal Kardinya Shale.
Lithology Description: Moderately to tightly consolidated, interbedded siltstones and shales, dark green to black, often puggy, glauconitic, and contain thin interbeds of mostly fine-grained sandstone.
Dolerite.

General Comments: Poor name choice. Not related to the Karlaya Limestone (after the Karlaya Limestone Member) in the adjacent Officer Basin.
Lithology Description: Vitriclastic, rhyolitic ignimbrites, breccias and lapilli-tuff facies.
Granodiorite
Recrystallised fine- to medium-grained biotite monzogranite; unfoliated. High Ca granite.

General Comments: Age approx. 3260 Ma. Together with the Roebourne Group units (in West Pilbara granite-Greenstone Terrane) is interpreted to be a rifted segment of Sulphur Springs Group/Cleland Supersuite of the East Pilbara Granite-Greenstone Terrane. See also Karratha Granitoid Complex.
Lithology Description: Granodiorite and tonalite; foliated with local compositional banding; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Previously within the Miningarra Subgroup, now [2013] Miningarra Group. Formerly part of the underlying Windidda Fm.
Lithology Description: Shale, generally finely laminated; siltstone, and minor sandstone; deformed and metamorphosed in the Stanley Fold Belt; ferruginous.

General Comments: Reserved as Karukaki (Edgoose and Close 1992) - spelling now corrected. Previously described as the basal unit of the Mount Harris Basalt (Forman 1966). Type Section:  24o49' 58.95S, 129o36' 45.31E (WGS84). Overlies Musgrave basement granite.
Lithology Description: Quartzite and quartz-muscovite schist, often rich in hematite and magnetite, minor quartz pebble conglomerate.(White crystalline quartz sandstone; rounded quartz pebble conglomerate beds; local heavy mineral layers of hematite and magnetite).
Conglomerate

General Comments: Musgrave Block. Bentley Basin. 1071 +/- 5 Ma SHRIMP magmatic crystallization age (RefID 69153, 2012).
Lithology Description: Volcaniclastic rhyolite; typically rheomorphic ignimbrite; locally crystal-rich, lapilli-ash tuff; locally abundant relict glass shards.

General Comments: Sir Samuel 1:100k sheet area 3042.
Lithology Description: Undivided gabbro; anorthositic gabbro and anorthosite; quartz gabbro and tonalite and pyroxene-rich gabbro - all metamorphosed.
Laterite

General Comments: North Shaw 1: 100 000 sheet area, east Pilbara.  Age: c.3240Ma. East Pilbara Terrane.
Lithology Description: Granodiorite and minor pegmatitic granite, massive to foliated; metamorphosed

General Comments: Map sheets: 3552 Blanche, 3652 Tabletop.; SF51-11 Tabletop. No geographical location names are recognised in this location. Name is Martu word meaning "towards the north" reflecting this suite as the being located in the northernmost Rudall Province. Mineralogy is plagioclase, potassium feldspar, quartz, hornblende and biotite. To be published (including geochronology) in Payne et al. (in prep).
Lithology Description: Dominantly weakly foliated granite with some strongly deformed/gneissic outcrops.

General Comments: Rocklea 1:100k, Pilbara. Said to be of Turee Creek Basin in 2012.
Lithology Description: Pelite, metasandstone, metaconglomerate, metadolerite, and banded iron-formation.

General Comments: Named after Lake Keene.  Map sheet SG 51-7 (Wiluna area). Previously a Formation level unit. Reduced to Member of Kanpa Formation in 2007. Said to be ~750 Ma in 2007.
Lithology Description: Dark grey to greenish basalt, fine-grained, coarse-grained and massive in middle of each flow, locally amygdaloidal and brecciated; veins and amygdales filled with calcite, red chert or chlorite; erosional top; no interbedded sediments.

General Comments: See also Kulshill Formation. Age based on Kulshill Group age (RefID 64630, 2008). Coal recognised in this unit prior to 1894.
Lithology Description: Deltaic sandstone, pebbly sandstone, mudstone, conglomerate and minor coal.

General Comments: North Shaw 1: 100 000 sheet area, east Pilbara. Also appears as misspelt Keep it Dark Monzogranite in RefID 69015.
Lithology Description: Monzogranite; undeformed to foliated; medium-grained, equigranular to weakly porphyritic; weakly metamorphosed
Greenstones

General Comments: Still included the subgroup components in 2006: From base, Strelley Pool Chert followed by Euro Basalt, Wyman Formation and Charteris Basalt. Includes rocks with ages: c.3350Ma and 3325-3315Ma. 2008 revision excludes Strelley Pool Formation from this Group.
Lithology Description: Felsic tuffaceous sandstone, quartz sandstone, siltstone, shale, chert, banded iron formation, schist, tuff, conglomerate, rhyolite, basalt, serpentinised peridotite; local dolerite sills; intrusive porphyry and microgranite; metamorphosed
Amphibolite, mafic schist
Chert
Leucogabbro and dolerite
Ultramafic rock

General Comments: Previously Kellys Knob Sandstone Member. Overlies Ragged Range Conglomerate, unconformably overlies Whitewater Volcanics and Halls Creek Group.
Lithology Description: Red to orange, tabular, cross-bedded, medium-grained, pebbly quartz sandstone with conglomerate beds towards the base.

General Comments: Should be Kens Bore Granite
Lithology Description: Granite

General Comments: See also Lexicon. A Kungurian-Roadian age suggested by Mory and Backhouse (1997) is supported by SHRIMP dating of Binthalya Formation by Lever and Fanning (2004). Potential source for hydrocarbons.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, shale, siltstone, claystone.

General Comments: Radiocarbon dating of shells within the Formation places it in the Holocene, viz., 5500 ± 160 yrs BP and 5590 +/- 240 yrs BP.PUBLICATION: Semeniuk, V., 2008, Journal of the Royal Society of Western Australia Volume 91 Part 1 (Supplement): 53-148.
Lithology Description: A fine to medium to coarse sand-sized bioclastic, quartzose and sparsely oolitic calcarenite, with layers of shells...

General Comments: Replaces the Yandicoogina Suite. See also Yandicoogina Granodiorite.
Lithology Description: Weakly to moderately foliated, fine- to coarse-grained, grey to dark-grey,biotite-hornblende granodiorite, tonalite, and minor monzogranite; locally seriate to porphyritic; local common mafic, ultramafic, and metasedimentary xenoliths and mafic schlieren.

General Comments: Map Sheet = Leonora. Nearest Town = Leonora. Briefdescription =  Consists of aphyric to feldspar-phyric basalt. This is a formation level unit. Wheretobepublished = GSWA digital release (maps and explanatory notes).
See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Fine and medium quartz sandstone, lesser clayey siltstone, pebble conglomerate and black shale.

General Comments: Age ~235 Ma (from 2001 reference). Said to include Cossigny Member in Roebuck and offshore Canning Basins, 2015.
Lithology Description: Sandstone with minor shale and coal.

General Comments: Robinson Range 1:250 000 sheet area. See also recent use of Kerba Monzogranite.
Lithology Description: Equigranular medium-grained biotite monzogranite; mainly massive, locally foliated to mylonitic; locally contains abundant inclusions of Archean granitic gneiss.

General Comments: This may be a deliberate name change. GSWA reference material for geochemical analyses.

Unexposed mafic intrusive unit assigned to the Moodini Supersuite, intersected during drilling of Madura Province basement underlying the Eucla and Bight Basins. See also GSWA ENS: Spaggiari, CV (partial report), Kestrel Cavern Gabbro (P_-MDke-oe): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 13 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained ferro-monzogabbro grading to coarse plagioclase-rich

General Comments: Lissadell & Dixon Range 1:250 000 sheet areas (east Kimberley region). Part of Lamboo Complex. Age updated by I.Sweet.
Lithology Description: Medium-grained biotite monzogranite.

General Comments: Lissadell & Dixon Range 1:250 000 sheet areas (east Kimberley region). See also Kevins Dam suite.
Lithology Description: Mainly massive, medium-grained, even-textured and porphyritic biotite monzogranite and syenogranite; mafic enclaves

General Comments: Reserved as Keyling Member by Mory, J. (1986). Gas prone.
Lithology Description: Mainly sandstone; lesser siltstone, shale, coal, conglomerate; very minor limestone.
Sandstone

General Comments: To be used in Mount Belches 3335 1:100 000 sheet explanatory notes.
Lithology Description: Leucomonzogranite, typically deeply weathered; includes hornfelses Mount Belches Formation. High Ca granite.

General Comments: Age 2970 Ma.  Formerly of the Bookingarra Group. In the Mallina Basin. Within the De Grey Supergroup. Assigned to Croyden Group in 2006. Returned to Bookingarra Group in 2017 redefinition.
Lithology Description: Flow-banded porphyritic rhyolite and minor dacite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: In the Edmund Basin. Within the Bangemall Supergroup. Contains stromatolites.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, fine- to very coarse-grained sandstone, dolostone; minor conglomerate, chert, felsic volcanic rock. Separately mapped: medium- to very thick-bedded quartz sandstone and siltstone; siltstone, minor fine-grained sandstone, dolostone, chert.

General Comments: Gascoyne Province. Shown as -Pge on Yanrey-Ningaloo 1:250k map sheet.  Parent Boolaloo Supersuite discontinued by GSWA; now part of Moorarie Supersuite (S.Sheppard, pers. comm., 2008)
Lithology Description: Even grained tonalite-adamellite

General Comments: Variation of Mount Kilkenny Gabbro (Reserved)
Lithology Description: A gabbroic sill with pronounced igneous layering into a lower olivine-plagioclase zone and an upper augite-plagioclase cumulate zone.

General Comments: Norseman region.
Lithology Description: Felsic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks.

General Comments: SG50-12, Glengarry. Includes the 'Dolerite' of MacLeod (1970) and in part the 'Narracoota Volcanics' of Gee (1979, 1987, 1990).  Maximum age from detrital zircons.
Lithology Description: Fine grained basalt with intergranular or intersertal textures, varying to microporphyritic in places; cherty and more thinly layered with interflow sedimentary rocks in the upper parts.
Calc-alkaline to tholeiitic basalt and basaltic andesite. Includes volcanics and dolerite sills and dykes. Minor pyroxenite in places

General Comments: In the Tanami area. Includes the informally named Jasperlitic Chert member. Correlates with the Lander Rock beds in the Arunta region. Ages derived from tuff in underlying Callie Member (Dead Bullock Formation), and intrusive Water Tower Tonalite. Hosts gold.  Prospectivity increases where crustal-penetrating structures intersect claystone facies.
Lithology Description: Schistose to phyllitic greywacke, siltstone and shale; minor lithic sandstone, granule conglomerate, quartzite, banded chert, basalt and dolerite. Locally contact metamorphosed to biotite zone.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

Lithology Description: Well-sorted, stratified and graded, rhyolitic, volcaniclastic interbedded pebbly conglomerate, breccia, sandstone and mudstone.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File E/52-2. c/ 1800 Ma. Intruded by sills of Hart Dolerite and by Aries kimberlite. See also Kimberley Group, Upper and Kimberley Group, Lower. Kimberley Basin, North Australian Craton.
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone, minor fine- to medium-grained feldspathic sandstone; micaceous and glauconitic sandstone, shale pellet conglomerate; siltstone, quartz basalt, argillaceous quartz sandstone.

General Comments: Informal subdivision of Kimberley Group. Kimberley Basin, North Australian Craton. Includes King Leopold Sandstone, Carson Volcanics.
To be used on the CARLINDIE mapsheet; nearest town is Port Hedland.
Lithology Description: Biotite monzogranite; homogeneous, equigranular to seriate.

General Comments: King Leopold Orogen [?]. Of Paperbark Supersuite, so must be Lamboo Province.
Lithology Description: Granodiorite

General Comments: c.1800 Ma. Intruded by Hart Dolerite sills and dykes. See also variation Leopold Sandstone. Kimberley Basin, North Australian Craton.
Lithology Description: White to pale brown, medium- to coarse-grained quartz sandstone and pebbly quartz sandstone; minor siltstone and granule to pebble conglomerate.

Stratigraphic Name: King of the Hills Dolerite Member
General Comments: a prominent, east-northeasterly trending, dolerite dyke, assigned to the Widgiemooltha Dolerite, that is evident on aeromagnetic images over a strike length of about 80 km between Sturt Meadows homestead (Zone 51J, MGA 301680E 6826130N) on WILBAH and Charlie Bore (Zone 51J, MGA 377820E 6838600N) on MINERIE. It forms locally prominent outcrops and hills where it is strongly contaminated and contains numerous felsic xenoliths. Part of the Widgiemooltha Large Igneous Province; intrudes Archean greenstone and granitic units of the Yilgarn Craton. See lso GSWA ENS: Wyche, S and Sapkota, J 2018, King of the Hills Dolerite Member (P_-_wh-o): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 13 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite with abundant felsic xenoliths.

General Comments: Only appears the Hovea 4 strat column, ?offshore Perth Basin.

Lithology Description: Grey, calcareous, glauconitic siltstone and shale of shallow marine to estuarine origin.
Basalt

General Comments: Previously Port Keats Group.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, glauconitic in part, shale, sandstone, fossiliferous limestone, rare coal.

General Comments: Not related to Kintore Granite, Qld. Invalidates the reservation of Kintore Dam Formation, WA.
Lithology Description: Medium-grained biotite tonalite.
Gneiss
Mudstone, fine sandstone, calcareous, laminated to thin bedded, ripple marked; minor conglomerate lenses; fossiliferous.
Conglomerate

General Comments: For use on mapsheet WEBB; nearest town Kiwirrkurra. To be pub: as part of Interpreted Bedrock Geology map of WEBB 1:250K sheet/part of MACDONALD 1:250K sheet. GSWA in early 2008. Originally mapped as part of Pollock Hills Formation. North Australian Craton.  Conservative max depositional age, 1633+/-6 Ma, however depositional age could be considerably younger (Kirkland et al. 2009).
Lithology Description: Red-weathering, lithic sandstone, quartz sandstone and conglomerate.
Medium-grained and massive to locally moderately-foliated gabbro.

General Comments: Fragmentary fish fossil assemblage includes Bothriolepis and an asterolepid, probably Remogolepis, presumed to be of Famennian age (Young, 1987a).
Lithology Description: Fluvial fossiliferous medium to coarse grained cross-bedded quartz sandstone with abundant mudstone pellets in places; minor interbedded siltstone and pebble to boulder conglomerate.

General Comments: Possible source of Turtle-Barnett oil.
Lithology Description: Siltstone

General Comments: Offshore Perth Basin. See also Kockatea Shale.
See also Lexicon. Numerical age from 2004 APPEA reference table. No furhter information.
Lithology Description: shale and siltstone with some limestone and sandstone.
Sandstone
Red-brown, medium- to coarse-grained ferruginous sandstone; claystone at base.
Sandstone
Foliated porphyritic biotite-rich metamonzogranite and metagranodiorite with mafic xenoliths and gneissic bands.

General Comments: Defined by V. Semeniuk (1995). On Yalgorup Plain. Thickness: 10m at type section. Proposed as as new component to Kwinana Group by B.Gozzard (approved by R.Hocking but not published as yet) and spelling with two letter ''l's" confirmed 30/1/08.PP.
Lithology Description: Calcarenitic aeolianite, and beach and marine calcarenites; shoaling and seagrass facies.
Sandstone
Iron formation
Porphyry

General Comments: Rocklea 1:100k, Pilbara. Said to be of Turee Creek Basin in 2012.
Lithology Description: Fine- to coarse-grained metamorphosed quartzitic sandstone, minor pelite and metaconglomerate.

General Comments: Mentioned in the text.
Of Sexton (1994).  Of the O'Callaghans Supersuite.
Lithology Description: monzogranite to syenogranite

General Comments: Defn on Tech File G/50-1.
Lithology Description: Greywacke

General Comments: east Kimberley
Lithology Description: Foliated to massive, medium- to coarse-grained biotite monzogranite.

General Comments: Within the Fortescue Group (Mount Bruce Supergroup).
Lithology Description: Porphyritic and fine-grained dacite, rhyodacite, rhyolite lava.

General Comments: Upgraded to formation status on ANGELO and DOCKRELL sheets (Griffin and Tyler 1994). Prev. mapped as Biscay and Olympio Fms. Also referred to as Koongie Park  Member /Tickalara Metamorphics (Griffin and Tyler 1992). In the Central Zone of Lamboo Complex.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed felsic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks, metasedimentary rocks, metabasalt, and hornfels; locally migmatitic; minor chert, banded iron-formation, and carbonate; locally intimately veined by granitic rocks and gabbro.

General Comments: Age: 1804+/-7 Ma. Parent from Capricorn 1:100k sheet.
Lithology Description: Thin- to thick-bedded, massive to planar laminated felsic volcaniclastic rock, and accretionary lapilli tuff.
monzogranite

General Comments: Only known from subsurface. Hocking (1985) erected type section in Yaringa-1 at 326-855m. The basal 33m assigned in 1994 to underlying new unit, Faure Formation. Previously of Kalbarri Group, but this Group name has been abandoned.
Lithology Description: Upward coarsening red and brown micaceous sandstone, with minor dolomite and siltstone. Bioturbation at top of section and cross-bedding present.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Status as formation was not changed when Cardabia Group was revised down to Cardabia Calcarenite.
Lithology Description: Predominantly calcareous pelagic deposits: silty calcarenite and calcisiltite with abundant fragments of the bivalve Inoceramus.

General Comments: 'Group' erected for 1:1 million mapping purposes only
Lithology Description: Calcarenite and calcisiltite, fossiliferous chalk, glauconitic marl; shallow marine.

General Comments: Example of the Sally Downs Association. Emplaced at ~1310Ma(?). In the Paterson Orogen. Appears to intrude the Rudall Complex.
Lithology Description: Weakly deformed and metamorphosed felsic and mafic igneous rocks; minor quartzite, mafic and ultramafic schists, amphibolite, and banded iron-formation.

General Comments: Tabletop 1:250k Intrudes the Rudall Complex.
Lithology Description: Weakly deformed and metamorphosed felsic and mafic intrusive rocks.

General Comments: Blanche 1:100k sheet area, 3552 (Tabletop 1:250k). For a tonalite. Shown as -Pgf on Connaughton 1:100k geological sheet.  Within the Krackatinny Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Tonalite

General Comments: Prices Creek Group, Canning Basin. Paper in BMR Journal
Lithology Description: Dolomite.

General Comments: Bloods Range 1:250 000 map sheet area. Type Section: 24 38' 02.97S, 129 24' 18.4E (WGS84) Age: Similar age to Dean Quartzite Age: ~850Ma. Previously included in Dean Quartzite.
Lithology Description: Red/purple crystalline quartz sandstone, abundant trough cross-beds, local heavy mineral layers of hematite and magnetite.

General Comments: Formerly within the Earaheedy Group. In type locality at Mount Throssell - 300m thick.
Lithology Description: Stromatolitic, oolitic and pisolitic limestone, calcarenite and mudstone, separated by shale and sandstone bands mainly in the upper part.

General Comments: Reserved for use on PEEDAWARRA 1:100K Sheet.  Nearest town: Paraburdoo. Sills intrude Edmund and Collier Groups. Age: 1070Ma.  Published in the 2008 1:500K Interpreted Geology of WA (GIS Dataset) - to be indexed (OR, 23-9-08). Warakurna Large Igneous Province.
Lithology Description: Dolerite and gabbro sills.

General Comments: Crosscuts both mafic and felsic intrusive rocks of the 1085-1040 Ma Warakurna Supersuite, and is in turn cut by the c. 825 Ma Gairdner Dolerite. However, a better indication of this suite's age was obtained from a poorly constrained Sm-Nd mineral isochron obtained from one of the Kullal Dolerite dykes, which yielded an age of c. 1000 Ma (Glikson et al., 1996). See also GSWA ENS: Howard, HM 2018, Kullal Dolerite (P_-_kl-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 13 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dyke suite consisting of fine-grained; olivine and plagioclase porphyritic dolerite and meta-dolerite; typically porphyritic texture or granoblastic where metamorphosed.

General Comments: Hosts oil and gas.
Lithology Description: Friable feldspathic sandstone, siltstone, claystone, coal. Some diamictite and conglomerate. Fluvial and fan delta with glacial influence.
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

Lithology Description: Loosely cemented boulders, cobbles, gravel and sand in a brown silty-clay matrix; ferruginous at base.

General Comments: North Shaw 1:100 000 sheet area 2755.  In the Pilbara Craton. Within the Pilbara Supergroup. Tambourah 1:100 000 age: c.3290-3252 Ma. East Pilbara Terrane.
Lithology Description: Dominantly komatiitic, high-Mg and tholeiitic metabasalt, metamorphosed to greenschist facies;shale; cobble to pebble conglomerate; quartz-rich sandstone; wacke; chert.
Sandstone

General Comments: Intruded by dolerite sills.
Lithology Description: Quartz arenite and metaquartzite with chlorite and mica

General Comments: Max Age: 2449 (+/-) 3 Ma. ?Based on age of underlying Woongarra Rhyolite?
Lithology Description: Pelite and subordinate thin- to thick-bedded metasandstone.

General Comments: Prices Creek Group, Canning Basin. Paper in BMR Journal.
Lithology Description: Sandstone.

General Comments: Correlates with Duerdin Group.  On MOUNT RAMSAY sheet.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, sandstone, shale, feldspathic wacke, dolomite, and tillite.
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Bentley Basin. These rocks previously included in the Tollu Group. Named for Kunmarnara Bore. Constituents also includes an unnamed mixed amygdaloidal basalt and microgabbro unit and an unnamed unit of strongly foliated quartz-pebble conglomerate, feldspathic sandstone, muscovite quartzite, and phyllite.
Lithology Description: Siliciclastic and mafic volcanic rocks.Basal conglomerates and sandstones, basalt.
Limestone

General Comments: See also misspelt Kurriyippi Formation.
Lithology Description: A thick succession of 30-90m-thick upward-fining cycles of sandstone and lesser amounts of siltstone, shale and minor coal, overlain by glacial sandstone and conglomerate.

General Comments: May be replaced by Kurrajong Monzogranite of Roberts et al (2004)?
Lithology Description: Komatiite

General Comments: May replace Kurrajong Complex of Painter (2003) or accidental formalisation of a monzogranite in the Kurrajong Complex?

Lithology Description: Conglomerate

General Comments: See also Kurrawang Conglomerate, misspelt Karrawang Formation. In the Kalgoorlie Terrane in Eastern Goldfields Superterrane of the Yilgarn Craton. Superseded by Kambalda Komatiite?[?this seems unlikely given very different lithologies - CEB Nov2012]
Lithology Description: Coarse, poorly sorted polymictic conglomerate; a variety of clasts including BIF and granite. Grades up into fine-grained sandstone and siltstone.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

Lithology Description: Massive, poorly-sorted, matrix supported, quartz-feldspar rhyolitic, lapilli-tuff facies.

General Comments: See also Kuruna Siltstone. Of Thorne and Tyler, 1996. Sandstone is stromatolitic.
Lithology Description: Basaltic to andesitic vitric, lapilli, crystal and lithic tuff, tuffaceous sandstone and siltstone, mudstone, chert, dolomite.

General Comments: Blanche 1:100k sheet area, 3552 (Tabletop 1:250k). For a granite.
Lithology Description: Tonalite

General Comments: Additional components to be designated by B.Gozzard (approved by R.Hocking) 24 January 2008; these include Tims Thicket Limestone, Koalup Limestone, Leschenault Formation, and Perth Formation. See separate units for details. PP Jan08.
Hosts the Hamersley Gorge (average grade 31.4% Mn) and Coppermine Creek (44% Mn) manganese deposits.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, shale, sandstone, phyllite, schist with kyanite, garnet, staurolite.  Cross-bedding common.

General Comments: Part of Lower Fortescue Group. Name replaces Kylena Basalt, Kylena Basalt Member and Kylena Volcanics.  Age: 2749-2735 Ma (Blake, 2001); ~2741Ma. Locally intruded by the Cooya Pooya Dolerite. Includes the lower part of the now abandoned Little de Grey Lava. Age range from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706. Oakover Basin.
Lithology Description: Basalt, andesite, dacite, high-Mg basalt, rhyolite; basaltic agglomerate; dolerite; grey carbonate rock with microbial laminations and stromatolites; sandstone; pillow breccia; tuff, limestone, conglomerate.

General Comments: Type area: Outcrops around Kynea Rockholes, lat 28deg41', long 116deg40'. Metamorphosed 'basement' unit, no known older units in region.
Lithology Description: Migmatitic gneiss (tonalitic to granodioritic) with monzogranitic leucosomes.

General Comments: Published defn Barnett (1975). Redefined by Gee (1979) - see card. Variously interpreted to be of Padbury Group, then Glengarry Group, Bryah Group; reassigned to Padbury Gp (Occhipinti et al 1997). Lack of detailed stratigraphic information has led to indecision re. status.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, greywacke and shale; conglomerate lenses in upward-fining cycles; turbiditic; metamorphosed in places to quartz(-mica) schist.
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

Lithology Description: Banded iron formation

General Comments: 2543-2499 Ma. Previously part of the Brockman Supersequence

Lithology Description: Leucocratic biotite- and muscovite-bearing, quartzofeldspathic orthogneiss, strong gneissic fabric; the protolith was probably granodiorite to tonalite in composition.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain.  Ages:2821+/-5Ma, 2810+/-5Ma and 2815+/-7Ma (zircon from gabbro) - but these zircon ages are older than interpreted host rock age and are therefore, probably inherited zircons. When reserved age stated to be c.2780Ma.
Lithology Description: Layered gabbros, ultramafic cumulate rocks and anorthosite with magnetitite and pyroxenitic layers; metamorphosed

General Comments: In the Pilbara region.
PUBLICATION: Semeniuk, V., 2008, Journal of the Royal Society of Western Australia Volume 91 Part 1 (Supplement): 53-148. Originally reserved as 'Lagrange'.
Lithology Description: White/cream/grey bioturbated (locally laminated) and root-structured calcilutite with mangorove wood and mangrove-habitat molluscs; underlies salt flats, samphire flats, and mangrove flats.
Highly variable biotite- and hornblende-bearing tonalite to granodiorite.

General Comments: Map Sheet = Kalgoorlie. Polymictic conglomerate, sandy conglomerate to pebbly sandstone; clast-supported; clasts of granite, mafic volcanic, sedimentary and banded iron formation; metamorphosed. Lower section of the Kurrawang Formation, approximately 460 to 750 m thick. To be published: Geological Survey of Western Australia digital release of the 2013-14 East Yilgarn package.
Lithology Description: Polymictic conglomerate, sandy conglomerate to pebbly sandstone; clast-supported; clasts of granite, mafic volcanic, sedimentary and banded iron formation; metamorphosed.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

Lithology Description: Subequigranular, medium- to coarse-grained biotite monzogranite. Low Ca granite.

General Comments: Defined as Lake George beds in 1981. The WA Lake George nomenclature takes precedence over the informal Lake George Formation (NSW).
Lithology Description: Massive, fine to very coarse poorly sorted fluviatile and partly pedogenic sandstone and conglomerate

General Comments: Age: <3Ma.  Geological Province: Fitzroy Graben.
Lithology Description: Lacustrine red brown and green sand, silt and clay with minor gravel, calcrete and gypsum

General Comments: Quartzite and quartz-mica schist occuring on the WEBB 1:250 000 geological sheet to the north west of Lake Mackay in the Aileron Province of the west Arunta Orogen. SHRIMP U-Pb detrital zircon ages indicate a maximum depositional age of 1750 Ma. Published in GSWA Record 2013/9. p6-8 [to be indexed ASAP]. Aileron Province, Arunta Orogen, North Australian Craton.
Lithology Description: Interbedded quartzite and quartz-mica schist.

General Comments: Southern Cross Domain, Youanmi Terrane, Yilgarn Craton.
Lithology Description: Pyroxenite, metamorphosed; amphibolite after gabbro and dolerite, minor metamorphosed leucogabbro and pyroxenite.

General Comments: Age inferred only through its equivalence to the Birrindudu Group. Defined as Lake Willson Beds in 1977. Described in GSWA Memoir 3 (1990) , NW Birrindudu Basin,  p351, 352, 355. May be lateral equivalent of Birrindudu Group. Mesoproterozoic. See also misspelling 'Lake Wilson beds'.
Lithology Description: Shallow marine stromatolitic chert, medium grained cross bedded sublithic sandstone siltstone and shale

General Comments: Introduced by Zibra in 2012 AJES 59(5) article. See also Lakeside Granite, Lakeside granite.
Lithology Description: Porphyritic monzogranite, schlieren monzogranite, leucogranite, mylonitic monzogranite and leucogranite.

General Comments: Unclear if this is an intentional formalisation of unit 79815 (Lakeside granite)[probably], or a deliberate name change from Zibra's 2012 useage of Lakeside Complex [which was used again in 2014].
Lithology Description: Tonalite to monzogranite.

General Comments: See also Lakeside Member. On the Yalgorup Plain.
Lithology Description: Aeolianites; cross-laminated to structureless, fine and medium calcarenite. Type location is same as for the formation.

General Comments: Same as Lakeside Complex.

East Yilgarn region. Mainly northwest-trending dykes intruding greenstones of the Eastern Goldfields Superterrane (Yilgarn Craton). Dolerite observed in drillcore. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD and Wyche, S (partial report), Lakewood Dolerite (P_-_lk-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 07 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite.

General Comments: Once part of De Grey Group (NORTH SHAW 1:100k sheet. Then temporarily part of Goldsworthy Group (Van Kranendonk et al 2004) - being the eroded and deformed remnants of the De Grey Supergroup (upgraded unit name). Now redefined into Croydon Group (GSWA'06)
Lithology Description: Coarse grained to pebbly sandstone and pebble conglomerate; minor siltstone and grey shale; metamorphosed

General Comments: In Lalla Rookh Basin.
Defined as Adelaidean. Shown as Cambrian on 96/28219.
Lithology Description: Fine to coarse quartz wacke, sandstone, cobble conglomerate, feldspathic sandstone and quartz sandstone.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Defined. Correlates with Stonewall Sandstone, WA. Fitzmaurice Basin.
Lithology Description: Silica-cemented quartz sandstone, commonly thickly bedded with locally abundant cross-beds and ripple marks; conglomerate, and minor siltstone. Becomes more argillaceous to the NW.
Medium to coarse and even-grained biotite muscovite adamellite and granite with microcline phenocrysts to 11cm, minor porphyritic granite, and quartz microcline muscovite tourmaline pegmatite

General Comments: In refID 72034. (GSWA (2016). 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology of Western Australia. Halls Creek Orogen, Lamboo Province. Variation also Subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Medium-grained leucocratic granite.

General Comments: Informal name referring to ultramafic rocks of the Lamboo Complex. Intrudes Koongie Park Formation; intruded by Loadstone Monzogranite.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed ultramafic and mafic intrusives: metamorphosed peridotite, pyroxenite, gabbro, anorthosite, and amphibolite with interlayered medium grade metasediments

General Comments: Hosts Telfer gold mineralisation.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, shale, limestone and dolomite.
Fine to very coarse, mostly silicified and moderately to well sorted, quartz sandstone, with fossil wood; shallow marine.

General Comments: In Canning Basin area, but younger than Canning Basin? Shown as Late Cretaceous in a 2009 figure? No information on where Eocene age data came from.
Lithology Description: Fluvial and probably colluvial poorly sorted sandstone and pebble conglomerate, minor siltstone and claystone.

General Comments: See Lancelin Beds for definition.
Lithology Description: Glauconitic chalk, marl, and calcareous mudstone.

General Comments: Top of Browne Formation.
Lithology Description: Generally medium-grained, very well-sorted, well-rounded and porous, cross-bedded quartz sandstone in foresets up to 11 m thick; minor silty beds to 0.6 m thick.

General Comments: Supersedes Lander Rock beds.  Aileron Province, Arunta Orogen, North Australian Craton. Two unnamed sub-units are mapped separately: metamorphosed BIF interbedded with psammitic and pelitic schist; and felsic volcanic metasandstone and metaconglomerate interbedded with amygdaloidal metabasalt. Most outcrops are weathered to saprock: original textures and fabrics are preserved, but mineralogy has been predominantly replaced. Hosts the Anningie field pegmatite Sn deposit and the Mount Doreen field pegmatite W deposit; also hosts the Nolans Bore phosphate-REE-U deposit.
Lithology Description: Interlayered pelitic schist and psammite, metagreywacke; gneiss; may include meta-banded iron-formation, metavolcanic rocks, amphibolite sills; greenschist to granulite facies metamorphism.

General Comments: Gascoyne Province. Included in -Pgbr on Glenburgh 1:250k map sheet.
In the Louisa Basin.  Age: c.610Ma. See also Landrigan tillite, Landrigan Formation.
Lithology Description: Massive tillite with thick lenses of sandstone and siltstone, and capped with purple or cream flaggy laminated dolomite; erratics of sandstone, subarkose, stromatolitic dolomite, granite and dolerite in a purple clayey or sandy matrix
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: For SATIRIST mapsheet; near Roebourne.  Age: >2.9Ga.  Intrusive equivalent of Bookingarra Group. Pilbara Craton.
Lithology Description: Widespread mafic-ultramafic sills and rocks with boninite-like compositions (Smithies 2002).

General Comments: See also Langfield group. Formerly "Eight Mile Creek Group" then "Keep River Group".  See also the misspelt Langford Group.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, limestone, shale and siltstone.

General Comments: Age: c.1835Ma. Detrital zircon maximum deposition age of 1860 Ma.
Lithology Description: Pink to red-brown, grey and green medium grained feldspathic sandstone with small scale cross beds, grading to arkose; lesser coarse poorly sorted sandstone and recessive green-red-brown micaceous siltstone, shale and phyllite.

General Comments: Average thickness of the group is 1030m; maximum of 2100m (RefID: 65233).
Lithology Description: Marine sediments. White  to red sandstone, locally bioturbated; minor siltstone and conglomeratic sandstone.
Granodiorite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: See UNIT DEFINTION.  Based on original description in BMR Report 174. Published on WATTS 1:100K map sheet.
Lithology Description: Medium grained and thin to medium bedded fluvial quartz sandstone with minor siltstone and conglomerate.

General Comments: To be used in the Rudall 1:250 000 sheet area.
