Lithology Description: Intercalated banded quartz-feldspar-mica gneiss, quartz-mica schist, quartzite, and psammitic gneiss.

General Comments: See also Latitude Hill Pyroxenite.
Reserved as Latitude Hill. See also Latitude Hill Gabbro.

Probably replaces both Latitude Hill Gabbro and Latitude Hills Pyroxentite. Part of G1 group. Along with Michael Hills intrusion, characterised by very strong aeromagnetic anomalies. Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).
Described in GSWA Record 1992/7, 93/27545.
Of Fairfield Group. See also Lexicon. Potential source rock for Sundown oil field,
Lithology Description: Shallow marine fossiliferous interbedded limestone, shale, siltstone and sandstone.
Mostly high-Ti tholeiitic basalt, komatiite, komatiitic basalt and banded iron formation; minor quartz-bearing clastic sedimentary rocks including turbidites; intruded by felsic porphyries.

General Comments: Used by GSWA. See also Lawford beds (used by AGSO in 1995 Paleogeographic Atlas; age = Miocene).
Lithology Description: Lacustrine and fluvial calcrete, marl, sandy calcrete, calcareous sandstone, chalcedony, calcareous breccia and calcareous conglomerate; fossil wood and stromatolites in places and partly lateritised
Coarse-grained and comprises zoned plagioclase phenocrysts in a groundmass of feldspar, quartz, biotite, and amphibole; xenoliths locally abundant, and leucogranite veins cut the tonalite in places.

Red-brown to grey phyllite with minor sandstone interbeds near the base, overlain by massive, thickly bedded, rippled and cross-bedded medium to coarse grained quartzite and quartz sandstone with minor phyllite

General Comments: Used on map sheet SG50-02; nearest town is Gascoyne Junction. Published on several 1:100 000 map sheets from the Gascoyne region, including Pink Hills, Candolle and Yinnetharra (version 2) as well as two GSWA Records. Leake Spring Metamorphics will replace the Morrissey Metamorphics, because all the type areas of the latter unit are now known to belong to other stratigraphic units.
Lithology Description: Interlayered psammitic and pelitic schist, pelitic schist, subordinate amounts of psammitic schist and amphibolite, and minor calc-silicate rock, chert, ultramafic schist and metamorphosed BIF; pelitic+ psammitic gneiss is minor component.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. 42615 indicates the name "has become functionally useless". Obsolete? Probably not: that was 1992; 60384 from 2004 has it still going strong[GO'C 2012]. Type section in Rough Range 1, 1216-1890 m. See GSWA Memoir 3 (1990), p469, 481-484. Shown as Sinemuian - Aalenian in 2013 GA Northern Carnarvon Basin biozonation and Biostratigraphy hart 36.
Lithology Description: Non-marine to marine sands. Pale grey, fine micaceous sandstone; common clayey siltstone; minor coal and claystone.

General Comments: Includes old Moochamulla Sandstone and Quindalup Beds. As discussed under Leederville Supersequence, Leederville Formation is composed of two separate chronostratigraphic units. These units represent northern and southern deltaic systems prograding into a central depocentre at different pace and therefore filling in the basin at different times. The sandstone previously identified as Leederville Formation in the northern portion of Vlaming Sub-basin that lies within the A. alata Dinocyst Zone has been reclassified as part of  the South Perth Supersequence.
Lithology Description: Interbedded, poorly consolidated, fine- to coarse-grained sandstone and black, carbonaceous shale, distinctive glauconitic shale and lignite seams.

General Comments: Of the Warnbro Megasequence.
Lithology Description: Predominantly fine to very coarse sandstones with glauconite, mica and minor feldspar. Interbedded with pyritic, glauconitic, argillaceous and micaceous mudstones. Highly fossiliferous in places and may contain coal fragments.  Sst increases up section.

General Comments: Intruded at 780Ma, 680Ma, 540Ma. Deformation and metamorphism 620Ma, 550-500 Ma.
Lithology Description: Dominated by felsic orthogneiss, ranging from granodiorite to alkali granite in composition, interleaved with anorthosite, leucogabbro and subordinate mafic lenses.

General Comments: Age stated to be Cryogenian and  825-800Ma in 2005.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, sandstone; quartz arenite and feldspathic arenite; minor conglomerate and shale beds.

General Comments: Sometimes informally subdivided into Upper and Lower parts.
Lithology Description: Fluvial and marine deltaic sandstones; minor shale.

General Comments: Fitzmaurice Basin. Correlates with Pincombe Formation, WA.
Lithology Description: Silica cemented quartz sandstone, siltstone, shale.

General Comments: North Shaw 1:100 000 sheet area 2755.  In the Pilbara Craton, within the Pilbara Supergroup. Incorporates the former Six Mile Creek Formation. See also misspelling Leilera Formation. East Pilbara Terrane.
Lithology Description: Wacke, local volcaniclastic sandstone, shale, and quartzite, metamorphosed; dacite, includes local minor felsic schist, metamorphosed; rhyolite and felsic volcaniclastic rocks, metamorphosed.

General Comments: Name obsolete?
Age: c.1864Ma. Several similar dates in references.
Lithology Description: Foliated coarse porphyritic biotite metamonzogranite, minor metasyenogranite and metagranodiorite, non-porphyritic in places.

General Comments: See also (misspelling) Lennis Formation.  Age is constrained by underlying Late Cambrian Table Hill Volcanics and overlying Early Permian Paterson Formation.
Lithology Description: Fine- to medium-grained feldspathic micaceous sandstone, minor siltstone.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Reserved as Leo by McCracken, S (1994).
Lithology Description: Limestones and minor mudstones, commonly heavily dolomitised.
Foliated porphyritic biotite granodiorite with green plagioclase and small mafic xenoliths

General Comments: Card. Originally reserved 25-DEC-74?  Age: 8280-5490 BP. Now proposed as new component to Kwinana Group by B.Gozzard (approved by R.Hocking but unpublished as yet) 24/1/08.PP.
Lithology Description: Grey to dark grey sand (quartz skeletal and quartz) muddy sand and mud; all may contain shells in layers.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File SH/50-9. See also misspelt Lesuer Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Light grey, fine- to very coarse-grained, cross-bedded quartz sandstone; minor siltstone.

General Comments: Offshore Perth Basin. See also Lesueur Sandstone.
See also Lexicon.

Intrusive mafic sills; Dolerite to gabbro, minor pyroxenite; commonly differentiated; cumulate to granophyric textures; C.2695 to c.2690.; LREE enrichment chondrite normalised). To be published = Geological Surevey of Western Australia East Yilgarn Update 2013-14, digital product.
Lithology Description: Intrusive mafic sills; Dolerite to gabbro, minor pyroxenite; commonly differentiated; cumulate to granophyric textures

General Comments: Tanami Province. Defn on Tech File F/52-2. Within the Lamboo Complex. Chemical parent (Frederick Suite) is I-type. Lewis Granite appears to have been moved into Grimwade Suite in 2013 NTGS Publicaiton 5 p11:12.
Lithology Description: Muscovite and biotite monzogranite, porphyritic in places, with minor pegmatite, aplite and granodiorite.

General Comments: Part of extensive sand blanket including Mount Kinahan Sandstone, Vaughan Springs Quartzite, Heavitree Quartzite and Townsend Quartzite. Previously considered part of Redcliff Pound Group, but see 2017 redefinition. For recent update see: Haines, P.W., Allen, H.J. 2016. The Murraba Basin: another piece of the Centralian Superbasin jigsaw puzzle falls into place IN GSWA 2016 extended abstracts: promoting the prospectivity of Western Australia: Geological Survey of Western Australia, Record 2016/2, p. 31-35.
Lithology Description: Cross bedded and rippled medium to fine grained quartz sandstone with shale pellet layers in places; minor shale, siltstone, limestone and chert with conglomerate and sublithic sandstone near the base.

General Comments: Age of unit 2593+/-10 Ma. Small tear-shaped post-tectonic Archaean pluton. Hosts the Lady Bountiful gold deposit.
Lithology Description: Fine- to coarse-grained; locally monzogranitic; massive. Quartz veins are common. Weathering has produced a thick zone of saprolite comprising white, poorly indurated, matric-supported medium quartz sandy clay.

General Comments: In the Crowhurst Basin. Age: c.?1500Ma. Crowhurst Group (Mesoproterozoic)
Lithology Description: Green shale with minor interbeds of green micaceous siltstone and very fine micaceous silty sandstone

General Comments: See Ligertwood Beds for bibliographic references containing DEFINITION.
Lithology Description: Breccia, conglomerate, conglomeratic sandstone and sandstone; limestone and dolomite clasts and a secondary travertine matrix are common near the base

General Comments: Protolith: 2738 +/- 3 Ma (Wingate et al. 2011).
Lithology Description: Metagranodiorite.
Fossiliferous, shallow marine micaceous and ferruginous mudstone, siltstone, shale, and thinly bedded fine to coarse quartzose sandstone and ferruginous shale, with concretions near the base.

General Comments: Bentley Basin.
Lithology Description: Shale; minor sandstone, tuff, basalt, chert, conglomerate, microbalite and dolostone.

Deltaic to alluvial fan conglomerate with pebbles, cobbles and boulders to 1.2m of quartzite derived from the King Leopold Sandstone, in a ferruginous sandstone matrix; overlain by rarely exposed sandstone.

General Comments: Age originally given as Adelaidean or Carpentarian. Includes the former "Kirkimbie Beds".  Age: 1640-1635Ma (SHRIMP U-Pb, tuffaceous rock, Smith et al 2001), probably from Kunja Siltstone in middle of Group, so age range for whole group may be greater than shown, but overlying Wattie Group has max age Statherian. Birindudu Basin.
Lithology Description: Dolostone, siltstone, dolomitic siltstone, dolarenite, quartz arenite, sublitharenite, mudstone, diamictite, tuff.

General Comments: Previously mapped as Canopy Rock Sst (in URAPUNGA), Mallison Sst and lower Wigram Fm (Malay Road Gp), and part of Baralminar beds.  All these now superseded by Limmen Sst (Roper Gp). Formerly also included rocks now mapped as Mantungula Fm. McArthur Basin.  Occurs in the Beetaloo Sub-basin.
Lithology Description: Fine to very coarse sandstone; pebble to boulder conglomerate containing clasts of chert (chertified carbonate), quartzite and siltstone. Minor micaceous siltstone.

General Comments: Map Sheet = SH 51-8, Plumridge. Greenschist grade, quartzite and metasandstone with well-preserved sedimentary structures. Minor metaconglomerate. Maximum depositional age is 1752 +/- 19 Ma. Minimum age unconstrained, but inferred to be c. 1600 Ma. To be published: GSWA Report; 2013.
Lithology Description: Greenschist grade, quartzite and metasandstone with well-preserved sedimentary structures. Minor metaconglomerate.

General Comments: Basalt; massive to pillowed; tholeiitic composition; minor komatiitic basalt and carbonaceous shale units; metamorphosed. Kalgoorlie Terrane, Eastern Goldfields Superterrane. To be published = Geological Survey of Western Australia East Yilgarn update 2013-14, digital product..
Lithology Description: Basalt; massive to pillowed; tholeiitic composition; minor komatiitic basalt and carbonaceous shale units; metamorphosed.
Grey-green and purple-grey siltstone and shale, buff feldspathic sandstone and minor boulder conglomerate

General Comments: Within the Goose Hole Group.
Lithology Description: Stromatolitic and fossiliferous limestone and calcareous shale, local chert.

General Comments: Age updated by I.Sweet.
Lithology Description: Fine- to coarse-grained quartz sandstone; micaceous siltstone and mudstone.

General Comments: Porphyritic tholeiitic basalt with rare pillows; feldspar phenocrysts; metamorphosed. Coolgardie Subgroup, Kalgoorlie Terrane, eastern Goldfields Superterrane. To be published = Geological Survey of Western Australia East Yilgarn Update 2013-14, digital product.
Lithology Description: Porphyritic tholeiitic basalt with rare pillows; feldspar phenocrysts; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Yilgarn Craton, sills intrude Norie Group, and Muroulli Basalt of the Polelle Group. 500m thick sills of gabbroic rock, may represent subvolcanic component of Muroulli Basalt. 2792+/-5Ma U-Pb crystallisation date from zircons.
Lithology Description: Sills of gabbroic rock.

General Comments: Probably intended to supersede Little Gold River Microgranodiorite.
Lithology Description: Microgranodiorite, micro-quartz diorite, and orthopyroxene-phyric andesite.

General Comments: Map Sheet = Leonora. Nearest Town = Leonora. Briefdescription = consists of felsic volcanic and volcaniclastic rock. It is named after Little Peters Well located NNW of Leonora. Wheretobepublished = GSWA digital release (maps and explanatory notes).

Not related to Little River units in Victoria and Qld. For sheet 3055; nearest town Nullagine. Pub: NULLAGINE 1:250K Geol. Series map 3rd.ed.June'07;and in Yilgalong Explan.Notes, June'07 Intrusion of Cleland Supersuite in Yilgalong Granitic Complex. Age: <3290Ma
Lithology Description: Quartz-biotite trondhjemite and tonalite; leucocratic, massive, fine- to medium-grained, weakly metamorphosed.

General Comments: Defined Bulletin B210, 1981. See also Lexicon. Replaced by Liveringa Formation for a while but Group now used again. Includes volcanics dated at 253 +/-5 Ma. Canning Basin.
Lithology Description: Interbedded sandstones, siltstone and shale; minor coal, conglomerate and limestone. Basalt intersected in Corbett 1 well.
Oolitic and microbial dolostone, quartzitic and silty dolostone, sandstone, dolomitic siltstone.

General Comments: MOUNT RAMSAY and GORDON DOWNS 1:250 000 sheet area. Kimberley Province.  Intrudes the Koongie Park Formation.  Bow River batholith. Age: 1835-1805Ma. In the Lamboo Complex.
Lithology Description: Weakly porphyritic biotite monzogranite and syenogranite and minor microgranodiorite.

General Comments: Ages, lithology updated from GA Timescales Project Feb 2009.
Lithology Description: Predominantly marine claystone and siltstone with minor paralic sandstone and shelfal limestone.
Microcline-phyric biotite granite

General Comments: PUBLICATION: Semeniuk, V., 2008, Journal of the Royal Society of Western Australia Volume 91 Part 1 (Supplement): 53-148.
Lithology Description: Pebble to boulder sized; these fragments of beach rock are embedded in laminated sand, bubble sand, and cross-laminated shelly sand and sand, or form a sand-free deposit resting on beachrock pavement; ribbon deposit formed along upper tidal beach face.
Monzogranite, massive leucogranite; High Ca granite.

General Comments: In the western zone of the Hooper Complex and Lamboo Complex (Bow River batholith).  Age: 1865-1850Ma.
Lithology Description: Commonly foliated, grey coarse porphyritic biotite granite, with zones of pink-grey biotite gneiss and augen gneiss

General Comments: Formerly included in old definition of Eucla Basin. See also variations: including Loongana Conglomerate, Loongana Sandstone, and misspelt Loongara Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Cross-bedded feldspathic sandstone, locally conglomeratic, carbonaceous sandstone; glauconitic sandstone, siltstone, claystone and shale; commonly pyritic.

General Comments: Age: c.2790Ma. Replaces the original reserved (also published) Lordy Basalt (K.P.Watkins, A.H.Hickman, R.Davy, 1985). Geological province: Murchison Domain.
Lithology Description: Komatiitic basalt; massive to weakly foliated, locally pillowed or vesicular; metamorphosed

General Comments: Defined Hickman 1990. Formerly of the Bookingarra Group - now a member of the redefined Bookingarra Formation (Croydon Group, De Grey Supergroup)[2006]. Reinstated and redefined as part of Bookingarra Group in 2016.
Lithology Description: Subaqueous basalt sheet lava up to 2m thick; pillow lava, hyaloclastite with intercalated massive quartz and laminated shale.

General Comments: Correlated with Mount House Group, and with Duerdin Group and Antrim Plateau Volcanics (Coates and Preiss 1980). Plumb disputes these correlations, preferring to correlate with Albert Edward Group only.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, shale, sandstone, tillite, minor limestone, dolomite and conglomerate.

General Comments: King Leopold Orogen. In the Hooper Complex and Lamboo Complex western zone.  Age: c. 1865-1850Ma. To be updated to Louisa Granite  (advice from GSWA Dec 2013).
Lithology Description: Coarsely porphyritic syenogranite and monzogranite

General Comments: In the Louisa Basin.
Lithology Description: Grey green or purple siltstone and shale interbedded with fine and medium grained quartz wacke.
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Replaces Lucas Beds and Lucas beds.
Lithology Description: Purplish to grey, medium- to fine-grained friable calcareous sandstone; medium- to coarse-grained non-calcareous sandstone (lithic to sublithic arenite); thin-bedded to laminated siltstone and mudstone; local thin limestone beds and sandy dolomite.

General Comments: Basal marine shales are oil prone.
Lithology Description: Interbedded siltstone, shale, limestone, fine sandstone.

General Comments: Age: c.1835Ma.
Lithology Description: Recessive rippled red-brown to grey-green micaceous siltstone and phyllite interbedded with fine feldspathic sandstone.

General Comments: Yowalga 1:250 000 sheet area. Age late Neoproterozoic (although ages of 540 Ma and under make it Cambrian).
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, mudstone, evaporites, conglomerate.

General Comments: Unit thickness is greater than 1750m.
Lithology Description: Basalt; massive, pillowed and breccia lithofacies, and can be subdivided into lower Mg-rich and upper Mg-poor components, which are separated by a thin mudstone.
Massive pebble to boulder conglomerate (tillite) and medium- to thick-bedded sandstone; minor siltstone; diamictite.

General Comments: Used for Proterozoic granites project. Gascoyne Province. Shown as -Pgbm, -Pgbr, & part of -Pgbt, -Pgmt, -Pgbl on the Winning Pool-Minilya 1:250k map sheet.
Also replaced Lyons Conglomerate. See also Lexicon. Replaced by Lyons Formation, but name restored in 1987.
Lithology Description: Immature sandstone, wacke, siltstone, shale and tillite; diamictite; numerous glacial erratics.
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

Lithology Description: Felsic tuff and agglomerate, and felsic to intermediate volcaniclastic sandstone and conglomerate.

General Comments: Briefly described as part of 2010 Acreage Release in: Nicoll R.S, G. Bernadel, T. Hashimoto, A.T. Jones, A.P. Kelman, J.M. Kennard, S. le Poidevin, D.J. Mantle, N. Rollet and P.R. Temple (2010) Northern Carnarvon Basin, Biozonation and Biostratigraphy, 2010, Chart 36. On CD: Basin Biozonation and Stratigraphy Charts, 2010. Geoscience Australia.
Invalid, should be given a proper name. Used 2005.
Kimberley Province. See also Mabel Downs suite.
Lithology Description: Variably foliated, medium-grained, even-textured to porphyritic biotite-hornblende tonalite and quartz-diorite; some edenitic hornblende crystals have orthopyroxene cores; abundant mafic enclaves.

General Comments: East Kimberley. Sally Downs Supersuite. 1832 +/- 3 Ma. West of Halls Creek Fault. Locally strongly deformed, but little evidence of hydrothermal activity; contrasts with coeval McHale Granodiorite.
Lithology Description: Medium- to fine-grained, foliated, hornblende biotite tonalite with abundant flattened mafic inclusions.

General Comments: Probably intended to be superseded by MacDougall Bluff Formation, but this name continues to be used in WA. Note: correct place name spelling (and capitalization) is Macdougall [Bluff], but intention for geological unit is not easy to tell from maps. Said by GSWA to be of Bentley Basin. Contains detrital zircons aged 1172 +/- 8 Ma, giving the maximum age for this unit and the Kunmarnara Group. Previously of Tollu Group.
Lithology Description: Metaconglomerate, metasandstone, quartzite, phyllite, psammitic gneiss, amphibolite, metamorphosed arkose, interlayered quartzite and schist, muscovite granofels.

General Comments: Ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Shale with thin BIF interbeds; chert.

General Comments: Plagioclase biotite tonalite; biotite schlieren; massive to foliated; metamorphosed. SHRIMP U-Pb zircon preliminary age of 2699 ± 6 Ma (GSWA 182299). Intrudes Lindsays Basalt, Coolgardie Subgroup. Kalgoorlie Terrane, eastern Goldfields Superterrane. To be published = Geological Survey of Western Australia East Yilgarn Update 2013-14, digital product.
Lithology Description: Plagioclase biotite tonalite; biotite schlieren; massive to foliated; metamorphosed

General Comments: See also Macedon Member.

Reserved by: Sheppard S., Tyler I.M., Griffin T.J.
General Comments: East Kimberley region

An important horizon marker.  Also supersedes Nymerina Basalt (Hickman et al, 1983) - according to stratigraphic correlation chart for the Fortescue Group, YARRIE. Age: 2717 +/- 2Ma (dacite). Includes upper part of the now abandoned Little de Grey Lava. Consists of two volcanic cycles and may need to be divided again in the future (2004 Cooya Pooya Explan Notes p19. RefID 69299).  Min age from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706. Oakover Basin.
Lithology Description: Massive, vesicular and amygdaloidal basalt, basaltic andesite, and andesite, minor dacite, dolerite sills; bedded lapilli, vitric, crystal and lithic tuff, volcaniclastic siltstone, shale, chert, sandstone, dolomite.

General Comments: In the Glidden Basin.
Lithology Description: Black shale, black laminated micaceous siltstone, purple and grey flaggy fine slightly micaceous feldspathic sandstone, and purple siltstone

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Of the Newman Sub-Group (Byro Group).

To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Madoonga, Kalli, Noondie 1:100k map sheets. Type area northern Weld Range, 26deg 56'S 117deg36'E.  Named after Madoonga Hst. Underlying Polelle Group banded iron formations of the Weld Range area.
Lithology Description: Rhyolitic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks; metamorphosed

General Comments: To be replaced by Madoonga Formation in 2015.
Formerly included in old definition of Eucla Basin. See also Madura Shale. Base is time transgressive. Barremian or older onshore; latest Barremian offshore. Age from sparse flora & fauna
Lithology Description: Carbonaceous or glauconitic sandstone, siltstone, and claystone and shale; commonly pyritic.

General Comments: Part of the Lake Johnston Greenstone Belt. Southern Cross Domain, Youanmi Terrane, Yilgarn Craton.
Lithology Description: Amphibollite after tholeiitic basalt, with  preserved pillows, metamorphosed mafic/ultramafic intrusives, and minor metasediments: BIFs and volcanogenic rocks.

General Comments: Reserved as Maggotty Springs. East Kimberley region. Turkey Creek, Bow 1:100 000 sheet areas. See also Maggoty Springs Granite. Age updated by I.Sweet.
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained, porphyritic biotite monzogranite; medium-grained hornblende-biotite granodiorite.
Quartz sandstone, pebbly sandstone and pebble to boulder conglomerate.

General Comments: Defined 1965.  Now [2001] includes Gibb and Wandjeli Sandstone Members, previously mapped as upper part of the Limmen Sandstone.  Occurs in the Beetaloo Sub-basin. Ages are said to be from tuffs in the Showell Member (Munson, 2016), which is at the top of the Mainoru Formation (although note that these ages have previously been described as from samples from 'the lower part of the Mainoru Formation (Jackson et al., 1999), and shown in Abbott & Sweet, 2000, and  Abbott et al 2001, as from the Wooden Duck Member.
Lithology Description: Green, purple and grey, laminated siltstone and mudstone, light grey calcareous siltstone; medium to coarse, thick-bedded sandstone interbeds.

General Comments: Intended to supersede the Lower Mount Goodwin Formation of Gorter (1998). Of Mount Goodwin Subgroup (Gorter, Nicoll, et al. in prep. Mar2009).
Lithology Description: Claystone and siltstone with rare thin sandstone interbeds, which are more common towards the top.

General Comments: Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008). Intrudes Whundo Group. Age: >2930Ma. Part of the Sisters Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Mafic rocks. Gabbro, leucogabbro, serpentinised peridotite and dunite, pyroxenite, and minor anorthosite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: For Dampier mapsheet; nearest town is Dampier.  Not related to the former Maitland Complex.  Named for the Maitland River. Age: <3.0Ga.  In the West Pilbara Superterrane/Pilbara Craton. Contains 10 named granites.
Lithology Description: Monzogranite, minor granodiorite, locally K-feldspar porphyritic, and local gneissic granitic rocks.

General Comments: Apparently replaces Malcolm Gneiss (unit no. 30535).
Lithology Description: Folded green calc-silicate rocks interlayered with black mafic amphibolite.

General Comments: M 85/24985 NT, also WA. Connection initially missed, reservation allowed to expire Jan 1981.
Lithology Description: Fluviodeltaic siliciclastics: red sandstone and shale; minor limestone.

General Comments: See also Mallens Formation.
Lithology Description: Quartz wacke, minor quartz arenite, bioturbated, cross-bedded; minor siltstone; characteristically intensely bioturbated.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: For a report on the Bonaparte and Ord Basins.
Lithology Description: Sandstone and siltstone.

Reserved by: Fitton, M.J., Horwitz R.C., Sylvester G.
General Comments: Formerly listed as part of Gorge Creek Group. Then became part of the De Grey Group. Now of the Croydon Group, De Grey Supergroup. Age: 3000 Ma. In the Mallina Basin/Pilbara Craton. Intruded by granites of Portree Suite.
Lithology Description: Interbedded metamorphosed shale, siltstone, sandstone, and medium to fine grained wacke; minor layers of chert; may contain gabbroic intrusions.
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Within the Sisters Supersuite. Possibly misspelt - name reserved as Malindra Well Granodiorite. Part of the Pippingarra Granitoid Complex.
Lithology Description: Hornblende-biotite granodiorite; grades to tonalite; massive to moderately foliated; locally inclusion-rich; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Acts as seal for Nita Formation hydrocarbon reservoir.
Lithology Description: Cyclic, massive halite and dolomite.

General Comments: For a granite in central WA - used to be the Malmac Dome. originally reserved as just Malmac (Hocking R., Pirajno F., 2001).
Lithology Description: Weathered monzogranite.

General Comments: Yilmia 1:100k map sheet area. Biotite-bearing metagranite. To be published = East Yilgarn 2013-2013 Update, Geological Survey of Western Australia digital product.
Lithology Description: Biotite-bearing metagranite.

General Comments: Isdell formation underlying (EG, HG 2007). Hosts Telfer gold mineralisation.
Lithology Description: Sandstone; minor conglomerate, siltstone, and shale.
Shale and chert.

General Comments: See also Mandu Formation, Mandu Calcarenite, Lexicon.  Age: <33Ma.
Lithology Description: White, mostly foraminiferal calcarenite to marl; low energy shallow marine.
Heterogeneously deformed and metamorphosed layered anorthosite, leucogabbro, gabbro, melanogabbro, ultramafic rocks.

General Comments: Superseded by the Manganese Subgroup (Muhling and Brakel, 1985). Fully described 1989, Balfour Downs. Group status retained in 2007 NULLAGINE (WA) 1:250K map sheet.  In the Collier Basin. Parts intruded by Davis Dolerite. Min age from K-Ar on glauconite in Coondoon Formation said to represent intrusion by Davis Dolerite. Max age from a tuffaceous unit near the base of the Manganese Group.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, mudstone, conglomerate, chert, dolostone; shallow marine/lagoonal origin.

General Comments: In the Perth Basin.
Lithology Description: Shale and siltstone with a few thin, probably lensoid, sandstone beds.

General Comments: This is a troctolite unit that outcrops through the main layered intrusions of the Bell Rock, Blackstone and Jamieson Ranges and these together form the Mantamaru intrusion. Mantamaru is the aboriginal name for Jamieson Community. Part of the revised Giles Suite (Giles Suite 1)
Reserved as Manyutup by Witt (1994). See also Manutup Tonalite Complex. NB: Ravensthorpe Terrane nomenclature was abandoned (Refid 65487, 2009)
Lithology Description: Dominated by coarse-grained equigranular biotite-hornblende tonalite, varies to include dioritic and granodioritic compositions; minor phases include quartz-diorite, microtonalite, hornblendite, anorthositic gabbro.
Metamorphosed dolerite

General Comments: See also Maori Queen granitoids.

The Mapa Igneous Complex is a layered gabbro intrusion in the northeast corner of the Yilgarn Craton. The Mapa Igneous Complex concordantly intrudes the northern part of the Mount Venn greenstone belt, and has been dated at 2755  +/-5 Ma (GSWA SHRIMP age). The name is derived from the Ngaanyatjarra name for Mount Cumming.
Lithology Description: Comprises several units: schist, amphibolite, schistose metapyroxenite, metadolerite, metagabbro, metamorphosed pyroxene-rich cumulate rock.

General Comments: See Bunting et al. (1977) for original definition. Wet sediment intruded by dolerite sill at 1843 +/- 10 Ma, which indicates this age close to time of deposition
Lithology Description: Siltstone, ferruginous shale, in part calcareous; basal intercalated tholeiitic basalt pillow lava, dolerite sills. Argillaceous dolomitic limestone.

General Comments: See also Mararoa Basalt Member, Mararoa Pillow Lava.

Defined 1977.  In the eastern part of Pilbara Craton. Within the Coongan Subgroup, Warrawoona Group, Pilbara Supergroup. Now redefined as top part of the Duffer Formation (Coongan Subgroup, Warrawoona Group, Pilbara Supergroup) - GSWA Record 2006/15 Van Kran
Lithology Description: Millimetre- to centimetre-thick layers of  red, white and black cherts; locally includes fine-grained, clastic sedimentary rock; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Formerly shown as part of Canning Basin. Dated c. 1870 Ma. Forms part of the Mount Joseph Migmatite. Intruded by Lennard Granite. Age: c.1870Ma. In the Western Zone of Lamboo Complex.
Lithology Description: Turbiditic metasandstone and quartz-plagioclase-muscovite-biotite phyllite; quartz-muscovite-biotite(-cordierite) and cordierite-andalusite-biotite-muscovite-quartz hornfels; minor quartzite.
Migmatitic sillimanite-cordierite-K-feldspar-plagioclase granofels and gneiss

General Comments: Pilbara region.
See also Marda Calc-Alkaline Complex and Marda Formation. Intruded by Butcher Bird Monzogranite.
Lithology Description: Calc-alkaline andesite-dacite-rhyolite rocks.

General Comments: New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk). Also, for COOYA POOYA map sheet; nearest town Roebourne. Cryst.age: 3006+/-12Ma. Forms most easterly part of Cherratta Granitic Complex.
Lithology Description: Porphyritic biotite granodiorite intruded by veins of leucocratic granite; compositional banding is interpreted to indicate inclusion of older, more mafic material.

General Comments: Basal unit of Muderong Shale. Lithology description copied from Mardie Greensand.
Lithology Description: Dark-green to green grey glauconitic, heavily bioturbated siltstone to fine-grained sandstone with interbedded siltstone and shale.

General Comments: After Maria mineral deposit/open cut mine. Map Sheet: SG51-13, Sir Samuel 3042. Conglomerate, sandstone, siltstone, shale and chert. Granitic and mafic clasts in conglomerate. Metamorphosed unit. To be published = GSWA geological map and explanatory notes, 2013/2014. See also unrelated Permian 'Maria Formation' in QLD.
Lithology Description: Conglomerate, sandstone, siltstone, shale and chert. Granitic and mafic clasts in conglomerate. Metamorphosed unit.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Onshore Perth Basin unit. Notified by A.Davidson 28-NOV-94.
Lithology Description: Thinly interbedded and discontinuous grey to black siltstones and shales, minor very thin beds of mostly fine-grained sandstone; predominantly marine; commonly glauconitic, micaceous, locally fossiliferous; variably pyritic or calcareous cemented.

General Comments: Includes the Munjina, Barumunya and Iowa Eastern Members. May be equivalent to Robe Pisolite.
Lithology Description: Conglomerate, silt, clay, channel iron deposits, intraformational breccia.

General Comments: No name reservation or definition has been received (2015). Invalid name.
Lithology Description: Chert.

General Comments: Sedimentation terminated by Delamarian Orogeny ~507 Ma.
Lithology Description: Sandstone; limestone; evaporites.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain.  Age: c.2625Ma. Part of the Bald Rock Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Muscovite-bearing alkali granite; equiganular; contains accessory fluorite; post-tectonic.

General Comments: This igneous suite comprises intermediate to mafic intrusive rocks (mainly dykes) which extend across much of the Yilgarn Craton and are concentrated around the SE, S, W, and NW margins. Components include the Fraser, Gnowangerup (Ravensthorpe), Boyagin, Muggamurra, and Wheatbelt dyke swarms; these will also be defined as dolerite units. The age of the suite is c. 1200-1215 Ma, based on ion microprobe U-Pb geochronology. Current research is aimed at testing whether the supersuite extends into the Musgrave Province. Tobepublished = These rocks have previously been included in the Marnda Moorn Large Igneous Province (Wingate et al., 2005; Wingate and Pidgeon, 2005), but not formally defined as an igneous unit. The new suite will be described in a paper currently in prep., intended to be published in 2010, but still not published in 2018. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD (partial report), Marnda Moorn Suite (P_-MM-o): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 09 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite and gabbro dykes.

General Comments: Defined 1970. See also Marra Mamba Banded Iron Formation. Basal unit in Hamersley Group. Ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Chert, ferruginous chert, jaspilite, banded iron-formation, minor shale, siltstone, mudstone.
Metabasalt with apparently only minor intercalations of dark metasediment and rare metadacite.
Pale-grey, largely oxidized siltstone with medium-grained sandstone capping the basal shoaling-up cycle, often capped by a dolomitic section. Locally contains thin gypsum and dolomite beds.

General Comments: Map Sheet = Wildara. Nearest Town = Leonora. briefdescription = Consists of mafic, ultramafic, sedimentary and felsic volcanic rocks. It includes the following formations: Mount Fouracre Basalt, Mount Clifford Komatiite, Hangover Formation. Wheretobepublished = GSWA east Yilgarn digital package (maps and explanatory notes).
Variation of reserved name Marty Bore Monzogranite, published by originator (Sheppard et al 1997).
Map Sheet SH51-5, 3139, MELITA.  Nearest Town = Leonora. Brief description = Quartz-feldspar-biotite granite; massive to foliated. To be published: GSWA Explanatory Notes Database.
Lithology Description: Quartz-feldspar-biotite granite; massive to foliated.

General Comments: For use on map sheet SH 51-3; nearest town is Cosmo Newbury. Located in northeast corner of the Yilgarn Craton. Dated at 2660 +/-3 Ma (GSWA SHRIMP age). To be published in several GSWA publications in near future, including 1:100K maps and geochronological reports.
Lithology Description: Porphyritic monzogranite.

General Comments: Reserved for  a granite in the Lissadell 1:250 000 sheet area (east Kimberley region). Used in Proterozoic Granites GIS as well. Not related to Matchbox Range Granite in QLD. Age updated by I.Sweet.
Lithology Description: Medium- and coarse-grained porphyritic biotite monzogranite and syenogranite

General Comments: In the Glidden Basin. Glidden Group (Mesoproterozoic)
Lithology Description: Laminated claystone, fissile laminated commonly micaceous shale and siltstone, flaggy fine and partly pyritic subgreywacke, and ferruginous feldspathic sandstone and medium grained quartz sandstone
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: East Kimberley. McIntosh 1:100 000 sheet area. Butchers Gully Suite.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed andesitic to trachytic volcanic and volcaniclastic rock with carbonate-rich matrix; minor ferruginous chert.

General Comments: See also the misspelt Maudobar Sandstone.

Not to be confused with Maurice Group of SA. Max depositional age from detrital zircon from lower Maurice Formation: 831+/-13 Ma. Max depositional age from detrital zircon from upper Maurice Formation: 698+/-20 Ma.
Lithology Description: Very fine to medium grained, cross bedded quartz sandstone; minor laminated micaceous siltstone and micaceous sandstone

General Comments: Probably an informal name. See also Sarah Granite (defined).
Lithology Description: Equigranular, homogenous, undeformed, hornblende-biotite monzogranite to granodiorite.

General Comments: May be a facies of Donnybrook Sandstone. Not used since this comment made in 1990.
Lithology Description: Ferruginous feldspathic sandstone, claystone, siltstone.
Metabasalt, commonly pillowed with minor interflow sedimentary rocks; dolerite; amphibolite.

General Comments: Mount Ramsey 1:250 000 sheet area.  In the Louisa Basin.
Lithology Description: Black grey and green shale with minor siltstone and fine to very fine sandstone

General Comments: Eastern Goldfields.
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained quartz syenite; K-feldspar megacrysts.
Laminated fine to coarse quartz sandstone, feldspathic sandstone, minor conglomerate and siltstone.

General Comments: This name was superseded by McHale Granodiorite in 1969, but the name was revived in 2004 and is now the preferred version [advice from GSWA Dec 2013, AUG2014].
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse grained,equigranular biotite-hornblende tonalite and biotite granodiorite extensive magmatic brecciation and associated alteration

General Comments: Includes 4 unnamed units. Lamboo Province, Halls Creek Orogen. Geochronology in the east Kimberley area of Western Australia. SHRIMP 1855+/-2 Ma, 1842+/-3 Ma (SHRIMP Data from OZCHRON1). See also McIntosh Intrusion, McIntosh Sill.
Lithology Description: Layered mafic-ultramafic intrusions: magnetite gabbro, magnetite gabbronorite, magnetite-olivine gabbro, olivine gabbro, leucogabbro, leucogabbronorite, anorthosite, olivine gabbronorite, gabbro, gabbronorite, peridotite and troctolite.

General Comments: See also McIntosh Gabbro. In the Central Zone of the Lamboo Complex. Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).
Lithology Description: Layered mafic-ultramafic intrusions; peridotite, troctolite, gabbro, olivine gabbro, gabbronorite, magnetite gabbro, magnetite-olivine gabbro, leucogabbro, leucogabbronorite, and anorthosite.

General Comments: Metasyenogranite, mingled with metagabbro; localised hybrids of metagranodiorite and metadiorite; may include intrusions of Bobbie Point Metasyenogranite and remnants of Archean rocks. To be published  in 1:250 000-scale interpreted bedrock geology map layers; 2011. Geological Survey of Western Australia Explanatory Notes database [is the explanatory notes database publicly accessible? Not Yet - Roger Hocking 31-Oct-2011].
Lithology Description: Medium-grained, equigranular, K-feldspar-rich metasyenogranite. Undeformed to moderate NE-trending foliation. Mingling of this alkaline granitic magma with metagabbro and quartz metadiorite has produced dioritic hybrid rocks.

General Comments: Probably named for area where found.

The basal unit is referred to as the Big Chert where it overlies the Upper Extrusives unit of the North Star Basalt.  In the eastern part of Pilbara Craton within the Warrawoona Group of the Pilbara Supergroup.
Lithology Description: Talc-chlorite schist and talc-carbonate schist, chert, banded iron formation, basalt, pelite, minor felsic volcaniclastic rocks.
Foliated porphyritic to even grained biotite hornblende granodiorite and tonalite with minor monzogranite and abundant small mafic xenoliths.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. See also Meda Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Fine to coarse sandstone, granule to pebble conglomerate.
Monzogranitic to tonalitic gneiss with gneissic veining. In places contains inclusions of layered anorthosite, leucogabbro, gabbro and ultramafic rocks

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain.
Lithology Description: Consists of mainly sedimentary rocks, felsic volcanic rocks, basalt and komatiitic basalt, metamorphosed.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain. Age: c.2780Ma.
Lithology Description: Mafic and ultra-mafic layered intrusive rocks - dominantly gabbros with anorthosite, magnetite and ultramafic cumulate rocks.

General Comments: Replaces Meentheena Carbonate Member. Stromatolitic.
Lithology Description: Lenticular units of stromatolitic, dark grey siliceous limestone and dolomite with volcaniclastic sandstone and siltstone, including accretionary lapilli beds; with calcareous sandstone, carbonaceous shale, local quartz sandstone and conglomerate

General Comments: This name reserved to replace existing Melita Rhyolite. Map Sheet SH51-5, 3139, MELITA.  Nearest Town = Leonora. Brief description = Rhyolitic to ryhodacitic rocks interleaved with contemporaneous basalt and andesitic basalts; dolerite and gabbro. To be published: GSWA Explanatory Notes Database.
Lithology Description: Includes volcaniclastic sandstones and breccias, massive crystal-rich sandstone; local fine-grained vitric to variably crystal-rich sandstone; fragmental rhyolitic rocks; basalt and basaltic andesite; local accretionary lapilli, dolerite intrusions.

General Comments: Reserved as Melita (Witt, 1991). See also Melita Complex.

Lithology Description: Littoral white to pale grey medium to coarse grained silicified quartz sandstone with local large-scale cross bedding. Contains fossil bivalves.

General Comments: Only one use later than 1993 - intended to be replaced by  Mellinjerie Formation? Previously included in Lennard River Group.
Lithology Description: Limestone, dolomite, and shale.
Even-grained biotite syenogranite and monzogranite; xenolith rich; folded and strongly foliated.

General Comments: Edjudina 1:250 000 sheet area. Reserved as Menangina Association and Menangina Clan.
Lithology Description: Biotite monzogranite with prominent K-feldspar megacrysts; cut by pegmatite and aplite; Hi Ca granite.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File SD/52-14. Age updated by I.Sweet.
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone and green and purple siltstone; fine-grained commonly micaceous and feldspathic sandstone; dolostone

General Comments: Published as Menyous Member in 1973, by J.F.Read in Bull Canadian Petroleum Geology 21(3), p344-394. Definition card for Menyous Limestone Member approved Dec 1974, but this longer name apparently never published.
Reserved as Menzies (Glassford 1985).

Defined 1962. Important aquifer - main source of groundwater for Alice Springs.  Formerly included in the underlying Larapinta Group and later,  the overlying Pertnjarra Group. Ungrouped in 2005. Note that Schmid (2016) and Austin et al (2017) still include this unit in the Larapinta Group. Poorly constrained age - probably Silurian-Devonian, but could be as old as Late Ordovician.  Formerly Mareena Bluff Formation. Also known as 'Marena red sandstone'. Numerical ages from Global Palaeomagnetic Database (GPMDB; McElhinny & Lock 1993, 1996).
Lithology Description: Porous, white to pale-brown, fine grained, well sorted quartz sandstone, minor conglomerate.

General Comments: For use on map sheet, MEREWETHER. Nearest town is Wiluna. Exposed on the western side of the Joyners Find greenstone belt. To be published in 2009: Geological Survey of Western Australia 'Central Yilgarn 100k Geological Information Series, 2009 update'. Abstract for the 2010 5th International Archean Symposium.
Lithology Description: Siliciclastic sediments -- sequence of strongly foliated conglomerates and shale/siltstones .

General Comments: See also Lexicon. SG50-6. Overlies and interfingers with Giralia Calcarenite. Age: 42-38.5Ma.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, poorly sorted, locally fossiliferous; fluviatile to shallow marine; lesser siltstone, conglomerate and claystone.
Sandstone, claystone.

General Comments: In the Kalgoorlie Terrane in Eastern Goldfields Superterrane of the Yilgarn Craton. 2016 Advice from GSWA that Formation is preferred on the basis of unit lithology, and is used in East Yilgarn GIS 2014.
Lithology Description: Biotite-bearing pebbly sandstone, sandstone, and siltstone; minor polymictic conglomerate; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Medium-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with amphibolite-facies assemblages; may have a greenschist overprint

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Medium-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with amphibolite-facies assemblages; may have a greenschist overprint

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Medium-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with amphibolite-facies assemblages; may have a greenschist overprint

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Medium-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with amphibolite-facies assemblages; may have a greenschist overprint

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic volcanics, including lavas and tuffs. Association may include volcaniclastic rocks.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic intrusive rocks.  Range in composition from alkali feldspar granite to tonalite; includes associated rocks such as migmatite and minor gabbro and diorite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic intrusive rocks.  Range in composition from alkali feldspar granite to tonalite; includes associated rocks such as migmatite and minor gabbro and diorite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic intrusive rocks.  Range in composition from alkali feldspar granite to tonalite; includes associated rocks such as migmatite and minor gabbro and diorite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic intrusive rocks.  Range in composition from alkali feldspar granite to tonalite; includes associated rocks such as migmatite and minor gabbro and diorite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset. [Note: Max Age name is in conflict with numerical age (Paleoproterozoic). Which is correct? CEB Feb-2012]
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic intrusive rocks.  Range in composition from alkali feldspar granite to tonalite; includes associated rocks such as migmatite and minor gabbro and diorite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset. [Note: numerical ages the wrong way around? or a typo? CEB Feb-2012]
Lithology Description: High-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with granulite facies assemblages; includes granitic gneisses

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: High-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with granulite facies assemblages; includes granitic gneisses

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: High-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with granulite facies assemblages; includes granitic gneisses

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Dolerite, gabbro and other mafic igneous rocks; commonly as dykes and sills; may include some metamorphosed mafic intrusions and subordinate ultramafic rocks.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly ultramafic intrusive rocks.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

Stratigraphic Name: Mesozoic siliciclastic units, eastern Canning Basin 80964
General Comments: In refID 72034. (GSWA (2016). 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology of Western Australia.  Also Subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, claystone, and conglomerate; undivided

General Comments: Forms the core of the Wyloo Dome.
Lithology Description: Sericitised monzogranite, cataclastically deformed in part with locally abundant mafic xenoliths.

General Comments: Within Turee Group, in Hardey syncline. Intruded by mafic sill with SHRIMP Pb/Pb baddelyite age of 2208 +/-10 Ma.
Lithology Description: Metadiamictite; clasts comprise metamorphosed felsic volcanic rock, chert, and sandstone.

General Comments: New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk).   Also, for DAMPIER map sheet; nearest town Karratha.  Intrudes Roebourne Group, the Regal Formation and Cleaverville Formation.
Lithology Description: Foliated granite (syenogranite and monzogranite).

General Comments: See also Michael Hills intrusion.
Lithology Description: Gabbro, anorthosite, pyroxenite.

Pale grey, gneissic to foliated metamonzogranite; derived from medium-grained equigranular to sparsely porphyritic biotite monzogranite. Includes an unnamed unit of pale grey, recrystallised mylonitic metamonzogranite

General Comments: Forms two elongated strips intruded into the Edale shear zone,  Everett Creek 1:100 000 sheet area, 2841, Youanmi 1:250 000, SH50-4.

For use on map sheet 3055; nearest town is Marble Bar. To be published: NULLAGINE 1:250K Geol. Series map, (June 2007)  with formal definition in Yilgalong 1:100K Explan. Notes (June 2007). Intrusion of Cleland Supersuite in Yilgalong Granitic Complex.
Lithology Description: Leucocratic biotite monzogranite; seriate to porphyritic; medium- to coarse-grained, weakly metamorphosed.
Medium to coarse-grained and mostly massive gabbro.

General Comments: McIntosh 1:100 000 sheet area, East Kimberley. Unit is fault-bounded. of the Halls Creek Orogen. Previously mapped as Olympio Formation of Halls Creek Group (Gemuts & Smith 1968). In the Central Zone of Lamboo Complex.
Lithology Description: Turbiditic greywacke, siltstone and mudstone; lithic, feldspathic and quartz sandstone; calcareous rocks; chert; and minor mafic lavas and sills. Regionally metamorphosed to mainly greenschist facies; commonly strongly foliated

General Comments: Bentley Basin.
Lithology Description: Basaltic lava flow: highly altered, strongly amygdaloidal or quartz-mottled basalt, basalt breccia, sedimentary intercalations include pinkish, quartzitic sandstones, and conglomerates, and uppermost continental red beds.
Granodioritic gneiss with 3500 and 3315 Ma zircon xenocrysts.

General Comments: See also misspelling Millajidee. Originally defined (1976) as of Grant Formation.
Lithology Description: Mainly sandstone and minor siltstone and conglomerate. Grain size mainly fine though a medium to coarse-grained middle part is present. Large and small-scale cross-bedding is common and the upper part is slumped in many areas.

General Comments: To be used in the Jackson 1:100 000 sheet area (SH50-12 / 2737).
Lithology Description: Porphyritic granite.

General Comments: Bentley Basin.
Lithology Description: Lava flows with basal massive basalts grading upward into progressively stronger vesicular and amygdaloidal basalts; local brecciated tops; mudstone-sandstone, volcaniclastic conglomerate, cherty microbialites.
Ferruginous shale and siltstone, schist, with porphyroblasts of pyrite; granular iron formation; bedded dolomite and dolomitic siltstone

Stratigraphic Name: Millidie Creek Formation - banded iron formation
General Comments: Used on Surface Geology of Australia 1:1 million scale dataset 2010 edition.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed banded and granular iron formation with minor shale

General Comments: Used on Surface Geology of Australia 1:1 million scale dataset 2010 edition.
Lithology Description: Sericitic shale with finely laminated carbonate layers, dolomitic marble, metamorphosed dolomitic sandstone, chloritic siltstone and quartz chlorite carbonate schist

General Comments: Used on Surface Geology of Australia 1:1 million scale dataset 2010 edition.
Lithology Description: Quartz-sericite-hematite phyllite and quartz-muscovite schist

General Comments: Of Beere (1984). Gorter et al (2005) subdivided off part of the original Milligans Formation as Yow Fm.and relegated Waggon Creek Fm. to Waggon Creek  facies. See also Waggon Creek Formation (interbedded within Milligans Formation and now relegated to Waggon Creek Facies status within Milligans Formation by Gorter et al (2005) - APPEA Journal 2005 (45/1).)
Lithology Description: Black and dark grey shale, partly calcareous; minor limestone; rare fine to medium-grained sandstone; thin to thick beds; diverse fauna.

General Comments: Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008). Supersedes Millindinna Complex and Millindinnah Complex. Of Sisiters Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Mafic and ultramafic rocks (gabbro, pyroxenite, and peridotite) as layered sills; metamorphosed.

General Comments: 270 km long northwest-trending dolerite dyke near Bell Gorge on Gibb River Road, west Kimberley; interpreted to be a feeder dyke to Antrim Plateau Volcanics (location: Lat 17o 10' 14", Long 125o, 19' 2"; 7465000 E, 8100100 N). Age: 513 +/- 12Ma (SHRIMP Zircon, Hanley and Wingate, 2000). See also informal Milliwindi dolerite. Included in the Kalkarindji Suite in Oct 2009. Note that GSWA considers this unit to be at Group/Suite rank rather than Formation rank.
Lithology Description: Dolerite dykes.

General Comments: Lower Fortescue valley. The main aquifer.
Lithology Description: Dolomite, calcareous dolomite, calcrete; with silcrete, clay, chert breccia, and local basal conglomerate.
Rippled and cross-bedded quartz sandstone and siltstone, with basal cobble and boulder conglomerate and interbedded minor sandstone in places.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Poorly to thinly bedded and cross bedded and in places graded fluvial fine to medium grained sandstone with minor conglomerate and siltstone; partly fossiliferous with plant fossils and palynomorphs.

General Comments: See Definition reference for source of unit relationships etc.

Lithology Description: Metamorphosed volcanic rocks (mostly basic) and volcaniclastic sandstones.

General Comments: Included within the Kockatea Shale?

Not related to Mindoola Formation - this was used in former stratigrap[hic description of rocks in the Murchison Domain but the grouping has now been revised and this name abandoned (2008).  Age ?2750 Ma. Geological province: NE Murchison Domain. Part of the Annean Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Tonalite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: See also Minerie Sequence.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed basalt, felsic volcaniclastic sandstone and chert.

General Comments: Gascoyne region, Glenburgh 1:250 000 sheet area.
Supersedes Mingah Tuff Member.
Lithology Description: Basaltic to andestic volcaniclastic sandstone and siltstone, quartz sandstone, shale and stromatolitic carbonate units; basalt flows
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: See also Lexicon. (Maitland, 1919).
Lithology Description: Fine- to medium-grained ferruginous sandstone, shale, micaceous siltstone, conglomerate.

General Comments: Map sheet: Lee Steere.
Burtville Terrane, Yilgarn Craton. Age c.2769 to c.2765 Ma. Comprises Hope Campbell, Surprise, and Baseline Orthogneisses.
Lithology Description: Migmatitic quartz-biotite orthogneiss and migmatitic orthogneiss.

General Comments: No type section or type definition identified.

Name used in:  Johnson, SP, 2013, The birth of supercontinents and the Proterozoic assembly of Western Australia: Geological Survey of Western Australia, p4, p14-15. [to be indexed soon, CEB Jul-2016]
Lithology Description: Predominantly siliciclastic, but includes stromatolite-bearing carbonate sequences. Basal conglomerate entirely of underlying Windidda Member cobbles and boulders in an ironstone matrix.

General Comments: Used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Minjar Hill, Badja 1:100k map sheet, 28deg48'S 116deg57'E. Type area: Cattle Well area. Stratigraphically overlying Scuddles Member, possibly conformable. Older than dated Gossan Hill Fm units.
Lithology Description: Felsic volcaniclastic rocks and fine-grained siliciclastic sedimentary rocks; minor amygdaloidal basalt; metmorphosed
Coarsely crystalline, orange-brown to red-brown, clear to translucent halite interbedded with reddish-brown partly dolomitic claystone.

General Comments: Wallaringa & Wodgina 1:100 000 sheets.
Lithology Description: Quartz and K-feldspar porphyritic muscovite(-biotite) monzogranite; fine- to coarse-grained; massive to weakly foliated.

General Comments: Gascoyne Province. Shown as -Pgbr, -Pgvl, -Pglb, -Pgbs & part of -Pgbt on Mount Phillips and -Pg on Mount Egerton 1:250k map sheets.
Also see Minnie Creek Supersuite. Example of the Cullen Association. Age: ~1800Ma. Geological Province: Gascoyne Province.
Of the Minyari Group (O'Callaghans Supersuite).
Lithology Description: Monzogranite to syenogranite.

General Comments: North Shaw 1:100 000 sheet area 2755. For a different unit from the old Miralga Formation.
Lithology Description: Pillowed tholeiitic basalts and interbedded cherts.
Predominantly calcareous pelagic deposits: low-energy marine-shelf calcarenite and calcisiltite.

General Comments: Not to be confused with Mirrabooka Formation in NSW. Shown as part of Coolyena Group. Perth Basin.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, dark greenish brown, very poorly sorted, silty and richly glauconitic; with thin interbeds of siltstone and shale, dark green to black, glauconitic.

General Comments: Subdivided into 6 unnamed units. Within the Mirturtu Suite of the Pitjantjatjara Supersuite. See also geochron ages with misspelling Miturtu Monzogranite (2012), 1181+/-6 Ma; 1203+/-16 Ma, 1175+/-15 Ma.
Lithology Description: Metamonzogranite, metagranodiorite, metaquartz-monzodiorite, charnockite; rapakivi granite; garnet coronas around mafic minerals; locally mylonitic.
Hornblende-garnet granodioritic augen gneiss

General Comments: To be published: Howard, H. M., Smithies, R. H., Pirajno, F., Skwarnecki, M. S. 2008. BATES, W. A. Sheet 4646: Western Australia Geological Survey, 1:100 000 Geological Series. Version 2 -- expected date of publication is December 2008.
Lithology Description: Massive to strongly foliated granulite facies rocks of granitic protolith with compositions dominated by monzogranite but with compositional range of quartzo-monzodiorite to syenogranite.

General Comments: Map Sheet = Norseman. This unit is a revision of the Mission Intrusion as the previous usage does not comply with current nomenclature protocols. To be published in GSWA series map release 2018 and explanatory notes, 2018-2020. See also GSWA ENS: SAPKOTA, J (partial report), Mission Gabbro (A-_ms-og): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 13 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Differentiated gabbroic sill; includes peridotite and pyroxenite seggregations; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Bentley Basin. Musgrave Region. Not related to Mission Basalt.
Lithology Description: Conglomerate, sandstone, shale, and basalt; minor tuff, dolomite, and quartzite.

General Comments: Previously considered part of the Pole Group. Now (2016) reassigned into the Vetters Subgroup, Kalgoorlie Group. The Missouri Basalt lies within the Davyhurst and Bardoc 1:100K map sheets areas.
Lithology Description: Massive to pillowed porphyritic basalt. Tholeiitic basalt and intercalated subordinate high-magnesium basalt;  metamorphosed.

General Comments: Not known if published by originator? PP 3/7/06.

Lithology Description: Arkose with sandstone, siltstone, chert.

General Comments: Defined Fairbridge (1953).
Lithology Description: Glauconitic sand, sandstone, clay, minor phosphatic nodules

General Comments: Incorrectly placed in Emu Pool Supersuite in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Table 2 p8). Intruded both Triberton Granodiorite and Boobina Porphyry. Age: 3317+/-2Ma (Barley & Pickard, 1999).
Lithology Description: Massive leucocratic monzogranite; very fine- to medium-grained; quartz-rich, minor biotite; equigranular to sparsely feldspar-phyric; metamorphosed.
Foliated quartz-phyric biotite metamicromonzogranite with minor metasyenogranite and metagranodiorite.

General Comments: Dixon Range 1:250 000 sheet area (east Kimberley region).
Lithology Description: Foliated and metamorphosed hornblende-biotite(-epidote) tonalite; inclusions of epidote amphibolite

General Comments: Within the Whim Creek Group, De Grey Supergroup. Red Hill Volcanics and this dacite member were formerly known as Mons Cupri Volcanics. Intrudes Red Hill Volcanics.  Age Mons Cupri Volcanics: SHRIMP U-Pb Zircon age of 2991+/-12 Ma (Barley et al 1994). Interpreted to be a member of Red Hill Volcanics of the Whim Creek Group (GSWA Mar06).
Lithology Description: Dark grey dacite, wholly coherent and contains: a spherulitic matrix indicative of high temperature devitrification of volcanic glass; plagioclase phenocrysts and abundant, cherty fragments.
Retrogradational deltaic sandstones and transgressive marine shales.

General Comments: Lateral correlative of Tindall Limestone and Gum Ridge Formation.
Lithology Description: Fossiliferous limestone, dolostone, calcareous mudstone; minor fine-grained sandstone and siliciclastic mudstone; chert and nodular evaporitic pseudomorphs; silicified outcrop, recessive.
Hornblende or biotite bearing monzogranite to granodiorite.

General Comments: Name from Moodagara Bore, on Rocklea 100k. Distribution: Newman, Mount Bruce, Turee Creek, Wyloo 250k. The Moodagara Dolerite is a suite of west-northwest trending dolerite dykes that pre-date the Panhandle Dolerite, and are equivalent to the unnamed P_d4 dyke suite of Tyler (1990). See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD (partial report), Moodagara Dolerite (P_-_ma-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 06 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite; mainly west-northwest trending dykes.

General Comments: Eucla SH52-14. In a drillhole through Eucla Basin. Granitic and gabbroic rocks. To be published=GSWA Record, September 2015. Age range from Wingate et al. 2015 in GSWA Record2015/10.
Lithology Description: Granitic and gabbroic rocks.
Dolerite;  mainly west-northwest trending dykes

General Comments: Previously partly included in Morrissey Metamorphic Suite. Age: >2000Ma. Hosts W-rich mineralisation at Hectors Bore.
Lithology Description: Pelitic and psammitic schist, quartzite, calc-silicate gneiss, marble, amphibolite, ultramafic schist, and metamorphosed banded iron-formation.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Defn on Tech File F/50-13. See also Moogaloo Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Quartzose or feldspathic sandstone and siltstone; minor conglomerate, claystone, and carbonaceous shale.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. SG50-1. Richly fossiliferous. Max. thickness: 1260ft.
Lithology Description: Dominantly limestone and dolomite with minor siliciclastic and evaporative horizons.
Lithic quartz sandstone and granule to pebble conglomerate with minor argillite.
Thin- to very thick-bedded, fine to very coarse-grained sandstone, siltstone, conglomerate, dolostone, dolomitic siltstone, and minor felsic volcaniclastic sandstone.

General Comments: SG50-12, Glengarry.  In the Yerrida Basin. Defined as Mooloogool Subgroup and subsequently upgraded to Group.
Lithology Description: Terrigenous clastic, volcaniclastic, mafic extrusive and intrusive rocks.

General Comments: c. 2830 Ma. Formerly of  parent Mount Edgar Granitoid Complex.
Lithology Description: Muscovite-biotite monzogranite, medium-grained, massive to weakly foliated; pegmatite with cassiterite, tantalite, beryl and zinnwaldite

General Comments: In the centre of the gneiss complex of the Mount Edgar Granitoid Complex.

Ruby Plains 1:100 000 sheet area.   Age: c. 610Ma. Possibly equivalent to other diamictite of Duerdin Group. Age: 793 +/- 30Ma (Rb-Sr) and 610Ma. Correlated with Elatina Formation. Said to include dolostone in Auvergne and Waterloo areas. Wolfe Basin.
Lithology Description: Massive matrix-supported polymictic pebble to boulder conglomerate; larger clasts striated; poorly sorted massive sandstone. Diamictite, dolostone "cap".
White, grey, brown or red, fine- to very fine-grained feldspathic sandstone and arkose; carbonaceous shale and conglomerate lenses.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Age: 1000 Ma.
Lithology Description: Consists of lithified sandstone, arkose, siltstone and volcanic rocks.

General Comments: Gascoyne Province. Intrudes Glenburgh Terrane. About 50 granites from the Supersuite have been dated by SHRIMP U/Pb zircon techniques. Hosts uraniferous and base metal quartz vein mineralisation with Cu-Pb sulfides at Mundong Well; also with W-skarn mineralisation in the N of the Province.
Lithology Description: Monzogranite, syenogranite, granodiorite and tonalite, diorite, gneissic to schistose granodiorite to monzogranite; local schist, amphibolite, calc-silicate and quartzite. Minor gabbro.

General Comments: (Le Blanc Smith, 1993). In the Collie Basin. See also Moorehead Fm.
Lithology Description: Laminated claystone and subordinate thin beds of buff-coloured siltstone, fine-grained sandstone and rare limestone lenses.
Siltstone/mudstone with calcilutite in cm-thick beds; local basal stromatolitic carbonate, intraformational conglomerate or lithic sandstone. Spar, dolospar and radiaxial calcite are conspicuous.

General Comments: Mentioned.
See also Morawa Lava and Morawa Lava basalt.
Probably replaces Morelands Formation?
Missing the Formation part. See also Morgans Island Epiclastic Formation.
See also Traves (1955) in WA Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Lateritisation & bauxite.

General Comments: Formerly of the De Grey Group; now [2006] part of Nullagine Group in the De Grey Supergroup. In the eastern Pilbara Craton. Estimated to be ~5km thick.
Lithology Description: Lower part: interbedded conglomerate, massive coarse-grained sandstone, siltstone and shale: Upper part: thinly bedded sandstone interbedded with siltstone and shale; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Reserved as the Mosquito Well Conglomerate.
Lithology Description: Conglomerate, sandstone and siltstone; metamorphosed.
Dark, grey-brown to black argillaceous rocks, with subordinate siltstone and fine-grained sandstone.

General Comments: Reserved as Motherin Granodiorite. East Pilbara Terrane.
Lithology Description: Interleaved monzogranite, granodiorite, granitic gneiss, and pegmatite; strongly foliated to banded to gneissic; intruded by granite pegmatite sheets; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Fully described GSWA Bull 137 p88 as Moogooderra Formation, but this appears to be a misspelling. See also misspelt Mougoodera Formation, briefly described. Named after Mougooderra Hill, Badja 1:100k sheet area. Type area Minjar Hill, 28deg51'S116deg58'E. Age <2793 Ma, but probably <2735 Ma as it has Glen Group relations.
Lithology Description: Conglomerate to sandstone to siltstone interbedded on a 1-30m scale with sandstone dominant; minor felsic volcaniclastic units, BIF, chert; locally strongly deformed; metamorphosed

General Comments: Of the Warrawoona Group (Pilbara Supergroup). Formerly of Talga Talga Subgroup.  Intruded by Coppin Gap Granodiorite and Munganbrina Monzonite. Age: c.3.48-3.43Ga; 3522+/-13 Ma. In the eastern Pilbara Craton.
Lithology Description: Dominantly pillowed metabasalt, metamorphosed pyroxene spinifex-textured komatiitic basalt, and thin horizons of metasedimentary chert and felsic volcaniclastic rocks; numerous dolerite and gabbro sills.

General Comments: Giles Complex, Musgrave Block. Sheets 4645, 4646. Approved defn card held [CEB Jul 2002]. Defn revised 29/3/96 to show enlarged distribution - by A.Y. Glikson. Desc publ. 1996, AGSO Bull. 239, p26 etc.
Lithology Description: Massive to weakly layered felsic granulite; leucogranulite after syenite; mafic granulite; granulite grade orthogneiss and paragneiss; metasedimentary rocks including quartzite, pelitic gneiss, calc-silicate granulite, migmatite.
Foliated weakly porphyritic leucocratic biotite muscovite metasyenogranite, aplite, pegmatite.

General Comments: See also Mount Andrew Migmatite Complex.
Maximum age from detrital zircons. Mount Augustus Basin. See also Mount Augustus Formation.
Lithology Description: Feldspathic sandstone, pebbly sandstone, and conglomerate; minor siltstone.

General Comments: Age of 1693+/-4Ma (Vallini et al 2005), interpreted as early diagenesis date. A variety of ages exist in the bibliographic references. Supersedes Mount Barren Formation also. Peak thermal metamorphism ~1205 Ma (RefID 65487, p24), further metamorphism event proposed at 1027 +/-8 Ma (RefID 64577). May be lateral equivalent of Woodline Formation.
Lithology Description: Quartzite, sandstone, dolostone, conglomerate, phyllite, pelitic and psammitic schist

General Comments: For Mount Belches 3335 1:100 000 sheet explanatory notes.
Lithology Description: Monotonous package of metamorphosed, multiply deformed wackes and mudstones.

General Comments: In the Louisa Basin. Age: c.610Ma.
Lithology Description: Purple to grey fine micaceous and ferruginous well sorted sandstone, and purple fissile shale and siltstone increasing towards the base; oscillation ripples, graded bedding, cross bedding, and clay pellet cavities

General Comments: To be used on the MOUNT BILLROTH mapsheet; nearest town is Dampier. In refid 65828 (2006) Appendix 2 shows this as replacing the Kurrana Granitic Complex as the parent of Golden Eagle Orthogneiss, according to the GSWA databases.
Lithology Description: Monzogranite to granodiorite.

General Comments: Of Upper Wyloo Group. Volcanic rocks which divide the Ashburton Formation. Age: 1828+/-5 Ma. Geological Province: Ashburton Province.See also Mount Boggola Volcanics for source of min age..
Max Age: 2480 (+/-) 30 Ma (Roddick and Libby, 1995).  Probably updated again since 1996?
Redefined 1979. Probably only in WA [previously shown as in NT and SA also - this was probably a mistake from regional references]. Max. thickness: 10km.
Lithology Description: A cover sequence of dominantly basaltic and sedimentary rocks of very low metamorphic grade unconformably overlying the granite-greenstone terranes.

General Comments: Redefined 1982.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, well rounded, fine to medium-grained quartz; sandstone, feldspathic, burrowed; siltstone and shale.

General Comments: Of the Sally Downs Supersuite. Geological Province: Kimberley Region. In the Lamboo Complex. GSWA used Mount Christine Granitoid for some years (~1998 - 2002), but now prefer Mount Christine Granite [advice from GSWA Dec 2013].
Lithology Description: Coarsely porphyritic, medium-grained biotite monzogranite.

General Comments: Map Sheet = Weebo. Nearest Town = Leonora. Briefdescription = Consists of komatiite and komatiitic basalt with relict cumulate, olivine spinifex and pyroxene spinifex textures. This is a formation level unit. I wish to redefine and formalise Mount Clifford peridotites that is in informal usage in the GA database. Wheretobepublished = GSWA digital release (maps and explanatory notes).
For a report on the Bonaparte and Ord Basins. In Ord and Bonaparte Basins.
Lithology Description: Stromatolitic limestone and matrix-supported basalt breccia, silicified at the surface.

General Comments: Within O'Callaghans Supersuite. Previously included in Mount Crofton Suite. U-Pb SHRIMP dating done on titanite due to high to extremely high U levels in zircon, resulting in crystal damage and Pb loss.
Lithology Description: Equigranular medium grained, grading to coarse and porphyritic, biotite monzogranite and syenogranite, with rare granophyre

General Comments: Gascoyne Province. Included in -Pg on Wyloo map sheet.  Parent Boolaloo Supersuite discontinued by GSWA; now part of Moorarie Supersuite (S.Sheppard, pers. comm., 2008)
Lithology Description: Biotite-muscovite adamellite and granite

General Comments: Intrudes Whitewater Volcanics.
Lithology Description: Foliated, coarse, pink-grey porphyritic biotite metamicromonzogranite.

General Comments: See also Mount Dugel metapelite.

Reserved by: Witt, W. K. (1987), De Paoli, M. (GSWA),  (25-FEB-2016)
General Comments: Briefly described in Swager et al (1990) Table 1 p6 as Mount Ellis Sill, then Mount Ellis Intrusion, now (2016) original reservation reinstated. It forms part of the Eastern Goldfields Superterrane of the Yilgarn Craton. Mount Ellis Gabbro lies within Bardoc and part way into the Kalgoorlie 1:100K GSWA map series sheets. To be published = GSWA digital release 2016. See also GSWA ENS: Wyche, S and De Paoli, MC (partial report), Mount Ellis Gabbro (A-_el-xo-a): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 13 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Gabbro, leucogabbro, iron-rich gabbro, and pyroxenite; metamorphosed. Locally displays granophyric segregations and pyroxenitic or dunitic basal segregations.

General Comments: East Kimberley region. Kimberley Province.  Of the Sally Downs supersuite. Age: 1835-1805Ma. Part of the Bow River batholith. Of Syenite Suite [advice from GSWA Dec 2013].
Lithology Description: Coarse to fine grained locally porphyritic partly recrystallised biotite monzogranite; associated with gabbro and locally rich in mafic inclusions

General Comments: Ruby Plains 1:100 000 sheet area. Defined as Adelaidian age. Of the Albert Edward Group.
Lithology Description: Cross-bedded, mainly medium grained sublithic and quartz sandstone with minor shale and siltstone, and iron-stained pebbly sublithic sandstone and conglomerate near base

General Comments: Map Sheet = Wilbah. Nearest Town = Leonora. Briefdescription = Consists of basalt with minor komatiitic basalt. The basalt is locally vesicular and amygdaloidal. This is a formation level unit. Wheretobepublished = GSWA digital release (maps and explanatory notes).

To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Mount Gibson Hsd, Mount Gibson 1:100k sheet. Type area: Hornet and Orion mines. Stratigraphic relations unknown in 2015, probably unconformably overlain by Polelle Group units.
Lithology Description: Felsic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks varying from rhyolitic to dacitic compositions; metamorphosed

General Comments: Murchison Supergroup, Murchison Domain, Yilgarn Craton. To be replaced by Mount Gibson Formation in 2015.
Shows massive carbonate replacement of chert (Lascelles, 2006, RefID 63153).
Only this informal version is recorded.
Also referred to as Mount Goode Dunite.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed tholeiitic basalt and metamorphosed plagio-phyric tholeiitic basalt.

Reserved by: Gorter, J. D. (Eni Australia), Nicoll, R.S. (GA)
General Comments: Rank proposed to be raised from Formation. Upper unit of the Kinmore Group. Composed of (base to top) Penguin Formation, Mairmull Formation, Ascalon Formation, Fishburn Formation (revision in prep. Mar 2009). Also published as such in 2013. See also Mount Goodwin Sub-group.
Lithology Description: Shale, claystone, siltstone and minor sandstone.
Leucogranodiorite, leucodiorite with amphibolite xenoliths.

General Comments: New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk). Also, to be used on ROEBOURNE map sheet; nearest town Roebourne. Forms part of the Harding Granitic Complex. Intrudes Andover Intrusion which is genetically related.
Lithology Description: Massive, medium- to coarse-grained monzodiorite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Type Locality: 24o40' 35.69S, 129o24' 50.91E (WGS 84).  Redefined by Edgoose, C.L. and Close, D.F. after Forman (1966). See also Mount Harris Volcanics. Intruded by veins of Walu Granite. At Mt Harris this basalt is thrust over Dean Quartzite.
Lithology Description: Epidotised amygdaloidal basalt, megacrystic schist, greenschist.
