General Comments: Gabbro, metamorphosed. Formation within the Leviathan Suite. To be published = Geological Survey of Western Australia East Yilgarn Update 2013-14, digital product.
Lithology Description: Gabbro, metamorphosed.

General Comments: For use on map sheet  SH50-42841; nearest town is Sandstone.  Sill that extends for at least 400km in the central Yilgarn Craton (map sheets MUNJEROO, EVERETT CREEK and ATLEY 100k). Best exposures at Mount Holmes and 13km to the ESE of Sandstone. It has been dated at 1070 /-18 Ma, and was therefore assigned to the c. 1075Ma Warakurna Large Igneous Province (Giles Suite, Warakurna Supersuite).  To be published in the Central Yilgarn GIS package (2009 update), released by the GSWA; and in Wingate et al. (in prep., probably to be published in Australian Journal of Earth Sciences).
Lithology Description: Gabbro sill with distinct magnetic signature; outcrops sporadically.
Glacigene rocks; tillite, sandstone, siltstone and minor stromatolitic dolomite.

General Comments: Upgraded from Formation to Mount James Subgroup by Steve Sheppard, Simon Johnson GSWA. Advice from RH 28Oct08.
Lithology Description: Quartzite, meta-arkosic sandstone to quartz-sericite phyllite, meta-quartz and metapolymict conglomerate, phyllite;pelitic and psammitic schist.

General Comments: Archean granite in Duketon 1:250 000 sheet area. Used informally in AMIRA report and pmdCRC papers but not previously published.
Defn of Mount John Shale on Tech File SE/52-6.  Same as Mount John Member,  Mount John Shale. Are any still current? This name is Defined, but date is old? Need to confirm.
Lithology Description: Grey-green siltstone, mudstone, and fine- to coarse-grained sandstone.

General Comments: In the West Kimberley Marboo Formation forms part of this migmatite. Previously considered part of the Hooper Complex, now (2016), considered a member of the Marboo Formation
Lithology Description: Quartz-K-feldspar-plagioclase-biotite-sillimanite-muscovite migmatite and anatectic granitoid.

Reserved by: Roddick J.C, Compston W, Durney D.W.
Lithology Description: Prekinematic granodiorite. Generally medium grained and massive textured though grain size locally variable.Contains rare 'basic' xenoliths and various acid dykes. Post-emplacement recrystallization and metamorphic textures visible in thin sections.

General Comments: Tonalite, granodiorite and monzogranite plutons 5 km in diameter intrude into Norie Group, Boodanoo Suite, Meeline Suite units of the Murchison Domain. Three geochronological constraints now indicate consistent ages.
Lithology Description: Metagranitic rock, locally sheared; schistose metagranitic rock, locally strongly sheared; metagranodiorite to metamonzogranite with muscovite-rich patches and rafts of metagabbro; felsic dykes, locally quartz and/or feldspar-phyric, metamorphosed.

General Comments: East Kimberley, Gordon Downs 1:250 000 sheet area.  Probably a correlative of Heavitree Quartzite and Bitter Springs Formation (Amadeus Basin).
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone, minor conglomerate; distinctive stromatolites present.

General Comments: To become part of the Higginsville Subgroup, Kalgoorlie Group.
Lithology Description: Gabbro, pyroxenite, serpentinised peridotite, ferruginous chert, felsic volcanic rocks, and black shale.

General Comments: Mount Leake outlier; straddles the Goodin Fault that separates Yerrida and Bryah Basins. Contains detrital zircon from sandstone aged 1785 +/- 11 Ma (U-Pb SHRIMP; Nelson, 1997). Considered a possible correlative of the Yelma Formation in 2009, but Yelma Fm now considered to be 1950-1970 Ma. (Johnson, 2013) RefID 69003.  [Is this unit still current? CEB Jul-2016]
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone, glauconitic in places, silicified stromatolitic carbonate, chert breccia and jasperoidal chert

General Comments: Map Sheet = Leonora. Nearest Town = Leonora. Briefdescription = Consists of sedimentary rock (conglomerate to shale and chert) with minor interleaved volcanic rock. I wish to redefine the Mount Leonora chert that is already in the GA database but is informal and not current. Wheretobepublished = GSWA digital release (maps and explanatory notes).

Lithology Description: Conglomerate-arenite.

General Comments: May not have been intended as a formal name. The rocks are shown simply as 'Granitic intrusions' on Outcrop Map 2: geology of Mount Malcolm in RefID 67268, GSWA Record 2011/18, the publication of a BSc Hons thesis.
Briefly described. Need confirmation of name Mount Manypeaks Granite?

See also Mt McGrath Formation.  Base age constrained by a 2007+/-16 Ma Pb/Pb baddeleyite age on a dyke cutting the underlying Cheela Springs Basalt.  Minimum age is more poorly constrained, probably around 2000 Ma. Overlying Duck Creek Dolomite is undated, and only the age of the Mount Boggola volcanic succession/Formation (1829+/-5 Ma), within the Ashburton Formation (~1805-1830Ma) above that provides constraint.
Lithology Description: Coarse sandstone, hematite conglomerate, pelite, dolomite.

General Comments: See also misspelling McRae Shale. Age: c.2603 Ma. Ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Mudstone, siltstone, chert, iron-formation, and dolomite. Thin bands of shard-bearing volcanic ash in upper parts.

Stratigraphic Name: Mount McRae Shale and Mount Sylvia Formation
General Comments: informal unit, used by 1:1 million Surface Geology of Australia datasets to represent 2 thin formations.
Lithology Description: Interbedded shale, chert, banded iron-formation
Sandstone (arenite), silicified in parts, with minor shale and conglomerate.

General Comments: Eastern Goldfields Superterrane, Yilgarn Craton.Still New in GSWA ENS, leave until it is 'reassessed'. Comment from Stephen Wyche: "Small gabbro unit on MOUNT BELCHES. Previously called Mount Monger Sill. If retained, will probably be called the Mount Monger Gabbro."
Lithology Description: Gabbro; relict cumulate texture; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Redefined as Negri Volcanics in 1979. Formerly of the Bookingarra Group. Now reverted to  the name Mount Negri and reassigned as a member of the new Bookingarra Formation (GSWA Mar.06) of the De Grey Supergroup.  Age: 2920Ma. Restored to formation rank in 2016.
Lithology Description: Variolitic and vesicular basalt, undivided; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Member of Marra Mamba Iron Formation, approved by Staines.~ 2600 Ma. SHRIMP age 2597+/-5 Ma. AJES 1998. Max & min ages  from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Banded iron-formation, shale.

General Comments: Lissadell 1:250 000 sheet area (east Kimberley region). 1859 +/- 3 Ma
Lithology Description: Coarse-grained porphyritic biotite monzogranite and syenogranite with rapakivi-like texture; medium- to coarse-grained, even-textured monzogranite

General Comments: 1077 - 1063 Ma. Bentley Basin. Divided, in part, into 3 unnamed volcanic and volcaniclastic units.
Lithology Description: Rhyolitic and trachydacitic volcanic sandstone, siltstone and mudstone, contains fiamme; minor mafic volcanic rocks; ignimbrite; rhyolite and trachydacite, spherulitic, perlitic or massive, intruded by / included in quartz syenite and syenogranite.

General Comments: Is this a misspelling, or intended to replace Mount Parker Sandstone? The first 2 uses appear to be misspellings.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, pebbly sandstone, conglomerate, siltstone, mudstone and breccia.

General Comments: Texas Downs Basin - mapped as Texas Downs Formation - BOW 1 : 100 000 map sheet. Also described as Mesoproterozoic. Superseded by Mount Kinahan Sandstone? or Mount Parker Formation?
Lithology Description: Well sorted thinly bedded medium grained quartz sandstone, medium to coarse sublithic arenite and minor pebble conglomerate with siltstone locally near the base; low angle cross bedding is common, and clay pellets occur on bedding planes in places

General Comments: Advised of use in unpubl.report & poss. confusion with publ. Peron Sandstone
See also Lexicon. Geological Province: Fitzroy Basin.

Name reinstated in 2016. It forms part of the Eastern Goldfields Superterrane of the Yilgarn Craton. Mount Pleasant Gabbro lies across the Bardoc and part way into the Kalgoorlie 1:100K GSWA map series sheets. To be published = GSWA digital release 2016.
Lithology Description: Gabbro to leucogabbro dominant; granophyric segregations; pyroxenite or dunite basal segregations; metamorphosed

General Comments: 1321 Ma maximum depositional age from quartzite. Buried and metamorphosed 1154 +/- 15 Ma (rutile growth: Clark et al., 2000).
Lithology Description: Quartzite, quartz-muscovite schist, quartz pebble metaconglomerate; in places contains biotite, garnet, andalusite, viridine, or sillimanite

General Comments: Southern Cross area. Map sheet area SH50-16, 2735. Poorly exposed granite with some possible gneissic component; typically deeply weathered, well defined dome structure in aeromagnetic data.To be published: GSWA 1:100,000 geological map.
Lithology Description: Poorly exposed granite with some possible gneissic component; typically deeply weathered, well defined dome structure in aeromagnetic data.

General Comments: Of Kriewaldt (1964). Type area is near Andover. Shows substantial thickness variations over short lateral distances. Formerly included in the Cooieena Basalt. Basal unit in Fortescue Group.
Lithology Description: Massive, porphyritic, vesicular, amygdaloidal and doleritic basalt; some high-Mg basalt, agglomerate, volcanic breccia, tuff, mafic wacke, shale, polymictic conglomerate and sandstone, siliceous limestone and dolomite.

General Comments: A capitalised variation of the current Mount Shea porphyry (Unit no. 72449).

Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008). See also Sholl Intrusion - unclear which name takes precedence?
Lithology Description: Gabbro, leucogabbro, serpentinised peridotite and dunite, pyroxenite, and minor anorthosite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Shown as Mt Solitaire Ssts in time space plot with a max deposition age within the 1850-1800 Ma range (~1820 Ma). Probably an informal name for sandstones in the Mount Solitaire sheet area. May be equivalent to Ware Group?
Lithology Description: Sandstone.

General Comments: See also Mount Sylvia Shale and misspelt Sylvia Formation. Ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706 give max age 2506 Ma, min age 2505 Ma, interpolated from stratigraphy, unit thicknesses and SHRIMP ages elsewhere in the succession.
Lithology Description: Mudstone, siltstone, chert, iron-formation, and dolomite.

General Comments: A revision of the Mount Thirsty Intrusion as the previous name did not comply with nomenclature protocol. To be published in GSWA series map release 2018 and explanatory notes, 2018-2020. On the Norseman map sheet. Named for Mount Thirsty. See also GSWA ENS:  SAPKOTA, J (partial report), Mount Thirsty Gabbro (A-_mx-og): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 13 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Differntiated gabbroic sill; pyroxenite to granophyre segregations;metamorphosed.
Dolomite, shale and siltstone.

General Comments: For use on map sheet SH 51-3; nearest town is Cosmo Newbury. Located in northeast corner of the Yilgarn Craton, in the Mount Venn greenstone belt. To be published in several GSWA publications in near future, including 1:100K maps and geochronological reports. This name reservation is the formalisation of previous informal nomenclature for these rocks.
Lithology Description: Thick, layered complex including gabbros, leucogabbros, layered leucogabbros and megacrystic gabbros; mafic intrusion. Metamorphosed leucodolerite; metamorphosed layered gabbro; and metamorphosed gabbro with minor pyroxenite or quartz gabbro components.

General Comments: New name added in nomenclature revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk). Intrudes Ruth Well, Regal and Cleaverville Formations.
Lithology Description: Quartz feldspar porphyry, rhyolite and dacite; chiefly intrusive; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Bentley Basin. Talbot 1:250k sheet SG52-09. To be published: Werner, M, Howard, HM, Smithies, RH, Aitken, ARA and Medlin C 2012, Mount Eveline, WA Sheet 4345: Geological Survey of Western Australia, 1:100 000 Geological Series.
Lithology Description: Flow-banded rhyolite, locally interlayered with siliciclastic diamictite, conglomerate, sandstone and siltstone, and amygdaloidal basalt.

General Comments: Co-magmatic with Pollock Hills Formation Felsic Volcanics. Ages: 1486 +/- 40Ma and 1639+/-5 Ma (SHRIMP). Warumpi Province, Arunta Orogen, North Australian Craton.
Lithology Description: Metamonzogranite, metasyenogranite, metagranodiorite and metatonalite.

General Comments: Arunta Province.  Age: ~1615Ma. Example of the Hiltaba Association.
Lithology Description: Fractionated granite, with extensive alteration effects incl: sodic-calcic, sericitic and hematite-K-feldspar in granite.

General Comments: Tambourah 1:100 000, sheet 2754. The suite is composed of several large units of metamorphosed gabbroic and leucogabbroic rocks that are intruded by much younger granitic rocks approximately 12 km northeast of Mount Webber, east Pilbara Craton. New geochronology has established that the suite contains the oldest exposed rocks of the Pilbara Craton.

Lithology Description: Carbonatite plug with mineralized lateritic cap; breccia with abundant glimmerite; locally silicified.

General Comments: Sir Samuel 1:250 000 sheet area. The Group includes the siliciclastic Maria Mine Formation (Strat No 77946), the Halfway Well Basalt (Strat No 77945), the Vivien Formation (Strat No 77944) and the Mosquito Well Conglomerate (Strat No 77948). These units occupy the Mount White Syncline on the Sir Samuel Sheet. To be published: GSWA map and explanatory notes 2013/14.

Lithology Description: Coarse quartz sandstone, feldspathic sandstone and minor arkose with abundant detrital tourmaline and zircon; generally less labile and finer grained upwards, with fine grained rippled micaceous sandstone near the top
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Essentially a sand plain (terrestrial) formation probably of aeolian origin.
Lithology Description: Mainly of red to orange quartz sand; locally sand is white. Also, sheets and wedges of white sand, ferruginised sand and root-structured sand interlayered locally with the main red sand. Trace fossils such as animal burrows, root casts.
Fine- to coarse-grained sandstone, minor mudstone; basal conglomerate

General Comments: Fitzmaurice Basin.
Lithology Description: Silica cemented quartz sandstone, minor siltstone and pebble conglomerate.

General Comments: MACDONALD 1:250 sheet SF52-14. Age based on detrital zircon signature and stratigraphic and structural constraints. Previously mapped as Ligertwood beds on the MACDONALD 250K map, but this unit is partly lithologically distinct from, and probably significantly older than, the outcrops at the Ligertwood beds type area (Ligertwood Cliffs) on the MOUNT RENNIE 250K sheet in NT (inferred to be late Paleozoic). The main outcrops of this new unit, and its proposed type area are in or near the Mu Hills in WA. Published in GSWA Record 2015/8, yet to be indexed.
Lithology Description: Cobble and boulder conglomerate is  dominant; Sandstone with interbeds of conglomeratic sandstone locally;  minor siltstone.

General Comments: Stated to be of the Kwinana Group (Abeysinghe 2003) but this is probably not correct?
Lithology Description: Chalky calcrete/limestone, lacustrine

General Comments: See also Lexicon. SG50-1.
Lithology Description: Light to medium grey siltstone and soft pyritic mudstone.
Sandstone, mudstone and conglomerate; fluvial.

General Comments: probably supersedes the Mudong Member?  Need confirmation.

After Mueller Range. Part of Lennard Shelf reef complexes. Elma 1:100 000 sheet area (Mt Ramsay 250k).  Name for an isolated conglomerate body east of the Margaret Embayment, previously shown as Elma Conglomerate (Tyler et al. 1998).
Lithology Description: Large cobble and boulder conglomerate.

General Comments: The name Muggamurra Suite had been reserved in 2009 for publication in 2010, but this name appears to have been used instead. To be updated to Muggamurra Dolerite Suite in 2014 [advice from GSWA Dec 2013], but to revert back to Muggamurra Dolerite in 2018 [advice from GSWA]. Dolerite and gabbro dykes; east-northeast to east-southeast trending; arcuate dyke swarm.  in the Murgoo to Glengarry 1:250 000 map sheet areas.See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD (partial report), Muggamurra Dolerite (P_-MMug-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 09 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite and gabbro dykes; east-northeast to east-southeast trending; arcuate dyke swarm.

General Comments: To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Mug's Luck Bore, Ninghan 1:100k sheet area. 29deg12'S, 117deg1'E. Type area adjacent to Carlaminda Hsd. Probably time-equivalent to the Lordy Basalt Member of the Meekatharra Formation in the northern Murchison Domain, but subtle differences in lava types and abundances warrants a separate formation. Previously included as a member of the Murrouli Basalt, now shown as part of the Yalgoo Formation in the Yalgoo 1:100 000 sheet, 2015.
Lithology Description: Thick sequence of pyroxene spinifex textured basalt flows; minor interlayered sedimentary and volcaniclastic rocks; widely metamorphosed to serpentinite

General Comments: WAROX data suggest that the Muir Hills intrusion (G1) dips to the north at approximately 75 degrees. Thickness of pluton unknown. Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).
Supersedes Muja Member and includes rocks from Cardiff Member and parts of Collieburn Member. Thickness: ~450m.
Lithology Description: Contains 9 main coal seams with intercalated conglomerate-sandstone-siltstone.

General Comments: For a report on the Bonaparte and Ord Basins.
See also Mulgabbie Formation.
Age: c.2934 Ma Part of Shaw Granitoid Complex Possibly same unit as Mulgandinnah Adamellite?
Lithology Description: Fine- to medium-grained, magnetite-bearing biotite monzogranite, locally with orthogneiss blocks; weakly foliated.

General Comments: Maximum age from  a single detrital zircon grain.
Lithology Description: Fine to medium grained quartz sandstone, locally glauconitic, shale and minor carbonate bands.

General Comments: To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015.  Named after Mulgine Hill, Rothsay 1:100k map sheet area. 29deg11'S, 116deg59'E. Type area Mount Mulgine. Intrusive into top-Norie Group and base-Polelle Group supracrustal rocks.
Lithology Description: Muscovite metamonzogranite, biotite-metagranodiorite and hornblende metatonalite phases. Host to Mo-W mineralization. Locally strongly deformed.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File SE/52-5. See also misspelling Mulkerrins Granite.
Lithology Description: White coarse and even grained leucocratic granite, syenogranite, monzogranite, tourmaline muscovite aplite and quartz feldspar pegmatite

General Comments: See also Mullaloo Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Poorly sorted, fine- to very coarse-grained, pale brownish-green, slightly glauconitic and clayey sand.
Algal limestone- nodules of calcareous red algae in a matrix of foraminiferal calcarenite.

General Comments: To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Mullewa town. Type area 5 km east of Wurarga Hsd. Metamorphosed 'basement' unit, no known older units in region.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed granitic to tonalitic rocks; typically gneissic

General Comments: Yilgarn Craton. To be published: Geological Survey of Western Australia online Explanatory Notes Database 2015. Probably only a part of the granitoid complex.
Lithology Description: Biotite monzogranite and granodiorite

General Comments: See also Lexicon.  See also Mullingarra Complex. Deposition age = Paleoproterozoic (~2200 Ma).  Metamorphism = Neoproterozoic (~1060 Ma)
Lithology Description: Quartzo-feldspathic, semi-pelitic and pelitic gneiss; granoblastic texture common; minor pegmatite and granitic segregation; includes lenses of quartzite and amphibolite

General Comments: Intrudes Apex Basalt and Duffer Formation. Formerly of the Munganbrina Suite of Collins (1983, 1993). In area of the Mount Edgar Granitoid Complex.
Lithology Description: Medium-grained, grey biotite-hornblende granodiorite; weakly foliated.
Algal dolomite, quartz arenite.

General Comments: Supersedes Mumba Pelite. See RefID 66299 Explanatory Notes for the Gascoyne Province p57-58.
Lithology Description: Quartzofeldspathic psammitic schist commonly with chloritoid; local minor pelitic schist and quartzite

General Comments: Within the Bentley Supergroup, Bentley Basin. Previously of Tollu Group until it was split up. In ref 69153 (2012), age: inherited zircons 1186+/-7 Ma (SHRIMP-B, 207Pb/206Pb).
Lithology Description: A stack of individual 1-5m thick flow units, from amygdaloidal basalt, basaltic andesite (the majority), to andesite. Locally, slightly migmatized to gneiss with alternating layers dominated by fine-grained amphibole or coarser-grained epidote.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Contains lepidodendroid plants and Bothreolepis fish fauna. Max. thickness: 4450ft. Replaced by the Munabia Formation due to greater shale proportion (Mory and Yasin, 1999), but subsequently changed back to Munabia Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Well sorted, fine- to coarse-grained sandstone with minor siltstone conglomerate and dolomite.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain.  Age: 2670Ma.
Lithology Description: Granodiorite with minor monzogranite, diorite and microgranite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Formerly Savory Group, Savory Basin.  For the location of one of the type areas see Bullen Explan Notes (1995). Age: ~800Ma.
Lithology Description: Fine to coarse sandstone, conglomerate and siltstone with minor shale and mudstone displaying a wide variety of shallow water sedimentary structures.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File G/50-1.

Lithology Description: Light-medium grey and medium-grained granite.

General Comments: Previously Mundine Well dyke swarm of Wingate and Giddings (2000). Intrudes all the stratigraphic units in Gascoyne Province, and Wyloo Group, Capricorn Group and Bangemall Supergroup. Cuts across dykes of Narimbunna and Kulkatharra Dolerites (Gascoyne Province Explan. notes, 2010) and extends across the Pilbara Craton. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD and Blay, OA (partial report), Mundine Well Dolerite (P_-_mw-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 06 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite dykes, sills, and small intrusions with locally abundant xenoliths and potassic alteration of wallrocks; includes minor quartz diorite, syenite, tonalite, and biotite monzogranite.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. SG50-1.
Lithology Description: Quartz arenite and quartz wacke, locally bioturbated.
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Oldest and largest pluton of the Mount Edgar Granitoid Complex area. Intrudes Mount Ada Basalt and intruded by Chimingadgi Trondjhemite.
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained, biotite monzogranite and granodiorite.
Medium-grained, equigranular, two-mica monzogranite; massive.  Low Ca granite.

General Comments: Satirist 1:100k sheet area. Replaces Kangan Granite/Kangan Adamellite.
Lithology Description: Biotite-bearing monzogranite and syenogranite; weakly foliated to massive; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Gas reservoir for Pemberton Field.
Lithology Description: A thick fluvio-deltaic succession of sandstone, claystone and minor coal; shoreline sandstone, shallow marine claystone and minor limestone in the upper part.

General Comments: Age: c.2940Ma (Nelson 2000). Exposed on SATIRIST.
Lithology Description: Hornblende (-biotite)-bearing granodiorite and monzogranite with greenstone and granitoid gneiss rafts and xenoliths.

General Comments: Moora SH50-10, Badgingarra 2037.  A polymict breccia comprising a mixture of fragments derived from the underlying Jurassic and Cretaceous sedimentary rocks set in a fine-grained clastic matrix. The fragments range in size from a few centimetres to several metres and are typically composed of sandstone, quartzite, grey siltstone, conglomerate and fragments that have been completely weathered to clay. The matrix of the breccia has a distinctive green colour due to the presence of glauconite. To be published = GSWA Explanatory Notes Database.
Lithology Description: A polymict breccia comprising a mixture of fragments derived from the underlying Jurassic and Cretaceous sedimentary rocks set in a fine-grained glauconitic clastic matrix.

General Comments: Albany-Fraser Orogen.  Interleaved with metagabbro and pyroxene granulite of the Fraser Complex. Previously considered part of the Biranup Complex, now Northern Foreland [2009].
Lithology Description: Amphibolite-granulite facies orthogneisses, interlayered with lenses of metamorphosed mafic rocks; minor jaspilite, amphibolitic schist, serpentinite, and metamorphosed ultramafic rocks.
Conglomerates and clays
Multicoloured claystone.

General Comments: Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008). See also information on the Munni Munni Complex. Part of the Sisters Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Gabbro, leucogabbro, serpentinised peridotite and dunite, pyroxenite, and minor anorthosite; metamorphosed. Contains platinum-group elements, nickel and copper mineralisation.
Thinly bedded, planar-laminated siltstone, dolomitic siltstone, dolostone, with interbedded dolomitic sandstone and quartz sandstone.

General Comments: Informal unit for the Surface Geology of WA, 1:1 million scale.  Equivalent to Depositional Package 3 of the Edmund Group (GSWA 500K Solid Geology GIS, 2008)
Lithology Description: Siltstone and mudstone; sandstone, dolostone, minor conglomerate

General Comments: Murraba Basin, Centralian Superbasin. See also misspelt Munya Sandstone (refid 67163). Conservative max depositional age of 1155+/-14 Ma, although age of deposition known to be much younger based on correlation with Lewis Range Sandstone (which may not be correct). Previously considered part of Redcliff Pound Group. Revised by Haines and Allen (2016, in prep.), who assigned the Lewis Range, Muriel Range and Munyu Sandstones to lower Supersequence 1, while the  remaining Redcliff Pound Group rocks are now considered to be Supersequence 3-4. See 2017 redefinition of  Redcliff Pound Group. For more information see: Haines, P.W., Allen, H.J. 2016. The Murraba Basin: another piece of the Centralian Superbasin jigsaw puzzle falls into place IN GSWA 2016 extended abstracts: promoting the prospectivity of Western Australia: Geological Survey of Western Australia, Record 2016/2, p. 31-35.
Lithology Description: Shallow marine to emergent, partly conglomeratic quartz sandstone with planar crossbeds, asymmetric ripples, and reverse and normal grading;  minor grit, breccia, shale, siltstone, limestone and chert; weakly folded.

General Comments: Ages, relations, lithology updated from GA Timescales Project Feb 2009 and acreage release package 2015. Age range varies in different parts of Carnarvon Basin. In Dampier Sub-basin age is ~187-175Ma (Pliensbachian to Aalenian)
Lithology Description: Thinly-bedded shelfal siltstone, claystone and marl.

General Comments: Previously comprised Luke Creek, and Mount Farmer Groups (2 subgroups and 17 formations); the new scheme defines the Supergroup as comprising 3 Groups - Norie, Polelle and Glen Groups (2008).
Lithology Description: Volcanic, and clastic and chemical metasedimentary rocks; includes subvolcanic layered mafic-ultramafic intrusions; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Probably replaces Murgoo gneiss.
Lithology Description: Heterogeneous: pegmatite-banded, generally fine-grained orthogneiss (after granite with pegmatite veins); medium- to coarse-grained, leucocratic biotite granite (intrudes the gneiss).

General Comments: Age: ~800Ma. Previously considered part of Redcliff Pound Group. Revised by Haines and Allen (2016, in prep.), who assigned the Lewis Range, Muriel Range and Munyu Sandstones to lower Supersequence 1, while the  remaining Redcliff Pound Group rocks are now considered to be Supersequence 3-4. See 2017 redefinition of  Redcliff Pound Group.
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone, grit, conglomerate, breccia, shale, siltstone, limestone and chert

General Comments: Published in GSWA Tanami - Arunta geological information series 2018 update. Within the Murraba Basin succession. Also Subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Undivided siliciclastic and carbonate rocks.

General Comments: For recent update see: Haines, P.W., Allen, H.J. 2016. The Murraba Basin: another piece of the Centralian Superbasin jigsaw puzzle falls into place IN GSWA 2016 extended abstracts: promoting the prospectivity of Western Australia: Geological Survey of Western Australia, Record 2016/2, p. 31-35.
Lithology Description: Sandstone-sublithic and quartz arenite and thin interbeds of chert granule to pebble conglomerate; minor siltstone, shale and dolomite.
Fine-grained to weakly porphyritic dolerite.

General Comments: See also the informal Murray Range Layered Intrusion. Will become part of the West Hinckley Suite (formerly Giles Suite 2).
Lithology Description: Pyroxenite/Peridotite/Gabbro.

General Comments: Comprises the mafic and ultramafic volcanic rocks referred to as the 'Murrin greenstones' by Stewart (2004) and by Hill et al (2001, GSWA Record 2001/10) as the 'Murrin Murrin komatiite complex'. See also Murin Murin Complex, published 2004.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed basalt, ultramafic rocks and minor sediments.

General Comments: See also Murrouli Formation, Muroulli Basalt and Murroulli dolerite. Parts intruded by Nannine Tonalite. Geological province: Murchison Domain. A dolerite sill that intrudes this unit has been dated at c. 2792 +/- 2 Ma.
Lithology Description: A thick succession of pillowed and massive tholeiitic basalt (high-Mg), metamorphosed to amphibolite and upper greenschist facies.

General Comments: Frequently used as a structural or geological province term. GSWA Report 106 (2010, p2) states the Mesoproterozoic to Neoproterozoic Musgrave Province, in central Australia, was previously referred to in Western Australia as the Musgrave Complex (Myers et al.1996).
Lithology Description: Metasedimentary and meta-igneous rocks.
Granulite grade felsic gneiss, mafic granulite, intermediate granulite, pelitic gneiss, staurolite-bearing felsic gneiss, and metagranite

General Comments: Unit to be used for Northern Territory and Western Australia 1:1 million geological maps, National Maps Project.
Lithology Description: Garnetiferous granulite-facies metamorphosed early-syntectonic granites, tonalitic biotite gneiss, granitic gneiss, clinopyroxene-hornblende gneiss, porphyritic orthopyroxene granite

Stratigraphic Name: Musgravian gneiss - quartzite, schist, porphyry, basalt
General Comments: Used in Surface Geology of Australia, 1:1,000,000 scale - Western Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Quartzite, quartz schist, porphyry, basalt

General Comments: East Kimberley region
Lithology Description: Medium- to fine-grained weakly porphyritic biotite monzogranite.

General Comments: Unconformable on Tims Thicket Limestone; unconformable below Kooallup Limestone. Restricted to Yalgorup Plain.
Lithology Description: Structureless grey to white quartz sand, mainly fine to med.sand, poorly sorted; progressively more iron-stained towards top of unit; minor feldspar

General Comments: Wallaringa and Wodgina 1:100 000 sheets.
Lithology Description: Biotite-muscovite monzogranite; locally with quartz and K-feldspar phenocrysts; massive to weakly foliated; metamorphosed.
Fine-grained, equigranular biotite monzogranite.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. SG50-6. Defn on Tech File G/50-5.
Lithology Description: Micritic limestone and calcreted mudstone; lacustrine

General Comments: Formerly "Lake Collie Beds" of Maitland (1919).
Lithology Description: Weakly lithified claystone, conglomerate and sandstone in upward-fining cycle; cross-bedded, fluviatile sands.

General Comments: See also Nalbia Formation, Norton Greywacke, Lexicon. Previously recognised in Ruby 1 (Mills, 1997), but this interval now (2000) assigned to Abdul Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Quartz wacke, bioturbated and fossiliferous, contains ferruginous concretions.

General Comments: Precambrian. West Pilbara.  Age: >3.1Ga. Within the Pilbara Supergroup - in the West Pilbara Superterrane
Lithology Description: Basalt, with minor ultramafic, felsic, and sedimentary units; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Defined (1968). Of Kriewaldt and Ryan (1967), GSWA used the abbreviated version  - Nallanaring Member - for a few years, but appear to have returned to the original name in 2003.
Lithology Description: Includes felsic, as well as basaltic, lavas and pyroclastic rocks.
Porphyritic granite; low-Ca granite.

General Comments: Graptolites, trilobites, brachiopods, conodonts and gastropod fossils present. Gas indicated in low porosity sandstones. Formally defined by Playford & others (1975).  Definition information copied from BMR Bull 210 (1981).
Lithology Description: Sandstones, interbedded shales, limestones and dolomites.

General Comments: Lithological Descriptor = aeolian calcarenite. Map Sheet = 1936. Nearest Town = Cervantes. Brief description = Fine to coarse grained well sorted aeolianite, yellow coloured, poorly to well cemented, and with distinctive cross-bedding. Mineralogy: carbonate, quartz, feldspar. Deposited in Marine Isotope Stage 11. To be published = This year (2014) in Australian Journal of Earth Sciences
Lithology Description: Consists of an eolian calcarenite/calcrete-microbialite/paleosol cycle.

General Comments: Hosts the Cloud Break and Christmas Creek iron ore deposits; dominantly martite-goethite supergene enrichment. Ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Yellow-weathering chert, cherty BIF, some shale bands.

General Comments: Age is Aldingan.
Lithology Description: Friable limestone.

General Comments: Of Flamingo Group, Northern Bonaparte Basin.

Reserved by: L. Bagas and M. J. Van Kranendonk
Lithology Description: An elliptical body of fine- to coarse-grained, equigranular biotite granodiorite, with lesser tonalite and monzogranite

General Comments: See also Lexicon. (Clarke et al., 1951).  In the Northern Perth Basin.
Lithology Description: Tillite, shale, tillitic sandstone, conglomerate; continental to marine.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain. Part of the Annean Supersuite. Cross-cuts through Norie Group.
Lithology Description: Metatonalite, characterised by white-weathering appearance and an equigranular to weakly feldspar-porphyritic texture with 15-20% hornblende.
Coarse- to fine-grained, variably sorted, thin-bedded sandstone; minor siltstone and claystone; local basal conglomerate.
Planar-laminated siltstone and thin- to medium-bedded quartz sandstone; thin lenses of pebble conglomerate.

General Comments: Previously included in Winning Group, but not by 2002. Appears to be in part lateral equivalent to Birdrong Sandstone and other Winning Group units, in part lateral equivalent to Yarraloola Conglomerate and Barrow Group.
Lithology Description: Shale, ferruginous and glauconitic quartz sandstone, siltstone, micaceous siltstone; poorly sorted conglomerate.

General Comments: Informal combination of units for map scale. Age from biostratigraphy.
Lithology Description: Poorly sorted sandstone (in places glauconitic), cobble to boulder conglomerate, and siltstone.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Interfingers with Windjana Limestone.
Lithology Description: Fossiliferous, shallow marine reef complex marginal slope and basin facies, red yellow and light grey silty calcarenite interbedded with siltstone, shale/calcirudite and sandstone.

General Comments: Glenburgh 1:250 000 sheet area, SG50-6, Gascoyne region.
Lithology Description: Foliated, equigranular to porphyritic, medium grained biotite metatonalite and metaquartz diorite, with abundant small mafic clots; minor leucocratic tonalite and granodiorite.
Biotite Monzogranite.

General Comments: Southern Cross area. Map sheet area SH50-16, 2735. Biotite monzogranite; fine to coarse grained; K-feldspar-phyric. To be published: GSWA 1:100,000 geological map.
Lithology Description: Medium-grained biotite monzogranite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: For use on PEEDAWARRA 1:100K map sheet SF 5014 and others. Nearest town: Paraburdoo. Sills intrude Edmund Group.  Age: ~1465Ma. Uncertain whether or not this unit should be considered part of the Bangemall Supergroup.
Lithology Description: Amphibolite; most are fine-grained rocks with a polygonal texture, comprising hornblende, plagioclase, quartz and titanomagnetite.

Reserved by: Moeskops, P.G.,  revised Van Kranendonk, M. 2008
General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain.  Age: approx. 2780Ma. Part of the Annean Supersuite. See also informal Narndee gabbro.
Lithology Description: Pyroxene peridotite grading into orthopyroxenite; chromitite; serpentinite; gabbronorite; troctolite; metagabbronorite and metagabbro; schistose amphibolite; hornblende gabbro.

General Comments: See definition for Narracoota Volcanics. Corresponds in part to Narracoota Volcanics. Includes the former Trillbar complex of Myers (1990). Includes a pyrite with a Pb-Pb isochron  of 1922 +/- 35 Ma (Windh, 1992): may be the date of mineralisation, not deposition.
Lithology Description: Basalt with local pillow structures and hyaloclastite, dolerite sills which are commonly rhythmically layered, peridotite, pyroxenite, and leuco- meso- and melano-gabbro; mafic and ultramafic schist, minor jasperoidal chert, and local volcaniclastics.

General Comments: Dated 4270 Ma from detrital zircon
Lithology Description: Gneiss, amphibolite, quartzite, schist, meta-BIF.

General Comments: Previously mapped (Dunn, 1963a,b,c) as Mount Birch Sst, Kookaburra Creek Fm and Yalwarra Volcanic Mbr (McArthur Group).  Differences in lithology have led to redefinition to comprise Mt Birch Sst, Knuckey Fm, Yalwarra Volcs and Walmudga Fm. Age:< 1640 Ma. Radiometric ages from ?tuffite in Balbirini Dolostone (middle of Group).
Lithology Description: Cyclic coarse-grained evaporitic-stromatolitic-ooidal dolostone, sandstone, siltstone; minor conglomerate; synsedimentary basaltic sills, sandstone, mudstone

General Comments: An ?accidental capitalised variation of Navajo sandstone. GSWA intends to formalise this unit [advice from Charlotte Hall 28-JUN-2013]. Detrital zircons 2657 +/- 4 Ma.
Lithology Description: Coarse-grained, quartz-rich, typically well-sorted sandstone with minor conglomerate containing felsic clasts.

General Comments: Lake Lefroy 1:100k sheet area. Biotite monzogranite. To be published = East Yilgarn 2013-14 update, Geological Survey of Western Australia digital product
Lithology Description: Biotite monzogranite
Partly stromatolitic dolomite, limestone and chert with minor quartzite

General Comments: Mentioned as parent unit. Age assumed from constituents. No other data. Includes Hercules Gneiss.

Uncapitalised variation of Nebo-Babel Intrusion. Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).
Lithology Description: Gabbronorites, hosting orthomagmatic Cu-Ni-PGE mineralization.
Interbedded fine to medium grained, micaceous, poorly sorted, thin to medium bedded sandstone interbedded with fissile, in part sandy and silty, shale.

General Comments: Not same as Negri Volcanics. Of the Goose Hole Group. Includes: Headleys Limestone, Nelson Shale, Linnekar Limestone, Panton Formation.
Lithology Description: Micritic and stromatolitic limestone and chert; siltstone, calcareous mudstone; minor feldspathic sandstone.

General Comments: Age updated by I.Sweet.
Lithology Description: Fine- to medium-grained, weakly porphyritic monzogranite

General Comments: King Leopold Orogen.
Lithology Description: Foliated medium grained hornblende biotite tonalite, diorite, and granodiorite, with minor pegmatite; chloritic schist and quartz veining associated with shears and along contacts

General Comments: Originally reserved as Nelsons Rocks Formation in 1987 and subsequently used informally for offshore Canning Basin Cretaceous unit.
Of the Negri Subgroup (Goose Hole Group).
Lithology Description: Maroon and grey gypsiferous shale and mudstone, minor sandstone, laminated limestone.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset. [Note: numerical Min Age = Cambrian in both AGSO 1996 and GTS 2004. CEB Feb-2012]
Lithology Description: Medium-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with amphibolite-facies assemblages; may have a greenschist overprint

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic intrusive rocks.  Range in composition from alkali feldspar granite to tonalite; includes associated rocks such as migmatite and minor gabbro and diorite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic intrusive rocks.  Range in composition from alkali feldspar granite to tonalite; includes associated rocks such as migmatite and minor gabbro and diorite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: In refID 72034. (GSWA (2016). 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology of Western Australia.  Also Subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, minor siltstone and conglomerate.
Biotite (-tourmaline)-bearing leucogranite; unfoliated.

General Comments: Albany 1:1 mill sheet area.

After Never Can Tell Bore. Map Sheet: SH51-1,  Wildara 3041. Basalt; fine-grained with local pyroxene-spinifex texture; includes fine-grained metamafic rock . To be published = GSWA geological map and explanatory notes, 2013/2014.
Lithology Description: Basalt; fine-grained with local pyroxene-spinifex texture; includes fine-grained metamafic rock.

General Comments: East Kimberly Region. Published 1992 GSWA Angelo 1:100 000 sheet. Also GSWA Rec 1995/4.  Age: 1865-1850Ma. Intrudes the Marboo Formation.
Lithology Description: Medium to fine grained biotite granodiorite and tonalite and minor monzogranite; abundant metasedimentary inclusions near contact.

General Comments: Local name.
Lithology Description: Medium to very coarse-grained, locally pebbly to cobbly quartzofeldspathic sandstone.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Yellow-grey, sandy or clayey limestone, rarely grading into calcareous sandstone.

General Comments: See also Newtown Felsic Formation and misspelling - Newton Felsic Formation.
Briefly described

Rason 1:250k map sheet area. The Ngarrutji Monzogranite is a 2659 Ma pluton (GSWA SHRIMP age) in the northeast corner of the Yilgarn Craton. The biotite monzogranite intruded the folded greenstones of the Mount Venn greenstone belt, but is in turn cut by the shear zone that runs along the eastern side of the Mount Venn Igneous Complex. The name is derived from the Ngaanyatjarra name for Thatchers Soak. To be published in the very near future in several GSWA publications, including 1:100 000 maps and geochronology reports.
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained monzogranite with biotite and local hornblende; minor granodiorite; local pegmatite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: SE52-9, Mount Ramsey.
Lithology Description: Siltstone with dropstones from pebble to boulder size of granite, basalt, limestone; minor sandstone.

General Comments: Yilgarn Craton. Updating name to current terminology. To be published: Geological Survey of Western Australia online Explanatory Notes Database 2015
Lithology Description: Mafic igneous complex containing gabbronorite, dolerite, anorthositic gabbro and quartz diorite; metamorphosed

General Comments: Reserved as Niagara. To be replaced by Niagara Igneous Complex [reserved SEP-2014].

Lithology Description: Grey, calcareous and less commonly dolomitic, mudstone locally grading to silty and argillaceous limestone and less commonly dolomite, with rare sandstone interbeds; minor halite; anhydrite is common.

General Comments: Age: <3.3Ga.  In the Pilbara Craton, West Pilbara Superterrane. Within the Pilbara Supergroup. Advised by Hickman, Apr 2014 that the Nickol River Formation is separated from the Roebourne Group by a regional unconformity, so is removed from the Roebourne Group (Hickman and Smithies, in prep.).
Lithology Description: Chert, banded iron-formation, carbonate and ferruginous clastic sedimentary rocks, quartzite, conglomerate, felsic volcanic and intrusive rocks.

General Comments: Variably contains heavy minerals including ilmenite, zircon and rutile that form an orebody known as the Coburn heavy mineral sands or the 'Amy Zone'.
Lithology Description: Red sand. Grading from sandy calcarenite adjoining the coast to quartz sand further inland.
Siltstone, shale, sandstone and dolomite. Deformed, low-grade metasedimentary rocks.

General Comments: Cuts the southern part of the Southern Cross Domain and Southwest Terrane of the South Yilgarn Craton. E-SE trending. Mafic dykes; west-northwesterly trending, variably magnetic; some exceeding 400 km in length; mostly interpreted from aeromagnetic data. GSWA preliminary age (data soon to be published) of 735 Ma (GSWA number 199025. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD and Spaggiari, CV (partial report), Nindibillup Dolerite (P_-_nd-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 06 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite/gabbro in outcrop.

General Comments: Cuts the southern part of the Southern Cross Domain and Southwest Terrane of the South Yilgarn Craton. E-SE trending. Strongly magnetic to non-magnetic; may correlate with Early Cambrian dykes in the western Albany-Fraser Orogen. Mafic. Age unknown but crosscuts major structures of Albany-Fraser Orogen, so post-dates Stage II (1215-1140) and may correlate with Early Cambrian dykes in the western Albany-Fraser Orogen. Composition largely unknown.
Lithology Description: Mafic.
Coarse-grained, porphyritic, biotite-bearing monzogranite; High Ca granite.
White to grey and partly epidotised quartzite, conglomeratic diamictite, phyllite and phyllitic siltstone, amygdaloidal basalt, chlorite schist, and minor meta-tuff and meta-rhyolite.
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

Stratigraphic Name: Ninety Seven Mile Formation and Elimberrie Formation
General Comments: In refID 72034. (GSWA (2016). 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology of Western Australia. Informal grouping of units suitable for map scale. Oscar Range Sub-basin, Louisa Basin.  Also Subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, diamictite, siltstone, limestone, phyllite, quartzite, metabasalt, metatuff, and metarhyolite.
Limestone reef complexes; cyanobacterial limestone, limestone breccia, shale and sandstone.

General Comments: To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Ninghan Hsd, Ninghan 1:100k sheet area. 29deg 25'S 117deg17'E. Type area: peripheral areas of Mount Singleton. Intrusive into the base of the Singleton Basalt Member sequence.
Lithology Description: Pyroxenite and minor peridotite at the base of the intrusion with gabbro, leucogabbro, and dolerite towards the top; metamorphosed.
Light grey to grey-green and red-brown claystone and siltstone with minor argillaceous limestone and sandstone.

General Comments: Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).
Lithology Description: Coarse-grained serpentinite after peridotite, minor metapyroxenite.

General Comments: Within the Norseman greenstones region.  Revised from Noganyer Group?
Lithology Description: Characterised by persistent BIF layers within clastic, partly felsic sedimentary rocks.
Interbedded sandstone, siltstone and shale; minor coal with minor shallow-marine limestone.

General Comments: Age: <830 Ma (poor age constraints) [form 1999 reference]. Considered Cryogeniain in 2005, 2009.
Lithology Description: Thinly bedded to massive dolomite and limestone; minor thinly bedded fine to coarse sandstone and siltstone with interbedded pebbly sandstone, siltstone, shale commonly weathering red-purple

General Comments: See also the informal Noondeeing gneiss.
Probably supersedes Noondine Member?
Lithology Description: Silicified, bedded, carbonate unit.

General Comments: Probable variation of reserved name Noongal Igneous Complex.
Lithology Description: Gabbro and dolerite; metamorphosed. Also, leucogabbro, serpentinite and tremolite-rich ultramafic schist (derived from intrusive rocks), metapyroxenite and metaperidotite.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Formerly known as the Noonkanbah Series (of Wade, 1937). Canning Basin. Gas prone.
Lithology Description: Marine fossiliferous calcareous and micaceous mudstone, siltstone and shale with limestone and fine to medium grained sandstone interbeds and minor granule conglomerate lenses.

General Comments: SG50-8, Peak Hill. A hill  and a pool in the northern part of the Doolgunna 1:100 K map sheet .Of the Karalundi Formation; ca 1.9 Ga Bryah Basin. These rocks formerly included in the Narracoota Formation, but field and petrographic evidence make it clear that these rocks do not belong in the Narracoota Fm. Basaltic hyaloclastite lavas,associated volcaniclastics, and dolerite sills intruding turbidite facies sedimentary rocks. To be published  in Australian Journal of Earth Sciences
Lithology Description: Basaltic hyaloclastite and dolerite

General Comments: For use in the complete revision of the Murchison Domain lithostratigraphy; to be published in GSWA Annual Review 2007-2008. Replaces the originally reserved, but unpublished, Norie Basalt (Watkins, 1987).
Lithology Description: Mafic schist after volcanic rock; metamorphosed BIF locally with recrystallised quartz and magnetite, moderately deformed;metamorphosed, moderately well-bedded volcaniclastic sandstone to siltstone of rhyolitic to dacitic affinity.

General Comments: After Norseman Limestone of Gregory (1916).
Lithology Description: Fossiliferous marine carbonate.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Probably an informal name for kimberlites found in the North Kimberley region.

Lithology Description: Biotite monzogranite; equigranular to weakly porphyritic.
Interbedded sandstones and shales, generally coarsening-up, and clean blocky 20 to 30 m thick sandstones with sharp boundaries and poorly defined fining-upwards character.

General Comments: After North Royal open pit at Norseman, where type section exposed. In article 64340 (Geology of Yardina...2008), p26,31, Clarke et al., 2003, shows that the North Royal Formation supersedes Lower Werrillup Formation and Pidinga Formation (misspelt Pindinga).
Lithology Description: Non-marine to marginal-marine, fluviodeltaic to estuarine sediments:quartz sands, clay and lignite

General Comments: Originally referred to 3 zoned granitic units of Shaw Granitic Complex (North Shaw Tonalite, Coolyia Granodiorite +an unnamed leucogranite). More recent mapping+SHRIMP show the leucogranite is not related - now named Pilga Leucogranite(Van Kranendonk 2006
Lithology Description: Contains tonalites, granodiorites and diorites.

General Comments: Card. In press according to DL1980.  Within the Shaw Granitoid Complex.
Lithology Description: Meta hornblende tonalite to diorite; equigranular, with local plagioclase phenocrysts.

General Comments: Comprises informally named sections (from base): Lower Ultramafics, Main Basalt, Thin Chert, Middle Ultramafics, Green Diorite Sills, Clastic Sediments, Upper Extrusives grading up into Big Chert (McPhee Fm). Within the Warrawoona Gp. (Pilbara Supergroup). Base age from Ar/Ar dating of hornblende in pyroxenite lens (van Koolwijk, 2001, AGSO-GA Record 2001/37 p102).
Lithology Description: Chert, basalt and dolerite, amphibolite and amphibolite schist, mafic volcanic rock, iron-formation with local quartz sandstone, komatiitic basalt: all metamorphosed.

General Comments: Intrudes the Tozer Formation (Whundo Group). Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).. Part of the Sisters Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Mafic layered intrusion. Gabbro, pyroxenite, and dolerite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: See GA datasets.
Lithology Description: Porphyritic granite - includes contaminated facies (largely marginal)

General Comments: Dolerite dyke; northeast-trending. Northampton 250k. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD (partial report), Northampton Dolerite (P_-_no-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 06 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite dyke.

General Comments: Name is possibly not current.  Mapped as part of the Tickalara metamorphics in GSWA 500K solid geology GIS (2008).
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed gabbro: clinopyroxene-orthopyroxene-magnetite-plagioclase-quartz(-hornblende-biotite) mafic granulite

General Comments: The term "Nullagine" was formerly used as Series or Beds to refer to rocks of the Fortescue Group; it is now used to refer to basin fill in Mosquito Creek Basin and comprises Coondamar and Mosquito Creek Formations.
Lithology Description: Psammite and pelite, interbedded.

General Comments: Age of base dated at 2775 Ma. 2772-2725 Ma.
Defined (1981). Also interfingers with Windjana Limestone. Oil recovered from this unit, likely sourced from Gogo Formation. Sealed by Fairfield Group shale.
Lithology Description: Well-bedded cyanobacterial  fenestral, oolitic, and pelloidal limestone; locally dolomitized, sandy, and conglomeratic. Includes an unnamed unit of conglomerate, sandstone and siltstone in the Larrawa (Red Bluffs) area.

General Comments: Most recent publications (2001-2003) suggest Middle Miocene to Early Pliocene age. Fowler 1:250 000 digital edition 2015 says Eocene-Miocene. Previously of Eucla Group.
Lithology Description: Limestone, bioclastic, micritic. Subtidal, platformal, above fair weather wave-base. Includes large benthic foraminifera and aragonitic material; well-cemented.

General Comments: See also Numbana Granite (DEFINED).
Lithology Description: Porphyritic to equigranular muscovite-biotite monzogranite, leucogranite; weakly foliated to massive; contains xenoliths and rafts of greenstone, granodiorite and other granitoids; local garnet-bearing pegmatite and granite dykes
Marine to fluvial siltstone, sandstone, plus basalt and dolerite sills.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. SG50-6. Defn on Tech. File F/50-13. Equivalent to the Moogooloo Sandstone.
Originally Nura-Nura Limestone of Wade (1937). See also the misspelt Nurra Nurra Member.
Lithology Description: Calcareous fine sandstone; mudstone, thin bedded, ripple marked, wavy and flaser bedding, bioturbated, fossiliferous.
Greensand, glauconitic sandstone and sandy siltstone.

General Comments: Gascoyne Province. Shown as -Pgml, -Pgmb & part of -Pgmt, -Pgbl on Winning Pool-Minilya 1:250k map sheet.
Ruby Plains 1:100 000 sheet area. Defined as Adelaidean age.
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone and lithic sandstone; minor siltstone and conglomerate.

General Comments: Of  O'Callaghan's Supersuite. I-type (granodioritic) Minyari type reduced granite. Age: ~625Ma. Geological province: Paterson Province. May have been upgraded to O'Callaghans Suite?
Lithology Description: Syenogranite.

General Comments: Divided into 2 suites: Mount Crofton Suite (oxidised) and O'Callaghans Suite (reduced). See also misspelling O'Callaghan's Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Equigranular even and medium-grained monzogranite to syenogranite which commonly grade into coarse porphyritic textures. Granite compositions are extremely variable.

General Comments: Age: c.1835Ma. Min depositional age 1834+/-3 Ma (felsic volcanics in Valentine Siltstone, higher in Speewah Group).
Lithology Description: An overall fining-upward succession of poorly-sorted, coarse-grained, quartz-rich sandstone, lithic sandstone, pebbly sandstone, granule to pebble conglomerate, and chloritic siltstone and claystone.

General Comments: Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).
Lithology Description: Gabbro; relict cumulate texture; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Defined 1966.
Lithology Description: Lacustrine carbonate deposits; limestone and calcareous sandstone; includes undivided variously silicified limestone, silty limestone, calcareous sandstone, siltstone and marl.

General Comments: Defined in RedID: 50188. Reserved as Oldham Formation.  Oldham Inlier (outlier of the Bangemall Basin?)
Lithology Description: Silicified quartz sandstone, some pebbly lenses; trough cross bedded, minor rippled and planar bedded intervals.

General Comments: Now obsolete in NT (pers.comm.Close, D., Mar'08), but remains current in SA.  See also ref: (1999) Petermann Ranges 1:250K Explan.Notes - replaced by Umutju, Pottoyu and Matururr Granite Suites.  Age: 1600 Ma. Age: >1607Ma (metamorphic age).
Lithology Description: Gneiss, quartz-feldspar-biotite-hornblende, with minor schist, amphibolite and quartzite

General Comments: To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Olive Queen minesite, Yalgoo1:100k sheet area. 28deg 19'S 116deg50'E. Type area: Wadgingarra. Intrusive into the eastern part of the Yalgoo greenstone belt.
Lithology Description: Very coarse grained quartz gabbro with coarse spinifex-like granophyric texture; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Includes invalidly named Oliver Sandstone Member.
Lithology Description: Mainly limestone and dolomite; minor sandstone.

General Comments: Invalidly named sandstone subunit within Oliver Formation (which is dominantly limestone). This unit needs a distinctive new name!
Lithology Description: Sandstones; predominantly quartzose, texturally sub-marine, and generally poorly sorted, grain-size very fine to very coarse
Biotite granodiorite; locally monzogranitic.

Reserved by: Preiss W.V., Walter M.R., Coats R.P., Wells A.T.
General Comments: Originally of Wells et al.(1967). Redefined in 2015. The Olympic Formation name has been used in both NT (Amadeus Basin) and in WA (Halls Creek Province) - misspelling of Olympio Fm. Together with the lateral equivalent, the Pioneer Sandstone, Olympic Fm is believed to correlate with Marinoan glacial strata of the Adelaide geosyncline. Recent U-Pb isotopic studies of detrital zircons from a sandstone bed within the Olympic Formation yielded a maximum depositional age of 690 +/- 14 Ma (Kositcin et al 2015).
Lithology Description: Diamictite with clasts of dolomite, sandstone, crystalline rocks; feldspathic sandstone, pink marker dolomite at top in places.

General Comments: Age of alkaline volcanic rocks (Maude Headley Member): 1857 +/- 3 Ma. Interpreted as a submarine fan system. Max. depositional age from detrital zircons in greywacke: 1873+/-5 Ma.
Lithology Description: Weakly metamorphosed, thin- to medium-bedded mudstone, siltstone, and matrix-supported quartz wacke, greywacke and arkose. Thicker metamorphosed coarse-grained to pebbly, clast-supported quartz sandstone units. Intermediate volcanics in Members.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Defn on Tech. File F/50-13.
Halls Creek & Angelo 1:100 000 sheet areas.  Of the Halls Creel Orogen.
Lithology Description: Pelite, calc-silicate rock, metachert, and meta-ironstone. Includes felsic volcanics.  Hosts copper-lead-zinc deposits.

General Comments: Pap sheet 2544 Meekatharra. Layered mafic-ultramafic sills, which intrudes into the middle of the Polelle Group stratigraphy. These sills have strike lengths of more than 40 km in the central part of the Abbotts greenstone belt.  Similar mafic-ultramafic intrusions of the Yalgowra Suite, some of which are dated (Ivanic et al., 2010), are found in the Meekatharra¿Wydgee greenstone belt farther south. To be published = MEEKATHARRA 100k , TIERACO 100k map sheets; Field guides.
Lithology Description: Layered mafic-ultramafic intrusive rocks: dominantly gabbro with minor gabbronorite, leucogabbro and dolerite; weakly deformed, metamorphosed.

General Comments: To replace Opaline Well Complex?? Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).
Lithology Description: Gabbro and dolerite; local dunite, peridotite, pyroxenite and basaltic rock; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Lies across the Davyhurst-Bardoc 1:100K GSWA map sheet areas. It forms part of the Eastern Goldfields Superterrane of the Yilgarn Craton. Supersedes Ora Banda Intrusion. Said to be historical name now re-used [where previously published?]. To be published: GSWA digital release 2016. See also GSWA ENS: Wyche, S and De Paoli, MC (partial report), Ora Banda Gabbro (A-_ob-xo-a): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 13 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Gabbro to leucogabbro dominant; granophyric segregations; pyroxenite or dunite basal segregations; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Not used since 1988. Obsolete?
Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Briefly described in Swager et al (1990) Table 1 p6, and later publications as Orinda Sill, then subsequently Orinda Intrusion. Now (2016) Orinda Gabbro name has been reinstated. It forms part of the Eastern Goldfields Superterrane of the Yilgarn Craton. Lies across the Davyhurst-Bardoc-Kalgoorlie 1:100K map series sheets. To be published = GSWA digital release 2016.
Lithology Description: Gabbro to leucogabbro dominant; locally granophyric; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Includes 8 granites including Andover and Bullock Hide Intrusions. For use on the DAMPIER map sheet; nearest town is Dampier.
Lithology Description: Gabbro, leucogabbro, serpentinized peridotite and dunite, pyroxenite, and minor anorthosite; metamorphosed.Intrusive sheets of porphyry and porphyritic microgranite. Granitic rocks.

General Comments: Defined McWhae et al.(1958); redefined 1995 to include 3 Members.
Lithology Description: Glauconitic sandstone, siltstone, shale, claystone

General Comments: Age: ~830 Ma, based on correlation with Ruby Plains Group, Wolfe Basin, and the occurrence of Linella avis (restricted to 850-800 Ma rocks)in the Wolfe Basin rocks. Variation on Oscar Range Succession.  Not related to old Oscar Formation (Devonian limestones), but both described in Lennard River, Canning Basin. Age evidently poorly constrained and previously considered to be in Mesoproterozoic to Neoproterozoic age. More recently considered Neoproterozoic & part of Oscar Range sub-basin, Louisa Basin.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, shale, conglomerate, and altered mafic igneous rock.

General Comments: This seam is at its thickest and most extensive on the Vasse Shelf - constituting more than 30% of the identified coal resource, thus making it a prime mining target.
Lithology Description: Seam thickness is generally between 2 to 4 metres.
Interbedded shale and sandstone; minor carbonate.

General Comments: Supersedes the Quinns Shale Member; that unit's type section is suggested as a reference section for the Otorowiri Formation in the Vlaming Sub-basin (see Backhouse, 1984). Also supersedes the Otorowiri Member of the former Parmelia Formation.
Lithology Description: Micaceous siltstone, shale, minor glauconitic sandstone.

General Comments: See also Outcamp Bore tonalite.
For a report on the Bonaparte and Ord Basins. Of the Elder Subgroup (Goose Hole Group).
Lithology Description: White, fine to medium lithic arkose and sandstone.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: For use on map sheet 2855; nearest town Marble Bar.  Intrudes Cotton Well Granodiorite. Dated: 3464+/-3Ma. To be published: June 2007 as MARBLE BAR sheet 2855, GSWA 1:100K Geological Series.
Lithology Description: Foliated to gneissic meta quartz-diorite and local granodiorite.
Includes arkose, mudstone and shale.

General Comments: Formerly Nabberu Basin. Age poorly constrained.
Lithology Description: Siliciclastic succession of conglomerate, quartz wacke, quartz arenite, and sericitic siltstone, overlain by a fine-gr.succession of BIF, hematitic and chloritic shale, feldspathic wacke and dolomite (See Ref: #49896)

General Comments: Previously included in the Soanesville Subgroup (Gorge Creek Group), NORTH SHAW 1:100k sheet area (2755). Also called Cleaverville Formation historically.  In the Pilbara Craton.  Reassigned to Soanesville Group when the subgroup was upgraded (03/06). Parts of this unit reassigned to the Cleaverville Formation in 2006 (Geology of Coongan 1:100k sheet).
Lithology Description: Thinly bedded iron formation, ferruginous clastic sedimentary rocks, quartzite, felsic volcanic rocks.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Medium-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with amphibolite-facies assemblages; may have a greenschist overprint

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Medium-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with amphibolite-facies assemblages; may have a greenschist overprint

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Medium-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with amphibolite-facies assemblages; may have a greenschist overprint

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic volcanics, including lavas and tuffs. Association may include volcaniclastic rocks.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic volcanics, including lavas and tuffs. Association may include volcaniclastic rocks.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic intrusive rocks.  Range in composition from alkali feldspar granite to tonalite; includes associated rocks such as migmatite and minor gabbro and diorite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic intrusive rocks.  Range in composition from alkali feldspar granite to tonalite; includes associated rocks such as migmatite and minor gabbro and diorite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic intrusive rocks.  Range in composition from alkali feldspar granite to tonalite; includes associated rocks such as migmatite and minor gabbro and diorite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic intrusive rocks.  Range in composition from alkali feldspar granite to tonalite; includes associated rocks such as migmatite and minor gabbro and diorite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly felsic intrusive rocks.  Range in composition from alkali feldspar granite to tonalite; includes associated rocks such as migmatite and minor gabbro and diorite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: High-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with granulite facies assemblages; includes granitic gneisses

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: High-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with granulite facies assemblages; includes granitic gneisses

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: High-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with granulite facies assemblages; includes granitic gneisses

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: High-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with granulite facies assemblages; includes granitic gneisses

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: High-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with granulite facies assemblages; includes granitic gneisses

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: High-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with granulite facies assemblages; includes granitic gneisses

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Dolerite, gabbro and other mafic igneous rocks; commonly as dykes and sills; may include some metamorphosed mafic intrusions and subordinate ultramafic rocks.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Dolerite, gabbro and other mafic igneous rocks; commonly as dykes and sills; may include some metamorphosed mafic intrusions and subordinate ultramafic rocks.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Mainly basaltic rocks; may include minor ultramafic volcanics

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset. [which is correct, age name Statherian or numbers = Orosirian?]
Lithology Description: Dolerite, gabbro and other mafic igneous rocks; commonly as dykes and sills; may include some metamorphosed mafic intrusions and subordinate ultramafic rocks.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset. [Are the numerical ages meangingful? Is the unit Statherian? Or is the age much less well known? CEB Feb 2012]
Lithology Description: High-grade metamorphic rocks, generally with granulite facies assemblages; includes granitic gneisses

General Comments: In refID 72034. (GSWA (2016). 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology of Western Australia. Eastern Canning Basin. Also Subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Sandstone and siltstone.

General Comments: For use on map sheet SH 51-3; nearest town is Cosmo Newbury. Located in the Mount Venn greenstone belt. Dated at c.2770 Ma (GSWA SHRIMP age). To be published in several GSWA publications in near future, including 1:100K maps and geochronological reports. Two volcanic units have ages of 2770 +/- 3 Ma.
Lithology Description: A package of felsic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks ranging in composition from andesites to rhyolites; texturally the unit includes coherent flows, breccias and volcaniclastic sandstones. All metamorphosed.

General Comments: Map sheet: 3235, Lake Lefroy. Granitic rock that is not exposed, but is located by aeromagnetic images and diamond drilling at the southern end of the St Ives Goldfields mining camp at Kambalda.  Intrusive, but textures are fine-grained thus given 'Microgranite" qualifier. To be published: Geological Survey of Western Australia Digital product release 2013.
Of the Eundynie Group in 2004? Of Plantagenet Group in 2010.
Lithology Description: Claystone, siltstone, sandstone; fossil sponges and molluscs.

Reserved by: Sheppard S., Tyler I.M., Griffin T.J.
General Comments: East Kimberley region. Different unit from Pandanus Siltstone Member (NT).
Lithology Description: Cream to pale-grey, medium-grained, weakly porphyritic to evenly textured biotite monzogranite.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Age: ~500Ma [form 1989 referernce].
Lithology Description: Glauconitic quartz sandstone.

General Comments: Map Sheet =SH51-09 Kalgoorlie,  3137 Bardoc 1:100k. Nearest Town = Kanowna. Sandstone and conglomerate with minor shale; metamorphosed. The Panglo Formation is found to the southwest of the Kanowna-Scotia dome and is thought to be a late basin sequence (sandstone, shale to black shale units, conglomerate units) that are equivalent to the Kurrawang Formation to the West (they are of the same level structurally - but separated by 200 km's of distance, i.e., they both overlie the Black Flag Group). The age range is difficult to ascertain and for now is assigned to the same ages as the Kurrawang. Reference Davis, B. K., et al., Precambrian Research 183 (2010) 316-337.  To be published = GSWA digital package 2016.
Lithology Description: Sandstone and conglomerate with minor shale; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Hamersley region. Panhandle Syncline located on Mount Lionel 100k. Also known in Mount Bruce, Turee Creek, Wyloo, Yarraloola, Newman 250ksheet areas. Dolerite; mainly northwest-trending dykes. Said to be dated by Muller et al. (2005) at 2208+/-10 Ma, a SHRIMP baddeleyite date of sills in the Hardey and Turee Creek synclines. See also GSWA's ENS: Wingate, MTD (partial report), Panhandle Dolerite (P_-_pa-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 06 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite.

General Comments: Within the Warrawoona Group (Pilbara Supergroup). Interfingers with upper part of Apex Basalt. Ages: 3454 +/- 1Ma (Thorpe et al, 1992a), 3470 +/- 2Ma and 3458 +/- 2Ma (Thorpe, 1991, written comm).
Lithology Description: Quartz-porphyritic rhyolite; felsic tuffaceous and volcaniclastic rocks; volcaniclastic conglomerate and sandstone; quartz-rich sandstone; chert: all metamorphosed.

General Comments: Nothing to do with (Paleoproterozoic) Panton Suite. See also Hudson Formation, Eagle Hawk Sandstone. Within Goose Hole Group. Incorporates the former Panton Shale, Shady Camp Limestone, Negri River Shale, Corby Limestone, Hudson Shale.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, mudstone, feldspathic sandstone, micritic and oncolitic limestone

General Comments: Nothing to do with (Cambrian) Panton Formation. The suite is equivalent to the Group I layered intrusions of Hoatson (2000), which includes the Panton, Big Ben, Mini, West McIntosh, South Melon Patch,  Springvale Track, West Panton, and West Robin Soak intrusions; the existing intrusion names are retained as informal names [advice from GSWA Dec 2013]. Age from Alice Downs Ultrabasics: 1856+/-2 Ma.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed layered mafic-ultramafic intrusions. Metadunite, metawehrlite, metalherzolite, metaperidotite; metachromitite layers; metagabbronorite, metagabbro, metanorite; meta-anorthosite.

General Comments: Informal unit of Panton Suite [advice from GSWA Dec 2013]. Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).
Lithology Description: Layered mafic-ultramafic intrusion: dunite, harzburgite, chromitite, amphibolite, gabbro, gabbronorite, norite, anorthositic gabbro, anorthosite, ferrogabbro, tremolite-antophyllite peridotite.

General Comments: East Kimberley region.
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained, rapakivi-like granite; medium- to fine-grained biotite-hornblende monzogranite and granodiorite, locally rich in mafic inclusions

General Comments: Age updated by I. Sweet. See also Paperbark supersuite. Shows magma-mingling of granites and gabbros.
Lithology Description: Predominantly medium- to coarse-grained, I-type porphyritic biotite monzogranite and granodiorite. Includes porphyritic rhyolite to dacite, lavas, pyroclastic deposits; massive, fine- to medium-grained gabbro.
Biotite-bearing norite, gabbronorite and minor gabbro; veins of intermediate hybrid rock; hybrid rock cut by veins of coarse-grained porphyritic tonalite and granodiorite.
