General Comments: Lies across Riverina 1:100K map sheet area.. It forms part of the Yilgarn Craton Granites. Named from Cassidy et al (2002; AMIRA P482/MERIWA M281). Also referenced to Papertalk Brook, WA (feature # WA100028750), which lies within the granite extent. To be published = GSWA digital release 2016
Lithology Description: Strongly foliated metagranite and granitic schist. Undivided gneiss and foliated granite.
Granodiorites and monzogranites.

General Comments: Ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Dolomite with minor chert and argillite partings. Thin- to thick-bedded dolomite with minor amounts of chert and argillite and tabular bedding. Contains a spherule marker bed.

Reserved by: Johnson, S. (GSWA),  Korhonen, S., Sheppard, S., Roche, L.K., Occhipinti, S.A.
General Comments: Migmatitic pelitic gneiss forms rare, 5-10m wide, discontinuous strips up to 100 m long, intercalated with intermediate to felsic gneisses of the Dalgaringa Supersuite in the Paradise Zone around Paradise Well on GLENBURGH.The two youngest analyses of detrital cores yielded a concordia age of 2083 +/- 7 Ma, interpreted as a maximum age of deposition of the pelitic protolith. Seven analyses of zircon rims yielded a weighted mean 207Pb*/206Pb* date of 1997 +/- 10 Ma (MSWD = 3.3), interpreted as the age of high-grade metamorphism and migmatization. Reference: Johnson, SP, Korhonen, FJ, Sheppard, S, Roche, LK and Occhipinti, SA 2013, Paradise Formation (P_-_pw-mli): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 29 March 2016, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>
Lithology Description: Migmatitic pelitic gneiss.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Mudstone, claystone; minor fine-grained sandstone; macrofossils; shallow marine deposits

General Comments: Tentatively correlated with the Moola Bulla Formation (Halls Creek Orogen).  Age: ~1.77 - 1.64 Ga, based on combination of youngest detrital zircons dates, diagenetic xenotime growth, age of Limbunya Group rocks (which overlie Birrindudu Group).
Lithology Description: Sandstone, conglomerate, siltstone; sublithic and lithic sandstone, quartz sandstone, conglomerate with jasperlitic and volcanic clasts.

General Comments: Basal age given is from interflow chert, high in the Paringa Basalt. Main ore host - gold mineralisation.
Lithology Description: Contains thin variolitic, pillowed basalt flows and thick, differentiated dolerite units (60623). Grades from high Mg basalts at base to gradually more evolved tholeiitic basalts towards the top.

General Comments: Cassidy and Champion (2002).
Lithology Description: Leucogranites to biotite-bearing monzonites, high-Ca.

General Comments: Not related to the Archaean Parker Range BIF.Used on the Glen Ayle 1:100K mapsheet.
Lithology Description: Fine- to medium-grained dolerite, commonly with pink granophyre zones; local superposition of sills indicated by l (lower) and u (upper).

General Comments: Intrudes units of the Kalgoorlie Terrane in the Eastern Goldfields Superterrane (Yilgarn Craton). See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD, Sapkota, J and Wyche, S (partial report), Parkeston Dolerite Member (P_-_lp-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 07 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Quartz dolerite.

General Comments: Probably a geomorphic unit rather than a stratigraphic one.
Lithology Description: Well sorted carbonate sand.

General Comments: Age is Neocomian. Both Formation and Group seem to be in fairly current usage [CEB Sep2009]
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, shale

General Comments: Nullagine 1:250 000 sheet area. Pilbara Province.
Lithology Description: Hornblende-biotite quartz monzodiorite.

General Comments: Also supersedes Wilkinson Range Beds, Yowalga Sandstone. See also Lexicon. Defined 1961. Underlies Cronin Ss, Cuncudgerie Ss. Redefined 1981. Age based on Sakmarian microfossils. Replaces Wilkinson Range Beds and Yowalga Sandstone in Officer Basin. Formerly listed as part of the Officer Basin (Neoprot - Devonian), but is too young; also formerly included in old defn of Gunbarrel Basin, but now too old for that (CEB Dec 2011). Canning Basin.
Lithology Description: Poorly sorted sandstone, claystone, conglomerate, tillite, siltstone, basal diamictite; varves and erratics in places - glacigene, lacustrine, to fluvioglacial.
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Considered together with Bryah and Padbury Group rocks to form a coherent tectono-metamorphic domain. Previously part of Glengarry Group. See also other variations on Peak Hill. Marymia Inlier, Yilgarn Craton.
Lithology Description: Quartz sericite schist, quartz muscovite schist, calc-silicate schist, metabasite, mylonite.

General Comments: Named after Pear Creek at 770300E 7681500N on the Coongan 1:00 000 sheet area. Used on the COONGAN and MARBLE BAR 1:100 000 map sheets. Within the Mount Bruce Supergroup.
Lithology Description: Brown-to-green-weathering, well-preserved clastic sedimentary rocks: interbedded sandstone and conglomerate, and basaltic breccia.

General Comments: Supersedes Pearce Member (Hyland Bay Formation). Now in Hyland Bay Subgroup (Kinmore Group).
Lithology Description: A lower unit of bioclastic limestone with abundant bryozoans and minor shelly debris, increasingly dominated by clastic rocks; upper unit of dark shale overlain by allochthonous bioclastic limestone with brachiopods, bryozoans and shelly debris.

General Comments: Intrudes the De Grey Group
Lithology Description: Hornblende-biotite high Mg diorite, granodiorite, and tonalite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Described in GSWA Memoir 3 (1990) , [overlies?] SW Birrindudu Basin,  p351, 359, 360. Possibly Devonian.
Lithology Description: Fine grained sandstone, planar bedded, laminated; conglomeratic sandstone with beds 30 cm - 1 m;laminated, silicified, ferruginous; conglomerate, well rounded cobbles and pebbles, thickly bedded, graded.

General Comments: For use on map sheet JOANNA SPRING; nearest town Broome. Within the Carribuddy Group. Subsurface only. A valuable stratigraphic marker aiding well-correlation across Canning Basin.  Previously unnamed. To be published: GSWA Report, 2008.
Lithology Description: Light-grey, hard, massive dolomite, stylolitic, with infilled subvertical fractures, microfaults, calcite filled veins, and minor vuggy porosity; argillaceous to silty dolomite.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Fluviatile ferruginous boulder conglomerate

General Comments: Proposed (March 2009, Gorter & Nicoll et al.) to be redefined as the basal unit of the Mount Goodwin Subgroup, Kinmore Group. Perviously of Hyland Bay Sub-group.
Lithology Description: Claystone, carbonaceous siltstone and minor calcareous sandstone in upward-coarsening cycles.

General Comments: Within the Norseman greenstones region.
Lithology Description: Mainly amphibolites and massive to pillowed basalts, with minor felsic volcanic and sedimentary rocks; also contains porphyritic felsic schists with amphibolite intervals.

General Comments: Thought to be equivalent to Mount Belches Formation (Swager 1995a, and Krapez ert al 2000).
Lithology Description: Polymictic clast-supported conglomerates, sandstones and mudstones.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File D/52-14. Max. thickness preserved in the Spider impact structure area: 600m. Xenotime overgrowths on zircon grains indicate a depositional or diagenetic age of 1704 +/- 14 Ma, considered a minimum age for the unit. Max.depositional age 1774+/-9 Ma U/Pb SHRIMP [RefID69099 Kimberley 2013 update]. [but said to be intruded by Hart Dolerite ~1784 Ma]. Kimberley Basin, North Australian Craton.
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone, pebbly sandstone, siltstone and claystone. An un-named lower unit of quartz sandstone, feldspathic sandstone, and micaceous siltstone, is mapped separately.

General Comments: Of Passmore (1970).
Lithology Description: Calcarenite and calcirudite.

General Comments: Used for Proterozoic granites project. Gascoyne Province. Included in -Pgbt on Winning Pool-Minilya 1:250k map sheet.

Lithology Description: Comprises thick beds of massive kaolinite and smectite, with ferruginous, siliceous and calcareous overprints, and lenses of cross-stratified ferruginous gravel.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

Six sub-units: cumulate pyroxenite, melanocratic dolerite with pyroxene phenocrysts to 2cm, equigranular magnetite-rich dolerite, magnetite granophyre, fine-grained oxide-rich dolerite, fine-grained chilled zone.
Red aeolian quartz sandstone with common soil concretions and root structures

Reserved by: Preiss W.V., Walter M.R., Coats R.P., Wells A.T.
General Comments: +Redefined in 1978. See card. The 730 +/- 45 Ma Rb/Sr  age  (Compston and Taylor, 1969) seems dubious. Age shown as 635 - 582 Ma in 2017 reference.
Lithology Description: Mainly (320m) red and green siltstone and shale, with flaser bedding, small-scale cross-laminations and thin interbeds of fine-grained sandstone; overlain by 1.5m of grey medium-grained feldspathic silicified sandstone and 30m of red siltstone.

General Comments: For use on Map sheet 2034.  Different from South Perth Shale (Early Cretaceous).  Now proposed as new component to Kwinana Group by B.Gozzard (approved by R.Hocking but unpublished as yet) 24/1/08.PP.
Lithology Description: Alluvial sands, silts and clays - a complex infilling a deep inset valley through Perth and upstream along the line of the present Swan River.

General Comments: Where do numerical ages come from? An old time scale? Said to be similar age to Aztec Siltstone fauna, Antarctica [1993 ref].
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, conglomerate, some limestone. Fish remains.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain. High-HFSE. Subvolcanic intrusion into Greensleeves Formation.
Lithology Description: Biotite granodiorite; weakly metamorphosed.

General Comments: Wallaringa & Wodgina 1:100 000 sheets. Chillerina Granodiorite occurs as locally abundant inclusions within the Petermarer Monzogranite (RefID 68283).
Lithology Description: Biotite monzogranite; strongly  K-feldspar porphyritic to seriate; massive to weakly foliated; locally with strong flow alighnment; locally abundant inclusions of Chillerina Monzogranite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: North Shaw 1: 100 000 sheet area, east Pilbara. Includes sheets and patches of Kavir Granodiorite and Tambourah Monzogranite.
Lithology Description: Migmatitic tonalitic orthogneiss with pegmatitic granite, granodiorite, and leucogranite sheets; porphyritic monzogranite; banded orthogneiss, migmatitic granodiorite and monzogranite.

General Comments: Gascoyne region. Mimimum age based on age of metamorphic rim. Maximum age of 2608+/-4 Ma is of deposition of protolith (from detrital zircons).
Lithology Description: Coarse calc-silicate gneiss, para-amphibolite, and pelitic and psammitic schist, minor quartzite and quartz diopside rock.

General Comments: Informally named horizon within the Virgin Hills Formation - contains scutelluines. On the eastern side of McWhae Ridge.

Lower part of formation (Middle Eocene) superseded by Maralinga Fm. in SA and by North Royal Formation in WA. Upper part (Late Eocene) remains as the Pidinga Fm and Anthony Member.  Maralinga Fm. reduced to Maralinga Member, of the Pidinga Fm. (Hou / PIRSA, 2005). Previously [2004] of Plantagenet Group.
Lithology Description: Interbedded, well-sorted, fine to coarse-grained carbonaceous sand and silt with minor lignite. Flood zone clays and lignite, fluvial/estuarine channel sands, gravelly (carboneous) coarse sands.

General Comments: To replace Pig Well Conglomerate
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed polymictic conglomerate and sandstone.

General Comments: Johnston Range 1:100 000 sheet area (2738).
Reef complex.
Lithology Description: Fossiliferous shallow marine reef to marginal slope and basin facies calcarenite, calcirudite, calcilutite, with minor interbedded shale and siltstone

General Comments: Satirist 1:100k sheet area. Formerly informally known as Friendly Creek monzogranite.
Lithology Description: Biotite-bearing monzogranite and syenogranite; leucocratic; weakly foliated to massive; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Revised stratigraphy (Van Kranendonk et al 2004) redefines supergroup as comprising: Warrawoona, Sulphur Springs, Gorge Creek and Kelly Groups. Age: <3515->2945Ma.  In Pilbara Craton. Gorge Creek Group now reassigned to De Grey Supergroup (GSWA 03/06).  A break in the volcanic activity of the predominantly volcanic Pilbara Supergroup, allowed for the deposition of the lithostratigraphic units of the Strelley Pool Formation to be deposited over the 75 million-yr period. Base age from Ar/Ar dating of pyroxenite lens in North Star Basalt (van Koolwijk, 2001, AGSO-GA Record 2001/37 p102).
Lithology Description: Includes multiply-deformed and metamorphosed greenstones dominated by basalt, chert, banded iron-formation, ultramafic rocks, with locally abundant felsic and sedimentary rock.
Basalt, high-Mg basalt, chlorite schist, tremolite-rich schist, altered basalt, local felsic volcanic rock
Undivided ultramafic rocks, komatiite, pyroxenite, peridotite, local mafic lava, quartzite, and chert; metamorphosed

General Comments: Nomenclature revised in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk). Formerly included in North Shaw Suite but recent mapping + SHRIMP indicate it is not related. Derived from the melting of sodic granitic protoliths in the core of Shaw Granitic Complex.
Lithology Description: Quartz, plagioclase and K-feldspar, <5% biotite. Pegmatitic to medium grained, as DEFINED by Van Kranendonk (2006) for revised Pilbara stratigraphy - white-weathering,medium- to coarse-grained, varying from homogeneous to schleiric to weakly gneissic.....

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Was part of Yardie Group - included in Cape Range Group in 1980.
Lithology Description: Quartzose, cross-bedded calcarenite and coralgal limestone; shallow marine

General Comments: See also Pillara Formation (amended by Read (1973) but generally not accepted, as the dominant lithology is limestone. Pillara Limestone is the preferred name (per email R.Hocking 27 Feb. 2008). PP. Interfingers with Sadler Limestone. Overlies Cadjebut Formation where that unit occurs.  GSWA petroleum prospectivity report (2004) suggests contained within the Gogo Formation?
Lithology Description: Fossiliferous shallow marine reef complex platform facies; yellow to light grey medium bedded algal, stromatoporoid and coral limestone with calcarenite calcilutite and rare oolite.

General Comments: The name Pillara Limestone has precedence although this unit is differentiated by its igneous origins and age (1400m years older). King Leopold Orogen, West Kimberley region.
See also Pillara Limestone.
Gascoyne Province. Included in -Pg on Edmund 1:250k map sheet. Defined by Sheppard, S. 10-MAY-2004. Intrudes Gooche Gneiss and Pooranoo Metamorphics. Intruded by Dingo Creek and Yangibana Granites.
Lithology Description: Most abundant rock is a coarse-grained porphyritic to megacrystic biotite(-muscovite) monzogranite to syenogranite; fine- to medium-grained biotite tonalite and granodiorite are abundant in places.
Siliceous siltstone and fine-grained sandstone, micaceous shale, quartz sandstone

General Comments: East Pilbara Terrane. Defined as Pincunah Member in 2006.Previously included at the top of the Kangaroo Caves Formation,Sulphur Springs Group. Being reassigned to the Cardinal Formation of the Soanesville Group. (A. Hickman pers com 4-JUN-2019). Explanation will be in Report and definition available soon.
Lithology Description: Banded iron-formation; jaspilitic; minor layered chert and shale; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Name reserved as Pincunah Granite. Pilbara Craton
Lithology Description: Moderately to strongly feldspar (-quartz)-porphyritic biotie (-hornblende) monzogranite; weakly to moderately foliated, typically with a strong phenocryst alignment; minor pegmatite and leucogranite.

General Comments: Defined as Pindar Beds in 1977. Described in GSWA Memoir 3 (1990) , NW Birrindudu Basin,  p351, 352, 355. May be lateral equivalent of Birrindudu Group. Mesoproterozoic.
Lithology Description: Shallow marine cross bedded, medium to coarse quartz sandstone and sublithic sandstone

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Defn on Tech File G/50-5. See also misspelt Pindiliya Formation.
Lithology Description: Poorly sorted sandstone, commonly lithic; conglomerate; ?fluviatile; includes minor authigenic silcrete.
Carbonates, sandstone, conglomerate

General Comments: Reservation extended. Onshore Perth Basin. Notified by A. Davidson 28-NOV-94.
Lithology Description: Discontinuous, interbedded sandstones, siltstones and shales of marine and non-marine origin; individual sandstone beds c.3 to 6 m thick.

General Comments: See Definition card for Pinjian Breccia. This overlies Carawine Dolomite of Hamersley Basin. Formerly included in Hamersley Basin and included/excluded from Mount Bruce Supergroup.
Lithology Description: Consists of angular fragments of chert and layered chert in a siliceous matrix; locally rich in iron and manganese oxides giving the rock a black to dark-brown colour and semimetallic lustre.

General Comments: Part of the Widgiemooltha Large Igneous Province; intrudes Archean greenstone and granitic units of the Yilgarn Craton. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD (partial report), Pinjin Dolerite Member (P_-_wp-o): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 13 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Mainly dolerite and gabbro; includes cumulate and granophyric differentiates

General Comments: Victoria Basin.
Lithology Description: Silica cemented quartz sandstone/orthoquartzite, minor siltstone and mudstone.

General Comments: New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk).  Also, to be used on PINDERI HILLS sheet; nearest town Karratha. Ages: 3114+/-5, 3130+/-Ma. Intruded by Cliff Pool Tonalite.
Lithology Description: Tonalite to granodiorite gneiss, generally compositionally banded with leucocratic layers of monzogranite and pegmatite; contains greenstone enclaves interpreted as xenoliths derived from the Whundo Group.

General Comments: 1:100k map sheet = 1936. Nearest Town = Cervantes.  Fine to coarse grained well sorted aeolianite, yellow coloured, poorly to well cemented, and with distinctive cross-bedding. Mineralogy: carbonate, quartz, feldspar. Deposited in Marine Isotope Stage 7. To be published = This year (2014) in Australian Journal of Earth Sciences.
Lithology Description: Consists of an eolian calcarenite/calcrete-microbialite/paleosol cycle.

General Comments: Madura Province.
Lithology Description: Basalt schist intruded by plagiogranite veins and pods.

General Comments: Appears to be intruded by the Amata dolerite.  Age: probably 820Ma. Correlated with Bitter Springs Formation.
Lithology Description: Grey quartz-muscovite phyllite, crystalline dolostone, fine-grained sandstone, red, green and pale grey fissile siltstone, dolomitic siltstone. Dominated by phyllite, interlayered with dolostone and minor schists in the north and Petermann Ranges.

General Comments: See also Pioneer Granitoid Complex. Are these the same unit? Related?
Lithology Description: Foliated biotite monzogranite; gneiss enclaves.

Reserved by: Preiss W.V., Walter M.R., Coats R.P., Wells A.T.
General Comments: Overlies Areyonga Formation and Bitter Springs Formation. Correlated with Olympic Formation. NOT related to Pioneer beds and Pioneer Sandstone (TAS). Together with the lateral equivalent, the Olympic Formation, these units are believed to correlate with Marinoan glacial strata of the Adelaide geosyncline.
Lithology Description: Pebbly arkose, feldspathic sandstone; dolomite in places; minor conglomerate at base in places.
Andesite lava, tuff, volcanic breccia.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain.  Age: ?2670Ma.
Lithology Description: Metamonzogranite.

General Comments: See also Pirie Calcarenite Member - the lithological component does not form part of the formal current name (email per R. Hocking, May 2008).

Lithology Description: A-type. Volcanic-arc and syn-collisional granite. Yb-enriched.

General Comments: For use on COOPER map sheet; nearest town is ?Warburton. For Neoproterozoic diamictite, siltstone and mudstone, probably Supersequence 2, known only in GSWA Vines 1 corehole, 779.2 - 2017m (TD). To be published in AJES (submitted).
Lithology Description: Dark-grey diamictite with local reddish-brown horizons, sandstone, mudstone and pebble conglomerate. Deposited in marine and possibly continental, glacially influenced settings.

General Comments: Musgrave Province
Lithology Description: Undivided: weakly to strongly banded gneiss; typically quartzofeldspathic but includes amphibolitic rocks; mostly of sedimentary or volcanosedimentary protolith but possibly includes felsic to mafic intrusive protolith.

General Comments: For use on MUSGRAVE map sheet.  Age: 1190-1120Ma (Edgoose et al; Major and Conor 1993; Scrimgeour et al 1999; Edgoose et al 2002; Young et al 2002; Close et al 2003a). Two distinct age groups, defining Early and Late Musgravian Orogeny. c.1219-1200 Ma, and c.1190-1155 Ma (Sen, 2009). Musgrave Province, associated with the Musgrave Orogeny. Three facies are mapped separately.
Lithology Description: Granite, monzogranite, monzonite, granodiorite. Includes metagranodiorite, metamonzogranite, gneissic porphyritic leucogranite, medium-grained mafic granulite, granitic gneiss, metasyenogranite.

General Comments: Informal, invalid name for older parts of Pitjantjatjara Supersuite. Musgrave Province, Paterson Orogen.
Lithology Description: Metagranite and gneiss.

General Comments: Informal, invalid name for younger parts of Pitjantjatjara Supersuite. Musgrave Province, Paterson Orogen.
Lithology Description: Metagranite, gneiss.
Siltstone, sandstone, bryozoal carbonates and spongolites.

General Comments: Age: ~203-~154Ma. Hosts the Daly River Road surficial Fe deposit and the McLeans surficial type Mn deposit. Potential hydrocarbon reservoir.
Lithology Description: Dark brown limonitic coarse to pebbly quartz sandstone, massive white friable quartz sandstone, conglomerate, siltstone and claystone interbeds, rare limestone and coal

General Comments: Equivalent to Yarle Sandstone in SA
Lithology Description: Fine-grained sandstone, siltstone, claystone with intercalated pebbly sandstone with silcrete clasts.

General Comments: Replaces Point Maud Formation.
Lithology Description: Massive dolomite. Core sample: Light grey to white dolomite with abundant vuggy and intercrystalline porosity and stylolites.

General Comments: Rason 1:250k map sheet area. Extensive layered monzogranite intrusion in the NE corner of the Yilgarn Craton. Extends along western side of Yamarna greenstone belt. Ages of c.2662 and c.2664 given on 2 different 100K maps (published 2010).
Lithology Description: Biotite monzogranite; fine- to coarse-grained; seriate to K-feldspar-porphyritic; abundant leucogranitic layers and schlieren; metamorphosedl.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Unit probably diachronous. Previously mapped as Border Creek Formation. And formerly part of the Weaber Group - revised by author Gorter et al (2005) as the onshore equivalent of Arco and Aquitaine Fms.  Age: ~322-~314Ma. NTGS still included this unit in Weaber Group in 2006, but not by 2013 (although shown in Weaber Group in 2015 Auverne map). See also Border Creek Formation [regarded as part of Point Spring Sst by Mory and Beere(1988) but actually overlies it].
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone, minor conglomerate.

General Comments: Developed as spits along an eroding coastline cut into the finger-like extensions of Mowanjum Sand. Age: 1190-500yrs. B.P. (for mangrove stumps).
Defined Fairbridge (1953). Type section in Poison Hill, 6.5km NNW of Gingin.
Lithology Description: Unconsolidated pale yellow to dark green, fine- to very coarse-grained, richly glauconitic, silty and locally clayey sand.

General Comments: For use on Barrow Island.  Not yet published by orginal author?
Cowan 1:100 000 sheet. See also the misspelt Polar Bar Formation.
Lithology Description: Includes gypsum-bearing evaporite deposits, aeolian lunettes and dune islands.

Reserved by: Gatehouse C.G., Harris W.K., Foster C.B.
Lithology Description: Fluvial sandstone and conglomerate; carbonaceous and lignitic claystone

General Comments: For use in the complete revision of the Murchison domain lithostratigraphy; published in GSWA Annual Review 2007-2008.
Lithology Description: Basalt, locally moderately foliated; pillowed and spherulitic (spherules to 15mm diameter) basalt; strongly sheared mafic (and minor ultramafic) schist; BIF and minor banded chert, typically granular texture. All metamorphosed.

General Comments: Defined in Mory (1988) NW Shelf volume for WA, Mory (1991) - GSWA Rep 29 for  NT and WA.  Age: >240->230Ma.
Lithology Description: Sandstone with interbedded shale; minor limestone.

General Comments: Dacitic volcanics which originally included the new Kiwirrkurra Formation (per email, I.Tyler, 11/10/07).  See also the misspelt Polloch Hills Formation with age: 1615Ma. Warumpi Province, Arunta Orogen, North Australian Craton.
Lithology Description: Arenite, tuffaceous sandstone, conglomerate, lapilli tuff, agglomerate, and highly altered porphyritic dacite-rhyolite lava.
Sand and grit-dominated psammitic gneiss.

General Comments: Wallaringa & Wodgina 1:100 000 sheets.
Lithology Description: Muscovite-biotite monzogranite, seriate to porphyritic, massive to weakly foliated, metamorphosed

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Age: ~290->280Ma (in 2001).
Lithology Description: Fossiliferous, locally carbonaceous, commonly ripple marked and cross bedded red-yellow/brown fine and thin-bedded to coarse quartzose sandstone; lenses of white claystone and siltstone and thinly bedded matrix-supported conglomerate; minor coal seams.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Originally described in the Port Hedland area. Overlies Canning Basin.
Lithology Description: Channel iron deposits and pisolite - pisolitic and limonitic riverine palaeochannel mineralisation.

General Comments: Located in the northern Gascoyne Complex. Intruded by Dingo Creek Granite and Durlacher Supersuite plutons.  S.Sheppard (GSWA, Oct 2008) advice to upgrade to group status.
Lithology Description: Pelitic schist, gneiss and granofels, and metamorphosed feldspathic sandstone and conglomerate. Very minor amphibolite and calc-silicate rock.

General Comments: Briefly described. Edjudina 1:250 000 sheet area.
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained quartz monzonite; biotite after hornblende; prominent K-feldspar phenocrysts.
White chalk, calcarenite, chert.

General Comments: A 200-400 m thick formation of Archean pillow basalt exposed at Cleaverville, northwest Pilbara. Stratigraphically between the 3.2 Ga Dixon Island Formation (Kiyokawa and Taira, 1998) and the 3.02 Ga Cleaverville Formation. Previously called the "Dixon Pillow Basalt" (Kiyokawa and Taira, 1998), but Kiyokawa now agrees the same name source (Dixon) should not be used for adjacent formations.Tobepublished = 2010, in GSWA Record in prep.: "Preliminary report on the Dixon Island - Cleaverville drilling project, Pilbara Craton, Western Australia", by Kiyokawa et al.
Lithology Description: Pillow basalt

General Comments: Radiocarbon dating of shells within the Formation places it in the Holocene, viz., 3520 +/- 200 yrs BP, 3680 +/- 210 yrs BP, and 4320 +/-220 yrs BP.  PUBLICATION: Semeniuk, V., 2008, Journal of the Royal Society of Western Australia Volume 91 Part 1 (Supplement): 53-148.
Lithology Description: Mostly grey, bioturbated to structureless, fine and very fine sand and shelly sand ranging to coarse sand and shelly sand. Sand grains are quartz, or quartz and bioclasts, and locally ooids.

General Comments: Of Sisters Supersuite. Nomenclature revised in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk).  Intrudes the c.2970-2940Ma Croydon Group. Age: 2946+/-6Ma. Formerly referred to as the Portree Granitic or Granitoid Suite. Intrudes the Croydon Group.
Lithology Description: Massive medium-grained leucocratic alkali granite in south; coarse-grained alkali granite in the north.

General Comments: Age: >2.9Ga.  In the Pilbara Craton.  Intrudes Mallina Formation.
Lithology Description: Alkaline granite in a series of nested plutons on YULE.

General Comments: North Shaw 1:100 000 sheet area 2755
Lithology Description: Interlayered pillow basalts and various cherts.

Reserved by: Edgoose C., Close D., Scrimgeour I.
General Comments: PETERMANN RANGES 1:250 000 sheet area. Includes Mulyati Granite, otherwise undivided. Ages: 1192+/- and 1144+/-12Ma (SHRIMP U-Pb zircon) - suggest a series of intrusions over a prolonged period of time. Parts previously mapped as Olia Gneiss. Name may have been replaced by the shorter Pottoyu Suite.
Lithology Description: Variously metamorphosed, foliated to migmatitic granites; includes biotite granite, hornblende granite, leucogranite, rapakivi textured granite.

General Comments: Also interfingers with Tandalgoo Red Beds.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, minor shale, sandstone; traces of dolomite.
Monzogranite, syenogranite

General Comments: A variation on Powder Intrusion (unit no. 78634). Probably intended to replace Powder Intrusion.
Lithology Description: Gabbro; metamorphosed. Leucogabbro; coarse grained with granophyric texture; metamorphosed.
Felsic volcanics, black-white chert, felsic tuff, ferruginous chert and banded iron formation

General Comments: Possibly informally named rocks associated with a power complex in the Golden Mile area?
To be used in the Rudall 1:250 000 sheet area.
Lithology Description: Quartzite, commonly micaceous, with intercalated quartz-muscovite schist, psammitic gneiss and biotite-plagioclase-quartz schist

General Comments: Dolerite; mainly north-northeast trending dykes.Part of Fortescue LIP; intrusive equivalent of Fortescue volcanic rocks. Newman, Mount Bruce 250k; Prairie Downs, Warrawanda, Ophthalmia, Rocklea 100k. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD (partial report), Prairie Downs Dolerite (A-_pd-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 01 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite.

General Comments: See also GSWA's ENS system.
Lithology Description: Dolerite.

General Comments: May include (supersede?) the Collieburn Member? Described as Collie Subbasin, Southern Perth Basin in 2008.
Lithology Description: Coal.

General Comments: Age: rhyolitic breccia 2758 +/- 6 Ma Barley et al 2006 (RefID 68107).
Lithology Description: Comprises arkosic sandstone and felsic volcaniclastic rocks.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Age: c. 1070 Ma. Intrudes Earaheedy Group.
Lithology Description: Dolerite sill, dyke, and plug; fine- to coarse-grained dolerite.

General Comments: Defined by Semeniuk (1995).  White, cream, yellowish and tan shell beds, shell grit, shelly sand, and coarse to medium sand.
Lithology Description: White, cream, yellowish and tan shell beds, shell grit, shelly sand, and coarse to medium sand.

General Comments: After Preston Point in the Pilbara. Dampier and Barrow Island 250k. Small suite of dolerite dykes, north-northeast trending. The dyke intrudes a thrust fault, which is one of a set of thrusts that form an imbricate zone in the Tumbiana Formation of the Fortescue Group in the Cape Preston area. Regional structural evidence (Hickman and Strong, 1998) indicates that these thrusts may belong to the 1815-1770 Ma Capricorn Orogeny (Sheppard et al., 2010, GSWA Report 110). Two dates: 1817 ± 2 and 1814 ± 4 Ma.Wingate, MTD and Hickman, AH 2009, 178156: felsic differentiate of gabbro dyke, Mount Rough; Geochronology Record 802: Geological Survey of Western Australia, 4p. http://geodownloads.dmp.wa.gov.au/downloads/Geochron/pdfs/178156.1.pdf. Wingate, MTD and Hickman, AH 2009, 178155: gabbro dyke, Mount Rough; Geochronology Record 801: Geological Survey of Western Australia, 4p. http://geodownloads.dmp.wa.gov.au/downloads/Geochron/pdfs/178155.1.pdf. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD and Hickman, AH (partial report), Preston Dolerite (P_-_pr-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 07 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite dykes; north-northeast trending

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone and siltstone.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, shale, limestone, and dolomitic sandstone.

General Comments: Prince Regent River and Nature Reserve. Dolerite; typically northwesterly trending dykes. This unit is interpreted from distinctive northwesterly linear trends on geophysical imagery and is not observed in outcrop. It is considered likely that dolerite is a main constituent of the unit. It was originally published as the Prince Regent Dyke Suite (79599), now formalised as Prince Regent Dolerite to avoid form term. To be published in Kimberley GIS 2018 package etc. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD and Phillips, C (partial report), Prince Regent Dolerite (DC-_pe-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 01 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Probably dolerite.
Coarse-grained, strongly foliated, hornblende-biotite granodiorite with evidence of a complex recrystallization history.
Dolomite, limestone, sandstone and shale.

General Comments: RefID 50223 gives youngest detrital zircon age: 1876 +/-10Ma.
Lithology Description: Fine- to medium-grained sandstone, generally texturally mature, locally pebbly and glauconitic; subordinate siltstone, shale and mudstone.

General Comments: Changed from formation status to member of Pallinup Formation by Clarke et al. (2003).
Lithology Description: Spongolite, sandstone, siltstone, claystone, locally silicified.
Limestone.

General Comments: See also Prudhoe Member.
Age: Late Cretaceous to early Paleocene. Restricted to eastern Ashmore Platform and Vulcan Sub-basin. See also Puffin Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Lenticular sandstones interbedded with shale.

General Comments: Paterson Orogen.
Lithology Description: Interbedded, laminated, slightly micaceous, grey to dark-brown-black shale; locally carbonaceous shale and siltstone; thin units of sulfidic shale and sandstone; minor carbonate rocks and chert.

General Comments: Originally Punkerri Sandstone by Thomson (1969); then defined as Punkerri Beds by Major (1974), now redefined as Punkerri Sandstone. See also Punkerri Formation (used in WA).
Lithology Description: Dominantly marine shale, siltstone, sandstone and limestone.

General Comments: Correct spelling of Pantapanta Formation.
Lithology Description: Ferruginized, laminated to thinly bedded sequence of dark grey dolomitic sandstone, grey dolomitic siltstone, and rare limestone, very fine grained pale brown dolomitic sandstone, chert, and shale.

General Comments: Bloods Range 1:250 000 map sheet area.  Age: 1075+/-2Ma (Pb-Pb zircon)
Lithology Description: Finely porphyritic rhyolite, tuff, minor volcaniclastics.

General Comments: A-type. Early Musgrave Orogeny.
Replacement name for Buchanan Sandstone (res.in error!)
Lithology Description: Medium- to very thick-bedded, medium-grained quartz arenite.

General Comments: Bentley Basin (GSWA 2011).
Lithology Description: Rhyolite, dacite, ignimbrite, basalt, volcaniclastic sedimentary rock, sandstone, and conglomerate.

General Comments: Formerly the Pyradie Pyroclastic Member of de la Hunty (1965). Ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Pyroxene spinifex-textured metabasalt flows and pillow lava; metatuff, and minor chert; contains komatiite locally.

General Comments: North Shaw 1:100 000 sheet area 2755. In the Pilbara Craton. Reassigned from the Gorge Creek Group as topmost unit of Soanesville Group (GSWA 03/06).
Lithology Description: Banded iron-formation, minor chert and shale; red-weathered, ferruginised, black shale; silicified shale, grey, white, and black layered chert; all metamorphosed.

General Comments: Defined and published in HOCKING, R. M., JONES, J. A., PIRAJNO, F., and GREY, K., 2000, Revised lithostratigraphy for Proterozoic rocks in the Earheedy Basin and nearby areas: Western Australia Geological Survey, Record 2000/16.  In the Oldham Inlier (Bangemall Basin)
Lithology Description: Shale, siltstone, minor sandstone and laminated chert.
Marine siliciclastics, limestone, sandstone, and claystone.
Does not outcrop. Consists of grey, brown white and pink layers of sandstone, varying in size from fine to coarse sand, well rounded to subrounded, well-cemented in a clay matrix.

General Comments: Gascoyne region. Age: c. 1985 Ma, from intrusion by c. 1970 Ma sheets and veins of coarse biotite trondhjemite. Max age is for deposition of sedimentary precursor (from detrital zircons).
Lithology Description: Pelitic and psammitic schist or gneiss interlayered with minor quartzite, calc-silicate gneiss and amphibolite.

General Comments: Geomorphic unit of McArthur and Bettany (1960). Includes the Becher Suite of wetland basins. Distribution of the Safety Bay Sand coincides with that of the Quindalup Dune System (GSWA Bull 124, p. 212) [RefID 36293]. Use Safety Bay Sand for lithostratigraphic purposes.
Lithology Description: Coastal dunes, beach ridge plains, tombolos and cuspate forelands, underlain by quartzo-calcareous sand.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. SG50-1.
Lithology Description: Carbonaceous shale, siltstone and fine quartz wacke, fossiliferous.
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Fully described in 92/27459, GSWA Bull 137. Quinns Shale and Quinns Shale Member also in database. Name to be revived in 2017-18 by Jack Lowrey (GSWA). This unit will be included in the Gabanintha 1:100 000 Map Sheet to be published in 2018, and retrospective changes to electronically available versions of the Reedy (2543) and Nowthanna (2643) 1:100,000 map sheets, as well as being described in terms of its chemostratigraphic context in journal format in late 2017 early 2018.
Lithology Description: Interlayered high-Mg and tholeiitic basalt.
Basal blocky sandstone, fining upwards with thinner sandstone beds and increasing siltstones and shales; distinct and characteristic high gamma ray diamictite horizon.

General Comments: PUBLICATION: Semeniuk, V., 2008, Journal of the Royal Society of Western Australia Volume 91 Part 1 (Supplement): 53-148. Radiocarbon dating of shells within the Formation places it in the Holocene, viz., 1285 +/- 150 yrs BP, 2290 +/-180 yrs BP, 1510 +/- 210 yrs BP, 2350 +/- 225 yrs BP, 3625 +/- 260 yrs BP.
Lithology Description: Generally light-coloured, shell gravel, shelly sand, and some sand that is variable in structure from bedded, to laminated, to cross-laminated, to locally bioturbated, to structureless.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain. Part of the Annean Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Tonalite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Bow 1: 100 000 sheet area. Is this name still current? Not used in GSWA Kimberley 2013 update that covers this area..

Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008). Part of the Sisters Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Layered mafic intrusions. Gabbro, pyroxenite, and minor peridotite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: For the DAMPIER map sheet; near Dampier.  Named for Radley Find Mine. Contains 7 named intrusions including Yannery Granite.  Age: 2925Ma. In the western/central Pilbara Craton.
Lithology Description: Ultramafic layered intrusions and granite.

General Comments: This name reserved to replace existing Raeside Granitoid Complex. Map Sheet SH51-5, 3139, MELITA.  Nearest Town = Leonora. Brief description = Granite; monzogranite to tonalite; locally gneissic. To be published: GSWA Explanatory Notes Database.
Lithology Description: Granite; monzogranite to tonalite; locally gneissic

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Pebble to boulder polymict conglomerate, pebbly sandstone, fine to very coarse grained sandstone.

General Comments: Yilmia 1:100k map sheet area.  A foliated biotite-quartz-microcline-sodic oligoclase granodiorite. To be published = East Yilgarn 2013-2013 Update, Geological Survey of Western Australia digital product.
Lithology Description: Foliated biotite-quartz-microcline-sodic oligoclase granodiorite.

General Comments: For the DAMPIER mapsheet; nearest town is Dampier. In the Sholl Terrane, West Pilbara Superterrane/Pilbara Craton. Contains some of the oldest components of Cherratta Granitic Complex.
Lithology Description: Gneissic metamonzogranite; locally migmatitic, and veined by younger granitic rocks; locally contains large mafic and ultramafic xenoliths.

General Comments: Part of the Widgiemooltha Large Igneous Province; intrudes Archean greenstone and granitic units of the Yilgarn Craton. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD (partial report), Randalls Dolerite Member (P_-_wv-o): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 13 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite and gabbro; includes cumulate and granophyric differentiates.

General Comments: RUBY PLAINS 1:100 000 sheet. Formerly of Ord Group. Contains zebra rock (kaolinitic siltstone), a striking red and white banded rock - now submerged in the Ord River reservoir. Wolfe Basin.
Lithology Description: Thinly bedded micaceous siltstone, ferruginous siltstone, claystone, quartz and lithic sandstone, dolomitic quartz sandstone, dolostone.

General Comments: Note: WA showed this granite as part of the Carrington Suite in 2006, but NTGS shows it as time equivalent, but not included in the Suite. Age: younger than 1805 Ma Stafford Event.
Lithology Description: Garnet-bearing biotite granite, mostly porphyritic with tabular feldspars sometimes defining a weak foliation
Granite gneiss.

General Comments: SG50-8, Peak Hill. Glengarry Basin. Detrital zircons give maximum depositional age of 2014+/-22 Ma (Nelson, 1997). Pb/Pb isochron age 1900 Ma from galena veins. Outcrops on western Peak Hill 1:250 000 sheet previously considered part of the Thaduna Greywacke are now mostly assigned to the Ravelstone Formation (Occhipinti et al. 1997), due to recongition of distinct lithological differences.
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone and greywacke, metamorphosed; interbedded siltstone and graded beds; chloritic fragments common in places; turbiditic
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Previously called Ravensthorpe Terrane. Includes tonalite dated at 2966+/-12 Ma U/Pb SHRIMP.
Lithology Description: Calc-alkaline volcanics and co-magmatic intrusions.
Highly fossiliferous limestone ranging from lime mudstone textures to rudstone textures.

General Comments: Newly named after the Box Soak Razorback. Max. thick: ~30. To be replaced by Razorback Chert Member.  This chert unit is just a local member within the Mount Ada Basalt. Its maximum thickness is 30 m, and its lateral extent is intermittent over about 15 km (tracing it is complicated by faulting).
Lithology Description: Consists of (grey-)black and white banded cherts, occasionally grading into grey-green massive chert.

General Comments: To replace Razorback Chert. This chert unit is just a local member within the Mount Ada Basalt. Its maximum thickness is 30 m, and its lateral extent is intermittent over about 15 km (tracing it is complicated by faulting).

New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk).  Also, to be used on ROEBOURNE map sheet; nearest town Roebourne. Ages: 3017 and 3014Ma. Intrudes Ruth Well Formation, Karratha Granodiorite and the Andover Intrusion.
Lithology Description: Dacite, rhyolite, quartz-feldspar porphyry; locally flow-banded.

General Comments: Age ~1330-1280 Ma. Intrudes both Nornalup and Biranup Zones.
Lithology Description: Biotite-hornblende monzogranite gneiss, garnet-bearing granodiorite gneiss, and rare syn-plutonic dykes.

General Comments: Syenogranite, porphyritic monzogranite, and granodiorite. Does this replace Red Hill Granitoid Complex?
Lithology Description: Tonalite-trondhjemite; equigranular, biotite-bearing. Syenogranite, porphyritic monzogranite, and granodiorite.

General Comments: Previously published as Red Hill volcanics.  Published as Red Hill Volcanics (02/32336).  Together with its member Mons Cupri Dacite, supersedes Mons Cupri Volcanics.  Age of Mons Cupri Dacite Member: 2991+/-12Ma. Whim Creek Basin.
Lithology Description: Felsic volcaniclastic rocks, intrusive porphyritic dacite+dacitic to rhyolitic lava; includes debris-flow, turbidite and fluvial facies; metamorphosed.

General Comments: McIntosh 1:100k. c. 1800 Ma
Lithology Description: Fine- to coarse-grained lithic quartz sandstone, feldspathic quartz sandstone, pebbly sandstone, conglomerate, siltstone, mudstone, basalt and basaltic breccia; carbonate rock
Massive to amygdaloidal basalt flows and basaltic breccia, dolerite, minor lithic sandstone, siltstone, and mudstone

General Comments: Maroonah 1:100 000, Edmund 1:250 000 sheet area., northern Gascoyne region. Probably Palaeoproterozoic.
Ruby Plains 1:100 000 sheet area.
Lithology Description: Polymictic conglomerate, cross-bedded medium to coarse and commonly pebbly sublithic sandstone, and minor dolomite.

General Comments: Age very poorly constrained. Top may be as young as Cambrian. See also misspellings: Redcliffe Pound Group, Red Cliff Pound Group. Redefined in 2017. For recent update see: Haines, P.W., Allen, H.J. 2016. The Murraba Basin: another piece of the Centralian Superbasin jigsaw puzzle falls into place IN GSWA 2016 extended abstracts: promoting the prospectivity of Western Australia: Geological Survey of Western Australia, Record 2016/2, p. 31-35.
Lithology Description: Abundantly cross bedded and rippled medium grained quartz sandstone, minor sublithic sandstone, shale, siltstone, conglomerate, arkose, breccia; some convolute lamination and disturbed cross beds.

General Comments: After Redeemer mineral deposit? Map Sheet: SH51-1,  Munjeroo 2941. Basalt; fine-grained with local pyroxene-spinifex texture; includes medium-grained layers and lenses; minor interflow sediments; metamorphosed. To be published = GSWA geological map and explanatory notes, 2013/2014.
Lithology Description: Basalt; fine-grained with local pyroxene-spinifex texture; includes medium-grained layers and lenses; minor interflow sediments; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Vasse River Coalfields.  Contains the Anniebrook Seam which is high quality in the Rosa Brook area.
Lithology Description: Predominantly sandstone with intercalations of siltstone, shale and thin coal seams.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain. Part of the Annean Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Trondhjemite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Possible equivalents of Pillara Limestone, Gogo Formation and Nullara Limestone.

Redefined the succession formerly referred to as the informal Lower Grant Group. Formerly the Betty Formation of the Grant Group. Shown as underlying redefined Grant Group of Apak and Backhouse (1998), by (REFID:64971), but included in the Grant Group by Mory et al. in 2008 on genetic grounds (RefID 64630)
Lithology Description: Medium-grained sandstone, with minor shale and siltstone; diamictite.

General Comments: Forms the Regal Terrane of the West Pilbara Superterrane (per statement by M.Van Kranendonk/GSWA, Mar06).
Lithology Description: Massive and pillow basalt with local basal peridotitic komatiite; minor chert, BIF, and shale. Includes strongly foliated amphibolite-chlorite schist. Metamorphosed to amphibolite or upper greenschist facies..

General Comments: Probably to used as Rest Point Mud.
Obsolete name?

Lithology Description: Oxidised non-marine, fine-grained clastic deposits.

General Comments: Age: c. 1800 Ma. Age updated by I.Sweet.
Lithology Description: Fine- to coarse-grained quartz sandstone; lithic and feldspathic sandstone; carbonaceous siltstone and mudstone; conglomerate; dolerite, basalt and basaltic breccia.

General Comments: text refers to Brewer & others 1987.
Used interchangeably with Richenda Granite. See also Richenda Microgranite.
Lithology Description: Foliated medium to fine grained granodiorite and tonalite.
Ferruginous sandstone with a thin basal conglomerate overlying Precambrian crystalline rocks and capped by laterite.

General Comments: Now of Aralka Formation. Formerly of the Pertatataka Formation. Not to be confused with Ringwood nomenclature for microgranite in QLD. Redefined by VJ Normington, N Donnellan 29-OCT-2015. Defn approved 10-NOV-2015.  The depositional age(658 Ma) is inferred from Re-Os dating of  Aralka Formation in Wallara 1.
Lithology Description: Dolomite and limestone, stromatolitic and pisolitic in part; calcarenite; minor siltstone; rare breccia.

General Comments: Lies across Riverina 1:100K map sheet area. Named from Cassidy et al (2002; AMIRA P482/MERIWA M281) and proximity to Riverina township.It forms part of the Yilgarn Craton Granites. To be published = GSWA digital release 2016.
Lithology Description: Granitic gneiss; foliated and lineated.

General Comments: Also known as Channel Iron Deposits - includes transported ferruginous regolith of fossil wood fragments. Name intended to be replaced by Robe Formation in 2003, but this change not accepted by GSWA.  See also Robe Formation. See comments in RefID 69538 (2014).
Lithology Description: Pisolitic, oolitic and massive limonite, minor terrigenous siliciclastic material, goethite and hematite deposits; developed along palaeodrainage lines; dissected by present day drainage.
Quartz arenite & feldspathic sandstone with minor chert.
Granular iron formation, banded iron formation, ferruginous and locally sericitic shale. Chert layers in places.

General Comments: Stated to be of the Kwinana Group (Abeysinghe 2003) but this is probably incorrect (per email R.Hocking 12 Feb 2008). Reassigned in 1995 from Quaternary to Pliocene, from above to below Ascot and Yoganup Formations. Forms a minor semi-unconfined aquifer.
Lithology Description: Brown to pale-grey, somewhat silty, slightly feldspathic, medium- to coarse-grained subangular sand.

General Comments: Narryer Terrane.
Lithology Description: Medium grained porphyritic monzogranite with tabular feldspar phenocrysts
Bioclastic sandy limestone; richly fossiliferous, notably with mollusc shells.

General Comments: Forms the Karratha Terrane of the West Pilbara Superterrane (per statement by M.Van Kranendonk/GSWA, Mar06). Removed from Pilbara Supergroup in 2006.
Lithology Description: Basalt, komatiite, serpentinised peridotite, chert, banded iron formation, carbonate, ferruginous clastic rocks, felsic volcanic and intrusive rocks, amphibole schist, quartz-mica schist, jaspilite; metamorphosed, locally sheared and foliated.

General Comments: Of  Hickman, 1997. GSWA Ann Review 1996-97 p76-81. See also Roebourne Group.
Vasse River Coalfields, Perth Basin. Correlated lithologically and palynologically with Irwin Coal Measures in the Northern Perth Basin.
Lithology Description: Characterised by poorly sorted feldspathic sandstone intercalated with siltstone and carbonaceous shale grading up into coal.

General Comments: Reserved misspelt as Rosarnel.
Lithology Description: Littoral sand, beach-ridge/dune unit of uncemented sand and shelly sand; includes a shoaling sequence of sediments.

General Comments: East Kimberley region. Kimberley Province. Part of Tickalara Metamorphics, Lamboo Complex. 1863 +/- 3 Ma.
Lithology Description: Foliated biotite-muscovite metasyenogranite and felsic gneiss; locally migmatitic and sillimanite bearing.

General Comments: Used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Rothsay locale, Rothsay 1:100k sheet area. 29deg 17'S 116deg53'E. Type area: Mount Mulgine. Intrudes at base of greenstone sequences, most commonly the base of the Polelle Group.
Lithology Description: Metagranodiorite to metatonalite, typically showing stretching lineations; locally with mica-rich marginal facies. Monzogranite to syenogranite. Granitic schist with abundant amphibolite rafts up to 50m long, locally strongly deformed;

General Comments: Of Passmore (1970).  Age: 100 000 +/-20 000 yrs B.P.
Lithology Description: Coral reef and shell limestone.

General Comments: Named after Round Hummock Hill, Pilbara region. Several medium- to coarse-grained unmetamorphosed dolerite dykes; an unusual totally altered gabbro dyke, coarse-grained, pale grey, good textural preservation. Now (2018) known to be part of 1075 Ma Warakurna Supersuite, although not published yet (Ashley Ramsley, written communication). See also GSWA ENS: Hickman, AH (partial report), Round Hummock Dolerite (P_-WKrh-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 07 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Several medium- to coarse-grained unmetamorphosed dolerite dykes; an unusual totally altered gabbro dyke, coarse-grained, pale grey, good textural preservation.

General Comments: Extrusive and intrusive komatiities in the Lake Johnston greenstone belt, Norseman region. To be published: 100k mapsheets of Lake Johnston greenstone belt, Geological Survey of Western Australia
Lithology Description: Komatiitic basalt with local pyroxene spinifex texture; komatiite with local olivine spinifex texture, minor cumulate and talc-tremolite schist: both metamorphosed.
Quartz arenite, with minor dolomite
Crystal-rich, porphyritic or phaneritic, quartz-feldspar rhyolitic intrusions.

General Comments: Reserved as Rowles Lagoon Granite.
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained biotite monzogranite; locally plagioclase-phyric; foliated; high Ca granite.

General Comments: Only recognised easily in the Yarraloola 1:250k map sheet area (GSWA Bull 144 p239). Also replaces Roy Hill Shale. Not used by Thorne & Trendall (2001), Bull 144, because the Warrie Shale Member and the Roy Hill Shale Member are difficult to distinguish in northern Pilbara and are not recognised in the south. Name may be obsolete (2001).
Lithology Description: Dark-grey to black (weathering to white) shale; spheroidal pyrite concretions common; white or ferruginous chert layers commonly interspersed. Includes a tuffaceous band.

General Comments: Informal name for Eastern Goldfields Province data (HG 09/2006)

Lithology Description: Gypsum-bearing evaporites.

General Comments: Nearest town is Gascoyne Junction. For publication on the PINK HILLS and CANDOLLE 100K map sheets
Lithology Description: Pale grey, medium-grained, seriate to porphyritic metamonzogranite; typically with well-developed igneous layering; commonly with mingled pegmatite veins; minor mesocratic metagranodiorite; locally schistose

General Comments: East Kimberley, Gordon Downs 1:250 000 sheet area. Age ~850-800 Ma based on stromatolite fauna in Eliot Range Dolomite.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, dolomite, stromatolitic dolomite, dolomitic mudstone, mudstone and siltstone. Fluvial to shallow marine shelf deposits.

General Comments: See also Rudall Metamorphic Complex.  Of the Paterson Orogen. Hosts Kintyre U mineralisation.
Lithology Description: Schist, gneiss, amphibolite, quartzite. Metamorphosed up to granulite facies.
Foliated amphibole-plagioclase rock, amphibolite, serpentinite, tremolite-actinolite schist, banded quartz-magnetite-amphibole gneiss, talc schist and tremolite-actinolite-chlorite schist
Layered orthogneiss derived from fine to medium grained granite or monzogranite, and mafic, ultramafic and metasedimentary rocks

Stratigraphic Name: Rudall Complex - leucogranite, syenogranite and monzogranite
Lithology Description: Equigranular to porphyritic, massive to weakly or strongly foliated leucogranite, syenogranite and monzogranite, with amphibolite xenoliths; locally megacrystic or pegmatitic
Metamorphosed ultramafic rock, mainly serpentinite, orthoamphibolite, metagabbro and dolerite

Stratigraphic Name: Rudall Complex - orthogneiss, schist, amphibolite, metamafics
Lithology Description: Generally banded, even grained and mostly strongly foliated leucocratic to banded orthogneiss, ranging compositionally from granite, monzogranite and granodiorite; locally porphyritic; amphibolite and metasediment lenses or layers; local pegmatite

Stratigraphic Name: Rudall Complex - paragneiss, schist, quartzite, metacarbonate, banded iron formation, metachert
Lithology Description: Banded quartz-feldspar-biotite paragneiss, schist and quartzite; amphibole-chlorite schist, quartz-garnet-biotite-sulphide schist, partly graphitic metapelite, metacarbonates, metamorphosed banded iron formation, and metachert; minor skarn
Quartz-feldspar-biotite gneiss and charnockite
Quartzite, micaceous quartzite, psammitic gneiss, fine quartz-feldspar-muscovite gneiss and schist in places with kyanite, ilmenite, K-feldspar, sillimanite, garnet
Medium to fine grained metadolerite forming layered (porphyritic/non-porphyritic) mafic sills, with pods of metaperidotite in places.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Probable correlative of Bulldog Shale in South Australia.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, porcellanite, some sandstone. Marine fossils.
Monzogranite, non-foliated to weakly foliated

General Comments: Formerly  part of Bookingarra Gp  - reclassified into Croydon Group.  Age: 3000-2900Ma. Intruded by Negri Volcanics.  Redefined again as part of the Croydon Group (email - Van Kranendonk/GSWA 2006). Hosts the notable massive sulfide mineralisation. Restored to Bookingarra Group in 2017 redefinition.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed shale and siltstone; minor sandstone; graded beds; locally well-developed slatey cleavage.

Reserved by: D.F. Close, I.R. Scrimgeour, C.J. Edgoose
General Comments: Published in Surface Geology of Australia, 1:1,000,000 scale - Northern Territory
Lithology Description: Orthopyroxene- and clinopyroxene-bearing granite, with rounded phenocrysts of zoned plagioclase 3¿5 mm in diameter and pyroxene phenocrysts 1¿2 mm in diameter, in a fine-grained groundmass.

General Comments: Nullagine and Noreena Downs 1:100 000 sheet areas
Age: <3.3Ga.  In the Pilbara Craton - West Pilbara Superterrane.  In structural contact with Regal Fm (Regal Terrane).
Lithology Description: Includes metabasalt, serpentinised peridotitic komatiite, talc-chlorite schist, grey- and white-banded chert  and black chert (Van Kranendonk 2006).

General Comments: Informal name for Eastern Goldfields Province data (HG 09/2006). Where published?
Geological province: Murchison Domain.
Lithology Description: Coarse clastic sedimentary rocks (chert pebble to boulder conglomerate), minor chert; weakly metamorphosed; schistose pelite and psammite, local biotite porphyroblasts and minor bands of felsic volcaniclastic rock.
Predominantly green-grey, micaceous, poorly consolidated sandstone, with interbedded grey shale and siltstone.  Correlates with the Kockatea Sandstone (Northern Perth Basin).

General Comments: Previously mapped as Yambarra Beds (Randal, 1962). Max. thickness: >222m. Victoria Basin. Hosts barite at the Saddle Creek deposit.
Lithology Description: Basal cross-bedded sandstone; upper siltstone, oolitic dolostone, dolomitic sandstone; minor shale, dolostone, dolarenite.
Sequence of sedimentary, pyroclastic and volcanic (both felsic and mafic) rocks, metamorphosed to greenschist or lower amphibolite facies.

General Comments: Interfingers with laterally located Gogo Shale, Virgin Hills Formation and Pillara Limestone.
Lithology Description: Fossiliferous, shallow marine reef complex marginal slope facies yellow to light grey calcarenite and calcirudite with thinner beds of calcareous siltstone and shale; slump folding is common, with rolled blocks of reef limestone in places

General Comments: Of Passmore (1967, 1970) and Playford and Low (1972). Age: ~3670 BP. Originally included Becher Sand (seagrass bank suite of sand) which was separated out by Semeniuk and Searl (1983). Distribution of the formation coincides with that of the Quindalup Dune System (GSWA Bull 124, p. 212, 1976)[RefID 36293].
Lithology Description: Quartz skeletal sand, humic quartz sand (soil), calcreted sand, medium and coarse sand and shelly sand, and beach rock.

Dominantly red-brown argillaceous, silty and sandy dolomite grading to dolomitic mudstone, with minor sandstone interbeds; anhydrite is common throughout as small nodules and vein fillings. Pale green reduction spots.
Interbedded sandstone, limestone, dolomite and shale; minor coal, evaporite and volcanics.

General Comments: Supersedes "Saint George Formation"

Age:3520-3400Ma. Within Pilbara Supergroup in Pilbara Craton. Originally included Towers Fm, Apex Basalt, Panorama Fm.+ Euro Basalt (Hickman 1983) - Euro Basalt  now reassigned to Kelly Group. Subgroup redefined as only Apex Basalt and Panorama Formation.
Lithology Description: Banded iron formation, shale, felsic volcaniclastics, chert, jaspilite, agglomerate, dolerite, basalt, ultramafic rocks, basaltic andesite, amphibolite, chlorite schist, felsic schist, komatiitic basalt, siliciclastic rocks; metamorphosed

General Comments: Part of the Albany-Fraser Orogen.
Lithology Description: Pelitic gneisses and mafic granulite, porphyritic granitic gneiss and two-pyroxene metagabbro. Garnet-cordierite migmatite.

General Comments: Age updated by I.Sweet.  Type example is Sally Downs Suite? See also Sally Downs supersuite.
Lithology Description: Mafic intrusions; biotite-bearing norite, gabbronorite, gabbro; cut by veins of granitoid rock. Fine- to coarse-grained biotite monzogranite, syenogranite, and granodiorite; biotite(-hornblende) tonalite; even-textured to porphyritic.

Stratigraphic Name: Sally Downs Supersuite - norite, gabbronorite, gabbro
Lithology Description: Biotite-bearing norite, gabbronorite and minor gabbro; veins of intermediate hybrid rock; hybrid rock cut by veins of coarse-grained porphyritic tonalite and granodiorite

General Comments: Kimberley Province. Within the Sally Downs Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Medium-grained, even textured biotite-hornblende tonalite; minor biotite-bearing quartz diorite and biotite leucogranite.

General Comments: Equivalent to the 'Sally Malay intrusions' shown on the McINTOSH 1:100 000 and DIXON RANGE 1:250 000 map sheets, and roughly equates with the Group V layered intrusions of Hoatson (2000). Of the 'Group V' intrusions, the Sally Malay, Dave Hill, Fletcher Creek, Frog Hollow, Mabel Downs Homestead, McKenzie Spring, Wilson Creek, and Spring Creek intrusions are considered to belong to the Sally Malay Suite.
Lithology Description: Layered mafic-ultramafic intrusions: gabbro, orthopyroxenite, leucogabbro, leucogabbronorite, anorthosite, olivine gabbro, olivine gabbronorite, gabbronorite, troctolite, olivine leucogabbro, peridotite, dunite, wehrlite, harzburgite.

General Comments: Unexposed mafic intrusive unit assigned to the Moodini Supersuite, intersected during drilling of Madura Province basement underlying the Eucla and Bight Basins. Published in: Occhipinti, SA, Doyle, M, Spaggiari CV, Korsch, R, Cant, G, Martin, K, Kirkland, CL, Savage, J, Less, T, Bergin, L and Foz, L 2014, Interpretation of the deep seismic reflection line 12GA-T1: northeastern Albany-Fraser Orogen, in Albany-Fraser Orogen seismic and magnetotelluric (MT) workshop 2014: extended abstracts compiled by CV Spaggiari and IM Tyler, Geological Survey of Western Australia, Record 2014/6, p. 52-68. Plumridge Map Sheet. Unexposed gabbro and gabbronorite identified by a distinct, north-northeasterly trending belt of remanently magnetized intrusions within the east Albany-Fraser Orogen that were intersected in exploration drillcores. The age of the gabbro is unknown, and it intrudes metasedimentary rocks of unknown age. Originally informally named the Salt Creek Complex by Mithril Resources Limited (2003, 2005) who identified it in drillcores. Gabbroic bodies range from 2-12km in diameter. Appears to intrude the Northern Foreland, Tropicana and Biranup Zones based on magnetic images where magnetic lows are coincident with drilled gabbroic rocks. May be part of the Gnowangerup-Fraser Dyke Suite or represent a younger event.
Lithology Description: Quartz diorite gabbro, gabbro, oligoclase-labradorite-orthopyroxene-clinopyroxene-biotite-magnetite-quartz gabbro and plagioclase-clinopyroxene-bitoite-ilmenite-magnetite-apatite gabbro.

General Comments: Consists of: South Caroline Clay, Yenyening Formation and Quairading Sandstone. Possibly Oligocene to Pliocene age. In Yilgarn Craton area.
Lithology Description: A palaeochannel system of sediments.

General Comments: De Grey (2757) area, Pilbara region. Port Hedland 1:250 000 sheet area. Redefined from the now defunct Paradise Plains Formation and reassigned to the new Bookingarra Formation of the Croydon Group (GSWA Mar.06).In 2016 Hickman states in GSWA Report 160 p59 that Salt Well Member, which is in the East Pilbara Terrane, E of the Ord Range greenstone belt,  is now considered part of the Lalla Rookh Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Mafic volcanic and intrusive rocks; includes debris-flow deposits; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Late Mesoproterozoic succession in Central WA. Same age as Mission Group.  Replaces part of Sunbeam Group. Salvation Basin.
Lithology Description: Cross bedded sandstone and siltstone with interbedded stromatolitic dolomite and evaporites.

General Comments: Lagrange SE51-10, Roebuck Plains 3461. Mudstone dominated interval with limestone interbeds and limestone nodules throughout. Type section is in petroleum well Olympic 1, Broome Platform, Canning Basin. Unit is 200 meters thick with continuous core from upper contact with overlying Willara Formation to the lower contact with the lower Nambeet Formation (?Wilson Cliffs Member: also to be reserved and defined). To be published = End of 2017 in GSWA Report.
Lithology Description: Mudstone dominated interval with limestone interbeds and limestone nodules throughout.
Siltstone, sandstone and claystone; micaceous, carbonaceous; locally glauconitic.

General Comments: In refID 72034. (GSWA (2016). 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology of Western Australia. Informal combination of units to suit map scale. Also Subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, sandstone and claystone; carbonaceous, locally glauconitic; radiolarian siltstone in Bejah Claystone.

General Comments: East Kimberly Region. Dated at 1788 +/- 6 Ma and 1790 Ma. See also San Sou Granite.
Lithology Description: Medium- to fine-grained biotite monzogranite; scattered fine-grained mafic inclusions.

General Comments: Newly added to the Weaber Group -  forms part of revision by Gorter et al (2005). Overlain by Sunbird Fm.which may(?) truncate it, or it it pinches out. Geological province: onshore Bonapart Basin/Petrel-Sub-basin.
Lithology Description: Loose, very well sorted , fine-grained to rarely medium-grained sandstone.

General Comments: Originally reserved as Sandfire Flat. PUBLICATION: Semeniuk, V., 2008, Journal of the Royal Society of Western Australia Volume 91 Part 1 (Supplement): 53-148.  Radiocarbon dating of shells and sediment within the Formation places it in the Holocene, viz., 1390 +/-170 yrs BP, 3170 ± 180 yrs BP, 3170 ± 130 yrs BP, 3415 +/- 260 yrs BP, 4070 +/- 220 yrs BP, 4470 +/- 120 yrs BP, 5070 +/-270 yrs BP, 7280 +/- 290 yrs BP, 7450 ± 190 yrs BP.
Lithology Description: Light-coloured to white, cream to grey bioturbated to structureless to locally root-structured to laminated calcilutite and shelly calcilutite.
Fine to coarse grained glauconitic sandstone.

General Comments: Mount Rennie 1:250, 000 map sheet (SF52-15).  Of the Kintore Domain, Warumpi Province.
Lithology Description: Interlayered and strongly foliated quartzite and quartz-muscovite schist with minor metabasite

Reserved by: Sheppard S., Tyler I.M., Griffin T.J.
General Comments: East Kimberley region
Lithology Description: Foliated, medium- to coarse-grained biotite monzogranite; minor biotite granodiorite.

General Comments: To be used in Mount Belches 3335 1:100 000 sheet explanatory notes. Redefinition of type section.
Lithology Description: Iron formation unit comprising wacke. mudstone and ferruginous mudstone.

General Comments: The Satellite Igneous Complex is a concordant mafic-ultramafic intrusive body that lies between the Hickies Bore Basalt and the Songvang Formation (mainly basaltic) in the Agnew-Lawlers area. It grades from peridotite and pyroxenite at the base to gabbro and dolerite on the top wheretobepublished = GSWA digital package 2013/2014. Geographical name = Satellite Well.
Lithology Description: Dolerite, gabbro ; metamorphosed. Strongly foliated mafic amphibolite. Serpentinite, pyroxenite - commonly altered to tremolite. Peridotite including adcumulate dunite and minor pyroxenite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Geological province: Mallina Basin/Pilbara Craton.
Lithology Description: Biotite(-hornblende) granite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File SE/52-10. Of the Halls Creek Orogen. In the Lamboo Complex (eastern zone).  Age: c.1880Ma. Different unit from Saunders nomenclature for NT granite and suite.
Lithology Description: Cross-bedded quartzite, arkosic quartzite, lithic arenite and quartz conglomerate; interbedded, buff-coloured phyllite is prominent near the top of the sequence.

General Comments: Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).
Lithology Description: Layered mafic-ultramafic intrusion.

General Comments: NOT related to Sawpit Sandstone, SA, VIC.

Bentley Basin. Talbot 1:250k sheet SG52-09. To be published: Werner, M, Howard, HM, Smithies, RH, Aitken, ARA and Medlin C 2012, Mount Eveline, WA Sheet 4345: Geological Survey of Western Australia, 1:100 000 Geological Series.
Lithology Description: Rhyolite, possibly as lavas and pyroclastic rocks, but may also include subvolcanic intrusions; typically shows a fine- to coarse-grained granofelsic texture, indicating weak to moderate recrystallization.

General Comments: Extract: ----"The Scorpion `Subgroup' of Williams (1990a) is here raised to group status, following the elevation of the Bangemall 'Group' to supergroup status by Martin et al. (1999). There are at least three thick couplets of evaporitic dolomite overlain by mixed sandy and silty siliciclastic rocks. The Scorpion Group was deposited in a northward-deepening coastal setting, sourced from adjacent areas to the south. The pattern of outcrop suggests that there is a major evaporitic diapir (now collapsed because of salt solution and withdrawal) in the central part of the graben occupied by the group. Formations have not been established within the group, although this would be possible with further work. The Scorpion Group is a probable correlative (based on tentative stromatolite biostratigraphy, Grey, K., GSWA, 2000, pers. comm.) of the lower parts of the latest Palaeoproterozoic - early Mesoproterozoic Edmund Group, the lowermost component of the Bangemall Basin that is exposed about 200 km to the west (Fig. 3; Martin et al., 1999). Dating using U-Pb SHRIMP suggests that deposition of the Edmund Group began at about 1640 Ma (Nelson, 1995)".   SOURCE DOCUMENT::   HOCKING, R. M., JONES, J. A., PIRAJNO, F., and GREY, K., 2000, Revised lithostratigraphy for Proterozoic rocks in the Earheedy Basin and nearby areas: Western Australia Geological Survey, Record 2000/16.
Lithology Description: Cross bedded sandstone and siltstone with interbedded stromatolitic dolomite and evaporites.

General Comments: Previously of Coolgardie Group. Now (2016) reassigned to the Broad Arrow Subgroup, Kalgoorlie Group. Scotia Basalt lies within the Bardoc and Kalgoorlie 1:100K  map sheet areas.
Lithology Description: Tholeiitic and/or komatiitic basalt flows; pillowed to massive; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Also referred to as just Scott Rock, or Scott Rock granite. Crystallisation age of 1175+\-12 Ma for the monzogranite at Scott Rock is typical of the ages of Esperance Supersuite granites (1200-1140 Ma, Kirkland et al., 2014). Intruded into Ragged Basin/Mount Ragged Formation. Post-dates Ragged Basin deformation and 1175+\-12 Ma monzogranite age provides minimum age of structural emplacement of Ragged Basin thrust slices.
Glenburgh 1:250 000 sheet area, SG50-6, Gascoyne region.
Lithology Description: Porphyritic to equigranular, coarse-grained, biotite- and muscovite-bearing monzogranite, syenogranite, and pegmatite; locally tourmaline bearing. Orbicular texture in places.

General Comments: Lake Lefroy map sheet area. To be published: East Yilgarn 2013-14 update. Digital package Geological Survey of Western Australia.

Lithology Description: Coarse porphyritic biotite monzogranite, partly recrystallised or chloritised in places

General Comments: Used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Conformably overlying Golden Grove Member and underlying Minjar Member. Probably locally transgressive downward into Golden Grove stratigraphy.
Lithology Description: Porphyritic dacite with lesser rhyodacite and felsic volcaniclastic units; locally with significant sulphide mineralization; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Informally named bed containing rich macrofossil assemblages within the Virgin Hills Formation.
Includes 3 unnamed subunits.[Comment from GSWA June 2016: is likely to become an Igneous Complex at Formation rank]
Lithology Description: Peridotite, commonly altered to a talc-carbonate assemblage; cumulate texture; pyroxenite, gradational contact with overlying gabbro; gabbro with subordinate pyroxenite; all metamorphosed

General Comments: WA Amadeus Basin. Only exposed in the Searle Hills, which will be the type area. Previously mapped as Sir Frederick Conglomerate, but contact relationships indicate that it is older than the Sir Frederick.
GSWA geochron record 1382 states that this unit is in the Western Zone of the Lamboo Province of Griffin et al. (2000).
Lithology Description: Foliated, sparsely porphyritic, medium to fine grained biotite monzogranite with minor syenogranite and granodiorite; numerous shear zones and quartz veins

General Comments: To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Seeligson Well, Ninghan 1:100k sheet area. 29deg11'S 117deg06'E. Type area: not specified. Crosscuts all units in the region such as Tuckanarra Suite granitic rocks and Mougouderra Basin metsedimentary rocks.
Lithology Description: Coarse-grained, undeformed monzogranite with 4-12 mm grain size; locally with 30 mm long K-feldspar megacrysts;  metamorphosed

General Comments: Lack of negative gravity anomaly suggests this unit is thin. Highly magnetic. Chemical parent (Frederick Suite) is I-type.

Lithology Description: Unconsolidated, white bioclastic quartz-carbonate sand of modern beaches and transgressive dune fields. Foredune and dune sand.

General Comments: Defined as Septimus Formation by Guillaume (1966). See also Lexicon. SD52-10,14. Formerly called "Mount Septimus Series", "Mount Septimus Limestone".
Lithology Description: Dolomitic and calcareous sandstone, minor limestone.

General Comments: Described. Turee Creek Basin.
Described. Turee Creek Basin.
Described. Turee Creek Basin.
Described. Turee Creek Basin.
Briefly described. Turee Creek Basin.

Quartzofeldspathic sandstone; massive to planar bedded; rare pebble lags and cross-bedding; metamorphosed.Upper section of the Kurrawang Formation approximately 1300m thick. To be published: Geological Survey of Western Australia Digital release of the 2013-14 East Yilgarn update.
Lithology Description: Quartzofeldspathic sandstone; massive to planar bedded; rare pebble lags and cross-bedding; metamorphosed
Grey, stromatolitic fossiliferous and oncoid limestone.

General Comments: a conglomerate at the base of the Loongana Formation.

Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed gabbro, epidotised gabbro, quartz gabbro, gabbronorite, norite, pyroxenite

General Comments: Briefly described. Halls Creek Orogen. Mainly Gordon Downs 1:250 000 sheet area. Supposed to be superseded by Shepherds Bore Plutonic Complex (see definition). Used in Proterozoic Granites GIS. Use revived by GSWA - see Kimberley 2013 update.
Lithology Description: Weakly porphyritic, biotite monzogranite and syenogranite.

General Comments: Replaces Sherlock River complex?? Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).
Lithology Description: Olivine gabbro, leucogabbro, granophyric gabbro, minor pyroxenite, granophyre; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Map Sheet: SF50-10 Wyloo 1:250k. Nearest Town: Paraburdoo. The Shingle Creek Group is proposed as the formal name to replace the informal lower Wyloo Group. As such it includes the Beasley River Quartzite, Cheela Springs Basalt, and Wooly Dolomite. Wyloo Group is now reserved for what was informally referred to as the upper Wyloo Group. To be published = The name has been used on all WA state-level datasets and maps since 2014, and is mentioned in the explanatory notes that accompany the 1:2 500 000 state map. A full formal description will soon be published in ENS, and may be included in a Record or external publication soon. See also the equivalent Horseshoe Supersequence.

Lithology Description: Quartzose and silty dolostone, dololutite, dolarenite, dolostone, sandstone; minor siltstone and shale; local intraformational conglomerate.

Stratigraphic Name: Sholl Shear Zone mafic volcanics, amphibolite, ultramafics 78362
General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the Mafic-Ultramafic Event Series dataset 2013. Minor deformed mafic volcanic rocks associated with mylonitic granitic rocks; felsic volcanic and sedimentary rocks in Sholl Shear Zone, Pilbara Craton. Sholl Shear Zone is up to 1000 m wide.
