Source: Hickman, A.H. and Smithies, R.H., 2001. Roebourne, Western Australia (Second Edition), 1:250 000 Geological series map (Sheet SF 50-3). Geological Survey of Western Australia: Perth, Explanatory Notes, 52 pp.
Lithology Description: Deformed mafic volcanics, amphibolite, minor ultramafic rocks

General Comments: In sheet area SE51-13. Radiocarbon dating of shells and soil within the Formation places this unit in the Holocene, viz., 1190 +/-170 yrs BP, 2440+/-190 yrs BP.  PUBLICATION: Semeniuk, V., 2008, Journal of the Royal Society of Western Australia Volume 91 Part 1 (Supplement): 53-148.
Lithology Description: In general, light-coloured to white, laminated, cross-laminated to bedded, to structureless and root-structured quartzose calcareous fine to medium sand.

General Comments: Geological province: Collie Basin.  Originally defined as maximum age = Late Carboniferous
Lithology Description: Mainly diamictite, tillite, sandstone.

General Comments: Previously considered a Formation rank unit within the Linger and Die Group, with Walter Williams Fm underlying. Now (2016) reassigned as a Member level unit within the Walter Williams Formation, Vetters Subgroup, Kalgoorlie Group.
Lithology Description: Ultramafic flows that bound the northern margin of the Liberty Granodiorite pluton. Komatiite; locally preserved olivine-spinifex texture; commonly serpentinized or silicified.

General Comments: East Pilbara Terrane.
Lithology Description: Meta biotite-hornblende granodiorite; locally common amphibolite and diorite xenoliths; moderately to strongly foliated.
Seriate biotite monzogranite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: mention as Silver Lake Peridotite in Clark et al (1986) p244, and other refs. Hosts Ni mineralisation.
Lithology Description: Comprises one or more laterally continuous flow units, with interflow sediments intercalated with komatiite flows.

General Comments: To be replaced by Singleton Basalt Member, Yalgoo Formation in 2015.
Lithology Description: Basal 1 km sequence of ultramafic rock, gabbro, high-Mg basalt, and BIF; overlain by a 2.5 km sequence of massive and pillowed tholeiites; then pillowed and pyroclastic tholeiites. Abundant subvolcanic gabbro and dolerite sills, some layered.

General Comments: Yilgarn Craton, Youanmi Terrane. Probably replaces Singleton Basalt Member, also established in Ninghan sheet area and used 2015, 2016.
Lithology Description: Psammitic and pelitic schist interlayered; metabasalt; metamorphosed ultramafic rock;serpentinized metaperidotite; interlayered pillow lava + hyaloclastite, siltstone; pyroxene spinifex-textured basalt.
Sequence of pebble, cobble and boulder conglomerate with kaolinitic sandstone matrix and thin beds and lenses of sandstone and pebbly sandstone.

General Comments: Not known if published by originator? PP 3/7/06.
Lithology Description: Consists of BIF intercalated with mafic, ultramafic and felsic flows and tuffs.

General Comments: For the MOUNT WOHLER map sheet; nearest town is Roebourne.  In the Pilbara Craton. Includes four geochemically distinct suites: Indee, Langenbeck, Portree and Radley Suites.
Lithology Description: Undifferentiated granitoid intrusions of the Sisters Supersuite; leucogranite (locally schlieric or pegmatitic), monzogranite, granodiorite, tonalite, diorite, tonalitic orthogneiss, rhyolite dykes, pegmatite; interleaved in places

General Comments: To be used on the Warrawagin mapsheet; nearest town is Marble Bar.

Lithology Description: Characterised by lens/pod accumulations of olivine accumulate.

General Comments: See also misspelled Sixty-six Hills Member"".
Lithology Description: Black-white chert, felsic tuff and coarse quartzite with well-rounded pebble size conglomerate.

General Comments: Defined in 1985 with age equivalent to Mesoproterozoic. Age updated 1995. Formerly included in the Savory Group which was partly replaced by the Sunbeam Group. See also the misspelt Skates Hill Formation - correct place name in WA is Skates Hills.
Lithology Description: Dolomite, chert, evaporite, sandstone, siltstone, shale, conglomerate

General Comments: See also Lexicon. D52-10,14.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, dolomitic sandstone and oolitic dolomite.
Low-Ca granite

General Comments: Bentley Basin. Age ~1078 Ma. Unit in Kunmarnara Group.
Lithology Description: Andesite and dacite, amphibole-bearing and locally amygdaloidal; rhyodacite and dacite with plagioclase phenocrysts; medium-grained granophyre, euhedral perthite and microcline crystals  surrounded by quartz and K-feldspar micrographic intergrowths.

General Comments: Tanami Province. Previously of the Frederick Suite. Appears to have been moved into the Grimwade Suite in 2013, NTGS Special publicaiton 5, p11:12.
Lithology Description: Porphyritic and non-porphyritic, mainly medium to fine grained, muscovite, biotite-muscovite, and biotite monzogranite; minor biotite granodiorite. Some pegmatite and aplite veins.
garnet-bearing schist with granitic veins

General Comments: Of Bentley Basin (GSWA, 2011). See also Smoke Hill Felsic Volcanics.
Lithology Description: Felsic lavas, including rhyolite and plagioclase-phyric dacite; lesser trachyte. Local layers or lenses of volcaniclastic breccias, conglomerates, sandstones and tuffaceous siltstones.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain.
Lithology Description: Tonalite and quartz diorite; metamorphosed

General Comments: New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk).  Also for use on DAMPIER map sheet.  Age:3012+/-3 AND 3013+/8Ma. Informally referred to as "Costean granodiorite" by Smith (2003).  Intrudes Ruth Well Formation.
Lithology Description: Foliated granodiorite.

General Comments: Norseman  1:250k sheet area, SI51-02. Garnet-rich pelitic and semipelitic gneisses, psammitic gneiss, calc-silicate rocks, and locally iron-rich metasedimentary rocks. All are interlayered with mafic amphibolite or granulite. To be published: Geological Survey of WA Report, to be published in 2013.
Lithology Description: Garnet-rich pelitic and semipelitic gneisses, psammitic gneiss, calc-silicate rocks, and locally iron-rich metasedimentary rocks. All are interlayered with mafic amphibolite or granulite.

General Comments: Supersedes Soanesville Subgroup, retaining all its units. Nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk). Type area is on NORTH SHAW 1:100 000 sheet, centred at 73100E, 7657000N. Age:c.3.20Ga. Removed from Pilbara Supergroup (Hickman 2011, in GSWA Annual Review 2009-10). Soanesville Basin.
Lithology Description: Conglomerate, arkosic sandstone, greywacke, lithic arenite, banded iron formation, shale, silicified shale (chert), sandstone, siltstone, quartzite, schist, basalt, mudstone, dacite, tuff, quartz-sericite schist; mafic schist.

General Comments: Unnamed unit within the Soanesville Group - for use in the 1:1M scale Surface Geology of Australia
Lithology Description: High-Mg basalt, chlorite schist, tremolite schist

General Comments: After Songvang Mine. Map Sheet: SH51-1,  Wildara 3041. Basalt; fine-grained and pyroxene-spinifex texture; includes minor komatiite; metamorphosed. To be published = GSWA geological map and explanatory notes, 2013/2014.
Lithology Description: Basalt; fine-grained and pyroxene-spinifex texture; includes minor komatiite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Fully described. Kimberley Province. Changed to Sophie Downs Granophyre Member for some years, but original name now revived [advice from GSWA Dec 2013]. Intruded by Woodward Dolerite?(from  Sophie Downs Granophyre Member).
Lithology Description: Variably foliated leucocratic and granophyric metamonzogranite.

General Comments: Geological Province: Kimberley Region. This unit in current use [advice from GSWA Dec 2013].
Lithology Description: Leucocratic metagranite, metarhyolite, metabasalt and amphibolite, and minor metasedimentary rock

General Comments: Reserved as South Caroline Clay Formation.
Lithology Description: Clays ranging from ferruginous greyish clay to gravelly green clay with slight brown striations; lenses formed in some areas of greenish sand, medium to coarse, subrounded to rounded grains.

General Comments: Probably not intended as formal name[CEBOCT97]

New name for silicic basalts in Mallina Basin, first described as "south Mallina basalt" (Smithies et al, 2004) - for inclusion in new Bookingarra Formation (Croydon Gp, De Group) - added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk). In 2016 Hickman states in GSWA Report 160 p59 that South Mallina Basalt Member, in the central part of the Mallina Basin, is present mainly within the Mallina Formation, although its stratigraphic position is not firmly established..
Lithology Description: Typically variolitic, commonly pyroxene spinifex textured, and pillowed siliceous high-Mg basalt.

General Comments: See also Maslin Sands, North Maslin Sand.
Lithology Description: Fluvial to marginal marine siliceous sand. Carbonaceous, pyritic, and glauconitic sand with goethitic pellets.

General Comments: Using a sequence stratigraphic framework, this unit the oldest of three 3rd order sequences that form the South Perth Supersequence. To be published: GA record in 2014 [actually GA Record 2015/09]. Offshore, not penetrated by any wells [recognised in seismic interpretations].
Lithology Description: Unknown.

General Comments: Using a sequence stratigraphic framework, this unit the second of three 3rd order sequences that form the South Perth Supersequence. This sequence comprises the Gage Sandstone, South Perth Shale and at places parts of the Leederville Formation. To be published: GA record in 2014 [actually GA Record 2015/09].
Lithology Description: Fine-grained to granular feldspathic sandstone interbedded with dark grey/black micaceous mudstone and siltstone; overlain by grey-black argillaceous, micaceous mudstone interbedded with carbonaceous, argillaceous, micaceous siltstone to sst.

General Comments: Using a sequence stratigraphic framework, this unit the [youngest] of three 3rd order sequences that form the South Perth Supersequence.
Lithology Description: Dominantly coarse grained quartzose sandstone with trace pyrite, mica and glauconite interbedded by thin carbonaceous material with rare coal and siltstone in Nth. Predominantly mudstone with trace glauconite and pyrite in Sth.

General Comments: Best known in subsurface in Perth metropolitan area onshore and the Vlaming Sub-basin offshore. See also South Perth Formation and other variations. Formerly included Gage Sandstone Member, which is raised to Formation status in 1995.
Lithology Description: Predominantly shale, glauconitic in part, with minor sandstone and siltstone.

General Comments: Of the Warnbro Megasequence. It largely coincides with the Gage Sandstone and South Perth Shale, however new biostratigraphy has changed the upper boundary of the sequence. To be published: GA record in 2014 [actually GA Record 2015/09]. Ages based on palynology.
Lithology Description: Fine-grained - very coarse feldspathic sandstone w interbedded mudstone and siltstone overlain by black argillaceous, micaceous mudstone. Grades upwards to siltstone with minor sandstone interbeds. Minor pyritic and glauconitic material.

General Comments: New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk).  Intrudes Nallana Formation. Intrudes Whundo Group of volcanics, but is 110M years younger.  No geological relationship with North Whundo Intrusion (mafic-ultramafic) and outcrops in a different area some 15km away and is 90M years older. All 3 units belong to separate geol. events.
Lithology Description: Massive, medium- to coarse-grained monzogranite; metamorphosed

General Comments: Map Sheet=Norseman SI51-2. Nearest Town=Norseman. Brief description=Syenogranite gneiss, typically interlayered with metagabbro.  Published in 2015 in Geological Survey of Western Australia Report 150, p33 etc.
Lithology Description: Syenogranite gneiss, typically interlayered with metagabbro.
Fine-grained felsic turbidites metamorphosed to schists, interbedded with tuffs.

General Comments: Defined 1958. Name possibly dropped ?1966 because 'unit' probably a mixture of Devonian & ?Permian conglomerate, but republished on 1998 Mt Ramsay map by GSWA.
Lithology Description: Boulder, with lesser pebble, conglomerate, coarse- to fine-grained sandstone, with minor siltstone; alluvial-cone, fan-delta and submarine-fan deposits. Poorly exposed.

General Comments: Variation of Spear Hill Adamellite (Defined)
Lithology Description: K-feldspar-phyric biotite monzogranite

General Comments: Savory Basin.  For location of type area see Bullen Explan Notes (1995).
Lithology Description: Cross bedded poorly sorted granule and pebble sandstone and relatively well sorted pebble to boulder conglomerate common near base, fine sandstone and sandy micaceous siltstone near top.

General Comments: Lake Lefroy map sheet area. Andesite; pale grey coherent to brecciated; microporphyritic; ubiquitous fine biotite- hornblende mafic inclusions; metamorphosed. To be published: East Yilgarn 2013-14 update. Digital package Geological Survey of Western Australia.

In refID 72034. (GSWA (2016). 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology of Western Australia.  See also stratno 80970 subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area, based on this one.
Lithology Description: Porphyritic dacite; fine-grained, massive or flow banded.

General Comments: Previously part of Kimberley Basin, now redefined as Speewah Basin. Also dated at 1835 Ma. Of the Halls Creek Orogen.
Lithology Description: Lithic and feldspathic sandstone, quartz sandstone, chloritic and micaceous siltstone, shale; minor rhyolitic ashstone and tuff; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Different unit from Spencer Creek Group.
Lithology Description: Basal thinly-bedded, fine- or medium-grained quartz sandstone; silty sandstone; dolomitic sandstone typical of upper part. Includes halite casts and pseudomorphs.
Quartz-feldspar porphyry, probably ash-flow tuff; foliated.

General Comments: For SPLIT ROCK mapsheet; nearest town is Marble Bar. Includes 12 named monzogranites and Myanna Leucogranite. Split Rock Formation now an obsolete name (per M. Van Kranendonk, 4/4/02). Said to be intruded by Cooglegong Monzogranite. East Pilbara/Kuranna Terranes.See also misspelt Split Rock Suite.
Lithology Description: Syenogranite, monzogranite, granitic gneiss, pegmatite.

General Comments: For use on map sheet PINK HILLS; nearest town is Gascoyne Junction. To be published: MOUNT PHILLIPS, MOUNT AUGUSTUS, YINNETHARRA and PINK HILLS 1:100K map sheets.  Named for Spring Camp Creek in the area.
Lithology Description: Quartzite and quartz-muscovite schist; foliated; quartz metasandstone, feldspathic metasandstone, quartz-lithic metasandstone; locally ripple-marked and cross-bedded.

General Comments: Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008). Informal unit of Sally Malay Suite [advice from GSWA Dec 2013]
Lithology Description: Layered mafic-ultramafic intrusion; gabbro, leucogabbro, leucogabbronorite, gabbronorite, anorthosite, minor troctolite; some olivine and/or chromitite-bearing; in rhythmic cycles; peridotite and troctolite

General Comments: See also Spring Well Volcanic complex. Ages from two different rhyolite samples.
Lithology Description: Calc-alkaline basaltic andesite to andesite, and dacite-rhyolite lavas, associated breccias; abundant microdiorite sills and dykes; subordinate volcanogenic conglomerate, sandstone and shale; high Sr/Y andesite and lamprophyre dykes.

General Comments: This name reserved to replace existing Spring Well Complex. Map Sheet SG51-13, 3142, DARLOT.  Nearest Town = Leonora?. Brief description = Rhyolitic to andestic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks; metamorphosed. To be published: GSWA Explanatory Notes Database.

Originally reserved as Springhill Member (Semeniuk 1995). Defined as Springhill Limestone Member by Semeniuk (1995). Not related to the 2-worded Palaeozoic Spring Hill Limestone in Bonaparte Basin (Druce 1963).
Lithology Description: Calcilutite and shelly calcilutite.

General Comments: Includes 3 unnamed units.These intrusions are coeval with granite and unlayered gabbro of the 1864-1852 Ma Paperbark Supersuite [advice from GSWA Dec 2013].
Lithology Description: Leucogabbro, anorthosite, and minor troctolite; olivine gabbro and chromite layers; rhythmic cycles.

General Comments: Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008). Informal unit of Springvale Suite [advice from GSWA Dec 2013]
Lithology Description: Layered mafic-ultramafic intrusion; gabbro, leucogabbro, leucogabbronorite, gabbronorite, anorthosite, minor troctolite; some olivine and/or chromitite-bearing; in rhythmic cycles; peridotite and troctolite
Metamorphosed altered quartz-phyric microgranite and quartz chloritoid kyanite rock

General Comments: ?Possibly an igneous province that includes the Stafford Granite as well as other felsic and mafic rocks.
Balfour Downs 1:250 000 sheet. Contains 'string of beads' macrofossils.
Lithology Description: Interbedded sandstone, siltstone, shale, conglomerate, dolomite, chert
Calcarenite, dolomite and chert.

General Comments: Use on Bremer Bay & Newdegate sheets.
Lithology Description: Thin basal conglomerate overlain by pebbly sandstone and dolomitic limestone. Discontinuous. Dolomite; metamorphosed, massive to finely bedded; locally ?stromatolitic.

General Comments: In the Louisa Basin. Age: c.610Ma.
Lithology Description: Flaggy thinly bedded poorly sorted purple coarse greywacke with a ferruginous matrix and common graded bedding, cross bedding, slumps and ripples
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

Lithology Description: Contains stromatolites. Sandstone, dolomite and siltstone, some claystone and shale.

General Comments: Age is controversial. The succession remains poorly constrained. Diagenetic xenotime minimum age of deposition around 1800 Ma; maximum age of 2016 Ma from detrital zircons.
Lithology Description: Lower and upper units of quartzite; a middle unit of quartzite, slate and phyllite.

General Comments: Type section 120m thick. Correlated with Masterton Sandstone. Birindudu Basin. Max depositional age from Stirling Sandstone, but note that max depositional ages from various parts of underlying Birrindudu Group are younger (a foliated granite underlying basal conglomerate is 1794+/-4 Ma, sublithic sst from Coomarie Range gives Max dep age: 1812+/-8 Ma).
Lithology Description: Quartz arenite, dolomitic sandstone, conglomerate

General Comments: Includes former Stockton Formation (renamed Shotts Formation), and Mosswood Formation and Moorhead Formation.
Lithology Description: Glaciolacustrine/argillaceous sequence.

General Comments: Age: c.2790Ma. Originally reserved as Stockyard Basalt (Watkins K.P., A.H.Hickman, R.Davy, 1985) and published by Watkins and Hickman (1990). Geological province: Murchison Domain.
Lithology Description: Basalt and komatiitic basalt, minor felsic tuff; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Lithological Descriptor = aeolian calcarenite. Map Sheet = 1937. Nearest Town = Eneabba. Brief description = Fine to coarse grained well sorted aeolianite, yellow coloured, poorly to well cemented, and with distinctive cross-bedding. Mineralogy: carbonate, quartz, feldspar. Deposited in Marine Isotope Stage 9  (325 ka). To be published = This year (2014) in Australian Journal of Earth Sciences.
Lithology Description: Consists of an eolian calcarenite/calcrete-microbialite/paleosol cycle.

General Comments: Previously combined with Carmichael Sandstone as "Stokes Formation" (Prichard and Quinlan, 1962).
Lithology Description: A succession of interbedded shale and siltstone, with thin beds of silty-sandy limestone containing abundant fossil debris; red shale and lesser grey-green siltstone; and interbedded red to green shale, grey-green siltstone and fine sandstone.

General Comments: New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk).  Intrudes Cleaverville Formation.
Lithology Description: Quartz-rich granophyre and quartz- and feldspar-porphyritic dacite.
Subfriable medium- to coarse-grained quartz sandstone, subordinate argillaceous and feldspathic sandstone, granule sandstone, red shale.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Massive boulder fanglomerate at the base overlain by mixed fluviatile to deltaic conglomerate and sandstone; clasts are rounded and mostly granitoid with lesser quartzite, vein quartz and foliated felsic volcanics
Dolerite to basal pyroxenite; differentiated sill; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Named after Straggler Rocks north of Carnac Island.  Used with incorrect spelling by Crostella and Backhouse (2000).  Briefly described.
Southern Cross area. Map sheet area SH50-16, 2735. Biotite monzogranite; fine to coarse grained; K-feldspar-phyric. To be published: GSWA 1:100,000 geological map.
Lithology Description: Biotite monzogranite; fine to coarse grained; K-feldspar-phyric.

General Comments: Age: 3.24Ga.  Not related to Strelley Pool Chert.  In the Pilbara Craton.
Lithology Description: Hornblende-biotite monzogranite, granophyric monzogranite, and subvolcanic granitoid intrusions; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Silicified carbonate sedimentary rocks contained within this formation have been mapped as chert in some areas. Strelley Pool Formation has been removed from the Kelly Group (RefID: 64405, 2008). It is now considered to be a regional marker separating Warrawoona and Kelly Groups, but part of neither.
Lithology Description: Silicified carbonate rocks, sandstone, conglomerate, chert, and dolomite, stromatolitic; layered chert after dolomite; quartz-rich sandstone or arenite; felsic volcaniclastic conglomerate and sandstone, minor felsic schist; all metamorphosed.

General Comments: Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).
Lithology Description: Metagabbro, minor metapyroxenite, serpentinite after peridotite

General Comments: Originally included in the Auvergne Group, also previously included in the 'Victoria River Group' of Traves (1955) and in the 'Coolibah Formation' of Laing and Allen (1956). Unconformably overlain by Jasper Gorge Sandstone in the Victoria Basin.
Lithology Description: Lower part is grey shale and red-brown micaceous siltstone; a succession of interbedded micaceous claystone, siltstone, minor mudstone and sandstone.

General Comments: In refID 72034. (GSWA (2016). 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology of Western Australia, as an unnamed member of the Stubbins Formation. Granites-Tanami Orogen.  Also Subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed dolerite sill; minor interlayered, metamorphosed feldspathic wacke, sandstone, siltstone, and mudstone
Coal-bearing siliciclastic rocks with sandstone dominating, and conglomerate/siltstone/mudstone/coal.

General Comments: NORTH SHAW 1:100 000 sheet area 2755.  Age: ca. 3.24Ga. Now incorporates rocks of former Golden Cockatoo Formation (Van Kranendonk 2006). Formerly included Six Mile Creek Formation, which is now assigned to Euro Basalt. Formerly included Budjan Creek Formation, reassigned to the Soanesville Group in 2011.
Lithology Description: Felsic to mafic volcanics and volcaniclastic rocks, chert, volcaniclastic sandstone, greywacke, shale, basalt, komatiitic basalt, amphibolite, mafic and ultramafic schist, banded iron formation, quartz-carbonate rock, siltstone.
Microdiorite and diorite
Metadolerite

General Comments: Previously the older part of the Savory Group; parts of Sunbeam Group now replaced by Salvation Group. This group is lateral equivalent of of the oldest part of Officer Basin succession in the east - the Buldya Group.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, conglomerate, shale, mudstone, dolomite, stromatolitic dolomite and evaporitic rocks.

General Comments: Top unit of Weaber Group - forms part of revision by Gorter et al (2005) - detailed lithology included.
Lithology Description: Massive limestone with minor sandstone.

General Comments: Not related to Mesoproterozoic Supplejack Dolostone Member, Skull Creek Formation, Bullita Group.
Lithology Description: Sandstone: white to pale pink, sublithic arenite, quartz arenite, conglomerate, siltstone and shale, minor volcanogenic sandstone; fine to coarse grained, variably sorted.

General Comments: May replace informal Surprise Rocks complex?
Lithology Description: Migmatitic quartz-biotite orthogneiss.

General Comments: east Kimberley
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained, porphyritic biotite-hornblende monzogranite.

General Comments: Includes hydrocarbon source rocks.
For Map sheet 2034; nearest town Perth.
Lithology Description: Interbedded alluvial sands, silts and clays.

General Comments: Age: Defined as Late Silurian (1985) but shown as Early Devonian in 1994, 1998. Includes Frasnian fish scales. Previously of Kalbarri Group, but this term dropped in 1994.
Lithology Description: Oxidised carbonate and siliciclastic rocks with minor evaporite beds, deposited in a reducing shallow-lagoonal to supratidal environment.

General Comments: upgrading of Member to Formation status. Datig os form tuff layers near top of unit.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, dolomite (locally stromatolitic), siltstone, shale, minor conglomerate and limestone. Minor micro-tuff layers.

General Comments: Different from Swift Formation (Swift Beds) of NT.

For use on map sheet SH 51-3; nearest town is Cosmo Newbury. Forms a series of medium-grained mafic sills within the basalts of the Mount Sefton greenstone belt.  The sills are laterally extensive and locally exhibit some internal differentiation with more leucocratic rocks preserved near tops of sills. Dated at 2812 +/-5 Ma (GSWA SHRIMP age). To be published in several GSWA publications in near future, including 1:100K maps and geochronological reports.
Lithology Description: Dolerite; minor basalt or gabbro components; metamorphosed; gabbro; minor pyroxenite or quartz gabbro components; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Kimberley Region.
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained, variably porphyritic biotite-hornblende metagranodiorite and metamonzogranite; massive and foliated

General Comments: East Kimberly Region. See also Syenite Camp suite. This Suite includes Corrara Granite, Grimpy Monzogranite, Mount Fairbairn Monzogranite, Syenite Camp Monzogranite[advice from GSWA Dec 2013].
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained, even-textured or weakly porphyritic biotite granodiorite and tonalite, with subordinate biotite monzogranite; minor hornblende-bearing granodiorite and monzogranite; mafic enclaves.

General Comments: Wallaringa and Wodgina 1:100 000 sheets. Formerly included in the Pippingarra Granitoid Complex.  Incorrectly grouped into Sisters Supersuite in GSWA Record 2006/15 (p11 Table 2).
Lithology Description: Biotite(-muscovite) granite; seriate to equigranular; fine- to medium-grained, massive to weakly foliated and metamorphosed.

General Comments: Previous Officer Volcanics  and Kulyong Formation included in Table Hill Volcanics in 2009.  Age: 500+/-7Ma (K-Ar, Veevers 2000); 504+/18Ma (Stern, et al. 2005).  Whole rock Rb/Sr age of 575+/-40 Ma (Compston, 1974) is likely too old? K-Ar age of 484 +/- 4 Ma reflects alteration. Included in the Kalkarindji Suite in Oct 2009.
Lithology Description: Tholeiitic basalt, dolerite, friable fine grained sandstone.

General Comments: NORTH SHAW 1:100 000 sheet area 2755. Within the Warrawoona Group (Pilbara Supergroup). This is the oldest recognized formation of Pilbara Supergroup. See also misspelt Tabletop Formation.
Lithology Description: Amphibolite; metamorphosed mafic volcanic and intrusive rocks; locally schistose; metamorphosed jaspilitic chert.
Meso-melanocratic, biotite rich granodiorites to leucocratic K-feldspar rich granites.

General Comments: Paterson Orogen.
Geological province: Murchison Domain.  Age: c.2625Ma. Part of the Bald Rock Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Undeformed monzogranite to syenogranite; post-tectonic

General Comments: Latest age information (Crispe et al, 2007) suggests Birrindudu Group ranges from 1735 to 1640 Ma.  Talbot Well Formation is the middle unit of this group.
Lithology Description: Stromatolitic chert, locally massive or brecciated and poorly bedded; sublithic sandstone, quartz sandstone, laminated siltstone, shale and minor limestone.

General Comments: Defined 1975. See also Talga-Talga Subgroup. Within the Pilbara Supergroup. Dresser Formation and Mount Ada Basalt, formerly of this subgroup, now assigned to the new Coongan Subgroup, based on new age data.
Lithology Description: Amphibolite, carbonated-altered basalt, chert, mafic schist, ultramafic schist, komatiitic basalt, banded iron formation, felsic volcanic rocks, siliciclastic rocks, serpentinised peridotite, metadunite, dolerite, interlayered amphibolite and granite.

General Comments: Paterson Orogen.
Lithology Description: Polymictic conglomerate and arkosic sandstone with rare heavy-mineral bands; thin interbeds of fine-grained lithic wacke, siltstone and shale.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Defined by V.Semeniuk (1983). Also formerly the Coastal Limestone. C14 dating: >37 000 years BP. U-series thermal ionisation Mass spectrometer technique age: 0.117 - 0.133 Ma. Apparently intended to be superseded by Tims Thicket Limestone, Myalup Sand and Kooallup Limestone (Semeniuk, 1995: see RefID 62020) but subsequent publications appear not to have accepted this.
Lithology Description: Unconsolidated to strongly lithified calcarenite with calcrete/kankar soils; aeolian. Locally quartzose, feldspathic, or heavy-mineral-bearing. Large-scale eolian cross-bedding.

General Comments: Also informally referred to as the Tambina greenstone complex.
Lithology Description: Undivided granitoid rock ; well foliated.

General Comments: For the TAMBOURAH map sheet; nearest town is Marble Bar.  Age: 3435-3420Ma; age also given as 3.44 to 3.42Ga.  East Pilbara Terrane of Pilbara Craton.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed felsic intrusives; granodiorite, granite, monzogranite, syenogranite, quartz diorite, tonalitic orthogneiss, leucogranite, pegmatite, tonalite, schlieric leucogranite and diatexite

General Comments: Note incorrect grouping in the Tambina Supersuite on page 7 of GSWA Record 2006/15. Shown as a unit in the Split Rock Supersuite in the Marble Bar 3rd edition map (RefID 66108), apparently moving it out of the previous Sisters Supersuite.  Sheets and patches are included in Petroglyph Gneiss
Lithology Description: Pegmatite, syenogranite, granodiorite, monzogranite, leucogranite, granitoid gneiss, tonalitic orthogneiss

General Comments: Age: ~1880-<1835Ma.  Intruded by Repulse Aplite, Water Tower Tonalite. See also UNIT DEFINITION (2007) for age details. The names Tanami Group and Tanami Complex appear to be used interchangeably in some references; however, Tanami Group has now superseded Tanami Complex. Group intruded by doleritic sills and deformed by the ~1830Ma Tanami Event. Stubbins Formation added to Tanami Group in 2015 (GSWA 1:100 000 maps, Kearney 4557 and Lewis 4657). Consitituents probably all defined in NT?
Lithology Description: Schistose to phyllitic greywacke, arenite, siltstone, shale and conglomerate; chert, tuff, basalt, acid porphyry, quartzite, hornfels, arenite, amphibolite.
Includes porous and permeable, pale brown, slightly ferruginous, fine- to medium-grained sandstones with minor interbeds of ferruginous dolomitic siltstone.

General Comments: Geological Province: Edmund Basin. This unit appears to have been downgraded from a formation to a member of the Kiangi Creek Formation in ~2010. See also Tangadee Rhyolite Member.
Lithology Description: Coherent rhyolite and lapilli-bearing felsic volcaniclastic rocks.

General Comments: Clear statement of rank of Tangadee Rhyolite.

Lithology Description: Mixed felsic and mafic lavas (rhyolite and basalt) and tuffaceous sedimentary rocks.

General Comments: Biranup Zone, Kepa Kurl Booya Province, Albany-Fraser Orogen.
Lithology Description: Interlayered mafic and quartzofeldspathic gneiss with abundant leucosomes, locally with garnet.

General Comments: Mory's original shelf carbonates unit (1991) is redefined with the upper 26m placed separately in the Sunbird Formation (Gorter et al 2005). See also Tanmurra Group. May be equivalent to Point Spring Sandstone and/or Burvill Formation.  Age: ~328-~322Ma.
Lithology Description: Calcareous and dolomitic sandstone with minor limestone, siltstone and shale.

General Comments: Informal name. Consists of two main flat-lying pegmatite bodies, the southern body has a thickness of 5m and the northern body thickness is 25m.

Lithology Description: Medium-grained quartz-feldspar sandstone; locally calcareous with interbeds of siltstone, calcarenite and breccia; with some allochthonous blocks of reef limestone.
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Formerly included in Yeneena Supergroup, but not according to Rudall 1998, Nullagine 2007 1:250k maps. Some references give broad maximum age estimates from detrital zircon data.
Lithology Description: Interbedded quartz sandstone, quartz pebble conglomerate, micaceous siltstone and shale, minor dolomite.

General Comments: New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk). Also, to be used on PINDERI HILLS map sheet; nearest town Karratha. Age: 3236+/-3Ma.
Lithology Description: Foliated hornblende-biotite tonalite consisting of sericitised plagioclase with quartz and biotite.
Porphyritic biotite microgranite and microgranodiorite; phenocrysts of K-feldspar, biotite and quartz.

General Comments: Defined 1969. Defn on Tech File SD/52-14.
Lithology Description: Siltstone; minor sandstone and limestone.

General Comments: Basal age is poorly constrained from age of unconformably underlying Scrutton Volcanics (McArthur Basin tectonostrat map, Rawlings, 2001). Seems to be divided into upper and lower parts in Geology of Queensland 2013, p56, 58. Includes Wire Creek Sandstone, with  a maximum depositional age of 1847+/-13 Ma. Only other age given is maximum depositional age of 1843+/-4 Ma for Westmoreland Conglomerate.
Lithology Description: Conglomerate, sandstone, greywacke, dolostone; basalt, dolerite, rhyolite, rhyodacite, dacite, trachyte, microgranite.
Heterogeneous monzogranite with gneissic inclusions and 2965 Ma zircon xenocrysts; prograde amphibolite grade metamorphism.

General Comments: Previously in Savory Sub-Basin?
Lithology Description: Medium- to coarse-grained sandstone, quartz wacke, siltstone and shale; minor conglomerate.
Leucocratic quartz-albite-orthoclase granite, locally mylonitised, brecciated and silicified, with greenstone xenoliths; syenite group.

General Comments: In the Louisa Basin.  Age: <610Ma.
Lithology Description: Mainly fine- to medium-grained feldspathic sandstone and quartz wacke, interbedded with conglomerate, fine- to medium-grained quartz sandstone, and laminated siltstone and mudstone; minor dolomite
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain.  Age: c. 2625Ma. Part of the Bald Rock Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Monzogranite to syenogranite; undeformed, but with common igneous flow fabrics.

General Comments: Of the central Paterson Orogen.
At top of Malu Formation. Hosts Telfer gold mineralisation.
Lithology Description: Fine to medium grained quartz sandstone interbedded with clayey sandstone, siltstone and shale, pyritic quartzite, and minor carbonate rock

General Comments: Presented in 'defined' format. Supersedes Tern Member (Hyland Bay Fm). Of Hyland Bay Sub-group (Kinmore Gp).
Lithology Description: Seaward transition from coarser clastics to shales. Interbedded claystones, siltstones and fossiliferous shales, coarsening upwards into bioturbated sandstones, calcarenites

General Comments: Defn on Tech File E/52-2. Age: >1790Ma.
Lithology Description: Stromatolitic dolostone, sandy dolostone, oolitic dolostone, mudstone, micaceous siltstone, and fine-grained sandstone.

General Comments: For use on map sheet 2148; nearest town is Gascoyne Junction. Age: c.1665Ma. To be published, mid to late 2008 on YINNETHARRA 1:100K map sheet, 1st ed. in next release of GSWA's West Capricorn orogen GIS package. Age: 1663 +/- 5 Ma. Regionally metamorphosed c.1280 Ma.
Lithology Description: Strongly tectonised lenses of  metagranite within foliated, coarse-gr., porphyritic metamonzogranite of Davey Well Granite.Comprises metamorph'd aegerine-augite- or hornblende-bearing qtz diorite + minor tonalite. With scattered inclusions of amphibolite
Andesite and pillow basalt interbedded with thick beds of silicic volcaniclastic rocks and rhyolite lava.

General Comments: This name reserved to replace existing Teutonic Bore Complex. Map Sheet SH51-1, 3141, WEEBO.  Nearest Town = Leonora. Brief description = Rhyolitic to andesitic volcanic rocks; coeval basalt and dolerite. To be published: GSWA Explanatory Notes Database.

Of Tyler et al (1997b), assigned to Kimberley Group by Blake (1997). TURKEY CREEK, BOW 1:100 000 sheet areas, east Kimberley. 1800 Ma. Includes beds formerly mapped as Red Rock Beds or Mount Parker Sandstone. Age updated by I.Sweet.
Lithology Description: Fine- to coarse-grained lithic quartz sandstone; pebbly sandstone; conglomerate, siltstone and mudstone; basalt and basaltic breccia

General Comments: Published in Surface Geology of Australia, 1:1,000,000 scale - Western Australia
Lithology Description: Massive to amygdaloidal basalt flows and basaltic breccia, dolerite, minor sandstone, siltstone, and mudstone
Rift fill conglomerates, megabreccias and turbidites. Predominantly lithic sandstone, quartz wacke and intercalated siltstone and shale and subordinate dolomite.
Quartz-muscovite-chlorite schist after felsic tuff and conglomerate

General Comments: Defn on Tech File G/50-2.
See also Lexicon.

Lithology Description: Low-Ca granite.

General Comments: Age: a range given in references. Also referred to as Granites Granite. Previously of The Granites Supersuite, The Granites Suite. Now (2013) included in Grimwade Suite? [see NTGS Special Publication 5, p11:12]
Lithology Description: Pink and grey porphyritic and non porphyritic biotite adamellite; minor pegmatite and aplite; locally foliated.
Subequigranular, fine- to medium-grained biotite monzogranite to granodiorite. High Ca granite.

General Comments: Wallaringa & Wodgina 1:100 000 sheets.
Lithology Description: Fine- to medium-grained muscovite (-garnet) monzogranite.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Correlated with Windalia Radiolarite.

Named for Thirty Three River. For use on map sheet SG50-02; nearest town Gascoyne Junction. To be publ: GSWA, 2007, Western Capricorn Orogen, 2007 update: 1:100K Geological Information Series. Probably replaces Perseverance Supersuite, used in 2007.
Lithology Description: Porphyritic and leucocratic muscovite-biotite-tourmaline-bearing granite and metagranite, and pegmatites

General Comments: Bentley Basin.
Lithology Description: Porphyritic rhyolite with minor trachyte and dacite; vitric lavas; sample descriptions include: metabasalt, felsic volcanic rock, (feldspar-phyric) rhyolite, rhyodacite.
Contains abundant clasts of BIF, including pebbles of enriched ore derived from erosion of the Hamersley Group.

General Comments: GSWA has also used Three Mile Intrusion for this unit, but currently prefers the name Three Mile Dolerite [pers. comm. A. Riganti 30JUL2014]
Reserved as Throssell Range. See also Throssell Group.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, shale, dolomite and limestone.

General Comments: Lennard River 1:250 000 sheet area (SE51-8). Kimberley region. Different from Throssell Range Group.
Lithology Description: Blue-grey poorly laminated micaceous siltstone with minor shale interbeds; sandy in the upper parts with fine grained flaggy grey-green laminated micaceous sandstone interbeds

General Comments: Yamarna Terrane. North of the Dorothy Hills Greenstone Belt. Not exposed; sampled from drill core. Contains xenocrysts dated at 2815-2800 Ma, 2775-70 Ma, and 2751 Ma (Cassidy 2007b). RefID 68107
Lithology Description: Granite gneiss

General Comments: To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Thundelarra Hsd,Thundelarra 1:100k map sheet. Type area (of Bunnawarra Suite) around around Kynea Rockholes. Metamorphosed 'basement' unit, no known older units in region. Age range given is age range of Bunawarra Suite units (no ref). This name also replaces the reservation for Windinie Supersuite. See also informal Thundelarra Group.
Lithology Description: Migmatitic tonalite to granodiorite gneiss with metagranitic leucosomes

General Comments: Metamorphosed equivalent of Halls Creek Group. c. 1865 Ma. Occurs in the central zone of Lamboo Complex. Age: c.1865Ma. Age updated by I. Sweet. Intruded by Sally Malay mafic-ultramafic intrusion. In the Central Zone of the Lamboo Complex. Hosts Bow River nickel deposit.
Lithology Description: Hornfels, amphibolite, mafic granulite, calc-silicate rock and marble, minor banded iron formation, quartzite, migmatitic pelitic gneiss intruded by mafic to intermediate dykes.
Amphibolite: includes epidote, garnet, or clinopyroxene; local volcanic textures; interlayered with pelite, psammite, calc-silicates and marble

Stratigraphic Name: Tickalara Metamorphics - gneiss, migmatite and granulite
Lithology Description: Migmatitic pelitic gneiss with layers and pods of mafic granulite, psammitic gneiss and calc-silicate rock; intruded by post-metamorphic mafic to intermediate dykes
Metamorphosed diorite and amphibolite
Migmatitic pelitic gneiss interlayered with mafic granulite
Strongly sheared mylonitic rocks

Interlayed pelite and psammite, with banded iron-formation, calc-silicate rock, marble, and minor amphibolite; includes biotite-muscovite (-andalusite)-quartz and garnet-staurolite-biotite-muscovite-quartz schist

General Comments: Ruby Plains 1:100 000 sheet area. Defined as Adelaidean age. Dated 666 +/- 43my (Bofinger,1967 PhD).
Lithology Description: Glacigenic massive to thin bedded to laminated micaceous grey and green shale and siltstone with minor thinly bedded lithic sandstone, and interbedded dolomite near base.

General Comments: Defined by Semeniuk (1995). Previously part of of the Tamala Limestone. Now proposed as new component to Kwinana Group by B.Gozzard (approved by R.Hocking but unpublished as yet) 24/1/08.PP.
Lithology Description: Calcarenitic aeolianite; beach, marine and forameniferal calcarenites and shelly/bioturbated calcarenite with seagrass assemblage biota, and karst features.

General Comments: Replacing the use of names Pillara and Nullara for the southern and central Canning Basin, exists in petroleum wells of the Barbwire Terrace, Canning Basin. wheretobepublished = A Revised Subsurface Devonian Stratigraphy for the Central and Southern Canning Basin. GSWA Report to be published early 2014. Map sheet= Dummer.
Correlated with Headleys Limestone. Originally defined Randal (1962). Redefined Kruse 1988. Lateral correlative of Montejinni Limestone.
Lithology Description: Partially dolomitised limestone with silt laminations, interbedded calcilutite and marl; bioclastic limestone, mudstone, siltstone; minor stromatolitic boundstone, cryptalgal laminate; local bioclastic calcarenite, arkosic sandstone, conglomerate

General Comments: Mesocratic granodiorite to diorite sills; garnet- to non-garnet bearing; metamorphosed. Intrudes the Brilliant Formation, Coolgardie Subgroup. Kalgoorlie Terrane. To be published = Geological Survey of Western Australia East Yilgarn Update 2013-14, digital product.
Lithology Description: Mesocratic granodiorite to diorite sills; garnet- to non-garnet bearing; metamorphosed
Dolomite and minor volcanic rocks.

General Comments: There are extensive exposures between Petermann and Bloods Ranges. Disconformably overlain by Neoproterozoic basal sediments of the Amadeus Basin (Dean Quartzite etc.).
Lithology Description: Deformed sediments and bimodal volcanics which include: mafic and felsic volcanics; felsic tuffs; interlayered mafic volcanics; felsic volcanics; volcaniclastic sediments and quartzite; conglom. and sst; siltstone; hematitic quartzite.

General Comments: Younger part of the Rudall Complex.
Lithology Description: Quartzite and schist.

General Comments: A-type. Yb-enriched. Geochemistry has within-plate as well as ocean-ridge indicators.
Lithology Description: A compositionally unique suite of schlieric leucogranites.

General Comments: Yamarna Terrane, Yilgarn Craton.
Lithology Description: Wacke and lithic sandstones, siltstone, abundant chert and banded iron-formation; felsic volcanic rocks; local intrusive rocks; metamorphosed.

General Comments: McIntosh 1:100 000 map sheet, East Kimberley.
Lithology Description: Fine-grained, sub-ophitic, biotite- and quartz-bearing gabbro and gabbronorite.

Reserved by: Sheppard S., Tyler I.M., Griffin T.J.
General Comments: East Kimberley region
Lithology Description: Moderately to strongly foliated, medium- to coarse-grained, porphyritic biotite monzogranite and minor granodiorite.

General Comments: Probably obsolete?
Correlated with the Tjauwata Group.  Age range form Smoke Hill Volcanics. Relationship with Tollu Volcanics? Of Bentley Basin (GSWA, 2011)
Lithology Description: Basal sandstones, pebbly sandstones and conglomerate; overlain by amygdaloidal basalts; these overlain by felsic lavas, then basic to intermediate volcanic rocks.

General Comments: Defined 1962. See also Lexicon. Wingate Mtns 1:100 000 sheet. Correlated with Birrindudu Group. Minimum age: 1200 Ma; maximum age 1780+/-80 Ma., but includes Depot Creek Sandstone, max age 1825 Ma.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, dolomite, siltstone.

General Comments: Eucla SH52-14. In a drillhole through Eucla Basin. Interlayered granitic and mafic gneiss.To be published=GSWA Record, September 2015. Eastern Coompana Province.
Lithology Description: Interlayered granitic and mafic gneiss.

General Comments: Also supersedes Toolonga Chalk. See also Lexicon. Formerly included in Cardabia Group but its status as a formation did not change when Cardabia Group was revised down to Cardabia Calcarenite.
Lithology Description: Chalky calcisiltite to calcilutite, marly, greenish, minor chert and local dolomite in tidal flats, poorly exposed; shallow marine open shelf.

General Comments: Name used in:  Johnson, SP, 2013, The birth of supercontinents and the Proterozoic assembly of Western Australia: Geological Survey of Western Australia, p4, p14-15. [to be indexed soon, CEB Jul-2016]
Lithology Description: Siltstone, sandstone, dolomite, and granular iron formation.

General Comments: Age from palynomorphs. Previously included in Madura Formation.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, claystone and shale. Minor sandstone; commonly pyritic.

General Comments: New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk). Age: 2985+/-7Ma. Intruded by Munni Munni. Oldest component in the Cherrata Granitic Complex.
Lithology Description: Foliated, and locally gneissic, hornblende tonalite and granodiorite. More magnetic than other components of the Cherratta Granitoid Complex, and locally contains amphibolitic enclaves.

General Comments: East Kimberley region
Lithology Description: Medium-grained, quartz-phyric biotite tonalite and granodiorite; metasediment inclusions abundant near Marboo Formation contacts

General Comments: A package of intermediate to felsic volcanic to volcaniclastic rocks in the Yamarna - Mount Gill greenstone belt (NE Yilgarn Craton). They range in composition from dacite to rhyolites and minor andesites. Will be published in the very near future in several GSWA publications, including 1:100 000 maps and geochronology reports
Lithology Description: Felsic schist; metamorphosed volcanics including dacite, rhyodacite, rhyolite, felsic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks; minor sandstone to siltstone.

General Comments: Permian, Bonaparte Basin.
Geological province: Murchison Domain. Part of the Austin Downs Supersuite. Cuts across greenstones.
Lithology Description: Metamonzogranite, commonly foliated; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Reservation dropped Jan 1980, but name published 1997; and in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk). Intrudes De Grey Supergroup. Age: c.2954+/-4Ma.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed porphyritic high-Mg granodiorite.

General Comments: Age: ~830 Ma [in 1998] . May be part of extensive sand blanket which includes Mount Kinahan Sst, Vaughan Springs Qtzite, Heavitree Qtzite and Lewis Range Sst (Redcliff Pound Gp). Of Buldya Group (advised RH GSWA 090606). Contains the Skirmish impact structure. The Pindyin Sandstone (SA) may be a synonym. Lith desc is for a combination of Townsend Quartzite and Lefroy Formation  on the Cooper 1:100k map (2011)
Lithology Description: Laminated to very thick bedded, well-sorted, medium- to coarse-grained quartz arenite and feldspathic arenite; minor conglomerate and shale beds; medium- to large-scale cross-bedding.

General Comments: Precambrian. West Pilbara. Age: ~3120Ma. Within the Pilbara Supergroup.
Lithology Description: Alternating metamorphosed basalt, andesite, dacite, rhyolite and thin sedimentary units including chert and BIF.
Green to brown coarse lithic sandstone with minor sandy dolomite and dolomitic sandstone, and scattered glacial erratics.

General Comments: of Krieg (1973) and redefined by Benbow (1982). Redefined 1997.
Lithology Description: Mostly non-marine sandstone, siltstone, claystone and minor dolomite, limestone, chert and conglomerate.

General Comments: Superseded by Treachery Shale (Mory 1988) but now replaces that name again (Gorter et al. 2008). ?Of Kulshill Group or has this Group been abandonded? Hydrocarbon seals. Oil and gas shows present in sandstones. Trace fossils are abundant in places.
Lithology Description: Predominantly carbonaceous, argillaceous, tillitic and varved siltstone with claystone; minor sandstone; several cores have massive diamictic fabric with facetted pebbles.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Overlies/interfingers with Pindilya Formation; also overlies Lamont Sandstone. Overlain by/interfingers with Pilgramunna Fm; and Bare Fm. Age: 17.5-10.5Ma.
Lithology Description: Calcirudite to calcilutite with coralgal limestone, commonly fossiliferous, quartzose in places; shallow marine to littoral

General Comments: Map Sheet = Leonora. Nearest Town = Leonora. The Formation consists of basalt and komatiitic basalt with minor ultramafic and sedimentary rocks. Where to be published = GSWA digital releases (maps and explanatory notes).

1:250,000 Widgiemooltha SH51-14; 1:100,000 Lake Lefroy 3235. Previously included in Merougil Conglomerate, Kambalda area. Unclear how related to old Triangle Island Beds, but both used in Yilgarn. Proposed publication: Doutch, D. A., and Cas, R. A., 2019, Stratigraphic and facies architecture of the Neoarchaean Black Flag and Merougil Groups, Kambalda, Western Australia: Depositional and volcanic evolution of Late Archaean submarine fan to fan-delta sequences that host significant gold deposits.
Unnamed unit used in the 1:2.5 million scale Geology of Australia dataset, and 'Pre-Cz geology, NSW & Vic'.
Lithology Description: Predominantly sedimentary rocks; includes sedimentary rocks of low metamorphic grade and diapiric breccias

General Comments: Archaean Granite in the Pilbara. Age: <3317Ma, <3300Ma.
Lithology Description: Biotite-hornblende granodiorite to tonalite; medium to coarse grained, feldspar porphyritic; common mafic xenoliths; minor porphyritic monzogranite.

General Comments: Upgrading of Trillbar Member of Narracoota Formation?
Lithology Description: Gabbro, microgabbro, mafic and ultramafic schist; minor mafic rock; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Formalising (a variation of) an informal WMC stratigraphic name Triodia Shale. Occurs in petroleum wells and mineral drillholes of the central Canning Basin wheretobepublished = GSWA report A revised subsurface stratigraphy for the Central and Southern Canning Basin. Estimated publication date early 2014. Map sheet = Dummer.

Lithology Description: Characterised by thin (1-10m) well-differentiated komatiite flow units. Flows exhibit well-developed flow top breccia, spinifex texture zones and well-developed B-zone cumulates. Only a few discontinuous sedimentary intervals.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain. Part of the Annean Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Metatonalite.

General Comments: Of Traves (1956). Mapped as Liveringa Group in GSWA 500K Solid Geology GIS (2008).
Lithology Description: Sandstone interbedded with siltstone, intraformational claystone and conglomerate

General Comments: Plumridge  SH51-08 and Neale  SH51-04 and Minigwal SH51-07 sheet areas. Interlayered granitic gneiss including tonalitic and dioritic compositions, mafic gneiss, garnet gneiss, and minor metachert and metamorphosed iron formation; may include intrusions of Paleoproterozoic metagranite. Tectonic Unit hierarchy: Tropicana Zone, Kepa Kurl Booya Province, Albany-Fraser Orogen.Publications: Occhipinti, SA, Doyle, MG, Spaggiari, CV, Korsch, RJ, Cant, G, Martin, K, Kirkland, CL, Savage, J, Less, T, Bergin, L and Fox, L 2014, Preliminary interpretation of the deep seismic reflection line 12GA¿T1: northeastern Albany-Fraser Orogen, in Albany-Fraser Orogen seismic and magnetotelluric (MT) workshop 2014: extended abstracts compiled by CV Spaggiari and IM Tyler: Geological Survey of Western Australia, Record 2014/6, p. 44-59. Doyle, M.G., Fletcher, I.R., Foster, J., Large, R.R., Mathur, R., McNaughton, N.J., Meffre, S., Muhling, J.R., Phillips, D. and Rasmussen, B., 2015. Geochronological constraints on the Tropicana Gold Deposit and Albany-Fraser Orogen, Western Australia. Economic Geology, 110(2): 355-386.
Lithology Description: Interlayered granitic gneiss including tonalitic and dioritic compositions, mafic gneiss, garnet gneiss, and minor metachert and metamorphosed iron formation; may include intrusions of Paleoproterozoic metagranite.

General Comments: Reserved as Troughton Formation. Age: ~240-~154Ma.
Lithology Description: Dominantly siliciclastic rocks.

General Comments: Map Sheet=Esperance SI51-6. Nearest Town=Esperance. Brief description=Undeformed to weakly deformed granite. Published in 2015 in Geological Survey of Western Australia Report 150.
Lithology Description: Undeformed to weakly deformed granite.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain. NOT part of Austin Downs Supersuite, as wrongly shown in GSWA Annual Review 2007-08 (Van Kranendonk pers. comm. 14-APR-2011)
Lithology Description: Consists of strongly foliated and locally magmatically layered granodiorite to monzogranitic rocks; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Middle part of Poole Sandstone. Difficult to distinguish from overlying Christmas Creek Member.
Lithology Description: Coarsening-upward sandstone, minor mudstone; plant fossils.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Age: ~23-19.5Ma.
Lithology Description: Reddish to yellowish, partly clayey foraminiferal calcarenitic packstone; shallow marine.

General Comments: East Kimberley region
Lithology Description: Medium-grained, even-textured or weakly porphyritic biotite monzogranite and granodiorite; minor tonalite.

General Comments: Defined as Archaean in 1975, considered to be Palaeoproterozoic in 1979, now (1991) Archaean age again. See 94/27718. Ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Pisolitic tuff, siliceous limestone and dolomite, mudstone, tuffaceous shale, siltstone, sandstone, volcaniclastic sandstone and siltstone, calcareous sandstone, local basalt and basaltic breccia, chert, local conglomerate, shale, jasper

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Also in Southern Carnarvon Basin. (Hocking, 1991). See also Cambrian "Tumblagooda Sandstone".
Lithology Description: Fine- to medium-grained sandstones; minor conglomerate; red, commonly bioturbated siltstone towards the top of the unit.

General Comments: Age: c.1835Ma.
Lithology Description: Fine grained, feldspathic sandstone interbedded with micaceous or sericitic siltstone, phyllite, minor coarse quartz sandstone, and mudstone.

General Comments: Turee Creek Basin. Age inferred and base only constrained by detrital zircons. Minimum age of 2208 +/- 10 Ma from SHRIMP Pb/Pb baddelyite analysis of two mafic sills which intrude the Turee Creek Group. [pers. comm. Stefan Mueller, from his PhD. See also Mueller et al. 2005]. Note that there is considerable debate on the age of overlying units in the Wyloo Group. RefID 69028, from GSWA Record 2011/25 (2012) gives Turee Creek Group age range as 2445-2210 Ma.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, dolostone and diamictite.

General Comments: Turee Creek Basin. 2452-2408 Ma. See also Turee Creek Group.
Informal name. Possible variation of Turkey Nest Monzogranite (probably not - CB)
Lithology Description: Layered mafic-ultramafic intrusion.

General Comments: See the former Turkey Hill Beds for full description. Age: 610Ma
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, claystone, diamictite.
Calcareous claystones and calciluties.

General Comments: As distinct from the Turrets Formation (Devonian siliciclastics) in QLD (no. 24052). The Turret Dolerite is a concordant intrusive unit that sits above the White Hope Basalt in the Mount White Syncline. The White Hope Basalt is the youngest extrusive/sedimentary formation of the Two Sisters Subgroup. The Turret Dolerite contains a thin pyroxenite base in the eastern limb of the syncline. It is characterized by an elevated primitive mantle-normalized thorium to titanium ratio and enriched light rare earth element profile. Geochemically, it compares with the Paringa Basalt described in Barnes et al. (2012) from the Kambalda region. wheretobepublished = GSWA digital package 2013/2014. Previously (invalidly) called Vivien Dolerite.
Lithology Description: Dolerite, medium grained; minor gabbro; metamorphosed. Pyroxenite, medium grained, metamorphosed.

General Comments: Map Sheet = Melita Nearest Town = Menzies. Banded granitic gneiss from within this unit has been dated at 2803 ± 3 Ma (Dunphy et al, 2003). Wheretobepublished = GSWA explanatory notes and interpreted bedrock geology map in 2017. The `Twin Hills banded granitic gneiss' and `Twin Hills gneiss' refer to the same unit. The lithological component of the name has been modified so that it better matches with the field information (Wally Witt¿s Melita Explanatory notes 1994, page 30).
Lithology Description: Foliated to gneissic metamonzogranite and is intruded by relatively leucocratic monzogranite and late pegmatite dykes.

General Comments: New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk). Also, to be used on DAMPIER map sheet; nearest town Karratha. Intrudes Nallana Formation.
Lithology Description: Medium-grained monzogranite and granodiorite, alkali-feldspar granite

General Comments: Informal name. A series of parallel and interconnecting pegmatite bodies. Hosts the Two Bobs prospect.
Lithology Description: Placer, granitic rare-metal pegmatite.

General Comments: Reserved as Two Gum Granite.
Lithology Description: Medium-grained, porphyritic, biotite-hornblende monzogranite.

General Comments: Map Sheet: SH51-1,  Munjeroo 2941 (or after two Sisters Well on Everett Creek 2841?). Basalt and komatiitic basalt interleaved with ultramafic rocks; minor sedimentary rocks; metamorphosed. To be published = GSWA geological map and explanatory notes, 2013/2014.
Lithology Description: Basalt and komatiitic basalt interleaved with ultramafic rocks; minor sedimentary rocks; metamorphosed
Sandstone, siltstone, mudstone, dolostone, and chert; minor conglomerate.

General Comments: Variation of reserved name Ularring Granite.
Lithology Description: Fine- to coarse-grained, weakly seriate, biotite monzogranite containing minor opaque oxides, muscovite, are rare apatite. Weakly recrystallised, but mainly undeformed.

General Comments: Geological province: Edmund Basin. Within the Bangemall Supergroup. Minimum age constrained by dolerite sill at Coodardoo Well (1449 +/-5 Ma), but more recent maps give older minimum age of 1460 +/-9 Ma, a SHRIMP U-Pb zircon age from a volcaniclastic unit; it is within error of c.1465 Ma age of Narimbunna Dolerite.
Lithology Description: Mainly thin-bedded black and maroon siltstone and mudstone, with lesser interbedded fine- to medium-grained sandstone, and minor chert, dolostone and felsic volcaniclastic rock. Characterised by large number of dolerite sills.
Medium- to coarse-grained hornblende-pyroxene granite metamorphosed at granulite facies; plagioclase or K-feldspar phenocrysts.

General Comments: Petermann Ranges 1:250 000 sheet area. Equivalent to part of Musgrave-Mann Metamorphics, Olia Gneiss and unnamed metamorphosed granites of Forman (1966, 1972).
Lithology Description: Foliated to undeformed clinopyroxene- and/or hornblende-bearing porphyritic granite with rounded blue-grey phenocrysts of K-feldspar. Less commonly equigranular and medium-grained. Localised biotite-hornblende-garnet migmatite

General Comments: Eucla SH52-14. In a drillhole through Eucla Basin. Foliated metagranite and metavolcanic rocks. To be published=GSWA Record, September 2015.
Lithology Description: Foliated metagranite and metavolcanic rocks.
Banded tonalite, granodiorite and monzogranite, gneiss and migmatite; strongly sheared; S-C mylonite fabric.

General Comments: Intersected in Ungani petroleum exploration well by Buru Energy Limited. Unit name reserved as informal pending formal description of the unit. Interpreted reservoir unit of the Ungani oil field.  Probably of the Fairfield Group, as it sits on Nullara Limestone, but could be a facies correlating with uppermost Nullara Limestone.
Probably named for upper part of Nickol River?  In the Pilbara Craton. Probably not intended as a stratigraphic unit name?
Defn on Tech File D/52-10. Formerly mapped as "Milligans Beds".
Lithology Description: Open shelf carbonates. Richly fossiliferous including brachiopods, corals and trilobites. Sandy limestone, calcareous sandstone; minor sandstone.
Poorly exposed dark grey-green tuff and tuffaceous siltstone with conchoidal fracture surfaces, overlain by grey-green flaggy laminated siltstone grading up into fine feldspathic sandstone.

General Comments: Geological Province: Money Shoal Basin - north and south.
Lithology Description: Friable white to yellow, medium to coarse quartzose sandstone, lenticular beds of siltstone, and minor beds of granular conglomerate; strongly weathered in outcrop.

General Comments: Defined in Veevers, 1958a. Redefined Playford and Lowry, 1966a. [card file] See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Massive boulder fanglomerate at base; mainly quartzite and sandstone clasts up to 1m in a granitoid-derived matrix, overlain by fluviatile to deltaic conglomerate and sandstone;  granitoid, schist and felsic volcanic clasts. Minor interbedded limestone.

General Comments: Vasse River Coalfields, Perth Basin
Defined by Mory (1988).
Lithology Description: Marl, calcilutite, calcareous claystone.

General Comments: Named after Vetters Sand Hill on the Bardoc map sheet. Vetters Subgroup lies within Davyhurst, Bardoc and part way into the Kalgoorlie 1:100K map sheet areas. It forms part of the Kalgoorlie Group in the Eastern Goldfields Superterrane of the Yilgarn Craton. To be published = GSWA digital release 2016.
Lithology Description: Fine to very fine grained mafic rock with minor ultramafic rock, undivided; metamorphosed; commonly deeply weathered.
Poorly sorted, usually fine-grained sandstone; lesser siltstone and conglomerate.

General Comments: Previously considered part of the Grants Patch Group. Now (2016) reassigned into the Vetters Subgroup, Kalgoorlie Group. Victorious Basalt lies within Davyhurst, Bardoc and part way into the Kalgoorlie 1:100K sheets areas.
Lithology Description: Plagioclase-phyric series of several lava flows vary from fine grained-glassy pillow basalt to coarse non-pillowed flows.

General Comments: Vines 1:100 000 sheet area. Type section - clastic sequence in Vines 1 stratigraphic corehole. Original definition by Stevens et at (2002) in Sedimentary Basins of Western Australia 3.  Redefined 2008. Age: ~540Ma.
Lithology Description: Clast-supported, relatively well-rounded and sorted, dark-brown to reddish, pebble conglomerate, with lesser quartz sandstone.

General Comments: Much of it previously assigned to Mabel Downs Tonalite. Age updated by I.Sweet. See also Violet Valley Granite, Violet Valley Granodiorite.
Lithology Description: Fine- to coarse grained, weakly porphyritic biotite granodiorite and biotite-hornblende tonalite; weakly to moderately foliated.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Fossiliferous, commonly red, shallow marine reef complex marginal slope and basin facies, interbedded calcareous siltstone, shale, sandstone, calcarenite, calcilutite; large blocks of reef common forming mega-breccia in places
Modern beach ridge/dune sequence of partly indurated, root-casted and calcreted sediment of the older members of the unit, truncated by a humic soil over which this member rests.

General Comments: After Vivien (historic) Mine. Map Sheet: SG51-13, Sir Samuel 3042. Felsic volcaniclastic rock and sedimentary siliciclastic rock; metamorphosed. To be published = GSWA geological map and explanatory notes, 2013/2014. Considered part of Mount White Group when reserved, but ungrouped when published in  East Yilgarn GIS for 2015.
Lithology Description: Felsic volcaniclastic rock and sedimentary siliciclastic sandstone, siltstone and shale; metamorphosed

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Formerly of Yardie Group. Included in Cape Range Group in 1980.
Lithology Description: Well sorted, medium grained, cross-bedded quartzose calcarenite with calcrete soils; aeolian

General Comments: Plumridge SH51-08 and Neale SH51-04 sheet areas. Interlayered mafic to ultramafic intrusive rocks, metabasaltic to metadacitic volcanic rocks, and metasedimentary rocks; may include Paleoproterozoic metagranite.  Tectonic Unit hierarchy: Tropicana Zone, Kepa Kurl Booya Province, Albany-Fraser Orogen. Publications:  Occhipinti, SA, Doyle, MG, Spaggiari, CV, Korsch, RJ, Cant, G, Martin, K, Kirkland, CL, Savage, J, Less, T, Bergin, L and Fox, L 2014, Preliminary interpretation of the deep seismic reflection line 12GA¿T1: northeastern Albany¿Fraser Orogen, in Albany¿Fraser Orogen seismic and magnetotelluric (MT) workshop 2014: extended abstracts compiled by CV Spaggiari and IM Tyler: Geological Survey of Western Australia, Record 2014/6, p. 12¿27.
Lithology Description: Interlayered mafic to ultramafic intrusive rocks, metabasaltic to metadacitic volcanic rocks, and metasedimentary rocks may include Paleoproterozoic metagranite.

General Comments: See also informal subdivisions: Lower Vulcan Formation, Upper Vulcan Formation. Includes interpreted deep marine fan sediments considered to be a reservoir facies.
Lithology Description: Marine sediments including mudstones and submarine fan sandstones.
Mudstone with thin interbeds of quartz sandstone.

General Comments: DARLOT 1:100 000 sheet area, northern Goldfields. Replaced by Wadarrah Quartz Monzogranite?
Lithology Description: Hornblende-quartz monzonite with local platy alignment.

General Comments: See Wade Creek Sandstone for definition. Is this a deliberate name change or a misspelling?
Lithology Description: Fine- to coarse-grained quartz sandstone, lithic quartz sandstone, pebbly sandstone, conglomerate, siltstone, and mudstone; also ferruginous chert breccia member.

General Comments: See also Wadera Calcarenite Member. The lithological component does not form part of the formal current name (email per R. Hocking, May 2008).

Includes Point Spring Sandstone (formerly part of Weaber Group), Arco and Aquitaine Formations. Overlies Weaber Group; unconformably overlain by Kulshill Group. Geological province: Bonaparte Basin/Petrel-Sub-basin.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, shale, sandstone.

General Comments: To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Wadgingarra Hill, Yalgoo 1:100k sheet area. 28deg18'S, 116deg44'E. Also type area. Intrusive into the central part of the Yalgoo greenstone belt, likely the lower Polelle Group.
Lithology Description: Massive gabbro with granophyric leucogabbro towards the top of the intrusion; metamorphosed. Layered intrusion - some original minerals preserved.
Yellow to red, well-sorted medium- to coarse-grained calcarenite; some limestone and dolomite.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. This name supersedes Eradu Coal Measures & Indarra Beds. (Clake et al., 1951). See also Wagina Formation.
Lithology Description: Fine- to medium-grained clayey quartz sandstone; minor conglomerate, shale, siltstone and coal.

General Comments: Wahlgu rockholes, Wahlgu 1:100 000 sheet area. Marinoan diamictite strata previously called ?Lupton Formation. Type section in Empress 1A stratigraphic corehole.  Probably published by originator in WABS 3?
Lithology Description: Predominantly glacial diamictite; basal well-sorted sandstone, mudstone and conglomerate.

General Comments: Layered gabbronorite, gabbro and leucogabbro over 2km thick intrude into Polelle Group metasediments of the Murchison Supergroup. Named after Waladah Bore, Madoonga 1:100k sheet area. 26deg50'S, 118deg03'E. Type area: Barloweerie Peaks. Published = AJES article on mafic-ultramafic intrusions of the Youanmi Terrane in 2010/2011.
Lithology Description: Gabbro with gabbronorite base and harrisitic leucogabbro top contact; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Map Sheet = 2348 Nearest Town = Meekatharra. briefdescription = The Waldburg Dolerite comprises several, predominantly northwesterly-trending dolerite sills, which intrude the middle and lower parts of the Edmund Group within the Western Capricorn Orogen. The sills have limited exposure, but were emplaced in a structural corridor between two major fault structures, the Lyons River Fault and the Ti Tree Shear Zone at, or near, fault contacts between different lithologies, or within silicified siltstone units and/or sedimentary successions dominated by carbonate rocks. The sills have been precisely dated at  ?1517-1505 Ma. To be published = On or after May 2015 in GSWA geochronological records, geological reports, maps and digital packages.
Lithology Description: Massive medium- to very-coarse grained moderately- to distinctly-weathered dolerite and/or a very coarse-grained leucogabbro.

Mainly red-brown to grey mudstone, often variably calcareous or dolomitic, with interbeds of dolomite, limestone and fine-grained sandstone and dolomite; minor anhydrite common; local significant sandstone sub-units.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain.  Age: c. 2625Ma.
Lithology Description: Biotite(-muscovite) monzogranites to syenogranites, ranging in texture from coarsely K-feldspar-porphyritic to coarse-grained, equigranular rocks.

General Comments: Youanmi, Windimurra 100k sheets.  To use in the southern Murchison Domain. Age: c. 2620 Ma. Type area: Walgoo paddock, northern Youanmi mapsheet, 8km south of Palagea Rockholes, lat 28deg31', long 118deg44'.
Lithology Description: Monzogranite, locally rich in muscovite and biotite; predominantly with equigranular texture and locally K-feldspar porphyritic.

General Comments: See Miningarra Trondhjemite.
Lithology Description: Quartz-rich biotite trondhjemite; medium- to coarse-grained; metamorphosed.

A clast-rich cobble conglomerate with rounded to well-rounded, compact to elongate clasts, mostly basalt and porphyritic dacite-rhyolite; matrix is coarse-grained quartzosericitic sandstone; metamorphic biotite common.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File E/51-13, PSSA Pub 5 (1961).
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone and minor conglomerate with abundant microflora and fauna, lignite.

General Comments: SG53-01 Henbury. Mixed sandstone, silicified dolostone and siltstone unit. Sits above Bitter Springs Formation and below Areyonga Formation. Poorly exposed in northern, south central and western Amadeus Basin. Best known and described from Wallara 1 petroleum hole. Has been previously informally referred to as "Finke beds". The name will be published in 2015 or 2016 in NTGS and Geological Survey of Western Australia publications and maps.
Lithology Description: Interbedded dolostone, dolomitic siltstone and shale with occasional pyrite and glauconite.

General Comments: Wallaringa and Wodgina 1:100 000 sheets. Possible alternative name for Wallaringa Granodiorite. Within the Sisters Supersuite.  Intrudes De Grey Supergroup.
Lithology Description: Hornblende-biotite granodiorite and tonalite; massive to moderately foliated; locally inclusion-rich; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Wallaringa & Wodgina 1:100 000 sheets. Alternative name for Wallareenya Granodiorite.

New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk).   Also, to be used on COOYA POOYA map sheet; nearest town Roebourne. Cooya Pooya explan notes (2004) refer to informal Waloo Waloo monzogranite on p13.
Lithology Description: Biotite monzogranite; medium-grained; weakly foliated; metamorphosed.
A-type. Yb-enriched, within-plate granite.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Correlated with Marinoan glaciation (ca610Ma) but palaeomagnetic evidence suggests an older Sturtian glaciation (ca770-750Ma)[from 2005 reference]. See also Walsh Formation, WA (not QLD).
Lithology Description: Diamictite with striated pebbles cobbles and boulders of quartzite and lesser siltstone, dolomite and igneous rocks in a green sandy or purple silty matrix, overlain by thinly laminated dolomite; local stromatolitic dolomite and pebbly quartz sandstone
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Previously considered part of the Linger and Die Group. Now (2016) reassigned into the Vetters Subgroup, Kalgoorlie Group.The Walter Williams Formation lies within the Davyhurst and Bardoc 1:100K map sheets areas.
Lithology Description: Peridotite; relict olivine cumulate texture; commonly serpentinized or silicified.

General Comments: On the basis of lithological features and tectonic structures the author has reassigned this unit at Woodie Woodie from the Neoproterozoic Tarcunyah Group to the Mesoproterozoic Manganese Group, and correlated it with the Stag Arrow and Balfour Formations. RefID 71042 Jones (2017).
Lithology Description: Stromatolitic dolostone, siltstone, shale, minor sandstone; discontinuous basal sandstone and conglomerate.

General Comments: Mount Rennie 1:250, 000 map sheet (SF52-15). Of the Kintore Domain, Warumpi Province.
Lithology Description: Felsic, intermediate to mafic volcanic rocks including silicified cryptocrystalline, porphyritic andesine, andesite, dacite, basaltic andesite, basalt, and dolerite.

Reserved by: I.R. Scrimgeour, D.F. Close, C.J. Edgoose
General Comments: Of the 1640-1630Ma intrusive rocks era. Intrudes Yaya Metamorphic Complex.
Lithology Description: Dark, fine- to medium-grained, foliated hornblende-biotite-garnet granodiorite to quartz diorite; foliated hornblende granodiorite; hornblende-biotite felsic migmatite; weakly porphyritic granodiorite and charnockite

General Comments: See also Lexicon. SG50-1. Richly fossiliferous. Replaced by Cody Limestone in Ruby 1, Abdul's Dam 1 (Crostella et el., 2000).
Lithology Description: Siltstone and fine quartz wacke, variably calcareous, very fossiliferous.
Secondary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

Lithology Description: Coarse-grained, equigranular, leucocratic monzogranite.
Distal, fine-grained.

General Comments: K-Ar age of ~1688 Ma from glauconitic sandstone (Horowitz 1975), reported for the Formation.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, shale and sandstone, commonly silicified.
Kaolinitic mudstone, siltstone, commonly radiolaria-rich, montmorillonitic when fresh; minor silty claystone, sublabile sandstone; scattered nodular pyrite.

General Comments: To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Wangata Hill, Yalgoo 1:100k sheet area. 29deg11'S 117deg06'E. Type area: Wangata Hill. Intrusive into adjacent granitic plutons of the Walganna Suite of the Bald Rock Supersuite.
Lithology Description: Coarse-grained undeformed monzogranite with distinctive igneous layering defined by gradational variation in the modal abundance of biotite and K-feldspar (0.5 to 3 m scale); K-feldspar up to 30 mm long; metamorphosed
Black-white laminated chert, massive black chert and felsic hyaloclastite with black chert dykes.

General Comments: Lies across Davyhurst 1:100K map sheet area. Named from the Wangine Lakes that lie within the extent of the granite body. It forms part of the Yilgarn Craton Granites. To be published = GSWA digital release 2016.
Lithology Description: Leucocratic, medium-grained, biotite-bearing monzogranite.

General Comments: For use on the BELL ROCK 1:100,000 sheet. Mapped as 13 separate but un-named units (2011). These high-grade intrusives incorporate rafts of Wirku Metamorphics in the west of the Musgrave Block (Sen, 2009). Musgrave Province.
Lithology Description: Mylonitic leucocratic granite, weakly to strongly foliated porphyritic metamonzogranite, orthopyr-clinopyr-biotite granite, metaleucogranite and mylonite.

General Comments: Age (see the informal Wankari volcanics): 1041+/-2Ma (Pb-Pb evap.technique) and 1051+/-22Ma (SHRIMP U-Pb zircon). See also the misspelt Wankeri volcanics.
Lithology Description: Locally amygdaloidal, fine-grained, porphyritic felsic volcanics with minor interlayered mafic units. Includes porphyritic rhyolite with rare epidotized and amygdaloidal mafic volcanics.
Fine to very fine, well sorted subangular micaceous neritic or non-marine sandstone; minor claystone.

General Comments: Onshore Perth Basin. Notified by A. Davidson 28-NOV-94. See also misspelt Wanneroo Formation.
Lithology Description: Discontinuous interbedded sandstones, siltstones and shales of marine and non-marine origin; individual sand beds generally 12-15 m thick; granitic scree boulders common in SE margin of Perth Region.
