General Comments: Mafic and felsic igneous rocks, collectively forming the Warakurna Large Igneous Province. Interpreted as a mantle plume event. Max age from Alcurra Dolerite. Warakurna Large Igneous Province. Mostly sills and plugs?
Lithology Description: Dolerite, gabbro, amphibolite, gabbronorite, granite, syenogranite, syenite; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Age: ~3.0Ga. Within the Pilbara Supergroup in the Pilbara Craton (Whim Creek Basin).
Lithology Description: Tholeiitic basalt lava, high-level intrusive sills, autobreccia and hyaloclastite.
A-type. Within-plate, Yb-enriched granite.

General Comments: To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Warbadoo Hill, Yalgoo 1:100k sheet area. 28deg08'S 116deg40'E. Type area: Pindathuna Creek. Intrusive into top-Norie Group and base-Polelle Group supracrustal rocks.
Lithology Description: Metatonalite, locally migmatitic, and metagranodiorite and metamonzogranite phases; abundant schistose metamonzogranite sheets intrusive into country rocks; typically lineated; pegmatic phase hosts blue lepidolite.

General Comments: For use in the Diorite 1:100 000 sheet area, West Musgrave Province. Strongly foliated to mylonitic fine- to medium-grained biotite-rich granite/gneiss.To be published = DIORITE 1:100 000 map sheet, in prep.
Lithology Description: Strongly foliated to gneissic biotite(-hornblende) metasyenogranite; garnet-bearing; commonly migmatitic.

General Comments: Name replaces invalid Bow River Dolerite Suite. Lansdowne, Dixon Range, Lissadell, Mount Ramsay 250k. Dolerite; mainly northwest to north-northwest trending dykes crosscutting the Central and Western Zones of the Lamboo Province. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD and PHILLIPS, C (partial report), Warmun Dolerite (P_-_wn-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 06 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite dykes.

General Comments: (Cockbain and Playford, 1973).
Lithology Description: Interbedded sandstone, siltstone and shale; minor conglomerate.

General Comments: published in: An Integrated Study of the CO2 Storage Potential in the Offshore Vlaming Sub-Basin. GA Record 2015/09, p40, p45.
See also Waroonga gneiss. Unclear which spelling is correct. Both place names exist.

Lithology Description: quartzofeldspathic gneiss of quartz-albite-orthoclase leucogranite, garnetiferous luecogranite and porphyritic monzogranite composition.

General Comments: See also Waronga Gneiss.Unclear which spelling is correct. Both place names exist.
Lithology Description: Biotite-rich granodiorite gneisses, generally deeply weathered, and sheared leucogranitic dykes. Contains large amphibolite xenoliths.

General Comments: Balfour Downs explanatory notes. Age said to be ~800 Ma and also  <1070 Ma  on maps in 2004. Shown as Cryogenian (but also ~840 Ma) in a figure in 2005. Basis for numerical ages not stated.
Lithology Description: Laminated to massive dolomite, stromatolitic dolomite, sandy dolomite, siliceous oolite, sandstone, siltstone and shale; evaporite pseudomorphs.

General Comments: Of Byro Group. SG50-6.
Of Daniels (1970). Probably obsolete. May be equivalent to Cheyne Springs Formation?

Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone, minor siltstone and mudstone.

General Comments: Redefined as 4 subgroups: original Talga Talga and Salgash Subgroups, to which have been added the new Coongan Subgroup and Coonterunah Subgroup (downgraded from group status). The previously proposed Kelly Subgroup now upgraded to group status. Comprises greenschist-facies volcanic rocks and make up, to a large extent, the greenstone belt surrounding the Corunna Downs Granitoid Complex. East Pilbara Terrane.
Lithology Description: Consists of dominantly  volcanic and sedimentary rocks. Tholeiites, high-Mg basalts, andesite, Na-dacite, K-rhyolites, chert, minor banded iron formation.
Basalt, komatiitic basalt; locally pillowed; locally carbonated or schistose; local peridotite, serpentinite; metamorphosed
Gabbro and dolerite, metamorphosed
Anorthositic metagabbro, fine to medium grained amphibolite, mafic hornfels, chlorite-tremolite(-quartz) schist, hornblende-plagioclase schist after basalt, high-Mg basalt and dolerite

Stratigraphic Name: Warrawoona Group - ultramafic and mafic rocks
Lithology Description: Interlayered mafic and ultramafic schist, amphibolite, talc-serpentine-tremolite-carbonate rock, basalt, high-Mg basalt

General Comments: Differerent unit to the Warrie Member of Jeerinah Formation.  Both units in Fortescue Group. Occurs only in Hardey Formation (or Koongaling Volcanics?), Gregory Range Inlier.

Defined 1966. Of Jeerinah Formation. Not used by Thorne & Trendall (2001), Bull 144, because the Warrie Shale Member and the Roy Hill Shale Member are difficult to distinguish in nothern Pilbara and are not recognised in the south.
Lithology Description: Shale, chert (locally ferruginous), mudstone and dolomite.

General Comments: To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Warriedar Hsd, Ninghan1:100k sheet area. 29deg08'S 117deg11'E. Type area: Fields Find. Larger intrusions are located at the base of the Polelle Group with smaller ones throughout the Polelle Group.
Lithology Description: Peridotite and pyroxenite, local cumulate textures, serpentinized; ultramafic schist; gabbro, dolerite, locally interlayered; weakly schistose metagabbro. All metamorphosed.

General Comments: Reserved as Warrigal Granite Gneiss. Deformation is said to be Paleoproterozoic.
Lithology Description: Well foliated to banded granitic gneiss, biotite monzogranite.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Unconsolidated fluvial cobble and minor pebble conglomerate; brown clasts, and fossiliferous in places

General Comments: Not to be confused with Warroo stratigraphic nomenclature in NSW.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed fine- to coarse-grained clastic rock, tuff, and mafic rock: metasandstone, metaconglomerate, metasiltstone, quartzite, quartz-mica schist, phyllite, slate, metadolomite, metabasalt and metabasaltic andesite with local amygdules.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File E/52-2. Oldest unit in the Spider impact structure forming the central dome. Ages recorded: 1704+/-7Ma and 1786+/-14Ma. Max.depositional age 1806+/-28 Ma U/Pb SHRIMP. Kimberley Basin, North Australian Craton.
Lithology Description: Massive to blocky, thin bedded, medium-grained quartz sandstone, commonly white to purple, and minor feldspathic sandstone; siltstone interbeds.

General Comments: For use on map sheet SH 51-3; nearest town is Cosmo Newbury. Located in northeast corner of the Yilgarn Craton. Intrudes the Mount Venn greenstone belt, cutting the solid-state foliation and in turn it is overprinted by late brittle deformation. As a result this pluton constrains the transition from ductile to brittle deformation in the NE Yilgarn Craton. Dated at 2643+/-6 Ma (GSWA SHRIMP age). To be published in several GSWA publications in near future, including 1:100K maps and geochronological reports.
Lithology Description: Equigranular monzogranite intrusion; minor granite and granodiorite.

General Comments: Bentley Basin. RefID 67375, Musgrave Province notes (2011) suggests name should be changed to Warubuyu Formation (to reflect the existence of intercalated siliclastic rocks which can be found throughout the whole stratigraphic interval), but does not formally endorse any change.
Lithology Description: Basalt and basaltic andesite, interlayered with volcanolithic mudstone, siltstone, sandstone, conglomerate, and laminated microbialite; local hyaloclastite; epidotized.
Gneiss, granulitic, with hornblende, biotite, orthopyroxene, clinopyroxene

General Comments: See also misspelt Watchpoint Formation.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone and shale.

General Comments: Used in the Rudall 1:250 000 sheet area. Of Yeneena Basin? Previously of Tarcunyah Group.
Lithology Description: Shale, finely laminated and locally stromatolitic dolomite, upward-fining sandstone-siltstone-shale rhythmic units, and sulphide beds

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain. See also misspelling Watagee.
Lithology Description: Ultramafic schist; pyroxene spinifex-textured basalt; komatiitic basalt, locally pillowed; dacite; quartz-sericite schist; light to dark-grey slate, highly fissile. All metamorphosed.

General Comments: Age: 1610-1570Ma.  Possibly correlated with Nathan Group. Micaceous siltstone, sandstone, minor dolostone in Auvergne area. Birrindudu basin.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, claystone, dolostone, chert, conglomerate.
Sequence of massive tholeiite; minor pillow lavas and pyroclastic rocks; silicified and epidotized. Intruded by monzogranite, with abundant microgranite and pegmatite veins near contact.

General Comments: Of Mory and Beere (1988). See also Lexicon. ?Defined 1966. Stratigraphy revised by Gorter et al (2005) - see APPEA Journal 45/1. Group may now be non-current?? But name used by NTGS in 2006 Auvergne map & 2013. Originally included Point Spring Sandstone as the topmost unit; since assigned to the Wadeye Group by Gorter et al. (2005). Latest Tournaisian to early Serpukhovian age.
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone, siltstone, shale, minor limestone and conglomerate. Shoreface, deltaic and fluvial deposits.

General Comments: DARLOT 1:100 000 sheet area, northern Goldfields.
Lithology Description: Granodiorite, both fine- and coarse-grained phases.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Defn on Tech File G/50-1. Name obsolete?
Max Age: 2449 (+/-) 3 Ma ? Age probably from overlying Woongarra Rhyolite. Ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Banded iron-formation (commonly jaspilitic), mudstone, siltstone; common interlayered metadoleritic sills.

General Comments: See also Weelumurra Beds. Overlain by gravelly conglomerate and calcrete correlated with Millstream Dolomite. Age relative to Robe Pisolite is unknown.
Lithology Description: Dark grey pyritic lacustrine clay.

General Comments: Roebourne sheets 2356, SF50-3. Published in 'Hickman, AH 2016, Northwest Pilbara Craton: a record of 450 million years in the growth of Archean continental crust: Geological Survey of Western Australia, Report 160, 104p.'

Lithology Description: Heterogeneous, porphyritic to even grained monzogranite with circa 2730 Ma zircon xenocrysts; in places numerous gneissic inclusions. Prograde amphibolite grade metamorphism.

General Comments: Age c.2704 (Barley et al 2002).
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed andesite lava and volcaniclastic rocks.

General Comments: Part of the Warakurna Large Igneous Province. Published on Glen Ayle 1:100K mapsheet.
Lithology Description: Fine- to medium-grained dolerite with disseminated Fe-Ti oxides; minor sulfides and accessory apatite.
Interdeveloped lavas (andestite, dacite, rhyodacite), tuffs, breccias, agglomerates and minor sediments, all variously deformed and metamorphosed.
Deformed, low-grade metasedimentary rocks. Siltstone, shale and basalt.

General Comments: The lower part of this unit has been renamed North Royal Formation. Werillup Formation now includes rocks previously included in upper Werillup Formation, Rollos Bore Formation and Wollubar Sandstone (RefID 24397, published 2003). See also misspelt Werrilup Formation, Werrillup Formation, Werilup Formation. May now [2008] be considered part of Eundynie Group.
Lithology Description: Dark grey, siltstone, sandstone, claystone, minor brown coal (lignite, carbonaceous siltstone), limestone.

General Comments: Age updated by I.Sweet.
Lithology Description: Massive, medium-coarse grained, porphyritic biotite monzogranite; minor granodiorite.

General Comments: Variation on West Angela Shale Member? Parent updated from Wittenoom Dolomite. Ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Shale, dolomite and dolomitic argillite.

General Comments: Geological Province: Jillawarra Sub-basin.  Assumed to be part of Bangemall Supergoup, if still current. May be local name, equivalent in part to Kiangi Creek Formation, Edmund Group.
Lithology Description: Lower coarse-grained sandstone and polymictic conglomerate; a thick turbidite unit of alternating sandstone, siltstone and minor conglomerate; a local dolostone and siltstone unit; an upper coarse-grained ferruginous sandstone, minor conglomerate.

General Comments: Previously Giles Suite 2, the second main phase of mafic magmatism within the old Giles Suite. To include the Murray Range Gabbro. See also GSWA ENS: Smithies, RH, Evins, PM and Howard, HM 2018, West Hinckley Suite (P_-WKH-og): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 13 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>. - but note: text changes in progress.
Lithology Description: Medium-grained, leuco- to mesocratic gabbro (to gabbronorite) is the massive, uncontaminated, undeformed parent to several other gabbros concentrated in the Murray Range.

General Comments: Mentioned

Roger Hocking (WA Strat Name Convenor) approved use of name [29-JUN-2011 email]. NNW-trending dolerite dyke swarm, dated at 976 Ma, intruding Proterozoic granite and volcanic rocks of the Warumpi Province of the west Arunta Orogen. Lithology: dolerite. Map sheet: Webb. Nearest Town: Kiwirrkurra. To be published: Aurore Joly, Michael Dentith, Alok Porwal, Catherine Spaggiari, Ian Tyler, T. Campbell McCuaig. An integrated geological and geophysical study of the West Arunta Orogen and its mineral prospectivity. GSWA report, publication expected Dec. 2011.
Lithology Description: Dolerite

General Comments: Mentioned in 94/27644. Described as Collie Subbasin, Southern Perth Basin (2008).
Lithology Description: Predominantly sandstone with interbedded subordinate siltstone in coarsening-upward sequence.

General Comments: See also name variations Mount Whaleback Shale, Whaleback Member, Mount Whaleback Shale Member, Mount Whaleback shale, Mount Whaleback Member and Whaleback Shale. Ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Thin band of iron formation rocks with significant sheet-silicate content causing a shaly appearance.

General Comments: Kellerberrin, Perth, Moora 250k sheet areas. Dykes of a range of mafic compositions, trending east-northeast to northeast; intrude Archean units of the west-central Yilgarn Craton. Assigned to the Marnda Moorn Suite; inferred ages 1215¿1205 Ma. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD (partial report), Wheatbelt Dolerite (P_-MMwh-od): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 09 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite and gabbro dykes.

General Comments: Reserved name is preferred, but this name in GSWA's ENS system.
Lithology Description: Dolerite.

General Comments: First comprised Warambie Basalt, Mons Cupri Volcanics, Constantine Sandstone and Mallina Formation (Fitton et al 1975); then Rushall Slate, Cistern Formation, Mons Cupri Volcanics (Smithies 1997); in 2002 comprised Mons Cupri Dacite, Red Hill Volcanics, Warambie Basalt. In 2010 comprises Warambie Basalt and Red Hill Volcanics.  Rushall Slate/Cistern Formation reclassified to Bookingarra Group.
Lithology Description: Shale, siltstone, sandstone, basalt, high-Mg basalt, volcaniclastics, wacke, conglomerate, dacite, rhyolite, metamorphosed semi-pelite.

General Comments: Unit in Crane Formation? Diagram is not fully clear.

Lithology Description: Boulder to cobble conglomerate grading up into fine to coarse-grained sandstone or orthoquartzite.

General Comments: Lithological Descriptor = aeolian calcarenite. Map Sheet = 1936. Nearest Town = Cervantes. Brief description = Fine to coarse grained well sorted aeolianite, yellow coloured, poorly to well cemented, and with distinctive cross-bedding. Mineralogy: carbonate, quartz, feldspar. Deposited in Marine Isotope Stage 13 or earlier. To be published = This year (2014) in Australian Journal of Earth Sciences
Lithology Description: Consists of an eolian calcarenite/calcrete-microbialite/paleosol cycle.
Sedimentary rocks (coarse conglomerate and sandstone).

General Comments: Originally reserved as White Hill Road Member (Semeniuk 1995) but defeined as White Hill Road Limestone Member (Semeniuk 1995). Type location is same as for parent formation. Forms the upper part of Tims Thicket Limestone.
Lithology Description: Aeolianites; cross-laminated to structureless, fine and medium calcarenite.

General Comments: After White Hope Mine. Map Sheet: SH51-1,  Wildara 3041. Porphyritic to glomeroporphyritic basalt; fine to coarse plagioclase phenocrysts; local intense epidotization; metamorphosed. To be published = GSWA geological map and explanatory notes, 2013/2014.
Lithology Description: Porphyritic to glomeroporphyritic basalt; fine to coarse plagioclase phenocrysts; local intense epidotization; metamorphosed.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.
Lithology Description: Fossiliferous chert, siltstone, sandstone, marl.

General Comments: Different unit to White Rocks Lamproite.
Lithology Description: Syenogranite, locally garnetiferous or biotite-rich; recrystallized and multiply deformed.

General Comments: Variously considered as part of Lamboo Complex, Hooper Complex, Bow Supersuite. Part also mapped as Castlereagh Hill Porphyry. Intruded by Mount Christine Granitoid and Paperbark Supersuite. Closely related to Paperbark Supersuite. Indistinguishable crystallisation ages for Paperbark Supersuite, Whitewater Volcanics and related intrusions.
Lithology Description: Thick-bedded, massive fine- to medium-grained quartz-feldspar rhyolite to dacite porphyry and welded ignimbrite; minor agglomerate, lapilli tuff, dacitic and rhyodacitic ash-flow tuff, and volcaniclastic sedimentary rock, minor siltstone interbeds.

General Comments: Balfour Downs 1:250 000 sheet.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, conglomerate

General Comments: Precambrian. West Pilbara.  Age: ~3.12Ga. Forms the Sholl Terrane of the West Pilbara Superterrane (per statement by M.Van Kranendonk/GSWA, Mar06). Removed from Pilbara Supergroup in 2006.
Lithology Description: Basalt, dolerite, chert, ultramafic rocks, sedimentary rocks, rhyolite tuff, agglomerate, banded iron formation, andesite

General Comments: New name added in nomenclatural revision in GSWA Record 2006/15 (Van Kranendonk).  Also, for DAMPIER map sheet; nearest town Karratha.
Lithology Description: Foliated, micrcocline-porphyritic hornblende granodiorite, containing layers and blocks of banded fine-grained tonalite gneiss, and banded biotite-rich gneiss; orbicular texture locally developed at Whyjabby Pool.

General Comments: See also Wicherina Member.

Unconformably overlies Killaloc Formation; progressively overlies younger formations of Limbunya Group from east to west.  As basal unit of Wattie Group, max age must match Wattie Group max age. Birrindudu Basin. Not to be confused with informal nomenclature for Wickham metamorphic rocks in Tasmania, or with WA's Wickham Pillow Basalt.
Lithology Description: Massive quartz sandstone, micaceous siltstone and laminated and brecciated chert, basal conglomerate.

General Comments: Different from NT's Wickham Formation.
Lithology Description: Alterated pillowed matebasite, dolerite dykes.

General Comments: Dolerite and gabbro; includes cumulate and granophyric differentiates.East-northeast-trending mafic to ultramafic dykes intruding Archean greenstone and granitic units of the Yilgarn Craton. See also GSWA ENS: Wingate, MTD and Romano, SS (partial report), Widgiemooltha Dolerite (P_-_ww-o): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 09 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite and gabbro; includes cumulate and granophyric differentiates.

General Comments: In the Western Zone of the Lamboo Complex. Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008). Informal unit of Springvale Suite [advice from GSWA Dec 2013]
Lithology Description: Layered mafic-ultramafic intrusion; gabbro, leucogabbro, leucogabbronorite, gabbronorite, anorthosite, minor troctolite; some olivine and/or chromitite-bearing; in rhythmic cycles; peridotite and troctolite

General Comments: McIntosh 1:100 000 map sheet, East Kimberley.
Lithology Description: Magnetite gabbro and magnetite-quartz gabbronorite with veins of biotite norite; veins of biotite tonalite.

General Comments: Company name of Beardsmore (2002). Hosts significant gold mineralisation (eg Sunrise Birthday deposit, described in some detail). Crops out as dark brown ridges.
Lithology Description: basal 100m conspicuous massive to strongly foliated, porphyritic pyroxenite; metamorphosed. Overlain by massive, even-grained gabbro.

General Comments: For use in the complete revision of the Murchison domain lithostratigraphy; published in GSWA Annual Review 2007-2008. Age: c.2740Ma.  The Wilgie Mia beds of Elias (1982. Belele 1:250K map sheet, explanatory Notes) are included within this formation. Geological province: Murchison Domain.
Lithology Description: Foliated banded iron-formation and felsic volcaniclastic rocks; weakly metamorphosed; schistose pelite and psammite.
Weakly foliated, light pink-grey, medium- to coarse-grained biotite granodiorite and trondhjemite.
Fine- to medium-grained quartz sandstone, quartzite; dark grey shale, siltstone, arenaceous schist and sheared sandstone

General Comments: Replaced by Paterson Formation in 1972. Subsequently revived by GSWA?
Lithology Description: Unsorted tillite, conglomeratic sandstone, current-bedded sandstone, and claystone; boulders to 1.2 m, mainly of granite
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Also interfingers with Goldwyer Formation. Fossiliferous.
Lithology Description: An open platform facies carbonate sequence with minor sandstone interbeds.Bioturbated carbonate and mudstone deposits; richly fossiliferous.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Max. thickness: >3000ft.
Lithology Description: Quartzwacke, siltstone, quartz sandstone and conglomerate; poorly sorted.

Stratigraphic Name: Willaraddie Formation, Munabia Sandstone, Gneudna Formation, Nannyarra Sandstone
General Comments: Group erected for mapping convenience only 1:1 M Geological Map of Australia
Lithology Description: Sandstone, siltstone, conglomerate, limestone, minor dolomite; fossiliferous

General Comments: Vasse River Coalfield, Perth Basin. Max. thickness: >747m. See also misspelled Williespe Formation.
Lithology Description: Poorly sorted feldspathic sandstone, with subordinate conglomerate, siltstone, shale, and sporadic thin, lenticular sub-bituminous coal.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. max. thickness: 1100ft.
Lithology Description: Quartzwacke, conglomerate and pebbly quartzwacke, claystone; poorly sorted.

Relatively narrow heterogeneous mafic unit, comprising a serpentinite base with unaltered meta-basalt and irregularly altered mafics ranging from quartz gabbro through dolerite and basalt to devitrified andesite.

General Comments: PUBLICATION: Semeniuk, V., 2008, Journal of the Royal Society of Western Australia Volume 91 Part 1 (Supplement): 53-148. Radiocarbon dating of shells within the Formation places it in the Holocene, viz., 3060 +/- 600 yrs BP and 6910 +/-180 yrs BP. Originally reserved as 'Willie Creek'. Canning Region, but not really Canning Basin.
Lithology Description: A fine to medium to coarse sand-sized bioclastic and quartzose calcarenite, with layers of shells.

General Comments: Included in the Scorpion Group on the Nabberru 1:250 000 geological map sheet.  Geological Province: Scorpion Basin.
Lithology Description: Interbedded stromatolitic dolomite, siltstone and sandstone, commonly with contorted bedding.

General Comments: Previously considered part of the Eucla Group.
Lithology Description: Wackestone, white to grey; skeletal mudstone; rudstone and minor packstone.  Locally laminations and scour channels, infilled with coarser material.

General Comments: Lagrange SE51-10. Fine grain, calcite cemented sandstone. Reference section is in petroleum well Olympic 1, Broome Platform, Canning Basin where the unit is 62m thick. Unit is the lower section of the Nambeet Formation and was continuously cored from the upper contact with overlying Upper Nambeet (Samphire Marsh Member: also to be reserved and defined) to total depth.  To be published = End of 2017 in GSWA Report.
Lithology Description: Fine grain, calcite cemented sandstone.
Pale grey, very fine- to fine- (rarely medium-) grained quartz sandstone with variable proportions of interbedded medium to dark grey siltstone. Common shelly fossils; conodonts.

General Comments: Not same unit as Wilson Well Gneiss. Informal unit of Sally Malay Suite [advice from GSWA Dec 2013]. Use of the term "Intrusion" in stratigraphic names is discouraged. Use of the stratigraphic term "Intrusion" is to remain in use in the Pilbara region only (per Conveners' agreement, AESC Perth 2008).
North Shaw 1: 100 000 sheet area, east Pilbara.  In Carlindi Granitoid Complex area. Not the same unit as informal Wison Creek intrusion.
Lithology Description: Heterogeneous, migmatic tonalitic orthogneiss; minor schlieric hornblende granodiorite.

General Comments: Canning Basin. Probably Holocene unit, so probably Canning Region, but not Canning Basin.

Redefined 1998. Has close genetic relationship with Labouchere Fm of which it was then interpreted as the Wilthorpe Member (Windh 1992). Upgraded due to distinctive lithology and erosional contact with Labouchere Fm. Overthrust by Narryer Gneiss Complex. maximum age of 1996 Ma is from detrital zircons.
Lithology Description: Conglomerate with sandstone matrix, sandstone, siltstone, commonly graded; chert, chlorite rock, metasiltstone and phyllite

General Comments: Of Bettany and Churchwand (1974).

Lithology Description: Granite, granophyre, marginal porphyritic granophyre and aplite also forms apophyses into Palgrave Volcanic Association rocks and into the Pussy Cat Group

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Different unit from Windalia Sand Member.
Lithology Description: Radiolarian siltstone, sandy radiolarite and chert; variably porcellanised.

General Comments: Invalid name (Windalia Radiolarite is older), but entrenched in industry and literature.
Lithology Description: Sandstone.

General Comments: See variation: Windanning Formation.
Lithology Description: Regionally extensive jaspilitic BIF interlayered with volcaniclastic sediments, felsic tuff and minor volcanic rocks.

General Comments: See Nabberru 1:250 000 geological map sheet.
Lithology Description: Stromatolitic carbonate limestone, shale, conglomerate, jasper, and peloidal jasper.

Reserved by: Williams, I.R., revised Van Kranendonk, M. 2008
General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain.
Lithology Description: Metagabbro and metaleucogabbro, grades into metagabbronorite, locally schistose and sheared, with abundant metagranite, aplite and granophyre intrusive sheets. Magnetitite layers <1m thick in magnetite-rich gabbro; metamorphosed.
Massive to crudely bedded cyanobacterial and minor stromatoporoid reef limestone with contemporaneous deposition of microcrystalline calcite

General Comments: East Kimberley.  Replaces parts of the Gardiner beds on Gordon Downs 250K.  Note: Extensive Gardiner still exists in NT and other parts of WA.
Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone, minor mudstone, dolomite, stromatolitic chert

General Comments: Of Pirajno (2004) as advised by R. Hocking (email 28/4/04). PP. Both dates from Bubble Well Member, Juderina Formation.
Lithology Description: A succession of graphitic shales, carbonaceous siltstones and sandstones, stromatolitic dolomites, and mafic rocks.

General Comments: Card. Published according to DL1980.
Part of Grant Group. N.B. Tentative ages, awaiting further palynology work (2008), on relevant drill core. Fitzroy Trough area
Lithology Description: Shale, carbonaceous, pyritic;  siltstone, minor limestone, local fine sandstone. Fossil assemblage includes palynomorphs.

General Comments: Turkey Creek 1:100 000 sheet area (sheet 4563, east Kimberley).
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed greywacke, lithic sandstone, siltstone, mudstone, basalt, dolerite; carbonate rocks including calcareous siltstone and sandstone

General Comments: Tanami Province.  See also "Winnecke Granophyre". Name still in use 2007. Intrudes Ware Group. See also Winnecke Monzogranite. Variably assigned to the Birthday Suite (2007), Granites Supersuite (obsolete), or Winnecke Suite (2001, superseded by Birthday Suite).
Lithology Description: Biotite-bearing syenogranite, monzogranite, including minor quartz-feldspar porphyry, quartz-phyric rhyolite.

General Comments: Age?
Lithology Description: Sandstone.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Previously wrongly stated to be in South Australia as well as WA [CEB 29-MAR-2010]
Lithology Description: Marine and coastal shale, siltstone and radiolarite: dominantly siliceous pelagic deposits with basal sandstone and conglomerate.

General Comments: Age: c.610Ma. In the Louisa Basin.
Lithology Description: Green to grey fissile to thinly flaggy laminated shale and siltstone with pyrite in places, purple siltstone, and green and purple sandstone interbeds

General Comments: For use in mapping Musgrave Complex area rocks by GSWA. Approved by R.Hocking (GSWA) Sept2008. West Musgrave Complex. Comprises much of the basement.
Lithology Description: Undivided, weakly to strongly banded gneiss; typically quartzofeldspathic but includes amphibolitic rocks; mostly of sedimentary or volcanosedimentary protolith but possibly includes felsic to mafic intrusive protoliths.

General Comments: Used in South Australia.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, arkosic; dolomite; feldspathic and micaceous sandstone
Primary Lithology Group: feldspar- or lithic-rich arenite to rudite

General Comments: Should not have been reserved,16/9/83-83/643. Published 24/10/84. Age: >75->65Ma [in 2001].
Also supersedes Wittecarra Beds. See also Wittecarra Sandstone Member.
Lithology Description: Basal conglomerate, then silty sandstone and siltstone, sandstone, conglomerate, and capped by sandstone with probable plant rootlets.

General Comments: Max Age: 2561 (+/-) 8 Ma. Ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Calcitic dolomite, interbedded chert and shale in upper and lower parts, volcaniclastic sandstone.

General Comments: Balfour Downs 1:250 000 sheet. In Collier Basin.
Lithology Description: Interbedded shale, siltstone, sandstone and conglomerate; local dolostone and stromatolitic dolostone.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain.
Lithology Description: Fluorite-bearing alkali granite; post-tectonic. Monzogranite, muscovite-rich granite and muscovite-bearing pegmatite; all metamorphosed.

General Comments: See also Lexicon.  See also Wogalli Sandstone.
Within the Muccan Granitoid Complex.
Lithology Description: Porphyritic to seriate monzogranite; grades to syenogranite; pink-grey, medium- to coarse-grained; local flow-banding and igneous mineral alignment, pegmatite banding, or other foliation with inclusions of schleric metatonalite.
Medium to fine grained biotite-pyroxene gabbro, quartz gabbro and quartz norite with some recrystallisation in places

General Comments: Hardey 2252, Wyloo SF50-10. A newly recognised glacial diamictite unit within the Kazput Formation of the Turee Creek Group. Ongoing formal naming of glacial diamictite horizons within the Turee Creek Group will assist description and global correlation with Huronian diamictites.To be published: GSWA Explanatory Notes System, and Record.
Lithology Description: Glacial diamictite.

General Comments: Previously included in the Victoria River Group of Traves (1955) and Coolibah Formation of Laing & Allen (1956). Birindudu Basin. See also the misspelt Wandoan Hill Formation, Wondoan Hills Formation. Type area is no longer accessible [noted in 2016].
Lithology Description: Glauconitic quartz sandstone, claystone, siltstone, shale, mudstone; minor dolostone.

General Comments: Variation of reserved name Wongarling? Age said to be : <840 Ma (poor age constraints) in 1999.
Lithology Description: Fine to coarse sandstone, quartz sandstone, and minor siltstone, silty shale and shale; local altered mafic pillow lava

General Comments: Formerly within the Earaheedy Group.
Lithology Description: Very fine grained arkosic sandstone and shale; mudstone, claystone, local conglomerate, intraclastic breccia and carbonate-glauconite breccia; glacigene to fluvioglacial.

General Comments: Previously considered part of the Pole Group. Now (2016) reassigned into the Vetters Subgroup, Kalgoorlie Group. The Wongi Basalt lies within the Davyhurst and Bardoc 1:100K map sheets areas.
Lithology Description: Komatiitic basalt; variolitic to pyroxene spinifex-textured; locally pillowed; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Ashburton Basin?
Geological Province: Southern Perth Basin.
Lithology Description: Homogeneous sandstone, feldspathic, poorly sorted, coarse to very coarse-grained, unconsolidated and light grey to colourless.

General Comments: Formerly included in the Collier Group, included in the Scorpion Group on the Nabberru 1:250 000 geological map sheet (2003).
Lithology Description: Coarse to medium grained white quartz sandstone, siltstone with numerous pyrite pseudomorphs, shale and minor conglomerate; rippled and cross bedded. Minor evaporite.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File SH/50-5.  In the northern part of the Perth Basin only.
Lithology Description: Marine claystone, siltstone.

General Comments: Offshore Perth Basin. See also Woodada Formation.
Replaced by Brown Gannet Limestone? NO this Group is younger than Brown Gannet Lst. Maybe reinterp in one well? See Woodbine Beds. [CEBJun95]. Still current as at 2013.
Lithology Description: Coarse, quartzitic sandstones with claystone interbeds, and minor coal and dolomite overlain by calcareous claystone and marl with calcarenite interbeds.

General Comments: Age: <3.10Ga. In the Pilbara Craton. Within the Pilbara Supergroup in the West Pilbara Superterrane.
Lithology Description: Consists of metamorphosed rhyolite tuff and agglomerate, and smaller amounts of metabasalt; rare units of carbonate-rich, ferruginous chert and  BIF.

General Comments: Identified as the wood sequence by Abbott and Sweet (2000) in their sequence stratigraphy interpretation of the Roper Group. Age: >1493+/-4 Ma. Within the Roper Group. Can be difficult to distinguish from Showell Member (Smith, 2016).
Lithology Description: Dominantly mudstone interbedded with very fine- to rarely medium-grained, commonly micaceous and glauconitic sandstone that increases in frequency up-section. Rare limestone or dolostone in middle part.conitic sandstone.

General Comments: Stromatolitic.
Lithology Description: Comprises quartz rich sandstone interbedded with subordinate chert, chert breccia, mudstone and volcanogenic lithic sandstone.

General Comments: See also Woodlands Member (WA).
Edmund Basin. Shown as member of Irregully Formation. May be a misspelling of Woodlands Arenite Member. [Woodlands Arenite Member was/is of the Gap Well Formation]. Age <1620 Ma.
Lithology Description: Thick-bedded quartz sandstone; minor siltstone.

General Comments: Overlies the centre part of the Woodleigh impact structure.
Lithology Description: Lacustrine deposits: laminated siltstone and mudstone interbedded with fine-grained silty sandstone.

General Comments: Age: 1620+/-100Ma (Rb-Sr ; Turek 1966 IN Jones, S. A. - 2003). Maximum deposition age (detrital zircon) = 1737 Ma. May be a lateral equivalent of Mount Barren Group.
Lithology Description: Quartz arenite, quartz conglomerate, argillite, mudstone; weakly deformed, with gentle upright folding and warping; weakly to moderately developed subvertical cleavage.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Defn on Tech File G/50-14. Preferred over Woodrarrung Formation (directive from R.Hocking/GSWA Mar.06). Max. thickness: ~3700ft.
Lithology Description: Cross-bedded coarse feldspathic quartz sandstone, finer and kaolinitic in upper section. Thinly bedded feldspathic and quartzose sandstone

General Comments: Age: c. 2927 Ma Part of Yule Granitoid Complex Replaces Woodstock Adamellite?
Lithology Description: Equigranular to K-feldspar-phyric biotite monzogranite; weakly to moderately foliated; locally abundant pegmatite and granite dykes; magnetite-bearing leucogranite pods; tonalitic orthogneiss inclusions; weakly metamorphosed and schlieric

General Comments: Possibly correlates with parts of Halls Creek Group. Formerly grouped with Bow River Batholith into Lamboo Complex. Intruded Ding Dong Downs Volcanics and Halls Creek Group. Ungrouped in GSWA 500K Solid Geology GIS (2008).
Lithology Description: Dolerite sill, altered to amphibolite near contact with granite.

General Comments: Vasse River Coalfield, Perth Basin
Lithology Description: Predominantly sandstone with interbedded conglomerate and subordinate argillaceous units.
Fossiliferous limestone.
Pelagic marl, hemipelagic marl, limestone.
Recrystallized monzogranite and granodiorite; typically coarse-grained, granoblastic, and lacks foliation; xenoliths described in some detail.

General Comments: Age: ~2.66Ga

Originally reserved and published as Woolgra Formation (1985,1990) . Name now to be revised for use in the complete revision of the Murchison domain lithostratigraphy; to be published in GSWA Annual Review 2007-2008 (Nov. 2008).   Age: c.2755Ma.
Lithology Description: Andesitic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks; weakly metamorphosed

General Comments: Formerly Woolnough beds.
Lithology Description: Red-grey stromatolitic dolostone, argillaceous dolostone, dolomitic mudstone, and minor dolomitic sandstone.

General Comments: SHRIMP U/Pb zircon age: 2031 +/- 6Ma from tuffaceous siltstone near base of unit in Mount Olympus area, interpreted to record syneruptive volcaniclastic sedimentation. The c. 2030 Ma age for the Wooly Dolomite indicates that this unit was laid down separately, following the Ophthalmian Orogeny, in the interval between the deposition of the Shingle Creek and Wyloo Groups.The underlying Shingle Creek Group, is proposed as the formal name to replace the informal lower Wyloo Group,. As such it includes the Beasley River Quartzite and Cheela Springs Basalt, but now excluding the Wooly Dolomite. Wyloo Group is now reserved for what was informally referred to as the upper Wyloo Group.
Lithology Description: Thin to thick-bedded locally stromatolitic dolomite, mudstone and minor chert; minor conglomerate and pebbly arenite at base. Includes tuffaceous siltstone.

General Comments: Defined 1973. To become part of the Higginsville Subgroup, Kalgoorlie Group.
Lithology Description: Basalt, often pillowed; komatiite; dolerite/gabbro intrusions.
Rhyolite, rhyodacite, rhyolitic volcaniclastic breccia and banded iron formation; metamorphosed.
Medium grained ferruginous sandstone, lithic sandstone, with locally common interbeds of siltstone and silty claystone.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Defn on Tech. File F/50-13. Gas source rocks and seals.
Lithology Description: Fine to coarse-grained sandstone, siltstone and shale; granule to pebble conglomerate

General Comments: DEF 87/25751. Local conodonts.
Lithology Description: Red-brown siltstones, sandstones and dolomite.
Grey quartz feldspar porphyry with phenocrysts of pink quartz and plagioclase and microcline

General Comments: Current usage in WA. See also Wright Hill Beds.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, sandstone, quartzite; minor black oolitic chert.
Red "scheck" breccia and fossiliferous limestone.

General Comments: Wurarga, Mellenbye 100k sheets.  To use in the southern Murchison Domain. Age: 2950 Ma. Type area: 5km east of Wurarga Hsd, lat 28deg25', long 116deg17'. Metamorphosed 'basement' unit, no known older units in region.
Lithology Description: Migmatitic tonalite to granodiorite with monzogranitic components; typically gneissic.

General Comments: Bentley Basin (GSWA, 2011).
Lithology Description: Dark-grey, feldspar-phyric rhyolite with very fine-grained groundmass; massive, flow-banded or spherulitic.

General Comments: Formerly (1976) included in the Grant Formation. Eastern St George Range.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, diamictite, claystone/siltstone with dropstones, minor conglomerate lenses.

General Comments: Informally established and subdivided by MacLeod et al. (1963). Maximum age is subject to debate (GSWA, UWA). Upper age from tuff near top of Ashburton Fm (1806 +/- 9) and from June Hill Volcanics (1799 +/- 8). Base age only poorly constrained to somewhere between a minimum detrital zircon age (2446 Ma) and the age of the Cheela Springs Basalt (2209 Ma). Appears to include a significant unconformity between Wooly Dolomite and Mount McGrath Formation. This group now [March 2016] split into two Groups. Shingle Creek Group, as the formal name to replace the informal lower Wyloo Group. Wyloo Group is now reserved for what was informally referred to as the upper Wyloo Group. Ashburton Basin.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, mudstone, conglomerate, siltstone, dolostone, mafic and felsic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks, banded iron formation, chert.

General Comments: Wyloo Basin. 2044-1977 Ma.

Age: 3325Ma. Note: Some older references place this unit within Kelly Subgroup (of Warrawoona Group); others say it overlies Warrawoona Group. Kelly Subgroup upgraded to Group status containing this Formation (2006).
Lithology Description: Felsic volcanic sandstone; tuffaceous; local quartz sandstone on Port Hedland sheet.  Felsic volcanic rock; local basalt; metamorphosed, on Nullagine.
Green and grey shale and siltstone with fine-grained sandstone interbeds

General Comments: Gascoyne Province. Shown as -Pgla, -Pghs, -Pgbb, -Pgbp, -Pgbs, -Pgvo, -Pgmb on Glenburgh 1:250k map sheet.

Lithology Description: Quartz sandstone, matrix-supported polymictic conglomerate, minor pebble conglomerate

General Comments: Lake Lefroy 1:100k map sheet area. Biotite monzogranite. To be published = East Yilgarn 2013-2013 Update, Geological Survey of Western Australia digital product.
Lithology Description: Biotite monzogranite.

General Comments: To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Yalgoo 1:100k map sheet. Type area: north of Yalgoo townsite. Probably time-equivalent to the Meekatharra Formation in the northern Murchison Domain, but subtle differences in lava types and abundances warrants a separate formation. See also previous usage as Yalgoo Subgroup.
Lithology Description: Pyroxene spinifex-textured basalt interlayered with thin flows of olivine spinifex-textured komatiite; tholeiitic and variolitic basalt dominant in upper part; sedimentary and volcaniclastic interlayers; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Named after Lake Yalgorup. Map Sheet = Pinjarra. Nearest Town = Pinjarra or Harvey. Brief Description = the name 'Yalgorup' to replace 'Myalup' for the Myalup Member of the Middle-Upper Triassic Lesueur Sandstone (proposed by Crostella and Backhouse, 2000 - GSWA Report 57, on p. 15) as Myalup has a previous usage by Semeniuk(1995, REFID: 63454) for a Pleistocene unit. To be published = 2013 as part of GSWA Harvey 1 well completion report.
Lithology Description: Sandstone and pebbly sandstone.

General Comments: Associated with Glen and Polelle Groups. Geological province: Murchison Domain.
Lithology Description: Mafic to ultramafic sills, ranging from dunite and pyroxenite at base to gabbro and leucogabbro with long feathery pyroxene crystals at their tops; includes peridotite.
Coarse, even grained, granulite-facies leucocratic monzonite

General Comments: Reserved as Yallingarrintha Granodiorite.
Lithology Description: Biotite-hornblende tonalite to granodiorite, foliated, metamorphosed
Medium- to coarse-grained dolerite, locally mesocratic and granophyric; in places layered with gabbroic base; local superposition of sills indicated by l (lower) and u (upper).

General Comments: With Greensleeves Formation, replaces Gabanintha Formation. For use in revision of Murchison domain lithostratigraphy; published in GSWA Annual Review for 2007-2008. Now includes the Kantie Murdanna Vocanics as a Member (Tim Ivanic, GSWA, pers comm MAR-2011)
Lithology Description: Banded BIF and ferruginous banded chert; andesitic and dacitic volcanic and volcaniclastic rock; both metamorphosed. Quartzite; psammitic schist locally grading into pelitic schist; pelite, locally strongly sheared; metasiliciclastic rocks.

General Comments: Robinson Range 1:250 000 sheet area. Geol Province: Gascoyne Complex.
Lithology Description: Foliated, medium- to fine-grained, even-textured, biotite monzogranite; minor leucocratic biotite-garnet monzogranite.
Proximal-littoral pink-brown arkose and feldspathic sandstone, minor siltstone, haematitic quartz sandstone, glauconitic sandstone, and quartz pebble conglomerate

General Comments: Older part of the Rudall Complex. Hosts the Kintyre uranium deposit. Median age for uraninite in the Kintyre deposit  837 +/- 31-35 Ma which is best interpreted as reconnaissance-level age determination. This age is in good agreement with the ca 845 Ma estimate for the deposit (Maas unpublished, cited Huston et al. 2009) (RefID 67182).
Lithology Description: Pelitic to semi-pelitic quartz-mica schist, hematite-biotite schist, muscovite quartzite, quartzite, with local psammitic gneiss, pyritic graphite schist, chert, and metamorphosed banded iron formation

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Age: circa 1000 Ma. Of the Mullingarra Complex, Pinjarra Orogen, not Perth Basin. Possibly correlated to Billeranga Subgroup of Moora Group.
Lithology Description: Siltstone, feldspathic sandstone, conglomerate; abundant volcanic fragments

General Comments: Balfour Downs explanatory notes.
Lithology Description: Laminated to thinly bedded dolomite with minor stromatolitic interbeds; calcareous and dolomitic shale and siltstone

General Comments: Variation of the reserved name Yandeearra Leucogranite (Smithies, 1998). Current name reserved by Van Kranendonk, M. (14APR05) but published as Yandearra Granodiorite (GSWA Record 2006/15).
Lithology Description: Biotite-bearing granodiorite, weakly to strongly foliated; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Topmost unit in Brockman Iron Formation. Ages from Trendall et al (2004), RefID 60706.
Lithology Description: Comprises alternating chert and thin shale, intruded by dolerite sills.

General Comments: Located at Yangibana Bore, Edmund 1:100 000 sheet at GDA: 314700E 7357600N.
Lithology Description: Biotite-muscovite syenogranite to monzogranite; medium even grained to locally slightly porphyritic granite.

General Comments: See Pinderi Hills 1:100K sheet. Archaean Monzogranite, about 15km2 in area that intrudes Archaean Whundo Group 35km south of Karratha. Age of intrusion is 2925Ma. Within the Sisters Supersuite. Also referred to as the North Whundo Intrusion.
Lithology Description: Fine to medium-grained, nonfoliated monzogranite; amphibole replaced by chlorite; anomalously magnetic.

General Comments: Defined as Yardarino Sandstone
See also Lexicon. Name dropped?

Named for Yareweeree Pool on Mount Wohler 1:100 000 sheet. Desc. in Smithies, R.H., 2002: Archaean boninite-like rocks in an intracratonic setting. Earth/Plan.Sci.Letters, v197, p19-34). Within the Croydon Gp/De Grey Supergroup. In 2016 Hickman states in GSWA Report 160 p58 that the Yareweeree Boninite Member intrudes the central part of the Mallina Basin and is now considered part of the Constantine Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Serpentine-rich ultramafic schist, chlorite-actinolite-serpentine-epidote schist after high-Mg basalt, and weakly metamorphosed melanogabbro and pyroxenite, characterised by a biniite-like geochemistry.

General Comments: Replaces Yaringa Evaporite, Yaringa Evaporite Member. Do not confuse with Yaringa Metamorphics of Queensland. Age probably Wenlock to Ludlow (see Yaringa Evaporite).
Lithology Description: Laminated oolitic dolostone interbedded with saliferous dark grey shales, halite beds and anhydrite.

Mainly composed of banded leucocratic and mesocratic granitic gneisses, consisting of several interlayered rock types, that have been repeatedly deformed and metamorphosed; most rock types are granitic.

General Comments: Technically invalid name. Not related to Yarra Granite. Not related to Yarra Yarra Creek Group.
Lithology Description: Coarse-grained, equigranular, leucocratic granulite-facies monzogranite. In places contains abundant inclusions of quartzite and banded iron formation.

General Comments: The Yarrabubba Granite is to be renamed the Yarrabubba Monzogranite and assigned to the Walganna Suite of the Bald Rock Supersuite. This change in nomenclature appears on the Nowthanna 1:100K map sheet, in prep. here at GSWA for release in June 2011.
Lithology Description: Coarse-grained, muscovite monzogranite; typically with large, round quartz phenocrysts; local pegmatite patches.

General Comments: Defined McWhae et al (1958); original type section 2.4 km SSE of Yarragadee Homestead. See also Lexicon. Briefly described in 00/30544.  Redefined by Backhouse (1984).  New ref. section nominated for Gingin No. 1 Well (356 -3315 m): Playford et al. (1976) and Backhouse (1984).
Lithology Description: Fine to coarse-grained, poorly sorted feldspathic sandstone, thin beds of shale, sitlstone; minor conglomerate and coal present.

General Comments: See also Yarragadee Formation.
Lithology Description: Fluvio-deltaic sandstones and siltstones were deposited in the lower part of the Yarragadee Sequence, followed by coarse-grained fluvial sediments. Intrusive rocks interpreted.

General Comments: Previously considered part of Winning Group, but now considered to unconformably underlie. Lateral equivalent to Barrow Group and in part to Nanutarra Formation.
Lithology Description: Polymictic conglomerate. Pebble to cobble conglomerate, poorly sorted sandstone and minor siltstone.

General Comments: Possibly refers to Yarraquin tonalite (unit no. 79821).
Lithology Description: Mainly high temperature granitic gneiss, including numerous xenoliths of mafic gneiss and paragneiss.

General Comments: See also Lexicon. Defn on Tech File G/50-14. Max. thickness (probably truncated): 1435ft.
Lithology Description: Laminated siltstone and fine-grained quartzwacke.
Biotite monzogranite; K-feldspar phenocrysts; High-HFSE Granite.  Coarse-grained and pervasively foliated.

General Comments: Wyloo 1:250 000 map sheet area. Broadly equivalent to the Blue Billy Formation, Edmund 1:250k sheet area.
Defined 1981. See also Yellow Drum Formation (favoured for some years). This name reinstated by GSWA ~2006?
Lithology Description: Calcareous sandstone; medium to coarse dolomite; minor shale, siltstone, limestone.

General Comments: Defined 1977. Redefined 1997. Formerly part of the Earaheedy Group. Max depositional age 2027 Ma (2005). Includes strata previously referred to Malmac Formation. SHRIMP U-Pb dating of magmatic zircons from thin tuffaceous layers in the Yelma Formation provides depositional ages of 1970-1950 Ma Johnson (2013) RefID 69003.
Lithology Description: Sandstone, dolomite (locally stromatolitic), siltstone, and shale; minor conglomerate and limestone; shallow marine to fluvial deposits.

General Comments: Name out of use since 1972. Probably obsolete?

Lithology Description: Sandstone, conglomerate, siltstone, shale, dolostone

General Comments: Does not crop out.
Lithology Description: Comprises mainly lake deposits formed of greenish to greyish clay with layers of blackish mudstone; two layers of lignite have been encountered in drill cores. Includes pollen, fossil leaves & branches.

General Comments: To be used in Murchison Domain updates in 2015. Named after Yilgaddy Pool, Yalgoo 1:100k sheet area. 28deg15'S, 116deg37'E. Type area 4.5 km northwest of Yalgoo townsite. Overlies Singleton Basalt Member NW of Yalgoo townsite.
Lithology Description: Andesite to basaltic andesite lavas; typically glassy and with distinctive coarsely spherulitic flows; minor basalt and dacite; metamorphosed. Includes felsic schist, and andesitic volcanic breccia to sandstone; metamorphosed.
Polymictic clast-supported (cobble-pebble) conglomerates, massive to weakly graded sandstones.

General Comments: Supersedes Yilgatherra Member. Geological Province: Edmund Basin. Within the Bangemall Supergroup.  Age: c.1620Ma. 300-350m thick.
Lithology Description: Basal sandstone and conglomerate, overlain by siltstone and dolostone.

General Comments: Formerly Yindagindi Limestone. See also Lexicon. SG50-1.
Lithology Description: Dominant pebbly quartzwacke and intercalated thin hard limestone beds. Most of the limestone beds are of light bluish-grey oolitic calcilutite with quartz sand up to 15%.

Stratigraphic Name: Yindagindy Formation, Williambury Formation, Moogooree Limestone
General Comments: Three formations grouped only for mapping purposes for 1:1 million map of Australia
Lithology Description: Sandstone, mudstone, limestone, minor conglomerate and dolomite; fossiliferous
Fine- to medium-grained, equigranular monzogranite. High Ca granite.

General Comments: Stated to be of the Kwinana Group (Abeysinghe 2003) but this is probably incorrect (per email R.Hocking 12 Feb 2008).  Also supersedes "Yoganup Shoreline Series".  Age: Tertiary - in Wedge Island area.
Lithology Description: Shoreline deposit consisting of basal conglomerate and foredune containing discontinuous concentrations of heavy minerals together with leached quartz sand.

General Comments: Youanmi 100k sheets.  To use in the southern Murchison Domain. Age: c. 2815 Ma. Type area: 5km east of  Youangarra Hsd, lat 28deg46', long 118deg49'.
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed siliciclastic rocks interlayered with felsic schist; local dacitic lava; minor metachert and metamorphosed BIF; locally strongly sheared.

General Comments: Geological province: Murchison Domain.  Age: c.2780Ma.
Lithology Description: Dolerite; modally layered pyroxenitic gabbro interlayered with serpentinite; gabbronorite grading into norite and leucogabbronorite, interlayered with gabbro; magnetitite interlayered with modally layered magnetite-bearing leucogabbro; metamorphosed.

General Comments: Rays Rocks, Youanmi 100k sheets.  To use in the southern Murchison Domain. Age: c. 2815 Ma. Type area: 5km east of Yuinmery Hsd, lat 28deg34', long 119deg10'.
Lithology Description: Felsic schist with local dacite to rhyolite lava, interlayered with metamorphosed BIF; locally strongly sheared.

General Comments: May be part of, or lateral equivalent of Laurel Formation, informally named for Yulleroo-1 oil well?  In the Fitzroy Trough. Mentioned as Yulleroo Formation in Oil Basins Limited: IPO Presentation, June 2006 (Patersons Securities Ltd).
In the Louisa Basin. Age: less than 610Ma.
Lithology Description: Glacigenic, medium-bedded, moderately to poorly sorted, fine- to medium-grained, ripple-laminated quartz sandstone interbedded with siltstone, mudstone, laminated dolomitic siltstone, and silty or sandy dolomite.

General Comments: East-west striking gabbro and pyroxene dykes on PINDERI HILLS, cutting the Munni Munni layered intrusion (of Radley Suite). See also GSWA ENS: WINGATE, MTD and Hickman, AH (partial report), Zebra Hill Dolerite (A-STzh-xod-ax): Geological Survey of Western Australia, WA Geology Online, Explanatory Notes extract, viewed 01 August 2018, <www.dmp.wa.gov.au/ens>.
Lithology Description: Dolerite and pyroxenite dyke.

General Comments: Carnarvon Basin unit. Similar age to Birdrong Formation? Between Barrow Group and Muderong Formation in age? ie Cretaceous.
Lithology Description: Delta-front sandstones.

General Comments: 1:250,000 Widgiemooltha SH51-14; 1:100,000 Lake Lefroy 3235. Previously included in Merougil Conglomerate, Kambalda area. Basal formation of the Lower Merougil Group. Conformably overlain by Triangle Island Sandstone Formation. Unconformably overlies the Morgans Island Formation of the Upper Black Flag Group. Proposed publication: Doutch, D. A., and Cas, R. A., 2019, Stratigraphic and facies architecture of the Neoarchaean Black Flag and Merougil Groups, Kambalda, Western Australia: Depositional and volcanic evolution of Late Archaean submarine fan to fan-delta sequences that host significant gold deposits.
Lithology Description: Extensive sheet-like matrix supported polymictic conglomerates and massive volcanic quartz dominated sandstone.

General Comments: The Ziggy Monzogranite is a variably foliated monzogranite intrusion in the northeast corner of the Yilgarn Craton near the Dorothy Hills. The monzogranite has sheared contacts with the greenstones of the Dorothy Hills greenstone belt. The monzogranite has been dated at 2832 +/-4 Ma (GSWA SHRIMP age). The pluton has been named after Ziggy's Bore, located at 51J 586653 6898608, which is 1 kilometre south of the geochronology sample site. To be published = several GSWA publications, including 1:100 000 maps and geochronology reports.
Lithology Description: Variably foliated monzogranite.

General Comments: Defn on Tech File D/52-10. See also misspelling Zimmerman Sandstone.
Lithology Description: Quartzose, feldspathic and lithic sandstone, minor siltstone and shale.
White, light-grey to pinkish-grey, seriate to even-grained, in places weakly foliated, medium to coarse-grained biotite granodiorite, tonalite, and monzogranite. Metamorphosed.

General Comments: Unit is to be used as part of a "standard set" of symbols for National Maps Project. Map Symbol: Qa.  May have been previously mapped as Qy (Qyt); some Qcc and Czca.
Lithology Description: Channel and flood plain alluvium; gravel, sand, silt, clay; may be locally calcreted

Reworked or incised sandy alluvium in older stream channels; lateritised alluvium; alluvial terraces above younger alluvium; alluvial and colluvial outwash deposits not in defined channel systems; sand, silt, gravel, clay, evaporites
Metagabbroic amphibolite, medium-grained, w remnant igneous texture, actinolite and/or hornblende plus calcic plagioclase.
Amphibolite.
Amphibolite, mafic schist, mafic rock intercalated with granite, para-amphibolite; metabasalt, metagabbro, metapyroxenite and metadolerite; Youanmi Terrane

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the Mafic-Ultramafic Event Series dataset 2013. Unassigned amphibolite; locally prominent in most terranes of the Yilgarn Craton, except the Kalgoorlie and Kurnalpi Terranes.
Lithology Description: Amphibolite, mafic amphibolites mostly derived from tholeiitic basalt and pillowed basalt; basalts are often associated with ultramafic amphibolites and para-amphibolites; rare compositional igneous layering
Concordant bodies of dark grey to black amphibolite with relict dolerite texture in places
Dark green epidotised amygdaloidal basalt with quartz and calcite amygdales
Meta-andesite, locally porphyritic; mafic to intermediate tuff, agglomerate, and volcaniclastic rocks, dacite
Anorthosite; massive, fine to coarse grained, metamorphosed

General Comments: A generic anthropogenic unit to replace Stratno 69829 (Qsm) for the Australian 1:1 million scale geology
Lithology Description: Made ground, mining areas, mullock heaps

General Comments: informal unit for the 1:1 million scale geology of Australia
Lithology Description: Artificial salt evaporation pans
Banded quartz-magnetite rock and banded iron formation

Stratigraphic Name: banded iron formation and minor amphibolite 74257
Lithology Description: Metamorphosed oxide-facies banded iron formation, finely laminated amphibolite, ultramafic schist, quartz-magnetite-(grunerite-garnet) rock.

Banded quartz-magnetite rock, banded iron formation, ferruginous chert, chert, quartz-grunerite rock; minor jaspilite and silicified slate and shale, exhalite, phyllite, chert breccia, sandstone, siltstone, agglomerate, tuff, silicic volcanic rocks
Basalt, amygdaloidal basalt, fine grained dolerite sills and dykes
Bauxite, aluminous laterite

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the Mafic-Ultramafic Event Series dataset 2013. Glikson, A.Y., Stewart, A.J., Ballhaus, C.G., Clarke, G.L., Feeken, E.H.J., Leven, J.H., Sheraton, J.W. and Sun, S.-s., 1996. Geology of the western Musgrave Block, central Australia, with particular reference to the mafic¿ultramafic Giles Complex. Australian Geological Survey Organisation, Bulletin, 239, 206 pp.  Un-named biotite gabbro intrusion, western Champ-de-Mars, south of Hinckley Range, western Musgrave (location: Lat 26.152599, Long 128.915336; AGD 66 co-ordinates 491537 E, 7107414 N).
Lithology Description: Biotite-hornblende gabbronorite, leucogabbro

General Comments: Lithology referring to an unnamed unit used for Queensland, Northern Territory and WA 1:1 million geological maps, National Maps Project
Lithology Description: Residual black, dark grey or brown clayey soil
Quartz or quartzite breccia in fault zones

Calc-silicate gneiss, quartz-feldspar-clinopyroxene-hornblende paragneiss, plagioclase-quartz-tremolite-actinolite-clinopyroxene-microcline gneiss, tremolite-actinolite-hornblende-epidote-quartz-plagioclase gneiss, amphibolite; Narryer Terrane
Diopside-epidote-plagioclase-microcline-titanite, with local garnet, magnetite and quartz; South-west Gneiss Terrane
Calc-silicate gneiss and schist, marble, dolomite and metadolomite, fine to medium grained actinolite and tremolite schist; Gascoyne region

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the Mafic-Ultramafic Event Series dataset 2013. Geological Survey of Western Australia, 2001. 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology Map of Western Australia, Geological Survey of Western Australia (June 2001). Unassigned calc-silicate gneiss and amphibolite; local small outcrops on Newdegate (amphibolite) and Collie (calc-silicate gneiss) 1:250 000 sheets.
Lithology Description: Calc-silicate gneiss and amphibolite; metamorphosed basaltic rocks; preserved pillow textures in amphibolites indicate volcanic origin for most of these rocks
Calc-silicate rocks with diopside, actinolite, carbonate, epidote, plagioclase, microcline, biotite, quartz; quartz chlorite carbonate schist; chloritic metasediment
Banded two-feldspar-epidote-actinolite-quartz rock; metamorphosed carbonate-rich sedimentary rocks, mainly dolomite; para-amphibolite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit for the Australian 1:1 million scale surface geology map for National Maps Project.  Map symbol: Czk.
Lithology Description: Calcrete, travertine; calcareous cementing of bedrock and transported materials; pisolitic to nodular or massive; as low mounds, in playa lakes, valley calcrete, or in subsurface; may contain intercalated chalcedony; locally dissected and karstified
Chert, some as tectonic dykes
Chert, iron-formation, quartz-grunerite-magnetite rock, quartz-magnetite-grunerite rock, quartz-magnetite-hypersthene rock, garnetiferous iron formation, magnetite-bearing quartzite.

Banded iron formation, chert, ferruginous chert. In places with jaspilite and red, black and white banded iron formation. Hornblende-grunerite-hematite-magnetite-quartz rock; schistose amphibolite and ultramafic schist; silicified and commonly lateritised
Undivided siltstone, claystone and sandstone

General Comments: Unnamed unit used on Australian 1:1M scale surface geology map.  Map symbol: Qdc.
Lithology Description: Coastal sand dunes, beach sand, barrier beaches, foredune, beach ridges; calcareous and siliceous, locally shelly and/or cemented (beach rock); locally reworked

General Comments: Unit is to be used as part of a "standard set" of symbols for National Maps Project.  Map symbol: Qrc. May have been previously mapped as Qc, Czc, Qrg; some Czr and Czca.
Lithology Description: Colluvium and/or residual deposits, sheetwash, talus, scree; boulder, gravel, sand; may include minor alluvial or sand plain deposits, local calcrete and reworked laterite
Clay and rock fragments washed into small lake-like depressions from surrounding slopes

General Comments: Unit is to be used as part of a "standard set" of symbols for National Maps Project.  Map symbol: Tsc (updated to Czcc)
Lithology Description: Conglomerate, sandstone, lesser fine grained sedimentary rocks; locally ferruginised or silicified; includes impact crater-fill conglomerate, breccia and brecciated sandstone
Boulder, cobble and pebble conglomerate, and sandstone
Glaciogenic boulder conglomerate, sandstone, shale and porcellanite, occasional pebbles of dark green silicified oolite
Fine-grained, massive or flow-banded dacite porphyry
Phyllonite and mylonite in fault or shear zones; strongly deformed and carbonated felsic volcaniclastic, mafic, and ultramafic rocks

General Comments: Unnamed Neoproterozoic dolerite dykes
Lithology Description: Unnamed mafic dykes; medium to coarse grained ophitic to subophitic dolerite and metadolerite, tholeiitic dolerite

General Comments: Informal unit for WA 1:1 million geology map. Also used for NTGS's Tanami 1:250k sheet area, as a subsurface unit interpreted by Songfa Liu for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area.
Lithology Description: Dolerite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the Mafic-Ultramafic Event Series dataset 2013. Un-named dolerite dykes (96496009) near Elizabeth Hills in the Mount Webb region, western Arunta (location: Lat 22.836960, Long 127.894780; AGD 66 co-ordinates 386461 E, 7473940 N). Wingate et al. (2000).
Lithology Description: Dolerite, sulphide (pyrite, chalcopyrite)-bearing dolerite, gabbro centres and chilled margins; all dolerites are unmetamorphosed and unfoliated

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the Mafic-Ultramafic Event Series dataset 2013. Myers, J.S. and Hocking, R.M., 1998. Geological Map of Western Australia, 1:2 500 000 (13th Edition). Geological Survey of Western Australia, Perth. Un-named dolerite dykes and sills of the Marnda Moorn LIP (Fraser-Boyagin-Gnowangerup-Wheatbelt-Muggamurra Dyke Swarms).
Lithology Description: Dolerite, quartz dolerite, quartz diorite, gabbro, leucogabbro, granophyre

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the Mafic-Ultramafic Event Series dataset 2013. Un-named dolerite sills and dykes - Paraburdoo (location: Lat 23.23953176, Long 117.60215377). Müller, S.G., Krapez., B., Barley, M.E. and Fletcher, I.R., 2005. Giant iron-ore deposits of the Hamersley province related to the breakup of Palaeoproterozoic Australia: New insights from in situ SHRIMP dating of baddeleyite from mafic intrusions. Geology, 33, 577-580. Age from U-Pb (baddeleyite).
Lithology Description: Dolerite

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the Mafic-Ultramafic Event Series dataset 2013. Un-named dolerite sills and dykes - Turee Creek (location: Lat 23.20513193, Long 118.28122274). Müller, S.G., Krapez., B., Barley, M.E. and Fletcher, I.R., 2005. Giant iron-ore deposits of the Hamersley province related to the breakup of Palaeoproterozoic Australia: New insights from in situ SHRIMP dating of baddeleyite from mafic intrusions. Geology, 33, 577-580. Age from U-Pb (baddeleyite).
Lithology Description: Dolerite

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the Mafic-Ultramafic Event Series dataset 2013. Myers, J.S. and Hocking, R.M., 1998. Geological Map of Western Australia, 1:2 500 000 (13th Edition). Geological Survey of Western Australia, Perth. Un-named dolerite (Yalgoo dykes). Approximate age shown as 1210 Ma, max age 2500 Ma from Muhling & Low (1977).
Lithology Description: Dolerite, diorite

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the Mafic-Ultramafic Event Series dataset 2013. Myers, J.S. and Hocking, R.M., 1998. Geological Map of Western Australia, 1:2 500 000 (13th Edition). Geological Survey of Western Australia, Perth. Un-named dolerite (Murgoo dykes).  Approximate age shown as 1210 Ma.
Lithology Description: Dolerite, quartz dolerite, hornblende dolerite, diorite
Dolerite, gabbro, leucogabbro, high-Mg dolerite.

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the Mafic-Ultramafic Event Series dataset 2013. Un-named dolerite/gabbro sill at Hasties Reward prospect (location: ~Lat 21.855, Long 122.129). Maidment, D., Huston, D., Maas, R., Czarnota, K., Neumann, N., McIntyre, A. and Bagas, L., 2008. The Nifty-Kintyre-Duke Cu-U-Pb-Zn mineralising events: links to the evolution of the Yeneena Basin, NW Paterson Orogen. In: GSWA 2008 Extended Abstracts: Promoting the prospectivity of Western Australia.
Lithology Description: Dolerite, gabbro

General Comments: Also in Officer Basin and Albany-Fraser Province. Also now used for subsurface unit interpreted by Alastair Stewart for the basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area (ie NT & Qld).
Lithology Description: Undifferentiated dolerite and gabbro dykes and sills; local granophyric patches, noritic dolerite and gabbro, hornblendite, and minor hybrid rock with rapakivi texture; locally metamorphosed
Dolerite, gabbro, leucogabbro, local harzburgite; Metagabbro; medium- and coarse-grained; includes some serpentinite, metaperidotite and metapyroxenite layers; metaleucogabbro

General Comments: Unit is to be used as part of a "standard set" of symbols for National Maps Project.  Map symbol: Qd.
Lithology Description: Dunes, sandplain with dunes and swales; may include numerous interdune claypans; may be locally gypsiferous

General Comments: Unit is to be used as part of a "standard set" of symbols for National Maps Project.  Map symbol: Qe.
Lithology Description: Estuarine, tidal delta and lagoonal deposits; coastal mud flats, silt and evaporite deposits; may contain older vegetated black soils
Estuarine, lagoonal, and lacustrine deposits. Numerous small lakes and swamps. Linear dunes common.
Brown and grey feldspar porphyry, cataclastically deformed in places; quartz-feldspar porphyry
Felsic and mafic volcanic rocks, some granite intercalations

General Comments: Lithology referring to an unnamed unit to be used for Australian 1:1 million geological map, National Maps Project.
Lithology Description: Felsic intrusive rocks; including tonalite, diorite, granodiorite, granite, monzogranite, rhyolite, microgranodiorite

General Comments: Unit  used for Northern Territory 1:1 million geological map National Maps Project, as Orosirian to Statherian. Revised to more general  Paleoproterozoic age and also applied to Pre-Cz geology, NSW & Vic,  basement geology of the Exploring for the Future area in 2019. In WA: felsic intrusives; negative gravity anomaly (relative to surrounding units) and typically very weakly or non-magnetic.
Lithology Description: Undifferentiated felsic intrusives, some gneissic

Undifferentiated felsic intrusive rocks, including monzogranite, granodiorite, granite, tonalite, quartz monzonite, syenogranite, diorite, monzodiorite, pegmatite. Locally metamorphosed, foliated, gneissic. Local abundant mafic and ultramafic inclusions
Undifferentiated felsic intrusives; granite, syenite, granodiorite, monzogranite, tonalite, diorite, granophyre, felsic rock

Biotite granodiorite and adamellite, tonalite and microtonalite, biotite granite, monzogranite, biotite-muscovite syenogranite and trondhjemite; sheets and veins of pegmatite. Local dark and light phases, and rafts or fragments of schist.
Feldspar-phyric porphyry, rhyolite
Strongly foliated felsic rock, quartz-muscovite schist, quartz-feldspar schist probably derived from felsic volcanic or volcaniclastic rocks

General Comments: Undifferentiated volcanics in the Youanmi Terrane, Yilgarn Craton
Lithology Description: Felsic volcanic rocks with pyroclastics, mafic volcanic and intrusive rocks, porphyry, serpentinite, local ultramafics

Quartz-feldspar (meta-) porphyry, porphyritic microgranite; rhyolite, dacite, rhyodacite, andesite; agglomerate, breccia tuff; felsic schist; felsic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks; dacite and rhyodacite tuff; dacite porphyry;

General Comments: Informal unit for Western Australia 1:1 million geological map
Lithology Description: Felsic volcanic and volcaniclastic rocks, locally amygdaloidal or fragmental; dacite, quartz-feldspar porphyry, tuff, agglomerate, andesitic lava, quartz-muscovite schist, felsic schist, felsic gneiss
Plagiophyric dacite, felsic lavas and pyroclastics

Stratigraphic Name: felsic volcaniclastic mudstone, komatiite at Lordy Bore 78065
General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the Mafic-Ultramafic Event Series dataset 2013. Lordy Bore felsic volcaniclastic mudstone conformably underlying komatiite, Youanmi Terrane, Murchison Domain (location Lordy Bore, south of Meekatharra, MGA Zone 50, 649946 E, 7032467 N; Long 118.508839, Lat -26.821293).Magmatic crystallisation age of felsic volcaniclastic rock lying directly and conformably beneath komatiitic rocks (interpreted by GSWA, 2009, to be ~age of (or very close) komatiitic sequence)
Lithology Description: Komatiite, felsic volcaniclastic mudstone

Stratigraphic Name: felsic volcaniclastic, basalt at Lake Wells 78060
General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the Mafic-Ultramafic Event Series dataset 2013. Lake Wells felsic volcaniclastic intercalated with basalt in Ulrich Range greenstone belt, Burtville Terrane on Strawbridge 1:100 000 Sheet (sample 193363, location ~400 m northwest of Lake Wells Homestead, MGA Zone 51, 51501110 E, 6981738 N; Long 123.011216, Lat -27.287344). Magmatic crystallisation age of volcaniclastic rock (meta-andesite) intercalated in lower part of thicker package of metabasalt and pillowed metabasalt (pers. comm., C. Hall, GSWA, 2009)
Lithology Description: Amphibolite-facies metabasalt and pillowed metabasalt
Dacite, quartz-feldspar porphyry.

General Comments: Unnamed volcanics in the Narryer Terrane, WA.  Used in the 1:1 million surface geology of  Western Australia
Lithology Description: Undivided felsic volcanics; metamorphosed; Narryer Terrane

General Comments: Unit is to be used as part of a "standard set" of symbols for National Maps Project.  Map symbol: Czl.
Lithology Description: Ferruginous duricrust, laterite; pisolitic, nodular, vuggy; may include massive to pisolitic ferruginous subsoil, mottled clays, magnesite, reworked products of ferruginous and siliceous duricrusts, calcrete, gossan; residual ferruginous saprolite

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the Mafic-Ultramafic Event Series dataset 2013. Unnamed gabbroic sill representing possible feeder to overlying basaltic flows and cuts the lower part of Woolyeenyer Formation, Kalgoorlie Terrane, near Norseman (location MGA Zone 51, 388137 E, 6440245 N; Long 121.813565, Lat -32.168729). Magmatic crystallisation age of granophyric dolerite dyke; dated sample is from granophyric phase within the dyke; coeval with 2664 ± 6 Ma Coates Siding gabbro in South West Terrane of Yilgarn Craton
Lithology Description: Gabbro

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the Mafic-Ultramafic Event Series dataset 2013. Coates Siding gabbro, Morangup greenstone belt, South West Terrane (approximate location (+/- 10 km) MGA Zone 50, 439920 E, 6493900 N; Long 116.366071, Lat -31.688647). Magmatic crystallisation age of gabbro; coeval with 2661 +/- 3 Ma Mount Vetters granophyric dolerite (Nelson, 1998); possibly coeval with 2669 +/- 11 Ma (Compston et al., 1986) Victory Dolerite in Kalgoorlie Terrane
Lithology Description: Gabbro

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the Mafic-Ultramafic Event Series dataset 2013. Distribution of inferred gabbroic intrusions under cover, interpreted (by GSWA) from magnetic and gravity anomalies in Albany-Fraser and Officer areas, and from drilling of similar anomalies in SA. From: D'Ercole, C., Lockwood, A.M., 2004. The tectonic history of the Waigen area, western Officer Basin, interpreted from geophysical data. Western Australia Geological Survey, Annual Review 2003-04, Technical Paper, 71-80 [RefID 69055]. Also used in: Hoatson, D.M., Claoue-Long, J.C., Jaireth, S., 2008. Australian Proterozoic Mafic-Ultramafic Magmatic Events: Sheets 1 and 2 (1:5000000 and 1:10000000 scale maps), Geoscience Australia, Canberra
Lithology Description: Inferred gabbroic intrusions under cover

General Comments: Informal unnamed unit for the WA 1:1 million scale geology dataset.  Northhampton Block, Pinjarra Orogen.
Lithology Description: Garnet paragneiss; Northhampton Block, Pinjarra Orogen
Granitic gneiss, microgranite, porphyritic granite, rapakivi granite, syenite, diorite

Banded granitic gneiss (monzogranitic to granodioritic), quartzofeldspathic gneiss with mafic bands, migmatite, granofels, mafic and felsic granulites, hypersthene-plagioclase-quartz granulite; schist, pelitic or mafic granofels

General Comments: Tanami 1:250 000 sheet area. Tanami Province. See also 79/03448, Kimberley-Mt Isa 1:2.5mill map?
Lithology Description: Medium to coarse biotite and muscovite granite; minor gabbroic rocks

General Comments: Used by Proterozoic Granites Project  - granitic rock unassigned. Rb/Sr age 2615 Ma.
Lithology Description: Granites: not subdivided - locally porphyritic, commonly foliated; unknown mutual relationships; abundant pegmatites in places.
Quartz microcline microperthite with rare plagioclase
Banded to agmatitic felsic and/or granitic gneiss, migmatite; high-Ca group.
Undivided granite, gneiss and migmatite; foliated felsic rock

Granite, metagranite, Equigranular to porphyritic granite; leucocratic granite; biotite granite with potassium feldspar phenocrysts in places; foliated adamellite; mixed granitic rocks; dioritic rocks
Granitic gneiss; high-HFSE group
Migmatite; low-Ca group.
Sheared gneissic granite
Leucogranite-monzogranite-tonalite-granodiorite-granulite migmatite, interlayered and gneissic to weakly foliated. Mafic ('pelitic') melanosome.
Granophyre

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the Mafic-Ultramafic Event Series dataset 2013. Kaluweerie granophyric dolerite from Sir Samuel 1:250 000 Sheet and Depot Springs 1:100 000 Sheet (sample 142859, location MGA Zone 51, 232490 E, 6918470 N; Long 120.284044, Lat -27.831784). East-trending dyke that has intruded monzogranite; metamorphosed to very low grade indicating intrusion may have post-dated regional greenschist facies metamorphism. Magmatic crystallisation age of granophyric dolerite dyke.
Lithology Description: Granophyric dolerite

Mafic and felsic granulites: hornblende-plagioclase-hypersthene granulite, quartz-feldspar-biotite gneiss with lenses of schist, amphibolite, ultramafic rock, banded iron formation, quartzite; quartz-feldspar-hornblende layered gneiss

General Comments: Unnamed unit used in the Mafic-Ultramafic Event Series dataset 2013. Geological Survey of Western Australia, 2001. 1:500 000 Interpreted Bedrock Geology Map of Western Australia, Geological Survey of Western Australia (June 2001). Unassigned high-grade granulite and migmatite metamorphic rocks; very minor mafic components of amphibolite in felsic hosts; many occurrences on Moora, Perth, Pinjarra, and Collie 1:250 000 sheets; restricted to South West Terrane. Metamorphic overprints at 2649 Ma and 2640 Ma (Wheat Belt region) and 2671 to 2654 Ma (Saddleback Greenstone belt).
Lithology Description: Granulite and migmatite; high-grade metamorphic rocks; amphibolite and hornblendite (Am and Amh units on Pinjarra and Perth 1:250 000 sheets) in granite and migmatitic granite host.
